text: There are a lot of expensive range hoods out there and many of them are not worth it.  Sure they look pretty but under the hood they just aren't that good.  This is one of Zephyr's most expensive hoods and for a good reason.First of all, this hood uses LED lights instead of incandescent or halogen bulbs.  This has 3 very distinct benefits.  1) No heat.  2) Less electricity 3) Longer lasting.  There are not many range hood makers using LEDs but Zephyr is one of themThe second reason and one of the biggest is this model uses a brushless motor for its blower.  Brushless motors are quite a bit more expensive than regular motors (Think Dyson) but is what makes this hood so special.  1)  Brushless motor is quieter.  2)  Brushless motor is stronger  3) Brushless motor uses less electricity.  This brushless motor is what enables this range hood to be almost whisper quiet on its lowest setting and also be able to push out 715 cfm while being quieter than most range hoods at 250 cfm.Finally, the thing that makes this one of the most expensive in the Zephyr line is the unique LED lighting on the "hood" itself.  This allows the hood to be either blue, white, or orange depending on your kitchen or your mood.  I know of no other hood which can do that and is a great talking point when people see it.Overall, Zephyr make amazing range hoods and this is one of their best.

These are perfect and the best cards to get.  They are quite a bit more expensive than the other cards I've seen but are completely worth it.First off, there is only one problem per card.  One side has the answer the other side does not.  This is what you want as you are trying to get your kids to memorize the answer not figure it out.  Therefore, I have my kids go through the side with the answer and say it out loud.  This hits visual, verbal, auditory methods of input into the brain.  After something becomes too easy I remove the cards ( 0, 1, 10 etc).  I have them go through the cards 2 to 5 times depending on how many cards are left.  After they have done that I have them do a 5 min drill sheet to see what they have learned and I will sometime go through the cards with them looking a the non-answered side to see which ones are still hard and which ones are too easy.

Obligatory Warning:  I am not a doctor and nor am I pretending to be one.  I am not giving any medical advice all I am doing is reviewing a product and how I use it.  If you are interested in finding out more about Ozone, I recommend watching some of Dr Robert Rowen‚Äôs, MD videos or trying to find the medical research by the German medical establishment or Cuban medical establishment.  Both of countries have made some pretty impressive headway.I am going to be reviewing and comparing the Steam Sauna Durherm Portable Personal Folding Home Steam Sauna and the Far IR Sauna DURHERM DIF-202 IR FAR Infrared Indoor Portable Foldable Sauna with Heating Food Pad and Chair.  Before talking about the saunas I will briefly touch on why you would want to sauna.Why Sauna?Sauna relieve stressSauna relax muscles and soothe aches/pains in both muscles and jointsSauna flush toxinsSauna cleanses the skinSaunas can help fight illness ‚Äî One of the most powerful way your immune system fights illnesses is by generating a fever.  The only problem when your body does it is it also raises the temperature of your brain.  This has obvious impactions as are felt when you have a fever.  By keeping your head out, your body temperature is increased while your brain‚Äôs temperature is not raised nearly as much.  Also, while ozone has many befits of providing oxygen to your body, it is an irritant for your lungs, so you could not use ozone in an enclosed whole body sauna.I‚Äôm not going to go into the benefits of oxygenating your body with ozone.  I will say that I run a water bubbler in between the ozone generator and the sauna.  This provides 2 benefits  then it will humidify the ozone before it reaches the sauna which is more important for the Far IR than the steam but it also makes a nice glass of ozone water to drink after the sauna.Overall, both of these saunas provide the benefits of hyperthermia.  It is amazing that you can do this for $100 to $200 and not take up a room in your house.  Modern technology is great.  Below is a rundown of the pros and cons of the two saunas.  I far prefer the Far IR sauna and I feel it is well worth the difference in price and is the much better value.Pros Steam SaunaCheaperBetter at warming the legs than the Far IR oneWarms up in 5 min from room temperature water.  No need to boil water first.ConsMore water in the sauna afterwards.  More to leak out of the sauna onto the floor.  I only had this problem when I moved it.  However, I do keep a towel under this sauna.- I use distilled water so this is not a problem for me but if you use  water with minerals you will have do clean the minerals off the steam generator with white vinegar or citric acid periodically- Steam nozzle can get moved accidentally and aim the steam at you which can be painfully hot- Fairly intensive to set up so it is not something you are really going to want to disassemble and reassemble daily.  Takes about 5 min.- Rudimentary controls.  The steam generator has one of those wind knob to roughly set the time.  That is the only thing you can set.  Can‚Äôt change the timer while in the sauna.Can only accommodate a little over 6 feet  (My guess would be maybe unto 6‚Äô 3‚Äù depending on how much you scrunch.)More difficult to set upHave to bring water to the steam generatorNo chair.  I bought a $20 plastic chair.Pro Far IR SaunaBetter controls - Can set temp between 130 and 150 in increments of 5.  Can set time from 5 to 30 min in increments of 5.  You can easily set the timer longer while in the sauna.  Can switch on the foot warming pad or leave it off.Warms up quickly.  I set it at 150 deg and 5 min and at the end of the time I reset the time for 30 min and jump in.The panels do get hot and are not comfortable to continually touch but they are not so hot as to burn you on contact.Incredibly easy to set up.  Simply fold open.  If you don‚Äôt want to leave it out, it folds into a slim package you could put in a closet or under your bed.Has a floor piece.Includes chair.Better control for heating specific parts.  If you want your arms warmer you can hold them closer to the 2 side Far IR heaters.  Want your back warmer, lean back a little further.  This is somewhat restricted by the neck collar which is designed to prevent you from being too far back and getting burned from the rear heater.ConsLegs not as heated as well as arms and torso.  I wish they could put 2 smaller heating plates in the front by your legs one on each side of the zipper.More plastic inside.  The wire for the footpad and the foot pad itself are plastic and therefore will eventually be corroded by the ozone.  However, all of the plates and the wires for the plates are outside.  Also, I am guessing it is going to be years before the ozone eats the plastic.  I only flow 1/8 liter per min.  If this becomes an issue sooner I will update.Can only accommodate a little over 6 feet (My guess would be maybe unto 6‚Äô 3‚Äù depending on how much you scrunch.)Overall, I greatly prefer the Far IR sauna and I think it is well worth the little bit extra you pay.  However, if you simply cannot afford the extra money then the steam sauna will give you much the same benefits.

D.M. Cavalier is very much mistaken.  This sauna does not make NEAR IR and nor does it make Medium IR.  I will provide some links in the comments but here is how you can tell it is not near IR.‚ÄúNear Infrared‚Äù, ‚ÄúIRA‚Äù, ‚ÄúShort wave‚Äù or ‚ÄúBright‚Äù Infrared heaters and ‚ÄúHeat Lamps‚Äù operate between 780†nm to 1,400¬†nm and emit temperatures of 1300¬∞C and more plus a bright red visible light. Emitters are typically Quartz with a reflector to concentrate the heat in a particular direction.‚ÄúMedium Infrared‚Äù, ‚ÄúIRB‚Äù or ‚ÄúMedium Wave ‚Äú infrared heaters¬† operate between 1,400¬†nm and 3,000¬†nm and emit temperatures¬† of 500 ‚Äì 800¬∞C and produce a deep red light (like bar fires).‚ÄúFar infrared‚Äù, ‚ÄúIRC‚Äù, ‚ÄúLong wave‚Äù or ‚ÄúDark Radiators‚Äù operate in the wavelengths above 3,000¬†nm.¬† Far Infrared elements emit much lower temperatures, typically¬† around the 100¬∞C mark and no visible light.¬† Human and animal skin absorbs Far infrared specifically well, because of its 80% water composition, making Far Infrared a biologically significant heating wavelength for humans and animals.Far Infrared heaters use a number of different elements, with popular ones being nickel or fecralloy wiring or more recently carbon fibre.He is also incorrect that only ceramic semiconductors  are used as FAR IR heaters.  Carbon while not the best material, is used extensively for its inexpensive price.It is very obvious that D.M. Cavalier  does not have the faintest idea what he is talking about and doesn‚Äôt own the product.Obligatory Warning:  I am not a doctor and nor am I pretending to be one.  I am not giving any medical advice all I am doing is reviewing a product and how I use it. In the picture these marbles look like cat eye marbles.  They are not.  They have some sort of exterior shimmery coating which gives a nice appearance.  I am not sure how durable this coating is and I don't know what it is made of.  Additionally, these marbles are not round.  They are roughly round but they are not round.  They are also not a uniform size.  I have uploaded a photo to show what I received.As far as price goes, they seem overpriced.  A quick search of Amazon and I found these two items.  200 Pieces Cats Eyes Glass Marble / Sling Shot Ammo for $8.93 or JMK 100 pcs Glass Marbles with Shooter for $5.88.For me this is not a product I would recommend.I was provided a sample of this product for a fair review.

This is a fantastic sink.  The blue fusion color is gorgeous.  Everything about this sink is top notch.The reason I give this sink 4 stars is this is a replacement sink.  I originally bought the sink faucet combo which is also amazing.  However, the installation instructions for the sink leave a little to be desired.  Also, the installation as it currently stands is flawed.  The bottom of this sink is not flat.  It is fairly curved.  So it does not sit on a counter top very well.  If you buy a round vessel sink, then you get a part for the sink to sit on in-between the counter top.  This part is curved on the top and has a gasket on the bottom.  This sink needs a piece like that as you don't want your glass sink sitting directly on a stone counter top.  The outside of the sink is the blue leaf and you don't want that rubbing on the counter top.  Also, since it is curved it is not very stable like that.  My first attempt, I tried to put a gasket in-between the sink and the counter top.  I couldn't really find one that fit very well so the sink moved too much and caused rubbing on the blue leaf.  So I needed to replace the sink.This time what I did was put down a fairly large patch of clear silicon around the hole on the counter top.  I then lowered the sink onto the patch and then screwed the drain in.  This has worked great so far.  The first install, the sink was very wiggly.  If you looked at it funny it would move.  With this install, the sink is much more solid.  With how wide the sink is, it still barely moves in a rotational direction. However, laterally and longitudinally, it is very solid.My other note is vessel sinks are not the best for smaller children as they like to use them as a handle for pulling themselves up.  Just something to consider.Overall, this sink is amazing and beautiful but I am not sure what Kraus was thinking with the installation.  They need to include a curved part to cradle the sink with a silicone gasket on both sides to keep it from moving.

I bought these sheets based on all of the wonderful reviews.  When I first got them, I was amazed at how soft and comfortable they are.  Really amazing sheets.Since I read the review I about the "morons" who can't follow directions, I have been exceedingly careful to follow the washing directions, cold water, low heat dry etc.None of that mattered as after about a month, the sheets have little balls all over them.  Since, the balls are mostly located on the points where ones body interacts with them with the greatest force, I conclude they are created from the friction of sleeping on them.It doesn't really matter how they are caused, the only thing that matters is they are exceedingly uncomfortable and I am looking for a replacement.Overall, if you don't mind spending $100 for new sheets every 2 weeks, these are fantastic.  If you think $100 sheets should last longer than 2 weeks I would recommend shopping elsewhere.  I have used DreamFit in the past and they have worked great.  I am thinking of trying their DreamFit 5 which are also bamboo sheets but after this experience I don't know if I want to risk the $200.

This is a fantastic little power strip.  I have this in my bedroom and it handles all of my charging needs.  It charges my phone, kindle and laptop and it powers my bedside light.  When I travel, this little guy comes with me.Overall, this is well worth the money and is now my bedroom charging station.

These are great sounding ear buds.  I give the sound quality a 7 which is the highest I feel qualified to give.These earbuds are also very comfortable.  I give them an 8.  The ear buds fit comfortably inside your ear.  However, the actual ear buds are slightly larger than others I have tried so I doc 1 point for comfort on that.  Also, the cord is slightly longer than some others I have.  I prefer the shorter cord, so I doc another point for that.The controls on these earbuds are easy to use and this was very easy to pair with my iPhone 6.  So a 10 for the controls.Overall, these are really nice bluetooth ear buds and are my second favorite pair.  For me the cord is longer than I prefer but for others the added length my be welcomed.  I would give this product a 4.5 star except no half stars allowed so I rounded up to 5.I was provided a sample for an honest review.

These bluetooth ear buds sound great.  I give them a 7 for sound quality and I don't feel qualified to offer any higher of a rating on any head set.  The ear buds come with small, medium, and large ear pieces.  I use the med which comes already installed and the ear buds are very comfortable in my ear.  These ear buds are great for cleaning, yard work, etc.The controls on the ear buds are easy to use and work well.  However, I don't prefer them on the cord.  The cord is pretty long as it is and the extra weight of the controls pulls the cord to it side and I feel it on my neck which I find annoying.Overall, these are some great sounding ear buds but the controls on the cord causes the cord to rub on my neck.I was provided a sample for an honest review.

This oil is expensive.  Of that there is no doubt.  However, it is more than worth it.  Our bodies need oil to function and this oil is a very good oil for that. Here is what this oil can do for you.  1) It helps you to feel full.  2)  It provides a slow even burn for your body so your insulin levels don't spike and it provides you energy throughout the day.A lot of reviews of this product have mentioned not cooking with this oil and I completely disagree with that.  First of all, this oil is exceptionally good for your body.  Second and most important for cooking is this oil is exceedingly stable with heat.  So while olive oil is great for salad dressing, it is a very poor cooking oil.  This, however, is a fantastic cooking oil.  As it doesn't smoke or burn up in the 300 to 400 deg range.  That means it keeps working as a lubricant with your pans and it doesn't convert into burnt substances which are not good for you.  Now this is not something you want to deep fry in.  Not that you really want to deep fry anything anyway.  But this oils is far too expensive to do something like that.  I use this oil basically as a replacement for butter.  One thing to note is this oil has no flavor so you need to add your own.  It is a blank flavor slate upon which you make your own flavors.So I use this oil for cooking my eggs.  I use this oil when cooking broccoli.  I use this oil for baking.  I use this oil on my popcorn.  Put on some Himalayan Pink Salt and you have some of the best tasting popcorn you have ever had.Do yourself a favor.  Stop using vegetable oils and butter for cooking.  Use this instead.  It has allowed me to reduce my portion sizes and still be comfortably full.  I can't recommend this Oil highly enough.

I have received 3 pairs of wireless bluetooth ear buds to review and these are my favorite of the 3.  All 3 of them have amazing sound.  I would give each of them a rating of 7 for the sound.  I don't really feel that I have a good enough ear to give anything a higher rating than that for sound.All three of the ear buds were exceedingly easy to pair with my iPhone.  All 3 ear buds have controls to answer a phone call, change volume, and change tracks.The place where this pair exceeds the others is comfort.  All 3 pairs have changeable sizes for the ear piece, so all of them are good that way.  However, one of the other pairs has the controls on the wire instead of the ear piece.  This causes the wire to pull in that direction and I find it fairly annoying.  The other set is about equal in comfort but has a slightly longer cord and slightly bigger ear pieces.  It is for this reason this pair is my favorite of the 3.Subjective Ratings of this HeadsetSound 7 (the best I feel qualified to give out)Pairing 10Easy of function 9Comfort 9Overall, these are a very nice set of bluetooth ear buds and I highly recommend them.I had to pay shipping but I received the sample for an honest review.

This is a great tea and coffee maker.  It is very light.  It fits over most sizes of cups and mugs.  Perhaps one of the most important features of this beverage maker is that it is exceedingly easy to clean.  Since it doesn't come apart it looks like it might be difficult to clean.  However, simply dump the grounds out into the trash and then rinse from the bottom side.As far as making coffee goes, just put in your favorite freshly ground coffee, fill with almost boiling water and let stand for a minute or two.  Then just put it on top of your mug and you have some amazing coffee.  We like to use this for Cafe Du Monde coffee also.Overall, this product does what it claims to do, is inexpensive, is light, and is easy to clean up.  A very useful addition to our kitchen and one I highly recommend.I received a sample for an hones review.

This book is a great little book just by itself.  The artwork and printing is first rate.  The story is a cute story and well written.  The AR (augmented reality) is a nice feature also.  My 7 and 6 year old children really were thrilled by it.The story itself teaches teamwork and redemption which I think are admirable traits to teach.The AR is a neat feature and the kids enjoyed it.  For me I don't like tons of apps on my phone.  So for future books in this series there needs to be just one app that covers all of them.  I personally don't want a different app for each book.A great concept and good book.I received a sample for an honest review.

These mats are wonderful.  They make cooking on the grill a real joy.  Below are some of the benefits you get from using these mats.1) Your food will cook in its own juice.  This keeps meat nice and tender.  I made some amazing tender and juicy chicken breasts.  If you want a dry crispy exterior simply move it off the mat onto the grill after cooking and sear the outside.  One thing to note is because it cooks in its own juice, you can tone down the marinate a little otherwise it can be too overpowering.2) Easy clean up.3) Much less mess on the grill.  If there is too much grease it can overflow.  However, any that doesn't overflow, you just let cool and then scrape off.4) Cook small and delicate food without it falling through or caking to the grill and then breaking.5) I have IR grill so this keeps the grates clean without the need for scrubbing which can cause rust.6) Use it in your baking pan to make cookies.  Keeps the pan clean and the cookies just slide off.7) Use it to cook really crispy chicken wings in your oven. Then instead of scrubbing the grease off the pan or oven, you just scrape it off.While I don't think this ranks up with the invention of the wheel or fire, I do think this is an amazing product which can change the way you cook and clean up the cooking.I don't have the other cheaper version of this mat so I can't directly compare them.  I can say these mats have a good stiffness to them and work great.  A solid 5 star product.I was provided a sample for an honest review.  However, I liked them so much I bought myself another set.

For day to day use, I find this bottle a little weird to use.  when it is full it is fairly rigid so one handed use is practical.  As you drink the water, the bottle becomes floppy which makes it difficult to drink with one hand.  You need two.  So this is not something I would really use on a day to day basis as I have a nice stainless steel, double insulated bottle which keeps my water wonderfully cold.However, this bottle rolls up into a very small and lightweight package.  This perfect for camping or to put into a survival bag.  Most bottles of that type are made of a plastic which is much thinner than this silicone.  It is strong but I still very much prefer this over those bags.  The silicone has a very nice texture and feel to it.  This bottle also has a handy carabiner to attach it to a backpack or belt loop.Overall, this is a great little bottle made of food grade silicone.  Day-to-day it is a little weird to use.  But for backpacking or survival bag this is awesome.I received a sample for an honest review.

This is a very nice, well constructed smart usb charger.  It know what you have plugged into the usb port and, therefore, knows how many volts and amps to send to the device for optimal charging.A feature I really like about this device are the hidden blue led lights in each of the ports.  It allows you to see the port in the dark to plug in the usb cord but it is not very bright so it doesn't bother you when trying to sleep.When I travel, I actually prefer a multi plug device that has 3 regular outlets and 2 usb outlets.  That gives me the best of both worlds.  However, if all you need are usb outlets, this is a solid well built smart device that will charge anything you need.I was provided a sample for an honest review.

These headphones are light and sound great. However, for me I have never worn a over-the-ear head set that doesn't hurt by ears.  For the first hour or two these do not hurt my ears.  However, after that, my ears do start hurting so because of this I rate them 4 stars.  I've gone back and forth between 4 and 5 stars because I am sensitive to this and not every one is.  However, I will hold the 5 stars for the first pair that doesn't.  So if you are like me and over the ear headphones generally hurt your ears, these will also.I was also very pleasantly surprised by how nice these sound.  The price of these makes you think they will only sound mediocre.  However, I have paid much more for corded headphones that only sound marginally better. The sound makes for very pleasant listeningOverall, these are really nice headphones that sound great, and are very easy to pair with your phone.  They are light on your head but if you are prone to over-the-ear headphones hurting your ears then these will hurt your ears also.  For people who are not sensitive to over-the-ear style these are a solid choice.  If you are sensitive then I would recommend either on-the-ear or ear buds.I was provided a sample for an honest review.

This tray is very useful and well built.  I use it to put 3 pairs of muddy work boots on.  It is strong enough that you can lift it without it bending with the 3 pairs of boots on it.Besides the 3 listed uses, this tray is also very useful for building a lego kit.  When you open the bag you can just put the pieces on the tray and not worry about losing any of the pieces.  It would also be useful for model building or any such thing where small pieces could be lost.Overall, a very nice an useful product.I was provided a sample for an honest review.

These are some very high quality garden tags.  They are a great size in that they are big enough to write quite a bit on them.  Also, the material is such you can use just about anything on them.  I have used sharpie, pencil, and pen.The obvious use for this is for gardening.  Put these in with the seeds when you pot plant them and then transfer them over when planting them in the ground.  However, some other possible uses might be as name labels for a dinner or maybe even labels for foods where you stick into the food sample or even ice.  Any place where you can stick these into a soft material, would make these useful labeling devices.I was provided a sample for a fair review.

This is one solid accurate scale for a great price.  There are 2 really nice features this scale has which not many others have.The first feature is the readout is removed from the scale.  This means with oversized packages you can still read out the weight.  Other scales I have used without this feature, you either have to do gymnastics to see the readout or hope that it locks in for when you remove the weight.  With this scale you can see the weight as it is still sitting on it.The second feature is the TARE button.  This allows you to put an object on the scale and then reset the scale to zero.  This allows you to measure items such as liquids, dirt, etc which you normally could not weigh.  Simply put on a container, press the TARE button, and then put your items in the container.This scale is built like a tank.  I was amazed how heavy and solid this scale is.  Very nice.I have tested this scale against 2 others and it was dead accurate.Overall, you can't go wrong with this as a postal or general purpose scale.I was provided a sample for review.

This is a comfortable Travel Pillow.  It kind of has a beanbag feel to it and it conforms to your head and neck very nicely and comfortably.  Also, I didn't really feel like it got too hot either.The price of this is just a little over a regular travel pillow.  For that couple of dollars extra you get the massage option.  For me personally, I thought even the lowest frequency was too fast for a nice massage.  Too me this is a buzz type vibration instead of boat rocking or pendulum speed vibration. I would have preferred about 1/2 to 1/4 of the vibration speed.  My wife, however, thought the massage feature was very nice and enjoyed it.So if you are thinking about this for the massage feature, figure out if a buzz vibration is slow enough for you.I was provided a sample for review.

My kids love these bags.  I have 2 kids and 2 bags.  They love to load these up and carry "stuff" (technical term) around with them.Do you like the smell of twine?  Good because these bags have a nice twine smell to them.  They are very handsome and I like the blue and twine color scheme.There is not too much more to say.  If you want some strong and handsome tote bags made from natural fibers, then you can't go wrong with these.I was provided a sample for review purposes.

Right out of the case this keyboard and case work really well and feel very nice.  It has a built in battery and the blue tooth sinks up easily with my iPad mini.  This is the perfect size for my iPad mini.  The keyboard feels nice to type on and the claim is for 5 million key strokes.This case came with a charging cord which you plug into a standard USB port.The reason I have the title I have listed is I had a keyboard and case previously which looked and felt exactly like this one.  I had no problems with it myself.  However, occasionally, I lent it to my 7 year old to play with and shortly thereafter, a key came up missing and the case started to come unglued.  So I would recommend being gentle with the keyboard and don't let little kids play with it.I don't know for certain this is the same keyboard so I can't review it based on the other keyboard.  However, it looks and feels the same as the previous one I owned so I recommend some TLC.I was provided a sample for review purposes.

I loves these measuring cups.  Because they are collapsable, 2 sets takes up about the same amount of space as one non-collapsible set.  These are easy to uncollapse but the easiest way I have found to collapse them is to put them on a flat surface and push down.That fact these can withstand 400deg and can be microwaved is very nice and useful.The only downside I have found with these cups verses regular ones is if you are trying to scoop something semi-solid like butter or coconut oil.  Not that hard sided cups are perfect at this either but they do work a little better than these.  Other than that I have not found any downsides to these.I was provided a sample for review purposes.

First off, JJCEO's review of this is so through and detailed there is really not any more to be said with regard to a review.  Everything he says in his review is very accurate and very informative.  So watch his video to see how this product handles and functions.With that said, I am going to focus more on why you would want a sound level meter.1) The first and most obvious would be to check sound levels in your house.  If there are places in your house that you spend considerable amounts of time in and they consistently read 60db or greater you may want to do something about trying reduce the noise levels.  Also, if you are trying to soundproof or quite your house then a meter like this will be crucial to test the success of your efforts.2)  Another very important area to check could be your work.  If you have a consistently loud work environment it can seriously damage your health (Headaches, tinnitus, hearing loss, fatigue, etc).  For example according to OSHA occupational noise exposure 1910.95, you can only be exposed to 100db for 2 hours per day without hearing protection.  Your office may be louder than you think and you won't know without testing.3) You have a neighbor who thinks it is cool to drive a vehicle with no muffler (especially motorcycles)  The EPA adopted a 80db at 35mph standard for motorcycles (less for cars) which took effect sometime around 1986.  Many states have a lower requirement (78db).  After market parts have to meet the same standards.  If you have a neighbor who refuses to abide by this, you could film the vehicle and noise meter and then go to the police and try to get them to enforce the standard.  I had a neighbor who like to start his illegally modified Harley at 0500 every morning and leave it running for 30min to warm up.  I wish I had this meter back then.4) Spot level testing.  If you are setting up a PA system or any sort of music system, this would allow you to test different spots in your space and ensure sound levels are adequate for the purpose required.5)  Show your teenagers how loud their music is from speakers or headphones (ear buds would be hard to test but I did test headphones).  Refer to OSHA noise guidelines.6) Noise ordnance violations.  Maybe you have neighbors who like to party late into the night especially on weeknights.  Maybe you live in an apartment complex with a loud neighbor.  You can show your landlord just how loud they are or be able to tell the police how loud the neighbors are being.Noise pollution can be hazardous to your health and this tool gives you the ability to find any noise pollution which might be impacting your life so you can do something about it.I was provided a sample for review purposes.

I recently remodeled my kitchen with some $4 satin nickel cabinet knobs and I really like the new look.  These knobs blow the ones I installed away.  These are heavier and more solid feeling.  You can feel the difference every time you open a cabinet or drawer.Too me this is something I feel and look at every day and thus brings me a little enjoyment every day.  These are pricy and only you can decide if the price it worth it but needless to say I will be purchasing more of these in the very near future.  To me, buying 6 packs of these for my kitchen (<$180) is a small percentage of what a basic kitchen reno costs($10-20K), that the feeling of luxury I get every day is more than worth it.I was provided a sample for a fair review.

I've had Phoenix since V3 and it has worked great.  Also, I now own V5 as a free upgrade from V3.0.  You cannot beat that for customer support.  All of the models are free also.If you want to learn to fly a RC Helicopter this is where you start.  You want Phoenix over RealFlight because of the great support and also because it comes with the helicopter model I recommend as your learning helicopter; the Nano.  Welcome to the adventure.  The first thing you need to do is get the version of this that doesn't come with a radio.  You will want to buy the DX6i Transmitter Only MD2 radio or better radio.  This radio will carry you through the Blade 450 and you can bind up to 6 aircraft to it and it only cost 130 bucks which is dirt cheap for what it does.When you get this program download, make sure you download the Blade Nano CP as this is what you are going to buy further on down the road (Just go ahead and down load everything but especially this aircraft).  Next download the Nano CP Spektrum DX6i setting from the web (Something to note, on the helo, the collective channel is reversed.  To you the same profile in the sim you need to reverse the collective channel in the program because it is setup normally).Now you have the radio you are going to use to when you get your helo, you have it set up the same way as you will use it, and you have the helo modeled in the sim.  You are pretty well set up for success now.  One thing to note, is the sim is easier in some ways and more difficult in some.  Also, there is a big difference between sitting in front of a screen and having this little angry bee flying at your head.  So keep that in mind.Before continuing, I will answer your question about why the Blade mCP X Bind and Fly RC Helicopter.  There are really 3 main reasons, the first is it doesn't have a stab bar.  To compensate for that, this helo is actually comparatively stable.  The second and most important is damage resistance.  I will tell your right now.  You are going to crash.  Even after hours in the sim, you will crash.  Got that.  If you, use your throttle cut before you actually hit anything, it is very likely, this helicopter will be flyable after the crash.  This is because of the light weight and lack of a stab bar.  Almost any crash with the 450 is going to put it out of commission (weight and stab bar).  The 3rd reason is repair costs are very cheap.  If you think I am off the mark on this, try flying the Blade 450 or Trex 600 in the sim.  See how many times you crash)I tried to learn to fly a RC helicopter twice before the mCP X and came away frustrated and significantly poorer both times (Hirobo Shuttle and TRex 450).  And the Nano CP is even better to learn on than the mCP X was.Start with the sim and you are going to save tons of money and frustration.  With your radio hooked up to the computer and the Blade mCP X running, practice your hovering (The sim has hover training but I personally did not find it very useful  Hover nose out until you can stay in one location.  Hover nose left and right until you can do the same.  Hover nose in.  Now do all of the same upside down.  Practice 30min a day every day.  After a few months, maybe sooner, you should have your hovering down.  Don't get frustrated, these little things are incredibly difficult to fly.  The biggest thing you are going to do is make your control movements to big.  If you are conscious of the stick moving, your movements are too big.Once you have that down, get yourself a Blade Nano CP BNF and start your practice all over again.  Move slowly  Don't expect to be able to do in real life what you can in the sim but you will be able to move rapidly because of your practice.Ok so I talked about how to learn to fly, but why this simulator.  The main reason is it has the Blade Nano.  Period.  However, I will say I have a very old computer and this program runs very smoothly on it.  So that is another plus.  I have seen some people knocking this sim because it has picture environments instead of 3D.  My response to that is big deal.  I really don't care that much about the environments and picture allows this to run smoothly on a slower computer.  Also, in V5 there are some 3D locals.  Everything I have seen and read about this sim says it  is realistic.  I would agree with that statement as much as any sim can be realistic. (Blade mCP X experiences tail blow outs and nose rotation during autorotations which does not happen in the sim)As far as the training and lessons go,  I am not really impressed.  There is a ton of work that needs to be done to make these more useful learning devices.  The programmers of this program should look at what was done in any of the Gran Turismo to see how they could make the training much better.  You will need to come to this program with your own training syllabus.  As I said before, there is an autorotation and hovering training mode.  The hovering mode gives you 1 control at a time.  Maybe useful for starting but you will quickly outgrow it.  Additionally, there are some demo lessons but the instruction goes far too fast to keep up with.  The training part really needs to be re-thought and improved.The extras can be useful and fun.  One extra is balloon pop.  The nice thing with this is it takes your conscious mind off of flying and put it on hitting the balloons.  As they said on Last Samurai, some times you have "too many minds".Overall, this is a great program which is an invaluable tool to help you learn to fly RC helicopters.  It will make you better quicker and cheaper than would otherwise be possible.
I use Gandpa soap and shampoo and I love them both.  They both work really well and don't leave a smell.  The conditioner on the other hand has a very strong lingering smell which I find annoying.

Like the product description says, make your eggs perfectly every time.  Want them runny, medium, or hard just cook it until the appropriate part turns dark.As far as smell goes, I have never smelled anything.  Also, this has never changed the taste of my eggs and I have been cooking with this for years.For cooking boiled eggs this timer is invaluable.

This shampoo smells like Gummy Bears to me.  My kids love the smell and have no problem using this shampoo.  My 5 year old absolutely hates washing his hair so this was a nice relief.It does a fine job cleaning their hair and I wash their hair once and it is clean.  Like all kids their age they love getting into all sorts of things which make their hair dirty.  After washing, I use the Jason Conditioner and that helps with my daughters long hair.

I was sent these for a fair and honest review.  My daughter has had these for about 1 month and they are still going strong.  The set I received came with a nice finish and after 1 month of hard wear from my daughter they still look new.These have a pretty good sound and have a pearlescent sheen but up close no one will mistake them for being real.These have a good length on them and can be used as a necklace either single or double and will work well as a bracelet.In looking around on Amazon, these seem to be on the high side in terms of price for costume pearls.  I don't know if the quality of these justifies that or not.

I don't use Compact Flash cards very much any more.  I only own one old camera which uses them.  So the card that I own is an old Lexar Platinum II 4GB 200x.  I have tested this reader writer compared to the other USB 3.0 reader writer I own.  This CF memory reader wrote to the card at an average of 13.3 MB/s and read at a very fast 44 MB/s.  With the other reader using the exact same card and data, the average was 8.2 MB/s write and 30 MB/s.  So the manufactures claims about this reader being faster than other USB 3 readers is accurate from my experience.One of the things I have always disliked about the CF is the fact pins can be bent especially in expensive cameras.  From my experience with this reader are that the card fits in snugly to prevent any pins from getting bent.  For me it worked very well.I was provided a sample for a fair and honest review.

Overall, this was a nice pillow.  The material was nice and it was comfortable.  However, both my wife and I tried it and it was too tall for both of us.  We prefer a little less hight in our pillows.  If you like your pillows on the taller side then it will be fine.Overall, this pillow was comfortable and and the material felt nice.I was provided a sample for a fair review.

My daughter just finished Black Beauty in her class and love it.  So I decided to surprise her with this book.  I was very impressed with the length and thoroughness of this version.  I was expecting  it to be around 50 pages and it clocks in at 170+ pages.  About 150 pages are dedicated to the story and 20 pages are dedicated to story boards.  That bonus was most welcome also as my daughter loves to draw and seeing the story boards shows her the process.This graphic novel obviously doesn't contain 100% of what the book has in it but it is pretty close.

Please be aware that learning to fly a helicopter like this is going to be difficult and frustrating.  You may be able to do magic with your fixed pitch helicopter but that experience has more negatives associated with learning to fly a full collective helicopter and very little in the way of positives.My first piece of advice is to not look a helicopters just yet and purchase the Phoenix R/C Pro Simulator Version 5.0 (As a note, I purchased this back at version 3 and I have never had to pay for an upgrade or for models.  Hats off to the developers for that.) and a Spektrum DX6i Transmitter Only MD2. Obviously since you now own a very good radio, I recommend the BNF version when you do get the helicopter. BNF stands for Bind N Fly and includes everything except the radio. RTF stands for Ready to Fly and comes with everything you need to fly. However, the radio is no where near capable as the DX6i and you are just wasting your money on it.Put your time in practicing how to hover in all aspects with the Blade Nano before purchasing this helicopter. Otherwise you will be tempted to fly this which will most likely end in a crash.Now the good news with the Blade Nano CP is that does not necessarily mean you will need to rebuild your aircraft and this is why I recommend this helicopter for learning how to fly a helicopter.  I learned on the Blade mCP X and while that was a very good helicopter to learn on it was bigger which makes it more prone to damage and it had tail blow outs which this helicopter does not,  Before the Blade mCP X, I tried twice to learn to fly RC helis and both times I came away exceedingly frustrated and much poorer for the attempt (Hirobo Shuttle and Align T-Rex). There are 3 main reasons I recommend the Nano CP. The first is the lack of a stab bar. The electronics which replace the stab bar actually make it more stable then it has any right to be. The second and most important is listed above. The lack of damage from a crash is huge. You can get right back up and continue learning. The 3rd reason is even if there is damage it is not very expensive to repair. All of these 3 reasons have made my 3rd attempt successful.The Nano CP is a joy to fly. It is incredibly nimble and powerful. In some ways it exceeds its bigger brethren. However, it is definitely not a replacement for them.So going back to the sim. First off set the DX6i up using the 3D setting for the Nano CP (As of right now, the actual aircraft requires collective reversing for the DX6i while the sim doesn't. Don't let this catch you out). Set the F Mode (flight mode) to Sport mode so the throttle is disconnected from the collective and is set at 100%. Start out by learning how to hover with the nose out. Then learn nose left and right. Then learn nose in. After you have done all of that. Learn upside down nose in. Then left, right, and nose out. Practice this 30 min a day everyday and you should have it very shortly. There are a couple of things to know about helos especially for hovering. Because the helicopter is dynamically unstable, everything takes three control movements. The first is to either stop or start something. The second movement is cancel that input by putting in an opposite input. The third movement is to neutralize the controls. When you start out you are put in way to much 2nd movement and you are going to miss the center. This is going to lead to huge over controlling. Get this under control in the sim.Now when you start flying your helo don't try your toughest hovering trick right off the bat. The sim is good but it is not perfect. Go through the sequence for the sim and once you have each mastered then move on. Another thing. The instructions say to not touch the right stick until you have the bird in the air. That is semi-good advice. If you look down and see the blade arc is not straight to the ground the helo is going to do something funky when it comes off the ground. Use the right stick to level the blade arc. Also, use the left stick to stop the helo spinning while it is on the ground. Then as the bird comes off the ground if it is moving in one direction of the other fix that.One thing to know about learning to fly a RC heli is you are going to crash. The most important thing to learn about this heli is when you are about to crash into something make sure you click your throttle hold switch which should immediately cut power to the rotors. Fight your instinct to slam the collective down as this will cause some nasty crashes. If you are able to cut the power before hitting anything, then damage to the heli will be minimal to none. Here are some things I have learned and some recommended spares.1) If you have any power still driving the rotors when they hit something, this will push the main gear down the main shaft. When you look are checking your helo make sure the main shaft cannot move up and down. If it can, push up on the main gear and push down and twist on the rotor head until there is no play. So far no trouble with the main shaft but I would have an extra main gear floating around.2) If it drives the gear down too far it can crack the landing skids. You can use super glue to put it back together but it is helpful to have a couple of skids on hand also.3) You are going to lose the rotor head pitch change links. There are 2 things you can do. First off, get the aluminum rotor head. This has a closed cage to hold those little buggers. You will lose less of them. Second, buy the rotor head linkage set.4) My first set of blades got pretty well beat up. They still worked fine but did not track as well as they should have.5) I have not had any problems with the feathering spindle, but if you have a bad crash with power on, you can be sure that bad johnny will bend. Get the titanium one and have a couple of spares.6) The parts are tiny. Get yourself one of those lit magnifying glasses or a strong pair of reading glasses so you can see the parts.7 Two batteries is nowhere near enough. Get yourself these Lightning Power Li-po 300mAh 3.7V 1S 35C for mCPx (4) battereis. These batteries or 300 mAh instead of 2oo and they are 35C instead of 25C so they last longer and give better response. Six batteries is good and is enough for 24 min of practice.The mCP X was revolutionary.  Never before had some much capability been available in such a small package. The Nano is a welcome evolution on the mCP X.  While not bullet proof, this bird can survive quite a few wrecks without damage. Almost any 450 crash is going to set you back a significant amount of money. If you're not crashing, you're not learning because you are not pushing your boundaries. That is oversimplified but not by much. Practice in the sim and then push your boundaries in real life. If you have a good instructor, then that person can help you progress without so many crashes. Now some of you may be wondering about starting with the Blade mSR. My recommendation is not to. I own the mSR and it is a blasts. However, it taught me bad habits I had to unlearn on this bird. Start with the sim and then get this.Pros:Amazing capabilities in a tiny packageCan come through certain crashes without damageCheap to repair after a crashPowerful and fastPriceNo stab bar(more stable, can't bend in a crash)ConsNoneIf you want to learn how to fly RC Helicopters, get the sim and then get this helo. It is the best training heli that I have found.Warning: If you don't know what you are doing with this you can seriously injure yourself or others. Practice in the sim. Practice in an open space with no one else around. If the helicopter is coming toward you and you can't stop it hit the throttle cut or just kill the bird (dump the collective These blades could easily blind you if they hit you in your face.

I've used ear plugs for work for over 20 years and I use ear plugs for sleeping and for loud activities like mowing the lawn.  Needless to say, I tried many brands and shapes of ear plugs.  After all that the 3M E-A-R Classic Plus Uncorded Earplugs, Hearing Conservation 310-1101 in Pillow Pack (affectionally know as the yellow foamy) has always been my favorite and worked the best for me.  It fits my ear the best and blocks the most noise.So how do the e-Plugz stack up?  For me, it is the best material I've felt in an ear plug.  It is very soft, comfortable and moldable.  It also, equals the yellow foamy for noise reduction.  For me, however, I have never really liked the bullet shaped ear plugs as it always feel like the put pressure on my ear drums.  So for me, this ear plug has better material than the yellow foamy but I am not as fond of the shape.  So for me, the yellow foamy is still my preferred ear plug.  However, if e-Plugz made an ear plug in the shape of the yellow foamy, it would be my number one choice.My wife on the other hand loves these ear plugs.  She loves the material and loves the shape.  She gets great sound reduction and great comfort.These are some exceptional ear plugs and I highly recommend them to anyone.  If you like bullet shaped ear plugs then these are a no brainer purchase.  Even if you don't prefer the shape it is worth a try as my wife generally did not prefer the bullet shaped ear plugs but she loves these.  I can say these are made of the best material of any foamy ear plug I have tried and with the class leading NRR33 noise canceling you cannot go wrong.  (The yellow foamy also has a NRR of 33).I was provided a sample for a fair and honest review.  These are highly recommended and I will be purchasing these for my wife in the future.

B+W is the brand I use for my filters.  They are exceptionally well made and have never failed me.  The construction is brass and the threads always fit so nicely on my lens.This filter is perfect for the GH4 or any other daylight video needs and here is the reason why.  During a normal bright sunny day at ISO 200, and around f/1.4 you are going to need around 1/8000 shutter speed.  Well that is going to make strobie looking video.  You basically want to shoot the inverse of 2x your FPS.  So at 30 fps you want your shutter speed to be 1/60.  To slow your shutter speed to 1/60 from 1/8000 you need to cut 7 stops of light.  This cuts 6 stops of light and you can cut the 7th by increasing aperture to f/2.So this 6 stop ND filter is the most flexible.  The 10 stop filter cuts too much and the 3 stop filter doesn't cut nearly enough.  So the 6 stop is just right.  While you can "stack" ND filters on top of each other you are really risking serious vignetting so it is not something I recommend.  If you only need to cut 5 stops of light then simply bump up your ISO 1 stop.For me, 6 stop ND filters have worked the best to shoot 4K video I can use as video and pull 8mp stills.

My wife is not really to deal with mechanical things.  However, the day before this arrived her check engine light came on so she was excited when this came.So she opened the package and followed the directions and then read and reset the code on her car.  She was very excited and we saved the diagnosis fee at the garage.  In this situation it is not really a problem we can fix.  But because we know what the problem, if the mechanic tries to take advantage of her, she will know it.  Knowledge is power.This product is well made and belongs in every car owners emergency car kit.This product has been so well covered in reviews it is hard add any other useful information.  Highly recommended.I was provided a sample of this product for a fair and honest review.

This is a nice little speaker that is easy to charge.  Just plug it into a powered usb plug and charge it up.  This speaker is better in the higher range than the lower ranges.I haven't really needed to use the suction cup but I did test it out and it worked fine.  Overall, there is nothing exceptional either good or bad about this speaker and for me that is the problem.For roughly twice the price you can get this speaker.  DKnight Magicbox Ultra-Portable Wireless Bluetooth Speaker,Powerful Sound with build in microphone, Works for Iphone, Ipad Mini, Ipad 4/3/2, Itouch, Blackberry, Nexus, Samsung and other Smart Phones and Mp3 Players (Black).  I much prefer not having to mess with wires and with this Bluetooth speaker I don't.  This speaker also sounds better.  To me these speakers are in the same ballpark for price so I would pick the bluetooth one every time.  If $30 is too steep for a speaker, then this one will work.  However, there are many choices for speakers in this price range.Overall, this is a decent speaker and if bluetooth is not important to you or the ability to stick the speaker to a window or other smother surface is important to you, then this could be a great speaker for you.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.

First off the version I noticed many people who have reviewed this product complained of the talking during blue tooth operations.  The version I have does not have the talking for blue tooth.  It makes a beeping sound.  When you first pair it does talk to you but after that it is just a beep.This product is an obvious copy of the Jambox and since I have one of those I thought I would compare the 2.  First of all, to my ears the sound from both is very similar and the battery life is similar also.  The blue tooth is easy to set up on both and each speaker has about the same range.  Like the Jambox you can use this as a speaker phone when paired and like the Jambox it works great.  So based on that and price alone this speaker is a great value.However, it has a really nice feature the Jambox is missing.  It allows you to pause, rewind and fast forward through the music you are listening to.  I really like this feature as sometime I like to listen to a song multiple times are skip a song.  Now I don't have to go back to the computer or pull out the phone.The only con I have for this speaker is that it is possible to turn it up to a volume which is too high for the speaker which causes distortion.  The speaker is plenty loud in the normal range and there is no reason this speaker does not limit power to not cause distortion.Overall, this is a great speaker for listening to music around the house or even providing background music for a party.A product sample was provided by the manufacturer for review purposes.

I've had this case for about 2 months now.  My first impression of this case was that it looked very high class.  It also smelled really good.  I love the smell of leather and this did not disappoint.This case fit the iPad nicely and has held up to 2 months of use very well and has kept my iPad nice and protected.  The little notches have also been very functional for having the iPad sit up at a great angle for using on a desk etc.This is a very nice and classy product and I would recommend it if you are looking for a stylish high class product.I was provided this product for review purposes.

This is a very nice and sharp machete that does a great job of clearing brush and chopping branches or smaller trees.  I had no problem cutting 4-6inc branches.The 16" size of this machete is just right and the curve of the handle allows it to fit just right to the hand.  So it is very comfortable and I find less fatiguing on my hand.The handle is made out of plastic which worked well but I wanted a little more grip.  So I wrapped it in hockey tape.  Proguard Elite Multi-Sport Cloth Tape - 1 Inch by 30 Yards  This stuff is excellent to have around as it can add some nice grip to many products.This blade is a carbon steel and as such it can rust.  To protect the blade after I am finished with it I use Sentry Solutions TUF-CLOTH Resealable Pouch, 12 x 12-Inch. This cloth is great as you just run it over the blade and it provides a nice protective layer.Overall, a great value and well worth the money.

For the money this is a decent Leica to NEX adaptor.  It is very hard to get the lens to actually lock into the adaptor but after fiddling with it for a bit it locked in just fine.  The adaptor locked into the camera just fine.  I am not a fan that the back side that mounts onto the camera is black instead of the same metal as the front.  However, the lens was nice and tight on the camera with no movement.Removing the lens was difficult.  The release lever is not very good and as I said the lens was on very tightly.Overall everything worked just find and you can't beat the price.

When I got this the first thing I did was put the batteries in and then plug the charger into the xbox one using the included usb cable.  Then since I had seen Tanker-X review I decided to try to take the batteries out.  Like Tanker-X said, the batteries were next to impossible to remove... the first time.  The way I got them out was to put tape on the back of the battery and then I slipped a utility knife blade between the battery and controller.After that, the batteries were snug but removable by hand.  It took about 2 hours to charge the batteries.  I knocked off a star for having to get a tool to remove the batteries the first time.The batteries themselves slide into the controller very easily.  The charger is much smaller than I thought it would be and it looks very good next to the xbox one.The instructions do say you need to remove the controllers once they are charged.  All companies will say that with a lithium batter for product liability reasons.  Lithium batteries are prone to thermal runaway so if that happens and it is plugged into the charger it can cause a fire.  Since the lights on the charger change from red to green when the controller is charged I am willing to bet that it also stops charging.Overall, a nice product that was only marred by how difficult it was to remove the batteries the first time.

I have used a lot of touch screen protectors and this has to be one of the best.  The kit comes with everything you need to put the protector on.  A really nice addition I have not seen before is the tape.  This tape will pull any hairs off you camera and you can even use it to pull bits off that get stuck to the inside of the protector.  It also comes with 2 screen protectors so if you mess up or have another camera with the same size screen you can use it for that.  My E-M5 protector started coming off so I replaced it with this.The really great feature of this protector is it is not a one shot proposition.  If you misalign the protectector you can peel it up and the put it back down.  If a pice of dust is stuck you can peel the protector up and use the tape to remove it.Overall, one of the best protectors I have used.

This is the GM1 kit to get.  I have purchased from Cameta before and everything went well.  For the same price as the camera you get a ton of accessories.  While none of them are top quality, they all work and most are useful.  Throw the cleaning kit away.  In 5 years of extensively shooting m43, I have never had a single dust spot on my camera.While I was first shooting and playing with this camera, I really liked it but I was stuck in my paradigm of it needs a grip, an EVF, and external controls to be a serious camera.  I was wrong!  In fact I bought this camera with the idea I was most likely going to return it.This camera is freaking amazing and so much fun to use.  It is the most exciting and revolutionary camera to come out in a long time.  That is a bold statement with the release of the Olympus E-M1, Nikon Df, and Sony A7.  Well I have all of those camera on hand and have shot all of them.  My favorite to shoot and carry hands down is this GM1!  The others are great cameras in their own right but this camera shifts the paradigm of what a small large sensor DSLM is.  It does this by an amazingly refreshing clean and non-cluttered physical interface.  It marries that with the slickest touch screen system I have seen to produce the least intimidating and best handling camera I have ever used.  That is saying a lot because I have used some amazing handling cameras.  The revolution of this camera is that there has never been a camera this small, that handled this well, has such great image quality, and, drum roll please, is stupid grin inducing fun to use.It is also a dead silent camera.  There is actually no need for the stealth mode this camera has because it is silent to begin with.  If you turn off all the default beeps and squeaks on this camera it is silent.No other camera that I know of has a 1/16,000 shutter speed.  This one does and for using fast 1.4 lenses in bright sun this can't be beat.Another super cool feature if you have the Olympus 12mm f/2 or the Olympus 12-40 f/2.8, when you click the focus dial to manual, it automatically turns on magnification and focus peaking.  Click it back to auto and that switches off.  Sweet. In the accompanying video, I am going to show you how to set it up and how simple and fast it is to use.The camera shares it sensor with the GX7 so this camera has the current state of the art when it comes to m43 sensors.  Another thing it shares with the GX7 is that Panasonic USA is only selling the black and silver version.  Right now there will be no black version, no white version, and no orange version.  Boo Panasonic USA.The lens on this camera is a gem and is optically superior than any other kit lens.  This all the more amazing considering how small they made it.  Shrinking the size like that usually entails all sorts of optical problems which need to be digitally corrected.  While it is a very nice all purpose lens, no one is going to confuse it with a fast prime.  It would be nice if it were a constant f/3.5 but that would increase the size.  The construction on the outside, however, is plastic so you need to be careful not to scratch it.  Right now the only way to get this lens is with this camera.  I am sure that will change in time.My first reaction to this camera is that it does not have a grip.  If this had an EVF that might be a problem.  However,  this camera is too small and is not designed to be held like a traditional camera.  It is small enough and is designed to be carried by 2 to 4 fingers on the top and bottom.My next reaction was this camera does not have an EVF.  For me an EVF is a must.  A camera would have to be exceptional for me to overlook this.  This camera is.  The handling on this camera is specifically setup to not shoot with an EVF.My third reaction was this camera does not have a traditional control dial to set shutter speed and EV.  Instead it has a rotating dial on the back.  This control setup works exceedingly well.  I would not have believed it before trying it but the Digital fusion (couldn't resist) between physical controls and soft touch screen controls is perfect on this camera.My forth reaction was this is a great looking camera.  Very clean and stylish.This actually leads me to what I think is one of the most underrated features on Panasonic cameras and is on the GM1.  This is intelligent auto plus (iAuto+).  I don't think most people understand what this does for you.  With most intelligent autos, the user is locked out from making any decisions at all.  Very nice if you are new and don't have any idea what you are doing but want to take nice pictures.  (Most DSLRs pop up the flash which actually makes this mode pretty worthless).  With iAuto, the camera scans the scene and the decides whether it is a portrait or landscape or flower etc and then makes numerous setting to the camera to optimize the picture.  It would take a person several minutes to make all of these changes.  That part of iAuto is great.  What is not good is you can't usually change the EV or the aperture setting.  But with iAuto+ you can.  You can set in EV, change the Aperture, and even change the colors.  On the GM1 you press the up arrow on the control wheel to scroll through the options of EV, Defocus control, and Color settings.  This is an incredibly powerful feature and I don't know of any other manufacture that offers it.Another really nice feature this camera has is a function button located on top and 5 virtual fn buttons located on the right side of the touch screen.  This means whatever controls you use most frequently you can program and have instant access to.  For a camera with very minimal physical controls, it handles very well and very quickly.Next is Panasonic's Q (Quick menu system).  You press the bottom left button which brings up the quick menu system on the screen.  This allows you to change any shooting setting that you want.I did not think I would really be able to use the large lenses on this camera.  I was wrong.  This camera is so small and light that you are basically just using the lens.  You support the lens not the camera because it is so small and light.My fifth reaction was Holy Smokes Batman, this camera is amazing and revolutionary.  I bought this camera to mostly for the lens and was most likely return it.  Instead I am keeping it and I am sure it will be my most used camera.ProsRevolutionaryAmazingly HandingAmazingly Small and Light - you really have to see it to believe itExcellent Kit LensCan use any of the full line of m43 lensesGreat m43 image quality in a small packageNice build feelNice Quick menu touch screen system.Great handlingBuilt in fill flash.ConsCamera is so small it is easy to accidentally set something on the touch screen.No tilting screen

Cameta Camera sells a kit version of this product on Amazon for the same price as the camera only.  The product link is as follows.  Panasonic Lumix DMC-GM1 Micro Four Thirds Digital Camera with 12-32mm Lens with 32GB Card + Case + Tripod + 3 Filters + Kit.  None of this extra stuff is top notch but it all works.  Some of it is useful.While I was first shooting and playing with this camera, I really liked it but I was stuck in my paradigm of it needs a grip, an EVF, and external controls to be a serious camera. This is a nice and small 2 port charger.  This little charger replaced a far more expensive one that I owned and it works much better.  It is also very small and fits snugly in the cars's power port.Some things to note on this charger is there are two different rated ports.  The first is a 2.1 amp useful for iPad and the second is a 1 amp for phones.  You can use the 2.1 amp for a fast recharge of your phone but that can cause the batter to heat up and shorten the life span.  So I would recommend that as an occasional thing.  The ports are marked but it is exceedingly difficult to read which is which.  Using a pair or reading glasses and another pair as a magnifying glass I could finally read it.  However, it is easy to remember which is which as the 1 amp is closest to the blue logo on the front.The second thing to note is you only get the 2.1 amps if only one device is plugged in.  If there are 2 devices, you get 1 amp from each port.The materials on this product are a cut above the standard.  The plastic feels more solid and this is very well put together.  I also like the little blue light.  It is not too bright at night but it does provide a little guide for plugging your device in.This product also has overheat and overcharge prevention circuitry built in to provide a little more protection to your device.All in all, I liked it so much I bought another one for my other car.I was provided this product for review purposes.

I do not like misrepresented products. These are not wool socks. They are - according to their label - a blend of wool and other fibers. Artificial wool is not wool. Wool comes from sheep and sometimes legitimately from other animals. Another misrepresentation is the term "super thick". They are not. In fact by the time they stretched to fit onto my size 9 female feet, they had become quite thin. In spite of being so stretched, they are comfortable and reasonably warm over liner sox, for this in-between season. (I have now purchased some similar "offshore" socks in men size which does solve the size problem but these don't have the cute patterns that I love. A choice of sizes would be logical here.)That said, they are well woven and come in very fetching patterns. Also the price is good although I was not happy when they became three dollars less after I purchased them. So far they have held up through my way of washing wool blend socks, which is in cool water and hung to dry.

For 19 years of retirement I have able to buy this standard Planner at Walmart. Prior to that they were supplied by my department, which is how I became accustomed to their use. Somehow they are just the right combination of portability and space and feature.This year Walmart had a bunch of "updated" planners. Why change what works? Now I'd be the first to say that in this town we have the World's Smallest WallyWorld so perhaps if I travelled elsewhere I would have discovered my faves on the shelves. But that wouldn't make sense. It's at least a 60 mile round trip to the next Walmart. So I was happy to discover this tried and true version on Amazon. Yeah, it cost a little more as somebody has to pay for home shipping even though we've already paid our Prime memberships. But oh well - gotta pick your battles and I am simply happy to have this ready to go for 2016.

Stay away from any and all Auslogics products. They were formerly good products, even the freeware, but have changed. Now they will install invasive spyware and unwanted toolbars and the like, saying you will have a chance to reject them during installation but they don't tell you that in order to have a choice, you must select a special option. So in other words they lie. Plus pay attention to the statements by other customers who have been cheated via short activation codes. You no longer want to have anything to do with this company. Sad when greedy underhanded people get ahold of a company that was started by good people.

This is a historical document, reproduced, so don't expect it to read the way a modern one does. But if you are descended from the Greenes of Rhode Island and want to trace that descent, or if you want to explore whether your Greenes or Greens are that line, this book will do the trick. The author does go off on self-fluffing tangents but people did that in those days. Don't worry about it, for the price and the documentation, just buy this.

I find Fage Greek Yogurt absolutely top-notch - creamy and never too acid - but this container has a design flaw. Let me say too that the preserves are the best. But you need a special tool to get them out of the too-narrow, specially-designed container. A normal spoon won't fit in there. And no, the fruit mixture doesn't flow out the way the picture shows. Some may come out that way but a significant amount must be somehow scraped out. So you can't get at what you paid for and go off to find some narrow implement to use as a scraper. Yes, a table knife will work. But other brands that package the fruit sauce separately from the yogurt have managed to design the container so that even a large spoon can be used as a scraper. What were the Fage people thinking? This goes along with their use of a pesky little paper on the top of their regular containers that always drips on its way to the waste can. Not thinking. But their foods are the best despite these annoyances.

First of all the yogurt is very good, dense as Greek yogurt should be (in other words not runny like the brands that leave too much liquid in so not good value) and not at all acid - again as some brands can be. The blackberry/raspberry preserves are perfect: not too sweet, not too tart. Couldn't be better!Another plus is the design of the container. Frankly, I am liking this configuration with the topping packaged separately. But you should know that some other manufacturers' container designs have too-small partitions for the topping so that you can't even get a spoon in and then you have to go looking for a special tool to remove the food you paid for. Not this kind. Both compartments are wide enough to use a regular spoon, even a tablespoon. Very high marks for this.

I will start by saying that this reproduction is just fine, no problem. The old documents appear to be copied as opposed to reset.I bought this due to my fascination with a Tory reprisal visited upon residents of the Middle Line Road area in 1780, masterminded by a vicious and vengeful Tory named Joseph Bettys (Bettis), in reprisal for the defeat of Loyalists (British forces) in the American Revolution just four years before. This lawless massacre and capture was not noted in history books when I was a student. Of course the old documents are written in a flowery and indirect manner, with which anyone who has studied 18th and 19th century original source material is familiar.This history has many illustrations and chronicles the lives of many original inhabitants thus is of great interest to anyone whose ancestors lived in the Ballston Spa, Saratoga County, New York area.

If Florida is on your radar for more than a short vacation, get this book and read it. I would have bought a Kindle version if Amazon offered it, but since that is not the case, I went to Stack's publishing website and ordered a PDF version there. Worked fine on my Windows laptop.Every place has a good side and the ugly. It's the unexpected that may "get" you. Stack makes it clear what you need to know if you are relatively happy where you are. My brother is going through his first full Florida summer in St. Pete and I am waiting for a report. That happens to be an area that gets fewer direct hurricane hits than others but is not immune. Plus his condo is in effect on stilts with special hurricane-proof windows. (Expensive but he has the bucks.) Still, he could face a mandatory evacuation. Stack lists that hurricane threat as the primo reason that people become quickly weary of Florida life. He probably could stuff even more helpful info but what he does give is most thought-provoking. Plus you can go to hs blogsite and learn more specifics and he will answer comments.In my case I am not happy where I am, do not have family around for holidays, have adjusted to a long winter indoor life and would like a more social existence. But my financial position does not allow an easy answer to snowbirding or sixing as Stack calls it, so I must think twice. Or three times. Snakes and giant cockroaches? Sudden torrential rains that flood dwellings even though not in flood zone? The need to be protected from far stronger sun exposure all the time? Sinkholes, volatile markets, higher crime, condo living that would curtail the exercise I get from yardwork?Well, you read it for yourself or you may regret it.

So the watch is ticking again. Installation required some careful work to see just how to press back a little lever that holds the battery in but that's to be expected. I bought from MYBATTERYSUPPLIER and the product was shipped quickly and the expiration date is Feb 2018. Since I have purchased 5 batteries that should keep this watch going for a long time, especially since they usually last beyond the expiration date anyway.

The story with its vivid characters, descriptions of place and time, dangers and betrayals, is a palatable way to understand an interesting and important part of the white settlement of the US West. It is a good adult read but also reasonably appropriate for teen/YA readership as there isn't too much graphic stuff, just some scenes of passion that don't become too explicit.I have read extensively about the actual history of the Mandans, so enjoyed the descriptions of what I already knew about their story and found it accurate. However, their story does not end well so inevitably the book ends on a down note although the author seems to downplay the tragedy of the tribe. However the book is well written, the characters more or less, mostly more, believable. I think you will enjoy it if you can get a copy. I had to borrow from the library.

Coconut oil is my new favorite for saut√© purposes, especially due to its high smoke point. This more refined version from a reliable producer does not have the coconut scent which makes it perfect for cosmetic uses, especially if left on the skin. I frankly like the light coconut odor when using it in cooking, as I also have some that is cold-pressed as opposed to this that is refined using the steam method. Coconut oil solidifies at normal (winter) room temperature thus is a bit trickier to remove from the container but one gets used to it. Besides, I keep it in the fridge as a hedge against rancidity.

Poisoning rodents is not my favorite solution but after years of living on a semi-rural river, I have found that I must have all rodent control methods in my arsenal. When one does not work, another will. Anyone who thinks about it will fear that a poisoned rodent may then be ingested by someone's pet. I no longer have my beloved indoor cats (which of course explains the presence of rodents - a renewable menace) so I don't have to worry about them but my neighbors let their cats run free. Besides death by poisoning - not my first choice.So this works in situations where the easily-set black traps and distressingly inhumane glueboards do not. Just be careful when handling the toxic bait

My main exposure to measuring wheels has been for the writing of hiking trail descriptions. This smaller one could work for that but probably the traditional larger ones would be better for rough terrain. This has the excellent characteristic of being easy to store whether in the vehicle or home, as it is compact to start with and then has the telescoping handle. I'd say this is best for specific lighter uses both indoor and outdoor.In my test runs which I double-checked with a high quality measuring tape, this wheel was sufficiently accurate for most uses, using the axle point to point. Thing is, this device is far easier to use than a tape in many situations. It is relatively lightweight, sturdily enough built as long as not abused.
