It will work on any camera that has a flash hot shoe, but must be used in Manual on those cameras other than a Canon.  A Canon is the only camera this flash will work for in the ETTL or Automatic Mode.  Great product Pixel!

I bought this Etronic Security Lock not for locking a bicycle, but for locking my 10 foot gate.  I like it for several reasons.  One is that it is thicker than the normal cable and would be really hard to break.  The second reason is the lock is using numbers.  I made the mistake of buying a cable lock in a department store and it had letters instead of numbers.  It almost drove me crazy trying to set up a code that made any sense that I could remember.  I never liked that one at all.I bought a second cable lock from another department store and it was so hard to turn the numbers that my wife refused to use it.  Back to the store it went.I ordered this one from Amazon, and for one thing it is thicker than almost any other cable, has numbers that turn easily and once the code has been dialed in,  it easily comes apart.  This one is a winner in many ways and I really like this cable for those reasons.  I wish it was shorter, but I guess I can't have everything.

I ordered this SanDIsk Ultra 32gb card for my smartphone after a cheaper brand did not work right.  This Micro SD card works perfectly in the smart phone and on my computer.  The cheaper card would not work on my computer as it could not see any files.  This SanDisk works great and I am able to format it and can see all the files on it as well.  Sometimes you just have to pay a little more and get the best.  This is one of those times.  I highly recommend the SanDisk Micro SD cards as they always work!

I have a big antenna pointed towards Atlanta in my attic and it works really well, but there are some stations that are weak and choppy.  I bought this antenna amplifier to put between the antenna cable and the tv and it really helps those weak stations come in better.  The ones that are choppy without the amplifier are not choppy with it in line and turned on.  I tried it both ways to make sure there was a substantial difference and there is.  The signal with the amplifier is much stronger and comes in a lot better.  There were two different ones, but this one stated a 20 db gain.  I am happy with the product!

The card seems to be working, but was unable to format it, and the adapter did not work at all.  Fortunately I had another adapter and was able to move some of the files from my old smaller card to this card.  I would not buy it again, and think I will reorder from a better seller.Added 7/14/15I looked at the card again and in my smartphone it is working and shows the amount of storage left on the card.  For some reason I was unable to make the card work well with my computer with an adapter, but it seems to work okay in the phone.I ordered a SanDisk Ultra 32 gb card instead and it works fine in my computer as well as in the cell phone.  The cost was a little more, but it is a brand name card and is worth the extra money.

I ordered this case for a Moto E and am very happy with it.  It fits the camera really well and adds plenty of drop protection at the same time.  It has a big hole in the bottom for a charging jack.The case adds plenty of protection to the camera lens and I am really happy about that as I kept putting my finger on the lens and when I took some shots with the camera the photos looked terrible.  At first I could not figure it out, then finally saw the lens had a fingerprint on it.  I cleaned the print off with a lens cloth and the photos improved dramatically!  This case will stop that problem as it is not easy to get a fingerprint on the lens now.A lens pen comes with the case, but there is no holder for the pen, so I see no need for it.  The case also comes with a Microfiber Digital Cleaner for the glass, but my camera lens cloth works better.  I neat freeby though.I really like the color as blue rocks!The case really adds a lot of shock protection from drops.  It is easy to hold in the hand and is made of material that is easy to grip.  The top and bottom are rubber or a rubber type material and add a lot of protection.  The push buttons work well, but it seem to take a little more effort to push the buttons now.This case looks very stylish and the color is great.  A great combination and security and peace of mind, knowing if I drop the smartphone it will probably survive intact and functioning.  That is a great thing!

I received several bulbs from G7 Sierra for a review.  This is one of those reviews.This particular bulb is a Non-Dimmable 50 watt (670 lumens) bulb.  What blows my mind about this bulb is how bright it is and the nice color of the light it produces.  I am using it in my garage and it lights up the whole garage perfectly.  With this bulb using such a small amount of electricity I just leave it on a timer and it stays on during the night.I have come to be pretty knowledgeable about the G7 Sierra bulbs.  For one thing, they are built like tanks!  The quality is fantastic and you know from the look and feel of these bulbs they are way above the normal bulb quality.  They are really well built and strong.  I dropped one on my garage floor a while back and it still worked when I connected it.  I was amazed!What totally blows me away is the amount of electricity they use, or should I say the lack of electricity they use.  This bulb uses 8 watts of electrical power, with an estimated annual cost of $0.99 or 99 cents for a whole year of use, based on use of 3 hours per day.  That, my friends, is almost nothing!  Even better than that, are you worried the bulb will burn out?  Try 22.8 years of use at 3 hours per day!  These might be the last set of bulbs you will ever have to purchase.Another great benefit of these awesome bulbs is they do not get hot to the touch.  That fact is important, but not really, as they will never need replacement!G7 Sierra has produced an outstanding product that will last tens of years and burn almost no electricity!  Who could not happy and satisfied with that?  A great product Sierra!  I will be buying many more of your bulbs in the near future, to replace all the older bulbs in my house.

I received this FiveJoy Hands Free Desktop Magnifier for a review.  This is that review.I was surprised at how lightweight the magnifier was.  The magnifier comes in two pieces.  One is the base and the other is the light itself.  There is a notch on the light stem and it fits into the base and will only go in one way.  The light is plenty strong and throws a good beam, lighting the whole area of the magnifier.  The magnifier has two different magnifications.  The main magnifier is a 1X and is great for just about everything.  The second magnifier is a 4X.  The only problem I had with the 4X is it is pretty small in diameter and not easy to get positioned so you can easily see through it.I made the mistake of trying to use this magnifier to see the inside of a ring my wife had bought.  At 1X it was not magnified enough to see the writing on the inside of the ring, and with the 4X the light from the magnifier was not positioned to see the lettering well.  In reality that was not a good test for this magnifier.I also used it to look at some fine print on a bottle and it worked great for that.  Even the 4X magnifier was easy to use in those conditions and this is more what the magnifier is made to be used for.  It is great for looking at fine print on papers or threading a needle and things like that.  The light is well  disbursed and spreads throughout the viewing area.All in all, I was happy with the magnifier and it works great!  The quality is great and the two pieces were easy to put together.  I would not hesitate to recommend it to others.

I bought this Leadcin Heavy 9mm Titanium Steel Men's Necklace because I liked the look of the link pattern and like the heavy titanium weight.  It feels good on my neck and I like the way it looks.  My wife stated that she wished it was a little longer, but it works fine for me.The clasps are very strong and sturdy and the necklace is really tough.The only thing I can see that would make the necklace better is if the snap was on a swivel as it tends to twist the necklace at the top where the snap is.  I would also like to see it a little longer, but I am more than happy with it and could see myself buying another one for a gift for a friend as well.

I received this 180 Cosmetics Bundle in exchange for an honest review.  This is that review.Right away my wife took the product from me and started using it.What she noticed right away is the fine lines in her face started receding.  She is an older woman and has had many birthdays in which she was 29 years old, but to tell you the truth she is on social security, so that tells something of her age.  At first I did not really notice, but after a few days of using the product her face just looks younger.Her skin tone is better and her face just seems to glow.  The fine lines near her eyes are gone and the heavier lines are fading quickly.  She asked me to feel her face, and it feels very soft, and smooth.  She says it also makes her skin feel a lot tighter and the cremes really do make her look younger by at least 10 years!  My wife is ecstatic about the creme, and let me know that when the supply starts getting low that I had better order her some more, or else!She is as happy as could be and I am happy for her.  This product really works!

My Netgear R6300 decided to take a dump after a close lightning strike lately.  It went off line and I unplugged it and plugged it back in.  The light came on and then went off and the unit died.I have had so much good luck with Netgear Products that I decided to buy this R6250 Manufacture Refurbished model.  It works great and is so easy to set up that it is almost ridiculous.  Just plug it in and the router does the rest.  It asks if you want to install the Netgear Genie and I clicked on Yes.That program is awesome.  It allows you to set up the 2.4 and 5 Ghz modes.  It also allows the setting of the Guest router with your own password as well.  Netgear really has it together in that the setup is a piece of cake.  Where this unit really shines is the speed.  I have a router supplied by the phone company for my internet connection.  This Netgear R6250 runs circles around the one from the phone company.  It is so much faster!My house is pretty 5800 square feet in two levels, and this router works everywhere in the house.  It puts out a really strong signal and did I tell you it is fast!  It is so fast it amazes me!Why did I buy the refurbished model verses the new model?  The main reason is it is half the money and the unit is factory refurbished with a 30 day warranty from Amazon.  I have had great luck with Netgear products in the past and this unit seems to be just as good!

This cable works for connecting a Yongnuo RF-603 II to a Panasonic Camera.  I am using it on the Panasonic FZ1000 camera and with the cable the Yongnuo RF-603 II can be used as a corded remote shutter release.  The cable is well made and perfect for using my camera with one of the Yongnuo flash units.

I received the Sangean Ant-60 Short Wave Antenna today and gave it a quick check out.First of all, I have a Grundig S450 DLX shortwave receiver.  I found stations around the band and compared the signal strength with and without the Sangean Antenna.I have the antenna spread inside the house and I am sure if it was outside it would be better.  The signal strength inside on one station in particular went from a signal strength of 2 on the dial without the antenna to 4 with the antenna.  I found this to be consistent throughout the bands.  It made the receiver much more sensitive to weak signals.The Sangean was easy to use.  It comes with a clip to hook to the radio antenna if no jacks are provided on the radio for an antenna.  In my case, the radio had an antenna input but it was a 75 ohm type instead of the 3.5mm jack that comes with the Sangean Antenna.  The clip goes over the top section of the radio antenna and clips into place.The Sangean Antenna comes rolled up on a spool.  To extend the antenna, just pull it out, and the spool has a spring clip on it to attach the spool to a small tree branch or something solid. Once finished with the antenna the spool has a finger hole in order to roll the antenna back into the spool.The quality of the Sangean ANT-60 is outstanding and built very solid.  It is easy to extend and retract the antenna and if your radio has not 3.5mm antenna jack, just clip it to the radio antenna.  The price was certainly great as well.  I highly recommend it.

I was offered this product for an honest evaluation and review on Amazon.  Here is that review:The Soundpeats Qy7 came in a nice little box and in the box was a nice little hard case.  Inside the case was the Bluetooth Earbud Headphones and all kinds of accessories.  I plugged the headphones into my computer with the supplied USB cable.  In no time at all the unit showed full charge.I was able to turn the unit on by pressing and holding the RDO button on one of the ear pieces and as soon as I pressed and held that button the unit came on and a red light lit up.I turned on the Bluetooth on my tablet and it immediately saw the Soundpeats Qy7 headset, so I connected the pair.  The volume was ok, but not really loud like I normally listen to music.  It turns out the volume control is on the other ear piece and has a + or - on the control. I pressed the + and the volume got louder.  I held it down and the volume got loud.  Really loud!  Great!  I turned the volume down on my tablet and listened to the music.  The sound was nice and sharp and clear.I paid attention to the headset itself, and it is well made with durable components.  The ear pieces were too  big for my ears, but in the accessories were other smaller ear pieces that fit just right.The green head band is really well made and is very strong.  All of the accessories were quality components for the headphones with different ear pieces.  The USB cable for charging the unit was very well made of quality materials.  There are no cheaply made parts on the Soundpeats Qy7 headphone.  It exhibits quality all the way, from the extremely well made hard case to the quality headphones.The best part.  The sound!  It was extremely sharp and clear and sounded awesome!  And it was loud, really loud!  Soundpeats outdid themselves on this unit and should be commended!  I received this unit for testing and giving an honest evaluation.  In my opinion, this unit is the one to beat!  Good stuff Soundpeats!

I received this iGearPro 3 in 1 Voice Recorder for an honest evaluation on Amazon.  This is my review.I opened the box and removed the 3 in 1 Voice Recorder and hooked up the USB cable from the unit to the computer.  Immediately a series of blue lights began flashing, first at 25%. Over the period of about 30 minutes the lights went from 25% to 100%, indicating a full charge.To turn on the built in light I pressed the power button two times and the light came on.  Two more times and the light went off....Cool!Next I hooked the 2200 MaH Power Bank to my cell phone and within 30 minutes it had the cell phone at full charge.  Cool!The last step was to check out the voice recorder.  I held down the voice recorder button for a second and a Red Light started flashing, indicating it was recording.  I let the recorder go for 30 seconds or so, while talking into the recorder.  I pressed the recorder button again to stop the recording and twice more to kill the red light.I hooked the recorder to my computer with the supplied USB cord and clicked on Play when that window came up.  The recorder played back the recording and my voice was so distorted that I could barely understand what I was saying.  The tv in the background was nice and sharp and clear, but my voice was way over distorted and loud and not understandable.The tv sound was fine, so that told me the recorder was ok, so I did another recording with the recorder about 18 inches away this time.  I spoke in a normal voice and did not speak loudly like I did the first time.I played the recording back on the computer again, and this time it was perfect.  It was plenty loud enough and my voice was nice and clear and I could hear the tv in the background.  The first time I had spoken in a louder than normal voice and I just over drove the recording circuit.  I learned that you need to speak in a normal fashion at a normal speaking level and if done the correct way, the recorder works perfectly!The recorder starts just as soon as the recorder button is pressed.  The recorder microphone is very sensitive and can hear everything in the room, which is good.  If I was dictating some information to the recorder, I would just speak in a normal voice.The recorder is very rugged and plenty of cables are included to charge various cell phones and tablets.  It is a nice little voice recorder, flash light, and cell phone/tablet charger.  I could not be happier with the unit.  It works great and the voice recorder is very responsive and very sensitive.  The pen light is strong as well.  This is a great little unit and I highly recommend it.

I found this unit brand new at a yard sale.  It works great!  The radio receives from 1711 to 29999 khz on short wave, plus AM and FM bands.  The readout is digital and has a fast and slow dial.  It works on AC or 6 D batteries.  The shortwave radio has an antenna for SW and FM bands, and appears to have a built in antenna for AM.What I did notice about the radio is it is extremely sensitive and the frequency on the dial is exactly spot on.  The radio will receive all the short wave bands to include ham and cb frequencies.lt has 50 presets for different bands as well.  The dial has a finger hole to make it much easier to spin. The radio works great in FM and the speaker has a good tonal quality, which is adjustable for bass and treble.  It also has a AM RF Gain control on the main face.  The radio also has a built in clock.I would recommend purchasing a Sangean ANT-60 Short Wave Antenna to go with the Grundig Receiver.  It clips to the antenna and is 23 feet long for better reception of the short wave frequencies.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000023VW2?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=oh_aui_detailpage_o00_s00What makes this short wave radio so outstanding is the frequency readout.  It is extremely accurate and any frequency between 1711 and 29999 Khz can be dialed easily for short wave reception.  The FM dial is also nice with a 10 station presets as well.  I am very happy with this product and it is definitely a keeper.

I received a bottle of this supplement in exchange for an honest review.The Tribulus Terrestris Suppliment is outstanding!  I was a little skeptical at first, but kept taking the capsules, one every day.  After two weeks I can feel an improvement.  I have more energy and just feel good.  I have been happy too. I received a bottle of the Eklund Essential Omega Norwegian Fish Oil capsules in exchange for an honest review.The Eklund Essential Omega - Norwegian Fish Oil is fantastic! The capsules look very rich and pure.The last bottle of fish oil I had was a cheap brand and 20 minutes after taking one of the capsules it would start coming back up into the throat with burps. I received one of these umbrellas for leaving an honest review.The size of the umbrella is fantastic as it is really large!  Just take off the case, and push the button and the automatic umbrella unfolds and snaps right up.  It is very strong in that it has 8 metal/fiberglass ribs for strength.  The ribs are mostly metal with a small length of fiberglass.  I love it that it goes up completely when the button is pressed, and even better yet, the canopy compresses when the button is pressed again.  The main pole does not go down automatically.  You must pull that down manually.The umbrella was easy enough to close down and get into the case.  The key is to compress the arms and wrap the material around them.  The fit is tight,  but if you roll it up snugly, it goes right in.  The umbrella looks so great once put back into the case.  It is very small and compact.I could not be happier with the umbrella.  It is very well made and very strong and durable.  The material is strong and well stitched and I love the push button up and the push button down.  The price is fantastic as well. I liked it so much I ordered a second one for my wife.

I do a lot of walking at fast speeds on a treadmill and at the speed of 4 miles per hour, my shins begin to hurt.  I can feel the stress in the legs and on the shin.  I was given the opportunity to use these #1 Graduated Compression Calf Sleeves Guard Socks for an evaluation on Amazon and jumped at the chance.  Anything that might relieve the pain I am getting from the shin splints are more than welcome!I wore the Calf Sleeve Guards Socks today while walking on the treadmill and 4 miles per hour was not a problem at all.  I was able to walk at 4.5 miles per hour with no pain what so ever.  These compression socks are excellent!  It feels so good to be able to work out harder and go faster without feeling pain.  I walked for an hour with no problem at all.These compression socks worked great for walking and working out, but there is another reason I wanted them and it is even more important.  I occasionally fly on airlines.  In one case, I fly from Atlanta, Georgia to Tokyo, Japan and that flight lasts 16 or more hours.  The problem with flying that far is what they call "Economy Class Syndrome", which is getting blood clots in the legs.  It can be very critical or even deadly.  Compression stockings are frequently used to prevent the blood clotting while flying and If I ever fly on a long trip again, you can bet I am going to be wearing this product!

My wife broke her ankle a couple of years ago, and still has pain and stiffness in the joint.  Nothing has helped relieve the pain.  She has tried different pain medications without success.  The pain goes away for a while but soon comes back.  I was offered this product in exchange for an honest review and I jumped at the chance.My wife put the Best Pantar Fascitis Compression Foot Sleeves for the ankle on yesterday.  She wore them for an hour or so, and I asked her how they were working and she said her ankle felt a lot better.  She said the throbbing pain inside the her foot was gone.  The compression foot sleeves fit pretty tight and they help with circulation.  The best part is the sleeves come in pairs and only one is needed in her case, so the other can be used later.  The sleeves are not hot and seem to breathe well with no perspiration or sweating under them.Later on my wife went to work and when she came home she still had the sleeve on and she said she loved it!I have been told by higher headquarters (my wife) that when and if these sleeves ever wear out, she wants a new pair immediately.  The price of the sleeve is very reasonable and I ordered another set.  I don't mind paying for a product that really works and this foot sleeve is a real winner!

I have to admit that I wanted the lanyard more than I needed the lens cap, but can use the 55mm lens cap on another camera.  The lens cap is great and better than most because it has two ways to get the cap off.  One way is to grab the cap by the outer squeeze grips and squeeze them together and the cap immediately comes off.  The other way is to grab the inside squeeze grips and take the lens cap off.  Why is this special?  Because sometimes the lens hood is connected forward in the proper using position in the camera and the outer squeeze grips are not available because of the lens hood.  In that case, just use the inner squeeze grips and take the lens cap off.The lens cap is great, but it is the lanyard that I needed for another lens cap I have.  It is 62mm and this company does not sell one with this lanyard in that size.  The lanyard is great as the bottom that connects to the cap is thin and very strong and easy to get through the lens cap, and the top is much thicker and very strong and easy to get through the camera strap holes.  It is the best of both worlds.  Most of the time when you order a lens cap, it comes with a string that is not even connected at the ends.  It is just a string.  You have to tie a knot in it and it is subject to coming lose and dropping the lens cap.  This lanyard is connected already, with two loops.  One goes on the lens cap and the other goes on the camera.  The quality is very good and it is very very strong.What a winner!  A great lens cap with two different inner and outer opening grips and a good quality strong lanyard with a small loop for the lens cap and a larger strong loop for the camera!

This Fotodiox 6 X 9 inch Softbox for an external flash is outstanding.I have several different flash softboxes and this one is the best of all of them.  In most brands once the softbox is unfolded will not stay straight.  They droop down because the seams that hold them straight are too weak.  I keep buying different brands and finally I have found a good one.  This softbox, once unfolded, stays straight ahead towards the subject without drooping.It took me a total of 3 - 6 X 8 inch softboxes and none of them are strong enough to hold the flash material straight on line with the subject.  I made the mistake of ordering a 8 X 12 inch softbox and it was even worse.  It looked like a wilted flower.  It would not stay straight out no matter how I  manipulated the seams.This softbox from Fotodiox is the best one of the bunch.  It is a little bigger at 6 X 9, and it works great too. It takes out the shadows and illuminates the area uniformly without any hot spots.  It works really great as a fill softbox on the external flash. The flash fill does not look like a flash was used and that is the look we strive for.  It sits up on top of the external camera flash all loud and proud.  I finally got the right one and now I am a very happy camper.

I have a different brand 6 X 8 softbox, and it works great, but the thing just wants to sloop downward and as much as I have tried, there is no way to make it stay and stand straight.  I bought this 8 inch octagon soft box, hoping it would stay straight when folded out.  To my surprise, it does stay straight!  What a relief!  I took several photos with the flash attached using the Neewer 8 inch octagon soft box and the lighting was very uniform and pleasing at all zoom levels.  I did not try to bounce the flash, but aimed it directly at the subject.  I was a little concerned the lighting would be more in the middle of the shot and less on the outside, but that is not what happened.  The lighting was even and the same at the corners as it was in the middle.  The thing I liked most about this softbox is once unfolded, it shoots straight out and does not sloop down.  What a winner!  I could not be happier with the product!

The Oregon S62 18 inch Semi Chisel Chain Saw Chain works perfectly on my Sears Craftsman 18 inch chain saw.  The chain cuts wood like butter  .

This sign is great.  It is big enough to put on my gate and be seen from the street.  It gives warning to anyone who might be thinking about coming to my property to steal something.  It goes really well with one of the dummy video surveillance cameras.

There are nights that I just cannot seem to settle my brain.  It seems when I go to bed, I am very sleepy, but as soon as I lay down my mind starts up and I can't seem to go to sleep.  I cannot judge this product in full, but I have tried it two different times when I had a night where I could not sleep and within 30 minutes of taking the pill, I was in dream land.  I woke up in the morning, alert and refreshed.  I am giving the product a five star rating as it works just like they say it will and I am happy with the results of taking it.

I found this light stand very acceptable and certainly strong enough for a light stand.  I plan on using it for an off camera external flash and a small umbrella.  The stand was nice in that it came with a case.  I also used a Flash Bracket Swivel Bracket Umbrella Holder Studio Tilting Bracket on top.  The flash attaches to the bracket and an umbrella can also be mounted on the bracket as well.  The stand has two upper extensions for getting the lights higher as needed.  The price is certainly very low and the quality is great.

The first thing I noticed is the light itself.  The Camo pattern is extremely pretty and as soon as my wife saw it, she took it from me.  I like the color of the light a lot!  It puts out quite a lot of brightness and lights the room up very well.Last night I was watching tv.  Earlier I had thought about checking the Camo Lantern out.  All of the sudden, out of the blue, the lights went out.  There were storms in the area, but not all that close.  I thought to myself, now I can really check the Camo Lantern with a thorough real test.  I went into my wife's room and went to the light.  I knew where she put it, but at that point I had no light on me and it was dark in the room.  I found the lantern by feel and pulled it apart and immediately felt the strong light coming out that lit up the whole room.  The lantern was actually very bright!At the time I read the summary for the light I realized it had no ON or OFF switch and thought that was a downer.  In a real life situation I was happy there was no switch on the lantern as it would not have been easy to find the switch in the dark.  I just pulled on the top of the lantern and the light came on right away.  Wicked Cool!When I read the summary for the lantern I also noticed it had no dimmer.  I would have liked for the light to have a dimmer mode to allow for a longer run on the AA batteries the lantern uses.  I also wish it would take a stronger battery like a D cell, but the light is way too small for a battery like that.The power was off for more than 3 hours and when the power finally came back on the Camo Lantern was still blasting away in full brightness.  I don't know how long the three AA batteries will run on the lantern, but at the end of the 3 hour stretch the light was still in full brightness.  In all actuality most of the time when the power fails three hours is plenty of time.  Normally the power is back on way before that.I am very impressed with the lantern itself.  The camo colors are just too cool and not drab like all the other lights I have.  The lantern puts out a very bright light that lights up the whole room.  I don't know how long three AA batteries will run the light, but it went 3 hours with flying colors.  I highly recommend this light and am going to buy two more for the other rooms in my house.

I received a set of the TeiKis 19 Piece Grill Set for an honest review.  I have checked out and have used the set and this is my review.The best part about this set is the case.  It is fantastic and built like a tank.  The outer part is made of a high quality strong plastic with an aluminum frame.  The case handle is made of steel and the case is really really well made.  The case has two snaps to hold the lid shut and they fit snugly and are tight.  The inside of the case is quality too, with elastic holders on one side of each tool, and Velcro on the other side.  With the Velcro on one side, it is easy enough to unhook the Velcro and pull the tool through the elastic loop.The slotted turner/flipper -  I go to yard sales a lot and buy BBQ turner/flippers all the time.  I kind of collect them, especially the good ones!  I am always on the hunt for a good turner that is well built.  The turner that comes in this set is the best turner I have ever seen.  None of the turners that I have found at yard sales have groves on the sides for scooping up hamburgers from the left or right side.  They are always just in the front.  This turner has a blade in the front like a normal turner has, but this one also has grooves in the left and right side of the flipper to pick up hamburgers from the left or right.  The handle is steel and has a ring in the end for hanging it.  It also has a bottle opener built into the flipper.  The turner has a little flex, but just the right amount.Jumbo Tongs - They are very well made and the tension on the tongs is just about right.  The ends of the tongs did not match up perfectly, but they work just fine.8 each Corn Holders - Very well made with steel handles with plastic on the ends.  I tried a couple of them on my wife's cooked corn on the cob and they work great!  They fit into the corn tightly and easily and keep the hot corn off the fingers.  They fit snugly in the case with elastic loops.4 each Steak Knives - The knives are all steel with serrated edges.  These knives are sharp, very sharp.  They cut through steak like butter.Heavy Duty BBQ Fork - Big long steel handle with a loop at the end for hanging.  The fork is very well made and has just the right amount of flex and the tines are very sharp.8 inch All Purpose Knife - Once again, all steel construction with a loop at the end for hanging.  This knife is sharp!  Very sharp!  You need to take careful attention when removing or inserting the knife in the case as this thing is no nonsense sharp!  Just be careful with the serrated edge and not  be in any hurry to get it out.Gourmet Basting Brush - The brush handle is steel with a loop at the end for hanging.  The brush itself is very soft and pliable, which is great for applying BBQ sauce.  The brush is also made of rubber so cleaning it is very easy and quick!Grill Cleaning Brush - Once again, a steel handle with a loop for hanging.  The grill brush has a scrapper on the front end for the tough stuff.  There is a plastic cover that covers the bronze bristles when not in use to keep the case clean.  The handle flexes just a little bit, just the right amount.  The bristles are extremely hard and stiff and clean the grill very effectively.Digital Thermometer - works incredibly fast on testing food for the proper temperature. It reads in Celsius or Fahrenheit, changed with a switch.  For fun I held the thermometer in my hand and amazingly it measured my body temperature of 98.6 from my hand.  Awesome!This grill set is a home run!  The tools are all well made out of steel and the case is fantastic!  All the tools are held in place with elastic on one end and with Velcro on the other for easy and quick removal and installation.  This TeiKis 19 Piece Deluxe Stainless Steel BBQ Grill Set is totally awesome and the last grill set you will ever have to buy.  The tools are well made of quality materials and should last forever.  I highly recommend this product!

I bought this diffuser on the recommendation of another reviewer for the Aperlite YH-400 manual flash.  It fits the flash perfectly.  I like the diffuser as it has a grid pattern in the end that diffuses the light even more.  Some diffusers have just plastic in the end, but this one has a diffusion pattern in the end of the diffuser to spread the light even more.  The price is certainly very reasonable and I am very happy with the product.
This adapter allows me to use my microphone, which has a 3.5mm jack to my camera's 2.5mm receptacle.  The quality is great and it works like a charm.
The adapter works perfectly on my Panasonic FZ1000 camera.  It adapts the 3.5mm male plug from my microphone to the 2.5mm receptacle on the camera.  The quality is certainly there and it works great!

I bought this flash on the recommendation of Graham Houghton, and found the flash to work as advertised.  The features of the flash have been covered by Graham and many others and I agree with all of them.  It is an awesome flash and is very powerful.  The only thing I do not like about the flash is the stepping process in turning up or turning down the power.  If the button above or to the right of the set button is pressed, the flash power goes up, but it is in steps, not in stops.  It goes up 1/3 EV every time the button is pressed and if the button is pressed three times it goes up one stop.  It takes forever to go from 1/64 to 1/2 power for instance by pressing the button.  The button can be held down, but at that point it goes incredibly fast and it is hard to stop it in time.  I wish there was a way to take the 1/3 EV stepping process out of the flash and just give me stops like from 1/64 to 1/32 to 1/16 without going through the stepping EV process along the way.The flash is a manual one in that the power and zoom settings are set by you and not the camera.  This flash will work on any camera that has a hot shoe and will not work in any of the auto modes like TTL.A Nikon 900 flash plastic diffuser will fit on the Aperlite flash.http://www.amazon.com/Xit-XTHD910-Bounce-Diffuser-SB-900/dp/B00BY3LQ8M/ref=cm_rdp_product

I received one of these LED Miner Safety Cap Lamps for an honest review on Amazon.  The quality of the light is outstanding as it has a thick plastic outer shell.  The unit has a red plastic cap over the charging jack for waterproof protection.  It comes with a head strap that is plenty heavy enough for wearing the Lamp on the head.The light has a red switch on top for turning the unit on. The switch has two power settings.  The first push of the switch provides full power and the second push provides a dimmed output.  I thought the beam might be adjustable for wider and narrower beam settings, but I could not adjust the light at all.The bracket that holds the head band swivels for using different angles of the light, and when I first tried to adjust the beam down I was unable to adjust it as the bracket screws were way too tight.  I just loosened the screws on the bracket a little and now it works fine.What really impressed me about this safety lamp is the light itself, as it is really bright!  The batteries really impressed me too.  The batteries are Lithium Ion and last a year between charges.  They are much better than normal NiMH batteries used today.The charger works perfectly too.  I just plugged the charger in while it was connected to the lamp and the light on the charger was red, showing charge.  I came back an hour or so later and the light on the charger had changed from Red to Green, showing full charge.This lamp is really well made of thick plastic material and looks like it could be dropped without damage.  The lamp is waterproof as well.  The batteries are killer with a long life between charges.  I highly recommend the LED Miner Safety Cap Lamp!

I received a set of Dog Electric Grooming Clippers Set for evaluation and review.  The first thing I noticed is the clipper set comes in a nice plastic box that holds all the components.  It has 4 different attachment plastic clipper comb sets.  I did not find these comb sets helpful in cutting my dog's hair as it is too thick and mattes easily.  That is not the fault of the set.  I have other very expensive clipper sets and the combs on them do not work either.I gave it a good test.  I cut the hair of my curly Chinese Crested dog.  His hair is incredibly hard to cut as it is so thick.  With the Dog Electric Clippers cutting the dogs hair was a piece of cake.  The clippers went through the hair like butter and it was easy to cut through the matted part.  The dog is normally really spooky but with these clippers he just sat there and let me go.  The clippers are pretty quiet, and even though it makes a noise when first starting, the dog did not seem bothered by that noise.I have a very expensive pair of clippers, but after a while the cutting head gets pretty hot.  With the Dog Electric Clippers the head never did get hot at all.  It was warm to the touch but not hot.  The dog sat there the whole time and never gave me any trouble.  I was able to take the hair off in several big pieces.  I also noticed that these clippers are easy to hold level for a straight cut.  I am very satisfied with the clippers and highly recommend them!

This Image set of filters work perfectly.  Not only are there ND (Neutral Density) filters to allow the camera to use a wider f stop (larger opening lens) for taking photos of plants or other objects in which you want a narrow depth of field with a photo taken by the camera during the day in bright sunlight, or for taking pictures of waterfalls in which you want the effect of that glow look with the water flowing.  The graduated filters work great too, in darkening the sky and leaving the bottom of the photo as is.  The sky is always brighter than the ground or the landscape and the graduated filters allow the sky to be darkened.  There are three different levels of the graduated filter and three levels of the ND filter for different occasions.  The kit comes with tons of adapters for just about any camera, and the holder is well made and the filters fit into it tightly.  I am very happy with mine and the price is certainly reasonable.  One thing I would recommend is keeping a lens cleaning cloth with the kit to wipe the fingerprints off the filters.

I used to have a Panasonic Camera and it had 52mm filters.  I bought a new Panasonic Camera and it uses 62mm filters.  In order to use my old 52mm filters I bought this step down ring from Adorama.  It works perfectly.  There is vignetting at the lower zoom levels, but that is easy enough to get rid of by zooming in more.  It might not be the perfect solution, but with this step down adapter I am able to use my old 52mm filters and that pleases me.  The adapter ring works perfectly.

I received this light and several others for an honest review on Amazon.  First I would like to say the bulbs from G7 Power are really well made, with very sturdy bodies and you can tell just by holding and looking at the bulbs that the quality is really there.  I accidentally gave this bulb the ultimate test.  I took the bulb out of the lamp in my garage and opened the box with the G7 LED 10 watt in it.  When I went to pull the bulb out, I lost my grip and dropped the bulb on a concrete floor.  I was appalled and horrified!  Surely this bulb will no longer work as it dropped hard on the concrete.  I put the bulb in the lamp and while holding my breath, hit the switch.  To my surprise, it lit up and works normally.  Believe me, these bulbs are well made and as tough as a tank.  I could not be happier with the G7 Power bulbs and plan on ordering several more of them.  In spite of being LED bulbs the prices of the G7 Power bulbs are very reasonable and did I say they are built like a tank?  They are built like a tank and I could not be happier with mine.

I currently have a Sigma 62mm CPL, but once I discovered the Hoya HD was as cheap as it is, I went for it.  I have the same Hoya HD in 52mm, but this one is 62mm.  I am very happy with this circular polarizer filter!  It is fantastic on the blue sky, and I did a comparison between the Sigma EX DG filter and this one and in my opinion the Hoya came out on top in more than one way.  The colors look deeper and just glow!  The filter does a great job of taking out the reflections of water.The photos with both filters look great, but I found that in a couple of photos, the Sigma filter shots came out a little out of focus, where the Hoya shots all looked sharp.  All shots were taken from a tripod to insure a fair comparison.There are a couple of big differences between the Hoya HD and Sigma EX DG filters.  I took every shot in aperture priority at f/5.6, and the ISO was 80 in all shots.  In every case the shutter speed the camera set with the Hoya CPL was faster then with the Sigma filter, which means it lets in more light.Another big difference is the glass itself.  The Hoya HD is hardened glass and has 8 coatings.  I noticed I had a fingerprint smudge on the Sigma,and tried to clean it off with a lens cloth, and that did not work.  It just smeared the fingerprint, and I had to use lens cleaning solution to get the print off.  I looked at the Hoya filter and there was a fingerprint on it as well.  With the Hoya all I had to do was wipe it with a lens cleaning cloth and it came right off.  You can tell the glass with the Hoya is really tough with a hard finish.  For those two reasons alone I would strongly recommend the Hoya filter over the SIgma.The Hoya CPL filter has 8 coatings and hardened glass.  This filter rocks!In comment 1 I am listing the photos taken with both filters.  Pay attention to the shutter speed.  All the photos are labeled.

My wife loves tea, but is very fussy about which brand she uses and she has a certain pot she really likes.  I got this teapot courtesy of Tea Beyond for an Amazon Review.  The teapot is really beautiful and has a really nice butterfly on the top.  The fact that it is glass, it brings out the flavors of the teas and enhances the aromas.  My wife has put her favorite tea pot back in the cupboard and this teapot has become her favorite now.  The colors are clear and many friends have commented on how beautiful the pot looks.  A great product.

My wife drinks a lot of tea and is very particular in what she likes.  She really enjoyed the Tea Beyond Combo tea products.  The tea has a great flavor and is so pretty in the pot.  I have never seen tea that looks like this.  The flavor is incredible and now my wife is bugging me for more.  I guess I will have to order more tea for the wife, because we all know that a Happy Wife means a Happy Life!  Great product!

The Hoya 77mm Neutral Density ND-400 filter works great!  It has about 9 stops of power, so getting a shot of 3 or 4 seconds during the day is easy accomplished.  The objects shot through this filter have incredible details so the filter does not degrade the photos at all.One thing I did notice though is the filter throws a magenta color cast on the target with the white balance in Auto in my camera.  This can easily be taken out in software or by using a Custom White Balance filter in the camera.  It may be my camera too, but in Auto White Balance the color cast has too much magenta.  To take care of this, I just shoot a 18% gray card or use a White Balance Filter through the camera for a custom white balance.  It may be that my camera metering for white balance may not react well in Auto for this filter.

This Promaster System Pro 77mm White Balance Lens Cap is outstanding.  I bought the 77mm size so I can use the cap on any of my cameras.  In fact, I ordered three of them for my 3 cameras.None of the cameras have a 77mm lens, so I used adapter rings to make the caps fit.  What I really like about the white balance lens caps is normally you need both hands on the camera while setting the custom white balance in the camera.  With both hands needed, one to take the shot and one to set the camera custom white balance, there is no extra hand to hold the white balance card in front of the camera, so one has no choice but to lean the card against something to set the white balance.This lens cap sets on the camera, so no extra hand is needed.  It works perfectly.  Just go to the target area and point the camera away from the target towards where the camera is going to be taking the photo.  Take a shot to set the camera custom white balance and you are done.  Then use that custom white balance setting to take the photo.

I used this scabbard on my Sears 20 inch electric chain saw that I bough at a yard sale.  It had no scabbard with the saw from the yard sale and I ordered this one.  My chain saw is a 20 inch and the scabbard is from an 18 inch to a 22 inch, so I cut two inches from the scabbard for my particular saw. It works perfectly and is very strong.  No weak plastic on this scabbard!  The scabbard is marked for cutting if the 22 inch is not needed.  I am more than satisfied with the quality of the scabbard.  It is very strong and sturdy.
I bought this chain for my Worx chain saw and it fits perfectly.  It is as good or better than the one that came on the saw and cuts through tree limbs like butter.

What do you need a variable ND filter for?  It works great for making water flow during the day when lighting is really bright. It also works great when shooting plants or things up close and you want a small depth of field.  In other words, you want the plant to be in focus, but want the other plants in the photo to be out of focus.  To get this effect, the aperture must be opened, and opening the aperture to the maximum sometimes allows too much light into the camera for the camera to get a properly lit shot.  With this variable ND filter it is easy to open the aperture and slow down the shutter to get that great depth of field we are all looking for.This Fotga Variable ND filter is great!  The best way to use it is to set the camera up in Aperture Priority and watch the camera shutter speed while turning the filter.  Once the shutter speed needed is there, stop turning and take the shot.  The filter does form an X when it is turned too far, and you need to be watching for that in the EVF (viewfinder) or on the LCD.  I have also noticed that zooming in with the filter changes where that X comes into play and it is not nearly as noticeable zoomed in.  The picture quality using the filter is very good as well.

I bought this chain saw for cutting trees around the house.  It works perfectly.  I have a 3000 watt generator on a cart,, and pull the cart to areas where I need the chain saw.  I run the saw from the generator and it works perfectly that way.  I am tired of trying to start my gas chain saws with the junk gas that is in use today.  It used to be you could leave the gas in a chain saw for months and all was well when it came time to use it.  That is no longer the case today as the gas will gum up the carburetor and not start.  Then it is an expensive trip to the repair shop to get the saw working again.  That is not the case with this chain saw.  Just pull the generator to the site and you have a working chain saw.  It has as much power as my gas saw, and I like the safety brake the Worx saw has incorporated.  It has 3.5 HP and goes through tree limbs like butter.  I could not be happier with mine.  It was a good investment.

This is the best bar and chain oil out there!  It flows easily and works great on my Sears and Worx chain saws.  I tried a bar oil that i bought locally and it was so thick that it would not flow to the chain.  No such problem with this oil.  It flows easy and works great keeping the chain lubricated.  I will buy more in the future as is needed.  This stuff is the best oil out there.
This flash diffuser works great on a Yongnuo flash!  I ordered 3 of them and they fit the Yongnuo flashes perfectly.  The price is really good too.  I could not be happier with the product!

This PC Sync cable works perfectly on my Panasonic Camera to sync the flash unit.  The cable is well made and durable, and the jacks are quality products.  A must have for my Panasonic FZ1000 camera (works on any Panasonic camera with a flash jack).

These diffusers work great on Yongnuo Flashes and have patterns in the front of the diffuser to distribute the light evenly.  The price is great for just the white diffuser and the two other colors are just an added bonus.  I ordered them for 3 of my flash units and love the quality and price.  I will continue to order from them in the future as I need more flash diffusers.  Great product!

This adapter ring as well as all the other adapter rings I have ordered from Gino works great!  They are easy to thread on the camera and the lens.  I am very happy with the Gino products and will continue to order adapter rings from them.  I have never had a problem with any of their products.

I was sent a bottle of Brainergy-X for review.  I took the product, one pill a day for 30 days. Did it help my memory?  It did.  I can remember much better than in the past.  The governor of Georgia, Nathan Deal.  The Senators of Georgia - Johnny Isakson and David Purdue.  My representative in congress - Lynn Westmoreland.  I could never remember these names before I started taking these capsules and now they just pop up in my mind when I try to recall them.  I don't feel any smarter, but I have much better recall than I had before.It may just be me, but I don't think so.  I am now able to watch Photoshop and Lightroom learning videos on my computer and remember the exact sequences and procedures of how to make a sky move to another photo for example.  I was never able to do that before.  I like the Brainergy-X so much that I bought two more bottles of the product, one for me and one for my wife.  I am hooked.  This stuff is really great and I love how it makes my mind work so much better.

I received this bulb and several others from G7 Power in exchange for honest reviews.  The first thing I noticed was how well made these bulbs are.  The quality is fantastic and you can tell from holding and looking at the bulb they are premium bulbs.I have an area in my side yard for my dogs to go and play.  I have a covered area in which I was using a  compact florescent bulb,  It lit the back yard, but just barely and even though it was rated at 100 watts, It was bright, but the light did not reach very far.I replaced that compact florescent bulb with the G7 Power Elko LED 15 (100W) watt bulb.  The first thing I noticed is how much farther and wider the lighting was.  I can see the whole back yard now!  It is also amazing that the G7 only pulls 15 watts!  The area the bulb is being used in is protected from the weather, but the bulb looks like it is sealed and could be used outside without any protection.

The Neewer 48 Macro LED Ring Flash is outstanding!  It comes with a ton of adapter rings (8 of them) from 49mm to 77mm.  The adapters are plastic, but seem sturdy enough.  I read in several reviews that the 62mm adapter does not work well.  I have a camera that requires a 62mm adapter, so tried the adapter that came with the Neewer  Ring Flash and guess what?  It did not work well.  It was too loose and would not stay in the camera.  I took the adapter off and put my UV filter back on and screwed it into the UV filter and it works fine there.  It was a tight fit and stayed in place.  I have a 62 to 67mm metal adapter so I screwed that adapter into the camera and tried the 67mm adapter that came with the flash and it works great too.  Nice tight fit!There are actually 4 modes with the flash.  Continuous, Flash, Left, and Right.  In the Continuous Mode the light stays on all the time.  In the Flash Mode, the camera will set off the flash.  In the Left or Right Mode the camera also sets off the flash.  I wondered how the camera could set off the flash as I could find no reference to the Flash Mode and how it works in any other review.  The flash foot has a pin, and any camera that has a hot shoe will set off the flash.The flash intensity is adjustable from -1.5 to +1.5.  I found that in taking shots of objects inside, the background behind the object was dark, and that is nice.  It pulls the eyes towards the target and not the background.The flash unit comes with 4 diffusers, but I did not try them yet.  I am more than satisfied with the clear one.  It also comes with a flash shoe for shots with the flash on a tripod or just sitting.To turn it on, just hold the ON/OFF button for a second or so, and it is turned off the same way. The ring flash is not made like a normal flash and will not light an object 10 feet away.  It is made for close up macro work.  It works great outside during the day as a flash fill for taking plant and flower shots.  I would not use the flash for anything more than 3 or 4 feet, especially outside as a fill flash.  It might work well as a portrait flash as the lighting will be well balanced and there will be no shadows.  If shadows are wanted, then I would use the Left or Right bank instead.The Neewer Ring Flash is easy to use.  It does vignette (can see the sides of the flash in the lens) at my camera wide open zoom setting though.  I rarely use the camera at wide open  zoom when taking macro shots, and to get rid of the vignetting I had to zoom to about 1X and it was gone.  I took some shots at wide open and kind of liked the look of the vignetted setting on the lens with the flash. It moves the eyes to the center and I do that in software very often for that same effect.

This flash diffuser works perfectly on my Metz 54-4 flash.  The color is white and the diffuser works perfectly in softening the harsh flash coming out of the Metz 54-4.  I use it mostly as a fill flash during the day to take out the shadows without it looking like there was a flash used.  It works great for that.  In looking at the photos, it is not obvious at all that a flash was used.  It fits the flash just right in that it fits snugly but at the same time is easy to get off.

The adapter ring that adapts from 62mm to 67mm works perfectly.  The adapter is made of metal and is very strong.  It does what it is supposed to  do and works right.  The ring is easy to attach to the lens and the filter I used attaches to the adapter very easily.  Perfect!

This neck strap is perfect for the Sony RX100 camera.  Just attach it to the camera and wear it around your neck.  No worries about dropping the camera to the hard surface below and is very convenient and quick to get the RX100 up for a shot.  It is so much better than carrying the camera in your hands with the hand strap over it.  It is also easier than using a camera bag and fumbling and possibly dropping it when going for a shot.  I could not be happier with mine.I left the original hand strap on the camera as well, so I can use either one.  It works great for me and I no longer feel stressed about possibly dropping the camera.

This white balance filter is great! Just take the lens cap off the camera and in the Custom White Balance Mode on your camera, take a shot for custom white balance for the scene you are shooting. Just take the camera to the target shot area and point it towards the incoming light and take a Custom White Balance shot for a custom white balance. It is easier than using a grey card as two hands are needed to set the custom white balance on some cameras.. One to press the set button and one to hold the camera. With this filter, both hands can be used on the camera and the white balance lens filter is already on the camera. Some people leave the white balance lens filter on the camera all the time, but to me the filter is hard to get off and on, so I just leave it tied to the camera on a string for easy use.

I think the jewels star series is King for these reasons:- 150-300 completely free levels, no ifs and buts- challenging but not frustrating- good graphics and sound effects- variation: some levels are timed, others have frozen jewels etc- the playing field isn't frustratingly big like Ultimate JewelThey take little space and are very entertaining.Well done, can't wait for part four.

From the perspective of someone who never heard about Five Nights, this game looks like it was invented by a demented space alien. I don't have the slightest idea what to do, but it's fascinating and strange. I'll take the challenge and find out by trial and error.

It's a nice game with relaxing chillout sound, and clearing a level can be challenging due to gravitational interaction between the planets.Not quite up to par with voyager grand tour though as for versatility and challenge.

I like this one, you have different firing modes and auto pause. Unlike most such shooters, it permanently saves your progress.It's quite challenging since the density of enemy fire is high.Since there are four sublevels per level, you get a whopping 40 waves for each of the three planets.

You don't have to go through complex menus and gameplay, and it's still fun.Just tap and/or activate magic.The amount you need to buy new items is a bit confusing at first. Iff it says 6500, you only need 500 because the first number is  G for gold, not a six.
This immediately reminded me of Grabatron.The difference is, here you need exact timing, hit or miss. You can try to create a chain reaction, too.Demands absolute concentration.
Thanks but NO thanks. There is no reason why I should have to sign up except that they can send spam.

This helidroid game is a good sequel to part one, it's more challenging due to very diverse tasks, as different as finding keys in the dark and combat.The levels have very smart and sometimes demanding tasks, and you get a path preview before starting. First person perspective is possible but in this game, levels where this is not recommended don't offer it.Tilt control is recommended, it's not difficult like they warn, just hold in a comfortable position before starting a level since it auto-calibrates. There is a link to part one, but even though I have it installed, it still leads to the store. It would be nice if installment is actually recognized.Still, challenging and flawless gameplay.Tested on Fire HDX.

A pretty good demolition derby where you have missions and can pick up health, additional time, and even set a fire trap.The cars aren't easy to hit (ramming the side is best) because of somewhat finicky controls, still a good game.

Take your X-Wing (which can be upgraded during the game) through 16 missions against Tie Fighters as well as larger ships like the Star Destroyer.Admitted, the controls are sluggish but you can get used to it.Three views available which includes gunner's view.Can't complain for free.
It's a minimalistic rpg but in a fully 3d environment.Controls are meh but playable.What really needs to be fixed is the tiny text, impossible on a phone, and you need eagle eyes on a 7" tablet.

This drone simulation is easy to control.Since this is a lightweight drone, you'll feel turbulence though.Nice 3D environment.You have to find and take out tanks, battleships, installations and fighter planes while under fire.What I'm missing are missions and a radar indicator for the enemy targets.As is, it's an endless search and destroy game, but a pleasing one.
This sim is not hard to control and has rescue missions.The area is relatively small and it can get repetitive but it's ok.
Unlike the original game which was pointless, this has better graphics, more action and most of all, it has missions.Have some destructive fun!

It's a great pinball game with exciting tables.The camera follows the ball, and you have graphically stunning special effects.The only thing I don't like is that the unlock feature and the menu can be confusing.
Tap as fast as you can.The first levels are cake, but soon, you will need your minions and upgrades to defeat the boss in time.
Controls are smooth, you have two views and steer around an area that isn't very big. Yes, you can bump into other vehicles and do stunts.Now, just add missions. The gun shouldn't just sit there.

You steer with arrows, you destroy things (if you manage the clumsy controls), and listen to an upbeat but boring rock tune.If you want a decent demolition game, take "demolition inc", this app is lame.

This app has a wealth of information. Not just elevation, it points out all important spots on Mars and describes them including landing sites of probes and rovers. It's a Mars atlas.Easy panning and zooming.Excellent preparation for the young generation, they or their children WILL colonize it, or as Tsiolkovsky said: "The Earth is the cradle of humanity, but mankind cannot stay in the cradle forever."
You have one gun with scope and twelve levels.Stags are harmless, but other animals will attack when wounded.You are stationary but can turn 360 degrees.Aiming is smooth.Not bad for free.

1:19 Mins This Moen faucet looks great and all the parts are very high quality.In my video I show everything that comes in the box and show the video mounted onto a sink. We are in the middle of remodeling our bathroom, so the only thing I didn't get to demo was putting water through the spigot, but I thought everyone would want to see the faucet in detail.We are very happy with this faucet -- our bathroom is going to look great.

6:21 Mins I show in my video the process of building this stylish particleboard piece of furniture you put together yourself.Biggest Pro:* Looks nice when finally assembled* Drawer handles in particular look nice* Has six drawers for storage* Complements most roomsBiggest Cons:* Is only laminated on some surfaces* Laminate is thin and can arrive damaged* Final fit of some pieces is a bit loose* Some of the pieces (non-visible-from-the-outside) are laminated in different colorsIn total it took one person about six-seven hours to complete, not counting painting:Because the drawers had unfinished particleboard on some surface, I didn't want to have that in contact with clothes I put into the drawers. So we painted the unfinished drawer surfaces, which took an additional two hours to complete.So, all in all, this is a functional piece of furniture, though still made of particleboard with plastic drawer rails, so don't expect too much from it and the dresser should serve you well.

2:59 Mins This is a fine office chair, though it is oversized.In my review video I go into detail about the chair, showing the chair's features and well as demonstrating that this chair is best suited for folks taller than 5' 10".The chair comes unassembled, and while it can be put together by one person, two people will find the job easier due to the awkward size of the parts.The chair looks very modern, the leather-like material feels soft, and I think the chair will be durable. So as long as you are a larger-scale person, you will likely find this larger-scale chair to be a good fit.

8:45 Mins In my review video I go into detail about this multicooker, but let me just say that I'm really enjoying it.The multicooker has a variety of built-in cooking options, including rice, boil, bake, brown/sear, slow-cook, and yogurt. You can make rice, yogurt, and oatmeal at the touch of a button, and you can even cook multi-stage recipes, all in one pot. For example, if you were cooking a meat dish, you could set the menu option to brown/saute -- this will allow you to saute your meat -- then you add vegetables and other ingredients and can select another menu setting, such as stew/soup, or bake/roast, or slow cook to finish your recipe, all in one pot.As I mention in the video, the menu beeps are annoying, and you don't have fine-tuned control over the temperature and timer settings, but all in all, this is a quality multicooker. It saves me a lot of time, takes up a lot less room (I've been able to get rid of my crockpot, rice cooker, and yogurt maker), and cleans easily.I'm very happy with this product and I hope this review was helpful.

This is a fine cable modem.It supports up to 343Mbps download and 143Mbps upload speeds, though your actual throughput depends on the data plan you have with your Internet provider. The modem also supports DOCSIS 3.0 (high bandwidth data transfer over an existing cable TV network) and has a gigabit ethernet port.In the box you get the modem, an AC adapter, an ethernet cable, and documentation. Note that this product is just a cable modem--you will also need a router/firewall for your home network.Setup was easy--we used Comcast/XFINITY. Here are the steps we followed:1. Plugged in modem between the network access point and the Comcast cable.2. Plugged in modem to power--lights started blinking.3. Waited 2 minutes: opened a browser window on the computer--the browser automatically went to: www.comcast.com/activate.4. Entered Comcast login credentials and followed the wizard steps.5. After 3 minutes, Comcast said, "Your device is compatible. Activation almost complete".6. Comcast then said, "Thanks! Your device is activated.  Please wait as the device is being reset and the latest configuration updates are being applied.  This may take up to 15 minutes.  If you ordered XFINITY High Speed Internet, please open another browser window to start using your service once the device's flashing lights have stabilized. If the XFINITY service is not available in the allotted time, please manually reset the device."7. Internet started working.One negative: The modem admin page, which is defaulted to 192.168.100.1, allows you to change the password, though you are limited to only 8 characters. Eight characters seems too short in today's security-conscious world.Comparing this modem to other modems I have owned, I noticed a few other limitations:* The modem does not support a ping test, which means you cannot ping from the modem to test network connectivity.* The modem does not support enable/disable of stealth mode.* The modem insists on using DHCP--it does not allow static addressing.So, all in all this cable modem works well, though the manufacturer has taken out a few admin features in order to make the setup "easy to use".

4:12 Mins Want to know a great way to make an impression the first time you are trying out for a band? Have your guitar strap come off in the middle of a song.Speaking from experience, if you play standing up (guitar or bass) you need strap locks.In my video review I give some details about these Ernie Ball strap locks--how to install them and how to use them. I also detail two features you should be aware of before purchasing:1. They have a "false lock" issue -- if you are in a hurry, you might think the strap is locked in place when it actually isn't -- just be sure to give a tug on the strap to make sure,2. They are quite big. While I feel they are very robust, just make sure everything fits into your guitar case. I take my strap off before putting my guitar in my case and everything is fine.So, all in all, I'm quite happy with these strap locks -- they installed easily, they are very easy to use, and when they are locked I don't have to worry about my guitar falling again.

7:12 Mins This is a great LED floodlight system.In my video I go over features of the light, and show it in use at night. Note that because Amazon does not allow embedded royalty-free music, I had to cut out segments showing me setting up the light -- see my full video on my YouTube channel if you'd like to see more detail.Note that this light does not come with a battery/charger -- the company suggests a battery you can purchase that fits perfectly in their included battery pouch that hangs at the base of the inflated pole.Otherwise, this system comes with everything you will need.Setup was very easy and fast -- it took 4-5 pumps to pump up the pole. And everything breaks down and fits into the included rolling case for transportation/storage.Note that this light is directional, as I demonstrate in the video -- it does not provide 360 degrees of illumination. Also note that there is no on/off switch -- connecting the LED terminals to the battery provides light.So I think this is a good solution if you need lots of bright, white light at night (outdoors -- probably not wise to inflate indoors, speaking from experience).

8:04 Mins In my video I review the guitar in detail, but let me just say I really love this guitar -- it's perfect for travel.When I travel by plane, I stuff the included gig bag with clothes around the guitar, which saves me on luggage. I hate checking bags, so it's great that I can carry the guitar onto the plane with me -- it fits in the overhead luggage bin.The feature I like best is being able to plug in headphones and my iPad, so I can jam along with tunes no matter where I am.The guitar has 4 built-in effects -- clean, boost, overdrive, and distortion, powered by 2 AAA batteries.Overall the guitar seems well-built -- it stays in tune and it was playable right out of the box. I will likely change the strings soon though, and may replace the humbucker pickup in the future.I will note that my guitar arrived with abrasion on the metal endcap at the nut of the guitar -- this was the only fit-and-finish issue the guitar had on arrival.I love being able to travel and play guitar at the same time. Very happy with this purchase, and I hope my video and review were helpful!

6:06 Mins This is now my favorite manual coffee grinder, replacing a plastic one I had used for a while. This one is stainless steel and is very portable. In fact, it pairs well with my aeropress coffee maker, which means I can have excellent coffee while on travel.In the video I show the grinder in detail, so be sure to watch. The only gotcha is the lid on mine was very loose, so if the grinder falls over, the lid can come off and the beans can spill out. However, when I keep the grinder in the travel pouch which comes in the box, so far I have had no issues.Wonderful grinder that makes a fine, consistent grind -- perfect for the aeropress coffee maker. My favorite!

1:19 Mins This Moen faucet looks great and all the parts are very high quality.In my video I show everything that comes in the box and show the video mounted onto a sink. We are in the middle of remodeling our bathroom, so the only thing I didn't get to demo was putting water through the spigot, but I thought everyone would want to see the faucet in detail.We are very happy with this faucet -- our bathroom is going to look great.

4:56 Mins In my video I show in detail how to put together the lamp as well as review the features of the lamp. I also point out a few minor flaws -- the glass shade has a sharp edge, the electrical cord had some sort of residue on it, and the metal base has a few dings in the finish. But this lamp is also very inexpensive, so if you want the look of a traditional banker's style desk lamp, then you might want to consider this lamp. It looks very nice on my desk--I'm happy with it.

4:24 Mins This toolkit by Ernie Ball is the perfect companion for any guitarist.In the video I show all the tools in the toolkit in detail, but let me just say this toolkit is ideal for throwing into your gig bag -- that way you'll never be let down when you need to fix something on your guitar.Yes, you might be able to assemble all the individual components of this toolkit yourself by raiding the toolbox in your garage or shopping at different stores. But this toolkit is convenient in that everything comes in one closable container. In addition, most of the tools have the Ernie Ball logo, so I know the Ernie Ball string cutters are just for my guitar, and I won't forget and use them for some other project around the house.Again, check the video for more details, but I'm very happy with this toolkit and it goes with me everywhere in my gig bag.I hope this review has been helpful!

9:59 Mins The Margaritaville Key West Frozen Concoction Maker is a great frozen drink maker.In my video I show in detail all of the features of this machine, along with demonstrating how easy it is to make a frozen drink.I especially love the large-capacity ice reservoir and the lid that doesn't need to be removed from the pitcher in order to pour your drinks.I have an older Margaritaville machine that I've used and enjoyed for years. This new model looks great and works just as well as the old one, so I know I'm going to enjoy this machine for years to come.In the video I also point out the height of this machine -- be warned that it might not fit under your kitchen cabinets!So, all in all, this is a large, high-quality frozen drink maker. It makes perfect smoothies and frozen drinks and it couldn't be easier to use. I'm very happy with it.I hope this review has been helpful to you!

One of the most useful tools you can have in the garage is a good socket set, and this Crescent CSWS12 socket wrench set so far seems to be absolutely great.The fit and finish on the individual pieces are high--everything has a durable chrome finish and there are no rough edges or sharp corners, so the items are ready to use right away. The pieces are also heavy and feel solid in the hand. I haven't found a job around the garage so far that this wrench hasn't been able to handle.The ratchet operates smoothly, and attaching and removing the sockets is easy with the quick-release button. Everything feels solid and well-made.There is one 3" extender.The sockets are 12 point and so far I've not had even any hints of fastener rounding.One thing to note: This is an SAE only set--if you need Metric, you'll need another set.Also, in the packaging, the sockets are fastened with a heavy piece of plastic. You'll need a cutter to clip off the plastic so you can remove the sockets. But once you do that, the tray all the pieces are affixed to seems like it could be reused, for a bit at least.All in all, I'm very happy with this socket wrench set.

I really like this case, but a couple things need to be clarified.First, this product is advertised as a "soft case" for all sorts of cameras. However, I wouldn't consider it a soft case--the walls of the case are a semi-rigid plastic covered on the outside and inside by a soft synthetic (non-scratchy) material, with foam lining the inner sides of the case. I say "semi-rigid" because there is some give to the case, especially in the middle of the lid, but the case retains its  boxy dimensions (it has rounded corners though!). The case provides a lot more protection and structure than a bag, but is more flexible than a metal or wooden box. Basically this case is just right for protecting your electronic gadgets while on travel.And that brings me to my second point. This product is advertised as being for cameras--but really it's great for any electronic device that can fit into it (outer dimensions are about 8.5 x 3.4 x 6.7 inches). Yes it fits multiple GoPro cameras and accessories, but I've also carried headphones and microphones, and it even perfectly fits two guitar effects pedals! So my main point with this is that you can carry so much more with this case than just cameras.The bottom of the case has a horizontal and vertical web of flexible elastic strips--you can secure your devices by hooking them under the straps. Unlike some other cases with built-in partitions, the webbing gives you a lot of flexibility with the shapes of devices you hook in there. And I'll note that you aren't obligated to use the webbing at all--the entire bottom of the case lifts out via velco.The top of the case has a soft built-in netting/pocket into which you can insert various items. I tend to put heavy gadgets in the bottom and cables in the top.My case is black with orange piping around the zipper. I like this, because the orange helps me easily find the case in a big bag. And I'll also point out that the zipper is a little tight, but seems well-made, so I'm happy with the zipper--I feel confident the case won't accidentally become unzipped while bouncing around on travel.Finally, it comes with a small aluminum carabiner clip, so you can clip your bag onto something if you'd like to--the case comes with a nylon flexible handle that is reinforced with a rubber grip for added strength and comfort.So, if you can't tell by now, I'm very happy with this case-it's especially great for carrying and protecting your electronic gadgets while on travel.I hope this review has been helpful!

In short, this is a useful vacuum, especially if you confine it to light-duty vacuuming and don't mind a few design annoyances.PRO:* The unit is light in weight, has a very maneuverable head, and is self-standing.* The vacuum is battery-powered, which means you don't have the inconvenience of being tethered to an electric outlet. Just pick it up and use.* The vacuum has a built-in hand vacuum, which comes in handy when vacuuming spot areas above the floor. Note however that you cannot use the floor vacuum part once you have removed the handheld vacuum.
