Collimation out of whack after a few months.  Never dropped it or mistreated it.  Very good image and comfortable to use when new, but seems to be poorly made.  It was after the Amazon return period and the cost and effort to ship them for warranty repair isn't worth the hassle.

Pro:  The product is pretty good although you still need to know what you are doing in any kind of complex situation.  I've tried other tax prep products and this is the best, albeit imperfect.I give it 3 stars because of the huge cost to do state e-file.  This is really deceptive price advertising -- they say it comes Federal + State, but if you actually want to FILE your taxes then it's another $25.The other terrible thing is if you pay your taxes electronically.  You GET NO RECEIPT OR PAYMENT CONFIRMATION.  The instructions say to check your credit card bill next month to verify that payment was made!  And the service fee charged is the highest of all possible online tax payment choices.  OK, you've got me as a captive customer, it's much more convenient to pay as part of the finalization of the return, but if you're going to charge me the highest fee in the market, don't you think you could give me the convenience of payment confirmation details?

This device gives you some degree of distance control, and is very useful for discouraging unwanted behaviors such as jumping up, or flower digging.  it seems to work as promised and seems reasonably solidly built.  For our dog, using it in recall training hasn't been as straightforward, but I don't fault the product.  Every dog is different and not every technique will work with every dog.I much prefer this to a shock collar, as it doesn't hurt the dog, it just startles & annoys.  So it is a more gentle correction.

As far as I can tell, memory either gets 1 start if it doesn't work or 5 stars meaning it does.  I don't see any in between.  Anyway this memory has worked fine in my laptop, raising performance because the default configuration was a bit memory starved.

I took off one star because of all the research I had to do in order to ensure that cloning to an "advanced format" disk would work for me, including spending time to validate that it has the right up-to-date firmware (it did.)  Read other reviews for technical issues.  I would prefer if they would supply some kind of system validation tool and cloning software to take away all worries.  With that being said, the drive works flawlessly for me, and there really is a noticeable boost in performance.  It was money well spent.
Nothing much more to say.  No problems, compatible with my system, added memory gives a performance boost.  Price was right.

I wish they had more varieties, and I wish it was possible to buy it in less than a carton at a time, but it's a good healthy product.  Adds fiber but has the texture and taste of real pasta (as compared to some whole wheat pastas that are healthy but unappealing.)

Just want a toaster that reliably makes toast, and this seems to do it.  I give it only 4 stars because I wish it had a light to show when it was down and toasting.  There are lights when "Bagel" mode is on, etc.  The heating coils don't glow brightly and so I wish it was more obvious when toast is toasting or when it's done.  That being said, it seems to be a good product.

Bought this to make it easy to transfer disk images to new drives.  Seems to work well, no problems at all.  There is a lot of info about different variations of installed firmware but the one I was sent seems to have the latest.  So far so good.

Seems to work perfectly well in my replacement application.  Didn't need anything fancy, the diverter in my old spout was really leaking.  This one is pretty tight.  There will always be a few drops that don't go up the shower and come out the spout, but it's working well, and the price was right.

Just got this printer.  Probably going to send it back.  If you use it in a busy office with lots of background noise, it might be a great low cost printer.  The wired setup is not too bad, although it's designed for techies not for ordinary home users.The deal-killer is the extremely loud fan.  I have the printer set to go into sleep mode after 1 minute, but the fan will go on for another 10 minutes.  Called tech support, they confirmed there is nothing you can do it about it, no configuration option to reduce the time.  If there was a good quality fan that was quiet that would be one thing, but this is a cheap and very "buzzy" fan.  I can't stand it in my quiet home office, it's VERY distracting.It's clear that nobody in charge of design at Brother ever uses one of these in a home environment.

Good solid light, nice color (not unnatural cold blue).  Listed as 12V DC, but as others have noted it works also on 12V AC, so many ordinary yard lighting transformers will work.There are NO instructions and NO indication of what the odd color codes on the wiring mean.  The yellow/green wire seems to be a ground wire, which I didn't use.  With AC power the polarity of the other wires didn't seem to matter.  Other reviews and answered questions for this product give info on the color code.  They really ought to print it on the box.  But it's still a good product at a low price.

We have a B&B room, and like to supply relatively healthy and nutritious snack bars with our coffee service.  These bars are nice.  I don't give them 5 stars because I resent that the package says "60" but really there are 30.  Each wrapper when opened reveals two halves each counted as a bar.  So you really get 30 wrapped bars, 60 total if you eat the pieces seperately.

We enjoy listening to the variety of performances on this album.  As another reviewed noted, sometimes with a set of all-instrumental pieces, they all seem to blend together with a sameness.  Not so here.  All of the artists are great, but we particularly enjoy Michael Stadler's work.  Recommended.
This smells like it has natural ingredients unlike some other products that smell like chemicals.  It is subtle rather than overwhelming, which is what we wanted.

This case fits really nicely and it makes the phone less slippery and easier to hold.  The case doesn't add much bulk to the phone, and for that reason it won't provide as much extra protection or padding as you might get in a larger case, but I prefer not to have a phone that is too big. The matte black case seems to be good for not showing fingerprints.  The HTC One phone metal case is quite beautiful so it's a shame to cover it up, so you might consider a more transparent case, but if an opaque case is OK, this is a very good one.

This is an excellent screen protector kit.  Like all of them, it is not easy to put on bubble & dust free.  There are three in a package, and you should plan on screwing up at least one of them before you finally get it applied.  But all screen protectors are like that.  This is a quality product once on.  Offered here at a good price.  If you have more than one phone, but one kit per phone (even thought it's a 3-pack.)

Bought this in order to have in-car charging wire be less messy.  My phone has the USB/charging port on the left side, and with this plug the wire goes down rather than sticking out from the side.  I have no way of knowing if this is going to be durable over the years, but it feels solid so far.

I bought a black case for my wife's phone and a "smoke" (dark gray) case for my phone. Both fit our HTC Evo Design 4G phones perfectly. These cases are a fairly hard material, so I don't think they will provide as much cushioning against drops as a fatter more squishy case might.  But a fatter case is fatter.  I think this one is a good tradeoff adding some extra protection without unduly increasing the size of the phone.

This device seems well built.  I've had no trouble with it.  The two pull-up hinged ports are convenient for devices that are added temporarily, as it makes the port easier to get at in the typical jumble of cables.  You do need to be aware that you can't plug in 10 max-power devices, but it seems that an average mix of max- and low-power devices works fine.  Nor can you fully power certain Apple products, which connect via USB but which draw more power than the USB standard specifies (so they like a special non-standard port.)  This is all documented.  Having 10 ports really helps me keep everything neatly connected at my desktop.  I have a number of things that are usually off or unused, but I like to have them ready to go, and my old 7-port hub wasn't enough.I'd give this 5 stars except for two small issues.  (1) I'd prefer a more linear port arrangement (like a single bar with all the ports closely spaced parallel rather than edgewise) for neater more compact cabling. And if the ports were facing up on a bar arrangement, the flip-up feature wouldn't really be needed. (2) There are bright blue lights to tell you it's on (put some tape over them if located in your bedroom...) but no lights to tell you that a port is active.  If I could I'd give this 4-1/2 stars as these aren't a really big deal for me.

This holster seems very well built, with genuine leather rather than the "leatherette" material used in other cheaper products.If you have silicone or rubber protective case on your phone it could be a tight fit.  I have an HTC Evo 4G Design with a rubber protector.  The Design model is slightly narrower than other Evo models, and it just barely fits with a snug fit.Speaking of snug fits, I wish this holster had a cutout or hole to allow you to push the phone up from the bottom.  I had another phone with a cheaply made holster, but one thing I liked was the ease of removal by sticking a finger in the bottom and pushing up.  For this I give 4 stars rather than 5.The other issue is probably an issue with any belt holster and big smartphone:  There really isn't a good place to have it on your belt.  If in front, you bang into it when getting things from your pockets or just when your arms move.  If on the side or rear you worry about crushing the phone when you sit.  Because smartphones are so big, you have a long wide package on your belt.  And this genuine leather product is a bit bulkier than the cheaper fake leather holsters.  The product is good, so this is just something to keep in mind before ordering any holster.

We have an older Dell Inspiron 600M laptop that works well enough except the power connection was intermittent because the power connector jack was worn and loose.  While even the cheapest new laptop would be more powerful than the old one, it does cost something and it's a pain to spend time configuring the new one to match the old one.  So I found some hints online about how to do the repair and bought this jack, which works perfectly for not much money.IMPORTANT NOTE:  Don't attempt this repair unless you are handy with a fine tip soldering iron and you know how to de-solder a connection.  The Dell service manual will NOT tell you how to do this -- follow the service manual to disassemble the unit down to the motherboard, and after that you'll have to find your own way.  Make notes of the steps so you can put it back together.  Look at it and think about it before each step.  Or go to Costco and buy the cheapest laptop you can find (which will be more powerful than this one...)  If you're handy with this stuff you can do the job in about an hour.  I'm pretty handy but I still half expected it to fail when I turned it back on.  For me, it worked.

I had an ignition random cylinder misfire problem.  Rather than spend money having the shop diagnose the problem, I replaced the spark plug wires and the ignition coil.  (I had earlier replaced the wires and the problem went away for a while, but I suspected the replacement wires weren't seating properly and the symptoms also pointed to the ignition coil.) This appears to be an exact fit, and the vehicle is now running smoothly.  Of course I can't tell you if it will last for 100K miles, but so far it's good, and a lot less money than buying at the dealer parts counter.

I can't say if these are going to last for years or not, but what I can say is these Ford OEM wires are a perfect fit.  The last set I had were not (and they went bad quickly as well, maybe because they didn't fully seat or something.) Car is firing on all cylinders now. The price here was far cheaper than buying from the dealer parts counter, and they were shipped quickly.  Good purchase.

I use this as my power supply when the laptop is on my desk.  One wiring harness with two connectors leads to the laptop (power and USB) and then I get three USB ports out. (That's not enough for all the stuff I've got, so one leads to another USB hub, but his helps increase my available desktop ports by just enough for my purposes.)  It comes with a velcro tie that I used to keep the two wires bound together.The reason I don't give it 5 stars is that one of the ports is a power-only port.  It is nice that it is always powered (and maybe even that's good because I can power something without it establishing a connection to my laptop) but I wish I could get an extra USB port for a total of four.  What you are getting is 3 USB ports and a charger port (always on if plugged in.)  If three is enough, then great.  If you need another hub, then really you're only getting two extra ports.Also it would be nice to have a power LED just to verify it's plugged in and working.Overall I'm pleased and the build quality seems solid.

I'm writing this review after a few days, so I can't comment on long term durability.  That being said, I found this screen protector to be packaged well and a perfect fit. It seems to be a quality product. As others have noted, if you get even a tiny spec of dust under it, you will really notice it.  However, if you are careful to clean the screen first, then use the included cleaning cloth as step two, and tilt the screen while looking almost edgewise for dust, you can get rid of everything. Because it's an exact fit, you have to be very careful in application to start it going straight.  (Take off any other protective sleeve first so you have edge-to-edge access to the full glass.) For me it applied smoothly and cleanly.  I did get one spec of dust, so using tape I lifted one edge carefully, cleaned, and rolled it down again.  It makes me feel a lot better having the phone in my pocket - with a rubber protective sleeve covering the sides and back, and this screen protector on the front, I don't worry about minor scratches.  If the protector gets scratched, well this is a two-pack, so off with the old and on with the new.  So far, very satisfied.

I wanted to make it easy to connect my laptop as a desktop workstation without plugging in a bunch of wires.  I've got most things at the desktop connected to a USB hub, so I just need to connect the hub to the laptop with one cable and then I've got a big keyboard, mouse, printer, etc.  This unit allowed me to attach a hardwired Ethernet cable to the USB hub so I could have full speed wired networking when sitting at my desk, without having to plug the Ethernet cable into the laptop. (That would be one more connector.  I'd really like a docking station, but there isn't one for my laptop.)This worked perfectly, and there was zero installation effort.  Windows 7 recognized it with no trouble.  It seems to work well, and seems to be sturdy. (Only had it for a few weeks, so don't know if it might fail in a couple of months, but so far so good.) Just what I was looking for and not too expensive.
We found this book to be quite useful in Santa Fe and Taos.  Don't know about Albuquerque. It's not perfect, but it seems to be one of the better choices.

My TV has a PC input (VGA plus 3.5mm audio jack.  When I use a laptop on battery it is fine.  When the laptop is plugged in to power, there is a loud hum.  The ground loop isolator seemed like the answer.  This product made a definite improvement, but it did not totally eliminate the issue.  I had hoped for 100%, so that is why I gave it only 3 stars.  It seems like it might be intended for in-car applications, and perhaps in that context it works better.  But for taking out 60 cycle hum in my home TV application it is only partially effective.

We have a toilet that is sluggish, but I'm pretty sure the pipe is not blocked with anything.  I've used a toilet auger to try to make sure the first few feet don't have a blockage.The stated purpose of this product seemed perfect and we gave it a try, going two full strength treatments.  I thought it made things a little better, but not enough better that I can be sure.  The sluggish problem is still there.It may be the product is a miracle worker in certain cases, and my case has some other problem.  So I'm giving it an in-between rating.  It might still be willing to try one more treatment, just in case.

We have the New Mexico and the Colorado road atlas books, and both are very good.  Detailed maps that show most roads of interest as well as many other geographic details.  Pleasing to the eye.  Very handy to have on a driving trip.

This shoulder wrap works effectively as a cold pack. (Haven't tried the warm option.  Instructions say to warm in microwave in a bowl of water, although I suspect you could get away with warming directly using a lower power setting, but I don't know for sure.)  With the cold option it holds the gel packs in the right position for things like rotator cuff injuries.  It seems well made.As others have noted, it is difficult to put on single-handed.  It's easy with another person to help.  To do it yourself, you'd almost have to pre-set the large band that goes under the opposite arm and put it on over your head on the other side.  This would only work if you could easily raise the opposite arm.  Then there is a final strap that you could probably put in place yourself with some effort.If you have a spouse or friend who can help you get it on, it's a fine product, particularly as a cold pack.Other reviewers complained that the cold pack doesn't last for hours, and indeed it doesn't.  But you're not suppose to have it on for a really long time, and no gel pack product will stay cold for a really long time.  I think it works properly.  I'd give it 5 stars if a single person could easily put it on.

Our dog is on a lifelong limited ingredient diet due to inflammatory bowel disease.  He eats the venison & potato dry food and gets a low maintenance dose of prednisone.  The IVD (now Royal Canin) food worked well, but we've were outraged by the constant price hikes and annoyed by the inconvenience of only be able to buy the food at a vet.  Then we discovered Natural Balance.  On a price per pound basis it's about half the price. Our dog has done very well with this food.  Although there is no way for me to be sure, I also think it's likely that sweet potato is more nutritious than plain potato, so that's another benefit.  If you buy from Amazon there is free shipping and no sales tax, as well.The food is a little more dense, so if you're switching from Royal Canin you might want to weigh your regular feeding of the old food, and determine how much of a scoop of the new food gives the same weight.  Not a big difference, but if you want to feed the exact same amount then go by weight.Very pleased with this food.  It's still expensive, but not like the thuggish price gouging from Royal Canin.

I decided I wanted to be in control of how closely my dog is clipped and I wanted to save money on groomers as well.  (No matter what we say, the groomers always seem to want to shave the dog much too closely.)  This clippers seems to be well built, as least for cleaning up my German Wirehaired Pointer.  I can't tell how well it would work for a heavy thick coat, but for this purpose it worked very well.  It's heavy and there is a fair amount of vibration, but not really a problem to work with.Why not 5 stars?  (1) The comb attachments seem flimsy (they worked fine, but I don't completely trust their durability.)  (2) The included DVD isn't great.  Fuzzy images and I was hoping for more explanation of how to groom various kinds of dogs.  (3) When I someday need to remove the blade for more thorough cleaning, the instructions are not clear.This clipper kit is inexpensive, and for occasional use I think it's excellent value for the money.

Seems to work as advertised.  I did the "one free meal" and then turned it on the next day, and promptly caught my rat.  I didn't have many to deal with so I can't tell you how long the batteries will last.  The plastic isn't heavy duty but strong enough for the purpose.  Definitely better than spring traps and I really don't want to leave poison around where my dog or other animals might get it.  Price seemed reasonable.
Bought these as a little extra present since my wife likes floral patterns.  She quite likes these.  Nice design, good quality, not expensive.

Don't expect to edit a PDF as if it were a Word document.  It's pretty painful to make major edits to a typical PDF.  But if you need to make a correction, or create fillable form fields in a document, or add/delete an image, or assemble several documents into one PDF, and so on, this tool works well and it's far cheaper than the Adobe product.  The ability to print to PDF means that you can create a PDF from virtually anything you can print.  I also like the feature that lets you pull out all of the text and all of the images from a PDF.It comes with an Office plug-in.  I suggest not installing that.  In Office 2003, the resulting toolbar doesn't behave quite right (repositions itself every time you open Word.)  For the rare occasion you need to convert a PDF into Word format, just use the Nitro program directly (and remember, the resulting Word document won't be that easy to edit.)  To create a PDF, just print to PDF. If you have Office 2007 or 2010 then you already have the Office option to Save As PDF.  The Nitro plug-in is not needed and it just slows the startup time of the Office apps.There are a few glitches and deficiencies, but if you do a lot of document prep where you need to deal with PDFs and you don't want to spend the big bucks for Adobe tools, this is the program to buy.  It's not perfect but it's excellent value for money.

This worked really well for a while. It works by extruding a hollow tube of product which surrounds the pill.  It takes some pressure, and the end piece fell apart.  If the plastic parts would hold together, I'd give it 4 stars.

PaintShop has a great feature set, and this version expands on that.  If only they'd pay attention to some details, this could be a 5-star product, but as it is, I will give it 3.  I haven't used it enough to encounter stability issues.  Once installed (on Win XP SP3) it seems to work, but the install had some confusing glitches and took a LONG time.  I have not tried to use the Project Creator.  For PaintShop itself, these things are annoying:(1) the Organizer is a big step backwards.  You no longer have a filmstrip of images along the bottom as you work.  Instead you must switch back and forth between Edit mode and Organizer mode.  If the switch were instantaneous I could live with it, but it's painfully slow.  And as others have pointed out, if you were working on an say image 75 that required you scroll ahead in the Organizer, when you come back from Edit and want to get to image 76, well you have to flip forward again because the Organizer didn't remember where you were. (In thumbnail mode it does seem to remember where you are.) When you have images open and unsaved, there is no visual cue in Organizer mode, so it's easy to forget. when This combined with how slow it is really hurts the workflow.(2) Express Lab is more powerful, and does have the filmstrip on the bottom.  You can now increase sharpness in Express Lab, but only by a fixed amount per click.  WHY don't the Smart Photo Fix suggested settings match the Smart Photo Fix suggested settings in Edit mode?  Why not a slider for sharpening?  And why don't all the standard Express Lab buttons fit in the default display (the Delete and Help buttons require you to click on the "more buttons" icon.  Better figure that you if you need Help in Express Lab...)  Express Lab would be a great workflow for quickly processing lots of images if only Corel would pay attention to these interface details.(3) It's very slow to start, and seems a bit sluggish in operation.Overall a useful product with excellent features at a very good price.  If Corel could just get it together to make the details be right, it would be a great product.  But as it is, 3 stars.
Needed to replace gasket on wife's 01 Focus ZX3.  This was the cheapest I could find, and shipping was prompt and free. Product fit perfectly, problem solved.

This seems like a sturdy cable and it worked fine with my older Dell laptop and Sony Bravia TV.  I did not try the cable with a really high resolution signal (I used 1024x768 at 60 Hz) but the image looked fine for my purposes.  For under $10 it was a good deal.  Seems solidly made.

This USB charger is out of the way (other chargers stick way out) so that's really nice.  It appears to supply enough power for more power-hungry devices (smartphones, GPS) although only one at a time.  However, it did not stay seated in my lighter plug.  The internal spring tended to push it slightly out so that it would stop charging.  I fixed it with a little duct tape wrapped around the barrel so now it's a tight fit.  (By the way, this unit fits flush, so if it is in tightly, don't plan on just popping it in and out on a daily basis.)  I also find the USB connector to be a bit loose.  So far it hasn't caused any problem because in my car the cable doesn't get knocked around very much.  But I feel it should fit a little more tightly.  Despite these fit problems I give it four stars since you can work around the problems and it's the smallest such unit and it charges power-hungry devices.

This is an excellent high-quality paper at a great price.  HOWEVER when they ship it they just toss individual reams of paper into a bigger box.  So during shipping the packages bounce around, and needless to say some of them split open.  The big box was sturdy, but some amount of the paper was damaged (and the blue wrapper ink rubs off on the paper as well.)  I could use 95% of the paper so I didn't bother complaining or asking to ship it back.  But depending on what happens during shipment, the damage could have been more extensive.  What they ought to do is ship a CARTON of paper in its original box as shown in the product illustration, and then place that full carton inside the sturdy outer shipping box.So it's 5 stars for the paper and 1 star for the shipping, giving a 3 star rating.

I'd give this 5 stars because it's small (stays out of the way in my car) and it has a higher charging capacity than some other similar chargers. But I'd give it 2 stars because in my car (Volvo 850) the charger would not stay in the socket -- it did not snap in tightly or did not have enough friction fit. (Another review said it stuck in so tightly that you had to consider it semi-permanent -- my experience is the opposite.)  Similarly, the USB socket seems like it's not a tight fit either.  I resolved both to my satisfaction by judicious application of some carefully placed strips of duct tape, and now it's fine. But really this isn't right.  So I give the product 3 stars overall.  YMMV.

This leather case for the HTC Ozone phone fits really well and it is quite convenient to use.  It's well designed, there is a small cutout at the bottom that makes it easy to push the phone out from below which I thought was a nice touch.  The magnetic closures work nicely.  I suspect the inner velvet lining may not be extremely durable, so I would plan on buying a new one in a year.  Since the price was only 1/4 of what the Verizon store wanted for a carrier that was much bulkier and less convenient, this is a great value.  I didn't give it 5 stars only because I felt the lining might not wear well with time, but I'm still quite happy with this case.
Far cheaper than OEM battery.  Mine seems to hold charge well.  I can't tell if the total capacity is equal to the "high capacity" NB-1LH, but battery life seems good, and the price was really right.

I wanted a portable drive to make backups that could easily be stored off site (like in a safety deposit box).  This is a small footprint drive, no external power, just plug in to USB port and use.  It's not blazingly fast, but it does the job with no muss or fuss.  I just use the drive, I don't bother with any bundled software.  Price was right.

As a background, I am a retired Information Systems professional and I am writing my first impressions of the Fire HD 8 from the perspective of being a long-time Kindle user. I have all the current e-readers and Fire devices from Amazon including the basic Kindle, the Paperwhite (2013,2014,2015 models), the Fire HD6, Fire HD7, Fire HDX7 and Fire HDX8.9 (3rd and 4th generation). Here is a summary of my initial impressions of the new Fire HD8.Amazon removed the Fire HD7, the Fire HDX7 and the Fire HDX8.9 and replaced them with the Fire HD (7" screen), Fire HD 8 and Fire HD 10.HARDWARE:WHAT COMES IN THE BOX: The HD8 Fire, a short USB cord and a power adapter. Finally, Amazon ships a power adapter with their Fires so you can charge and use the device right out of the box. (Picture attached)SIZE: The HD8 is longer than the older HD7 but the same width as the discontinued HD7. It is also thinner. (8.4"x5.0"x0.3" versus 7.5"x5.0"x0.4"). I have large hands and can hold it with one hand, but even with my hands, I really need to use both hands. Because it is longer, it seem "top heavy" to me. The back is also slick and slippery to hold. Mine has a habit of sliding off the table.Display: The resolution of the screen is 1280 x 800 same as the HD 7 but the pixel density is lower due to the longer screen length. In practical use, though, you can't tell the difference. The display is nice and bright but barely readable in bright sunlight. One nice touch is that now, you can choose your own wallpaper! It comes with 9 stock images and if you don't like one of them, you can choose your own image in your Amazon Photos folder.BATTERY: Like the HD6 and the HD7, the battery in the HD8 is rated at approximately 8 hours of mixed use. I wish Amazon had included the 11-hour battery life of the HDX7. The extra 3 rated hours of older HDX7 is a substantial improvement on the new HD8. With this device, I have to travel with a portable battery charger when flying across the country. I also have to constantly stay close to a plug at home when using it heavily while I browse the internet or watch videos. Realistically, I can use it for about 4-5 hours before trying to find power.STORAGE: The HD8 can be ordered with 8 GB or 16GB. However, Amazon has now added a slot where you can insert a microSD card. All Fire tablets support all classes of Ultra High Speed (UHS) MicroSD Cards. Important! For non-UHS MicroSD cards, Amazon recommends Class 10 MicroSD cards for optimal performance. Class 2 MicroSD cards may not perform well enough to support video playback or capturing burst mode photos. Although most apps can be stored on the SD card, I recommend that you order the 16GB version of the HD8 as not all apps can be loaded on the SD card, including downloaded books. You will need more than the 8 GB if you plan on downloading any books, music, videos or take photos. You can probably get by with buying the 16 GB version and using it without an SD card. If you find a need to store more content, you can always add the SD card later.The SD card slot is located on the upper right side of the device (see picture). You just open the flap and pop the SD card in. The slot is spring-loaded so that a push should spring it out again. The spring was rather stiff in my device and I had a heck of a time getting it to seat in the slot without popping out again. But once I got it to stay in, the card has performed flawlessly.WIFI: Amazon has improved the WiFi from the HD7. It comes with a dual-band antenna that operates under the a/b/g/n/ac protocols using both the 2.4 Ghz and the 5 Ghz frequency range. I live where there are about 30 routers that the HD8 can detect and it picks up my router fine without a lot of interference. I would rate the WiFi performance of the HD 8 as above average.SOUND: This is where the HD 8 shines. Amazon has upgraded the sound with Dolby Atmos and dual stereo speakers. While there are not very many movies or videos available yet, when they do become available, you're set.Atmos is a new surround sound technology, developed in 2012, that expands upon the current 5.1 and 7.1 set-ups. With Atmos, each speaker has its own feed, enabling new front, surround and ceiling-mounted height channels. I was watching a movie with cheap headphones and thought I heard helicopters fly by my house. It took me a minute to realize that the sound was from the helicopters in the movie. It really sounded like they were coming from the left and moving to the right OVERHEAD. Wow, I was impressed!!The volume buttons are placed along the top of the HD 8 along with the power button, the headphone jack and the power receptacle. So all the buttons you would touch are on top. No buttons are on the sides or bottom.Amazon improved the placement of the speakers on the HD8 by moving them from the back to the side of the device. Still not as good as having them on the front, but better than the back. I found that just placing my palm behind a speaker reflects the sound to the front for improved listening. Speaker sound is pretty good for normal listening.CAMERA: The back camera is not bad and it is considerably better than the camera on the new basic Fire HD. The front camera might be OK for Skyping but color saturation and focus aren't that great on the front. There is no flash on the back so all pictures have to be taken in adequate lighting.All the pictures uploaded to this review were taken by the back camera of an HD8 so judge for yourself. I have uploaded pictures of1. The new basic HD 7 on top of the HD 8.2. The device, cord and power adapter included with the device.3. The new HD8 (magenta) next to the old HD7 (pink but called magenta). As you can see the shades are different.4. The front screen of the old HD7 and the new HD 8.5. The new basic Fire HD, the HD8 and the HD10, side-by-side.6. Screen showing carousel of apps loaded and running7. New home, back and app buttons on bottom of screen8. Top of HD8 showing power and volume buttons.SOFTWARE:When I turned on the HD8 and started through the initial setup, it immediately had to download updated software and reboot. After that setup was slightly quicker and easier than the older devices but very similar.The HD8 software version is Fire OS 5 which is a redesigned Amazon skin that runs on top of Android Lollipop version 5.1. There are a lot of changes from Fire OS 4. First, the carousel is gone. In its place, Amazon has tabs across the top (under a search line) called RECENT, HOME, BOOKS, VIDEO, GAMES, SHOP, and APPS. You swipe right or left to move back and forth between tabs or touch the tab name. The HOME tab starts with a row called "New Items" with icons for the latest books, videos, etc. that you have downloaded or purchased. Under that is the traditional grid of apps. The RECENT tab contains a grid of icons of the most recent used items for the device. In order to read books, watch movies, etc., you must either swipe to or touch the appropriate tab.You are not going to get away from Amazon's marketing on these tabs. For instance, the BOOKS tab has a row call "FROM YOUR BOOKS LIBRARY" which displays a couple of icons of your books. At the right is small text link that you can touch titled "See all your books." Under that you have "Recommended for you in Kindle Unlimited." (I don't subscribe to Kindle Unlimited so don't know why I need that.) Below that are more rows "Recommended for you." Best Sellers, Recommended for you in Mystery, Thriller and Suspense, Recommended for you in Science Fiction, Recommended for you in Nonfiction, etc. with a "See more products" link and a "SHOP KINDLE BOOKSTORE" link at the bottom. The tab contains lots of real estate acreage for selling books with a postage-stamp sized lot for my stuff.The older Fires have three icons on the bottom of some screens that were a back arrow, a house and a search magnifier for back, home and search respectively.  The new Fires have three new icons: a left-facing triangle, a circle and a square (see picture uploaded). These are available on every screen. The left-facing triangle is the back button, the circle is the home button and the square brings up the currently running or loaded apps. This is a new feature that you can access from anywhere, including the home screen. Hit the square and a carousel of loaded apps appears. You can browse up and down the list, close any running apps or hit the one you want to open. (see uploaded photo)I haven't used the device but a day but I am already disappointed. The new FIRE OS 5 operating system has quite a few bugs. I was reading email and a couple of times when I opened up a daily email from bookbub.com which contains quite a pictures of book covers. Paging down to email caused the screen to wig out with color lines and blocks of randomly colored squares. If you ever had an HD television that pixelated on the screen because of a weak signal and it couldn't decode the signal, you know what I mean. I should note that the processors in all three new Fires are slow and can't keep up. Switching screens, browsing, and even reading has some hesitation or delays.The new Fire OS 5 also has problems with collections. Because I have thousands of books, I use collections extensively for my book inventory. I have categories such as "Books Already Read," "Sci Fi," "Mystery," "Currently Reading," etc. Every book I buy, I assign it to a category of its genre, whether it is in my reading queue, currently reading or have already read. This is the way I can find anything quickly, including what I am reading. Anyway, when assigning new books to categories on the new FIRE's, the assignments won't stick. In Fire OS 5, in order to assign a book, you have to go to the "BOOK" tab, select "See all your books" on the right of the first row, hold-press the book icon to select it, hit the plus button in the upper right bring up the collection list, click the collections to add to, and hit the OK button. You do all and bring up the book collection list only to find that the book you assigned to the collection isn't there. You go through the process again and guess what, it comes up blank. I can't seem to assign books to collections, especially if they are in the cloud. So I have to grab my trusty Paperwhite or older Fire to assign books to categories.IN SUMMARY:The HD8 has several nice features and some aggravating features. The new FIRE OS 5 is a different experience but is too buggy to be used seriously. The hardware is improved with the addition of a microSD card slot. However, the battery still sucks but at least Amazon includes a power adapter which you should keep close when using the HD 8. You'll need it.The HD 8 is certainly a substantial upgrade over the basic $49 Fire HD but it costs quite a bit more. The HD 10 is essentially the same, just a bigger screen. (See uploaded side-by-side pictures for comparison) FYI. The icons, etc. are the same size on the HD 8 and the HD 10. The HD 10 puts more "space" between the icons and shows more content.Should you buy the HD 8? If you have an older Fire, NO. I can't see a compelling reason to "upgrade" because it is not really an upgrade. There are too many problems with the OS. In fact, I would probably buy an equivalently-priced Android or Apple tablet over this one--especially if you are using the internet for browsing or like to play games. At least you will have access to Google or Apple store for the wealth of apps available that aren't in Amazon's Fire Store.If you primarily read books, get either the Paperwhite or the Voyage. Either of these devices are outstanding for reading books, having high quality screens that you can read in the dark or the bright sunlight as well as a battery that will last weeks instead of hours.If you are set on buying one of Amazon's new Fire's and can't decide which one, I would recommend the FIRE HD 6. I carry that little tablet everywhere. It fits in a purse; it fits in a pocket; it even fits in a nook in my car and I can connect it to the car's Bluetooth to read Audible books and play my music when driving. Although small, the screen resolution is outstanding on the HD 6 and it runs the stable Fire OS 4 operating system. If you just HAVE to get one of the new devices, get either this one or the basic Fire HD. I prefer the HD 8 over the basic Fire because1) the battery is 8 hours versus 7 hours,2) better sound,3) much better WiFi,4) faster processor (even this one is slow),5) higher resolution screen6) better cameras,7) better audio8) you can get this in the 16GB version and9) you can pick your own color.Later as I continue to use these new Fire HDs, I'll update my review.====================

Meet the cast of characters:Caitlin Sommers who is also Katherine Southard. The main protagonist is a woman who suffers from multiple personality disorder (dissociative identity disorder). The story begins with her in a fugue state, 7 months of her life missing due to amnesia caused by her mental disorder. She is wandering around a warehouse parking lot, blood on her clothes and a dead body in the warehouse. Convinced that she killed the man, she tries to discover her lost memories while being hunted down by both bad guys and the boogieman in her dreams. At the same time, the police are trying to investigate the murder and her.Other characters:Josh Sommers is the man Caitlin Sommers is married to. She had left him angry after a fight for unknown reasons only to disappear for 7 months and then show up again after being presumed dead.Desmond Bixby or Bix is the fiance of Caitlin's other personality, Katherine Southard. He knows "Katie" as a much wilder, seedier woman. Together with Josh, her husband, he helps Katie in her search for the truth.Charlotte Hunnsaker is the detective trying to find the identity of the dead body and who killed him.Mike Bookerman is a bad guy who is also dead but the characters don't know this in the beginning.Chops is another bad guy who uses a persona of a successful building contractor when he is not killing people.Summary:This psychological thriller is not the usual "what is going to happen next," edge-of-your-seat story. Rather, it is based on the personality of Caitlin Sommers seeking to discover what has already happened with the help of both her husband, Josh, and her fiance, Bix. The book is well edited and the author, James Hankins, has an excellent writing style. My main criticism is that he begins the book with some unrealistic premises and actions. Other reviewers comment on this. I was put off by the unrealistic reactions of the characters in the beginning but kept reading to discover that the story does become more interesting.This is a book that you will either really like or really hate. If you enjoy a well-written thriller that doesn't use a detective or lawyer as the main character but is still a crime book, this book is for you. If more realistic personalities and actions are important to you, pass this book on by.

Pomegranate puzzles quality is comparable to Ravensburger puzzles.Pomegranate uses art such as paintings or in this case, stained glass as images for their puzzles. This puzzle has a nice cardboard backing with a matte-type printing which prevents glare from overhead lighting. The pieces are nearly all interlocking.This might look like an easy, 500-piece puzzle but don't be fooled. It is difficult to tell if a piece belongs to the peacocks head, tail or background. And the cut sometimes lines up with the color changes, so it is challenging to find a neighboring piece. You also can't always tell the orientation of many of the pieces so you have to try them rightside up, sideways or upside down to find the correct fit.It took 2 adults 5 days to get this one done. The finished puzzle was so beautiful that we left it together for a few days and took pictures of it before breaking it down.In summary, a nice puzzle to put together.

The novel, True Conviction, is both very good and very bad.The good:The author has talent. There is a lot about the story I like. He has great mastery of dialog and point of view. He also can develop engaging and interesting characters. The type of readers who might like this book are young teenage boys who don't care about reality and like super heroes. Mature audiences or those adverse to some swearing should pass this book for something better.The bad:First, a good editor and classes in proper English would help. Verbs are notoriouly misused. The book is riddled with improper tense and selection between singular and plural forms.Second, the author needs to do research about the United States. He has no clue as to geography or U.S. government or customs. He places the story in a town called Heaven's Valley, Nevada that is 150 miles north of Las Vegas. It is described as very hot, by a freeway and the sun doesn't set until after 10:00 pm.For British readers, the United States is about the size of the entire continent of Europe and the state of Nevada alone is almost 40% larger than the island of Great Britain. 150 miles north of Las Vegas is in the middle of nowhere where nobody lives in the large, long valleys ranging fom 5000-6000 feet in altitude bordered by mountains 11000-13000 feet high. Yup, the difference in altitude between the valley floors and the mountain ridges is greater than the highest point in Great Britain.The nearest "highway" is highway 50, a 2-lane road nicknamed the loneliest road in America, not a freeway. And it is definitely not hot. Summer daytime temperatures might reach the 90s(F) for a couple of months but nights always cool down to the 40s and 50s. Sometimes this place is noted for being the coldest place in America. (Las Vegas is hot but 150 miles north of LV is not.)What is possible in the story is the concept of a uranium mine. However, it can't be the only uranium mine in the United States. There are hundreds of active low density uranium mines in the United States and over a hundred of low-level uranium deposits in Nevada alone. Also, in Nevada, mineral rights are separate from property ownership. You can own the land but you don't own the mineral rights. The U.S. government does. You can apply for mineral leases and patents. But that is really irrelevant as the U.S. government owns 85% of Nevada including this area which includes, guess what, the Atomic Energy Commission's Nuclear test site where they test nuclear bombs. And the Nevada Test Site sits next to Area 51 of UFO and alien creature fame. The high level nuclear waste site at Yucca mountain is in the area, too.Another geography lesson, unlike the United Kingdom which is near the north pole, Las Vegas is nearer to the equator. It does not have long daylight hours in the summer like London. In August, the sun sets around 7:00-7:30 pm, not at 10:00 pm.If the author takes the time to at least google the area he writes about and hires a good editor to correct his English, he has the potential of becoming a popular writer. The story had potential. But as it is currently written, the book is not worth buying.

The story begins with Matt Jones who is excited about his new job as a homicide detective in Hollywood. The evening before his first day on the job, he is waiting in a restaurant for his friend, Hughes, to celebrate. His friend is late. After ordering a beer, his cell phone vibrates in his pocket. His supervisor, Lieutenant Bob Grace, calls him into his office and says "You were supposed to start tomorrow, Jones. I know that's how we left it. But I'm in deep s--t, and I need you tonight." Matt sends a quick text message to Hughes. "Dinner off. Call me."Matt wonders why the Lieutenant told him nothing about this assignment except "You'll see why it's so f----d up when you get there." Matt arrives at the scene and understands why Grace is so rattled. A murder had been committed in a parking lot directly across the street and within fifty yards of an LAPD community station. The victim had not been identified until Matt picks up the victim's phone and sees a text message "Dinner off. Call me."Matthew Trevor Jones, welcome to Hollywood Homicide! To say more will spoil the story with all sorts of spoiler alerts. Suffice it to say that the story is a complex, realistic, twists and turns story that will keep you up all night worried about what will happen next. It is not a strict white hat versus black hat cop story. The bad guys and the good guys all have their virtues and vices.For those who want to know, there is some swearing but not much. There are also some romance scenes that I personally think could have been left out but these nit-picks are minor compared to the overall strength of the story line. Hence, my rating of 4 stars.The ultimate questions are:Did I like the book? Yes, definitely.Would I buy another book from this author? I already have. Near the end, a character is introduced named Lena Gamble. I have discovered that the author, Robert Ellis, has an earlier 3-book series about Lena Gamble. I have bought the first one which cost me an expensive $7.99.Should you buy this book? Only if you like well-written, complex, realistic, keep-you-guessing, chills-down-your-back thrillers starring a cop in Los Angeles!Cautions: There are some foul words and graphic scenes in this novel.

The quality of Buffalo Games puzzles are not up to the level of Ravensburger or Eurographics. The cardboard is thin and many pieces can be fit in the same slot so you must really pay attention to the subtlety of color shade variations to find the right piece. However, that doesn't mean they have inferior puzzles. Buffalo Games have attractive pictures and the puzzle pieces are clean with no puzzle dust.Even though this is only a 750-piece puzzle, it is as challenging as a 1000-piece puzzle. You would be surprised to discover that a piece could be part of the bridge or the castle or even a rock! Add to that the similarities of puzzles shapes require you to pay close attention to the slight variations in tit shape, size and color hue. The beauty of the picture encourages you to keep at it to see the finished picture. Included with the puzzle is a glossy piece of paper with the puzzle image printed on it. This is easier to use than the box to examine the picture for guidance in finding the right pieces. Overall, this is an enjoyable, challenging, but not overwhelming puzzle to piece together. I recommend it but docked it a star as it is not the quality of Ravensburger or Eurographics puzzles.

Normally, I do 1000-piece puzzles but began this 500-piece puzzle for something a little less challenging. Hah! This puzzle is more difficult than it seems. Check out all the whites and grey. The positive is that the puzzle is the usual nice Ravensburg quality. Nice interlocking pieces with no puzzle dust and an interesting "cats gazing out the window" picture when you're done. In summary, an enjoyable puzzle to put together.

Quality puzzle! Similar in quality to Ravensburger puzzles such as nice cardboard with no puzzle dust and good picture imprinting. The pieces are cut differently as they are not always standard, interlocking pieces of the same size. However, this makes the puzzle sometimes more challenging and sometimes easier. Sounds strange but let me explain: sometimes you have no idea what type of piece will fit, but other times it is obvious such as "look for a piece that is white with a slightly curved edge on the left and is long and narrow" and woo-lah! There's only one piece sitting in the box that obviously matches. The picture is challenging to put together as you really have to pay attention to car color, words, and piece shapes. And somewhat educational when done. See how the classic Mustang evolved and when looking at the styles over the years, you can understand why the Mustang was so popular. Also, it's different from the usual landscape or painting puzzles which I have grown tired of. FYI, I am an elderly lady so this puzzle can be fun for the gals as well as the guys.

I was hesitant to buy this case because it had no reviews and an extremely long estimated delivery date. But for a cheap $9.99 including shipping, I thought "What the heck?" and clicked buy. Two days later, the case arrived as promised.The case was exactly as described. It is literally generic, no logo is stamped, etched or otherwise shown anywhere to give you any idea of the manufacturer. (Like everything else, it's made in China. No surprise.)How does it compare? I have many different color, brand and style cases for all the Kindles and Fires. I currently own 17 Amazon Kindle and Fire devices which are usually "on loan" to various family members and friends. Personally, my favorite case is the FYY Classic Slim Fit Folio Leather Case, but this case is my second favorite. For the various Kindles and Fires, I have tried cases from MoKo, Poetic, rooCASE, Infiland, Supcase, I-Blason, Bear Motion, Ionic, Fintie and of course Amazon. This case compares favorably, especially for the price.CONSTRUCTION AND USE: The quality of the leather is much better than or equal to the others. The stitching is good and unlike the MoKo and a few others, even the back flap is stitched to prevent separating. The front flap is sturdy enough to maintain its shape and not wilt or bend when used as a stand as pictured. It has an elastic loop on the side into which you can slip a capacitive pen to carry with the device. Most importantly, the magnets work to put the Fire to sleep when closed and wake it when opened. Except for the Moko and Supcases, there have been hit-or-misses with this function. Often, other brand cases will turn the device off 9 times out of ten, but that 10th time the case wasn't closed just perfectly and unbeknownst to me, the device wasn't put to sleep. I have used this case for a month and the magnets have performed flawlessly. I have even held the case parallel to the ground and shook the Fire. The case stayed closed. ONE CAVEAT. If you put the case in a bag or purse, the jousling of other items can cause the case to open and wake the Fire. Some cases such as the MoKo and some Poetics have an elastic band that you can strap around the front flap to prevent this but those cases cost at least twice as much.This case has all the opening in the right places so that you can access the USB port, the volume buttons and the power button. The holes for the speakers are large enough to allow the entire speaker to broadcast sound. Some cases use a design where they cut multiple slits where the speakers are. This leaves tiny strips of case which cover the speakers and mute the sound somewhat.This case has no fancy pockets on the inside cover nor does it have any hand straps. The inside cloth covering is a nice felt and feels soft, not like the sandpaper feel that some other brands have. Although I wish it had a strap, it also does not leave any impressions on the device screen from a strap.VERDICT: Overall, this case is a good value for the price. It performs its function reliably with no frills. Can you get better? Yes, but you will pay more. If you are happy buying a Chevy, instead of a Cadillac, then buy this case. If you want a Cadillac and are willing to pay the premium price, try the FYY Classic Slim Fit Folio Leather Case.

I sometimes get UTIs or urinary tract infections, especially when travelling. These, and especially, the Azo brand, were recommended by my doctor. I began buying the product at Walmart as in our rural community, that was the only store that carried these tablets. Once Walmart was out of stock, so I logged onto Amazon. I ordered the tablets to try out. Surprisingly, Amazon was cheaper than Walmart, charged no sales tax and rhe product was delivered in about a week to the door.They are easy to tear off a days supply, stick in a purse or suitcase and go. These tablets have the exact same ingredient as the prescription medication, Pyridium, which is phenazopyridine, but at a lower strength. It does not cure the infection but relieves the pain, urgency and other discomforts until antibiotics can kill the infection. It also helps us old ladies who have irritations to the urinary tract due to old age.I highly recommend as they do help control UTI infection symptoms. Take with water and continue to drink water to flush the drug through your bladder. They are cheaper than getting the prescription and are just as effective. WARNING: they will turn your urine to a bright red-orange color so don't be alarmed when that happens. Just be prepared on your next trip to the bathroom. The effect goes away about 24 hours of stopping the drug.

I purchased these earrings at a lightning deal of $29.99. The "regular" price was stated as $55.00.First, these earrings are beautiful. They hang nicely from the ear lobe and have brilliance and sparkle that will receive compliments and are perfect for formal evening wear. Nice size... not too big, but not too small either. However, I only rate them 4 stars because of the post are thin and bent a little. By bent, I mean the posts themselves are crooked along the alignment down the length of the post, not how they are attached to the earring base. Because of that, they don't slide into my ears as easily.Are they worth $30? Definitely! Are they worth $55? No. If you can get them on sale, buy them. They ARE beautiful.
Surprisingly, I love this color. It is hard to describe but it has a sheen/ sparkle that is subtle and enhances the skin color of my fingers. It spreads well, dries fast and lasts.
Outstanding Ravensburg puzzle. Difficult but not impossible. Interesting scene and the usual outstanding Ravensburg quality.

I had the original recording on vinyl as I think this interpretation by Otto Klemperer as performed by the London  Symphony one of the best ever recorded. The performance is 5 stars. The remastering leaves much to be desired, hence the overall 4-star rating.

I had purchased several Poetic cases in the past and liked them so I purchased several colors for the HDX 8.9. BIG MISTAKE!! The quality is not the same. Non of the covers put the device to sleep or wake it up. On one cover the magnets didn't even work to close the cover. The edge of the front cover is sharp and cuts into my fingers when I hold the device. I do not recommend this cover for the HDX 8.9, even if it were given away for free. However, Poetic SlimBook Case for New Kindle Fire HDX 8.9 inch (2013) Navy Blue (3 Year Manufacturer Warranty From Poetic) works great!
This is one of the best crime thrillers I have read in a while. There is quite a bit of guessing with twists and turns to who-done-it speculation. Not quite the level of Alfred Hitchcock but close.

This book is not at all what I expected. Some fantasy but realistic. The plot flowed. The characters developed with depth. The author wrote with flowing sentence and paragraph structure but most importantly, I kept reading.... until the end.... and.... No spoilers but you won't be disappointed. A quality book.

This is the second book in the Divergent series. The factions are at war and there is a secret that is at the center of the battle. Alliances are formed but not all in a faction align together. Simulations created by the Erudite create mindless warriors from the Dauntless who, while under the control of the Erudites, attack the Abnegation faction first. Can Tris and Tobias stop the Erudites? Tobias' father Marcus knows the secret and keeps it secret. Tris helps Marcus but she cannot forget the cruelty Marcus inflicted on his son Tobias.The one problem I have with this book is the contradictions of Tris's character. She appears too timid and self doubting to have been the same character in Divergent. This Tris would never have become a Dauntless. Yes she is Divergent but comes across more as an immature willful child than as a resourceful developing young warrior woman.

Jayceee Dugard had been kidnapped, raped and held by a man in his backyard in California for years. This is her story.  I do not normally read books such as this but this book stands out. She talks about what happens, but more importantly has an outlook about life that we can all learn from. Her voice speaks more eloquently than most and left me with a few points to ponder about myself. A captivating book that holds you better than most fiction books.
While the writer writes well, the character development could have been better. The book was entertaining but not a classic.

We have problems with chipmunks, rabbits, voles, and shrews. So this product seems like a good alternative to catch and release, which frankly is not working for us. The application did not have a disguisting smell, and I swear there was some peppermint in there.It does say it will cover 5000 sf, and I'm not certain how that is possible unless you run when applying. I intended to cover all of our foundation areas and did not even make it halfway around the perimeter of the house.Unfortunately, I believe this ended up causing more problems than it was worth. After about a month, we noticed a distinct smell in the house and eventually called pest control. Shrews coming in through the foundation. We were able to stave them off but it was not enough ...

The idea is clever. Unfortunately, it's not a complete set and the Spots are one of three items needed to complete this twister set. Nevertheless, you can still play. But it's more like the game SIMON than TWISTER in my opinion.

Like many of us in cold winter climates, we have coats ... plural. A coat for this, a coat for that. Looking deep into my coat closet this year, I realized that I really did not have a coat appropriate for all work situations but instead have several coats for work ... a beautiful princess-seamed walker that's too tight to wear with suits, a sized-up walker that's fine with suits but not in regular clothing, no coat for when I wear long sweaters or dusters, and so on. Why can't I have just one coat for work & professional dress ?I live in a winter climate but frankly I don't need a heavy coat to go from my car into buildings, or between buildings, even if the walk is 2-4 blocks. I also don't want to lug around a big coat in airports or in the city either. Sure, if I was a commuter and stood outside waiting for a bus, or if the average winter temperature was less then 20 degrees, then of course I would be looking for something else than an all-around lighter coat. But as it is, I dress in layers in every season and frankly don't want a heavy winter that I only use 2 months of the year.I had my heart set on getting a light wool coat with a water-fall or fly-away color. After searching high and low and coming up short at the price point I wanted, I decided to give this shawl wrap a try. For me, the coat is pretty darn close to perfect, and here's why: The wrap style and dolman type sleeves will accommodate all kinds & styles of clothing, from short dresses to suits to bulky sweaters to chiffon tops. It's light enough that it can be worn in buildings, airports, malls, etc without breaking a sweat but warm enough to give me just the boost needed to ward off the chill. Short of the coldest days of winter, I can make this coat work, and it will carry me from October to March. :)The shawl color is well-designed, and it comes high around my neck, making a scarf almost unnecessary. The sleeves come to my wrist joint yet still seems generous enough for my frame.A couple words of warning -** Sizing from Nordies: XS=0, S=2-4, M=6-8, L=10-12, XL=14, and they say order down if between sizes. I concur. I'm an 8/10 and ordered both medium & large. Both sizes were a bit restrictive in the shoulders so it's the design of the coat itself, not the size. The large did seem "bathrobe" like and was definitely not the coat for me. I preferred the excess material for wrapping in the large, but the top half of the coat ended being too large for my scale. So, order down.** The coat's waist is almost empire like. It ties high, toward the lower end of my ribs and I'm short waisted!  You can see this on the model ... note where her elbow crease is and where the belt is tied. When I realized that this was where the coat should be tied and stopped fighting it & trying to fit it lower, the coat suddenly looked elegant and high end.** The coat is long on me. I'm 5'5" and the coat is about 3" below my knee, which makes sense if you figure the model is probably 5'9" or 5'10". I might get it taken up ... we'll see.** The red does not read as red-blue in person as it does on my screen. I'd call it a true red,and one which tends toward pink & orange (think pink & orange in sunsets). The color is far too warm for me, so the coat is not a keeper. However, I ordered the gray instead, in spite of not wanting to be one of "those people" who wear gray & black in winter. I want color!** It is not shipped well and will come as a huge, wrinkled mess. Amazon really needs to take a cue from other stores like Lands End, JCP or Pendleton when shipping coats & jackets: Ship them in a flat box meant for coats, not one better suited to books & coffee makers. Basically, you will need to steam out the wrinkles, unless you are brave with an iron.Would love to see this coat sold here in other colors, like a dark muted teal, a mid-to-dark greige (taupe-gray), and indigo or ink (purple-black or blue-black). I'd probably buy one of each in a more contemporary take on classic colors. But for now, I'm content to have one winter coat that will work for me all season long ... in gray.

These AK sweater tights are quite nice. I am a Medium, and I ordered the M/L because I'm pear-shaped and carry weight in my lower half. Unfortunately, the material stretches excessively so that the tights will be unwearable for most, regardless of size.The pair fit comfortably initially and it was love. However, after a half day of wear, the tights became excessively stretched out so that I had major fabric "cankles" - not a little but A LOT, like 4-5 inches worth. They were also excessively stretched out in the waist and hips so that they would no longer stay up. As a result, the tights fit more like a Tall XL or Plus size.After a half day of wear, the tights -- which fit a 5'5", 145# woman  -- now would be more appropriate for someone 6-foot tall and 200 pounds. While I was happy with the price I paid, I would never purchase again. I ordered 6 pairs, wore one, sent the rest back. I think I'm out 3 bucks ... and still having a laugh with my co-workers about the day I wore "cankle" tights to work.

The positive reviews for this hat are well deserved. Unfortunately, it is not one size fits all. On me, it does not completely cover ears and is snug &  tight. I typically wear a Large in hats, and this knit hat is definitely smaller thsn that and has very little give.

Overall, quality of construction is spot-on for this price point. Unfortunately, it seemed to run small for me. I am reliably an 8 top or 10 bottom in US sizing. The 40 was a slim fit for me, with narrow & restrictive shoulders and constrictive movement in hips. In the end I decided to return and not reorder one size up.Best to order luxe sizing, rather than department store (better brand) sizing. For me, that would be a 12 (42) rather than the 8/10 (40) which I more typically wear.34=2, 36=4, 38=6-8, 40=8-10, 42=12, 44=14.

The fabric weight and jacket styling were exactly what I was looking for. Unfortunately, there were too many negatives to outweigh the positives.- Does not come with a belt.- The edges are not hemmed but instead have an overlock stitch. Looks cheap and unfinished. Will not wear well in long run.- There is no lining, which is OK. But the seams are unfinished, which is not OK.- Sizing is problematic. I ordered a large and shoulders were too narrow. Pockets were high -- at my rib cage! I am 5'5" an 140 pounds, and wear 8/10 which is a medium yet the large was too small!Overall, there's a lot of potential here, but it is mis-sized for the American market and over-priced for the quality of construction. It's so simply constructed that I know I can make this on my own for about 30 bucks or pay someone to do it for 50-60 bucks ... which is exactly what I intend to do.Finally, I've since looked closely at the other reviews. Many of them have a consistent pattern ... positive, uncritical reviews; a few sentences; misuse of words (e.g., vest and peacoat); inconsistency among reviewers ("it's warm" and "it's light for summer"); un-truths (has a lining, quality construction); and ... here's the kicker ... it's the sole review for the author. I mistakenly trusted these reviews ... and I should not have and I really do know better. Barnum Bailey was right. Don't be one. Just saying ...

The style works very well for my body type, but the cut was smaller than other MP tops from Ellen Tracy. The print & fabric was nice but looked marmish on me. Best for the under 30 crowd in my opinion & inconsistent with the styling of the brand.

This item is one in a series of wedding-themed Amazon Exclusive deals. It's two full-size 0.4 ounce Butter London nail polishes in some of the most popular & sought after colors. I already had Hen Party, which I love as an overcoat, so I decided get a back-up bottle and take a chance on Goss.You get:** Hen Party - a sheer opal with pink an blue undertones - can be used alone or as a topcoat** Goss - to me, it's a rose-gold chrome, if ever there was one - perfect for clubbing or a dazzling pedicure - could also be used with Hen Party to tone it down for everydayBoth colors are unique and look good on most skin tones. You can't go wrong with these, and the price is hard to beat. A great deal on a premium brand.

This item is one in a series of wedding-themed Amazon Exclusive deals. It's two full-size 0.4 ounce Butter London nail polishes in some of the most popular & sought after colors. I already had Hen Party, which I love as an overcoat, so I decided to take a chance on these. You get:** Yummy Mummy - a mid-toned beige which reads bluish & grey undertones on me** Aston - a gorgeous & rich pink-toffee color with finely milled sparkles - an update for a once-ubiquitous dusty roseBoth colors are unique and look good on most skin tones. I like Hen Party as an overcoat on Yummy, but it's not my favorite. On the other hand, Aston is a beautiful and luxurious neutral.I think naming this a "Mother of the Bride" set is appropriate since the colors may be a bit too mature for the younger crowd. But don't overlook either of these if you want work-appropriate nail polish.You can't go wrong with these, and the price is hard to beat. A great deal on a premium brand.

This item is one in a series of wedding-themed Amazon Exclusive deals. It's two full-size 0.4 ounce Butter London nail polishes in some of the most popular & sought after colors. I already had Hen Party, which I love as an overcoat, so I decided to take a chance on these. You get:** Molly-Coddled - an opaque lavender, not quite as blue-gray as the Pantone color "Radiant Orchid" but close** Fruit Machine - a carnation-pink creme that's perfect for spring & summerBoth colors are unique and look good on most skin tones. I like Hen Party as an overcoat on them as well.You can't go wrong with these, and the price is hard to beat. A great deal on a premium brand.

If it looks like a duck, swims like a duck, and quacks like a duck, then it's probably a duck.This bag doesn't look like leather, doesn't feel like leather, and doesn't bend like leather. It's not leather. So why does it "smell" like leather? Hmmm....I'm appalled and the number of "designers" marketing vinyl as leather ... or trying to by adding flavah to vinyl ... and getting away with it. I recently ordered 3 different Isaac products from 3 different outlets. This one was the only one not sold as leather. However in each instance, the product was pleather.This is my last Isaac purchase. Evah darling.Not leather.

If it looks like a duck, swims like a duck, and quacks like a duck, then it's probably a duck.This bag doesn't look like leather, doesn't feel like leather, doesn't bend like leather, and doesn't smell like leather. It's not leather.I'm appalled and the number of "designers" marketing vinyl as leather and getting away with it. This is my last CK purchase. Evah.Not leather.

These flats are great. They fit my foot well, have a bit of cushion, and don't slide on floors. They are true to size, and there's a wee bit of heel too.The metallic nude is a great color that goes with everything. I just might get a back-up pair.

Super cute and uber comfortable, these sandals are easy to walk in and easy to wear ... all day long. They are generous in the width but not overly so to cause issues or problems. I do believe they run a little short. If you are between sizes, my suggestion is to order up.

Super cute sandals, especially in the teal color, which really is a seafoam green to me. They might run a tad short in the length, which shows up at the heel for me. However, these are so comfortable and the fit is so great, these sandals are keepers.I love sandals with cutouts or straps, and I usually have problems with my small toe peeking out. No problem at all with this style. No problem with big toe at the front of the sandal either.One downside, which is the reason for 4* rather than 5* - The shoes are a bit heavy. When I tried these on, I had been wearing Skechers wedges which are lightweight, and the weight difference is significant. Only thing I can hope for is that the weight difference means they will wear better in the long-run ... will update if so.

Cute and interesting shoes. Unfortunately the fit was off for me.I usually wear 8M, sometimes a 7.5. I ordered the 8W and the width worked well, especially the heel which would usually be too big for me in a W. Unfortunately, the length & the arch were off for me too. It was almost as if I was too forward in the shoe and my big toe was up against the top of the shoe. It might be worth a try in an 8.5M. We'll see ... I usually don't have the patience for ill-fitting shoes but that's just me.

These are much higher than I typically wear but are amazingly comfortable & solid underfoot. They are surprisingly easy to wear.I purchased 2 pairs in an 8, which is my size in this brand. Both shoes fit exactly as expected. Unfortunately both shoes also had minor defects in the leather, which made them look like seconds. I sent the red pair back but decided to keep the gray pair, fearing a return & replacement could possibly result in a pair which was even worse.The gray is a dark gray or light black. I quite like the color. The red is a nice, deep red, almost brick red, but the brown toe seemed out of place, like an afterthought.

Awww shoot. These shoes are too short in length and too narrow at the ball. Otherwise, they are a nice shoe at a good height. The construction & materials are high quality.I am a 8M. Would need at least an 8.5, more likely a 9M, to wear these comfortably. Pity. Wish they fit.

I like the Wasabi! It's warm but not too hot. It's a nice addition to the seaweed, which is a satisfying and healthy snack.I'd previously had Annie's Sesame Seaweed. The Sesame version has too much oil & can get a bit messy. The Wasabi version doesn't have the oil, and I think it tastes better too.Winner!

l love this color. It's a safe neutral that seems to go with anything I wear. It's the only color in my stash that I can say that about. Truly an amazing color for me and my skin tone. Unfortunately the tube leaves a lot to be desired. In particular, the cap is useless. It doesn't stay on. Otherwise this would be a five* product!

Overall, this is a really nice piece. The chain is good quality, and the size of the pendant is nice. I also really like the rose gold which is unique. Unfortunately, the diamonds are very poor-quality. Of course, I did not expect them to be even good or fair at this price. However, the pendant would have been so much better simply without the addition of these itty bitty gray bits, and if the pendant was simply a two-colored pendant instead. As it is, it just screamed "cheap" to me. Pity too ... I otherwise really liked it and wanted to keep it. However, I knew I would never wear it.

Body was generously sized but the arms were not. The arms were snug with a polo shirt, but the chest was huge. It also was considerably longer than pictured -- more like a walker.Pity - would have made a nice cold weather coat in upper midwest.
Body was generously sized but the arms were not. The arms were snug with a polo shirt, but the chest was huge. Pity - would have made a nice cold weather coat in upper midwest.

The "Sun Up" color is a lovely coral that reads more orange than pink. The jacket also is beautifully constructed, with super nice details. Overall I quite like it.Unfortunately, the jacket ran small for me. I typically wear a 10 in better brands, and I'm a solid 10 in Jones, Lands End, Kasper, etc. If anything, AK tends to be too generous with sizing in my experience. However, I felt that this AK jacket in a 10 was too snug and fit more like an 8.Sizing up was warranted.

This is a great bracelet ... not too big, not too small, just right. The rose gold is spot-on trend. It goes well wearing with my Skagen watches that have rose gold in them, as well as wearing alone.I mpurchased several Skagen jewelry pieces recently. All were high quality items, but many were not quite right for me. However, this piece was a keeper and one of the best in the lot imo.

I wasn't so certain about this piece when I opened the package. However, as soon as I put it on, I was awestruck. It's a very high-quality piece of costume jewelry. Traditional yet with a modern twist. I'm delighted to have it, and it's one of my best jewelry finds on Amazon ... and I've purchased a LOT of jewelry over the past 15 years. LOL

I ordered the Sovana 2.5" Mary Jane heel in 8 and was shipped the Keyo 1.5" Mary Jane heel in 8.5 instead. Prolly a good thing, since I've struggled to find a pair of these woven textile shoes in a 2.5" to 3" height that actually worked. For me anyway, what I find is that my foot slides too far forward at that height, and there is no support at the heel. If I had not received these accidentally, I likely would have never tried them.They are not the most supportive shoe, nor will they be the most durable. There is not enough padding or support at the ball of the foot, so they are not made for walking or standing either. However, this Keyo style is comfortable and light. I like the way they hug my foot but don't strangle it. The bronze is a nice, glitzy neutral that casts some rose gold too. The bronze color would be an awesome "nude" color for someone with darker skin than my own.I'm a true size 8 and the 8.5 size is perfect.

Like others have said, sizing is an issue in this shoe, and sizing varies across different colors. I usually wear an 8M. I ordered 8.5M in Black & Asphalt based on reviews. The Black pair is just a bit snug but going up to a 9M wouldn't work.
