I was provided this for an honest and unbiased review.

Nice costume for my son. Glowing eyes were a big hit. We live in NY and it gets cold, so he needed to wear warm clothes underneath, and there was room for sweatshirt. We got through this year, and so will go to next year as well. He loved it, and his friends thought it was cool. The only problem is that he found it hard to see at night and ended up taking off the hood. Some places where he went were pretty dark and not well lit, and when you are running around with your friends, playing tag, etc., you want to be able to see well. Also, and more importantly, for safety issues.

I was asked to review these sunglasses and was provided them for an honest and unbiased review. With that said, I have a a pair of Oakley's that look similar and came with two different lenses. They are carbon fiber and cost over $400. These are significantly less expensive, note I did not say cheaper. The cases are about the same size and all 5 lenses fit nicely and securely in the case.  The one polarized lenses is labeled and looks the same as the others when looking through it. There is less glare, and I used it while fishing and found it was fine. The lenses are are great for the price. They are not as sharp as my Oakley's, but they do the job. The vented lenses mean they are less likely to fog up, and I didn't experience any fogging yet. It also comes with a soft cloth to clean the lenses, and you will be cleaning them. The one thing I found is that they like fingerprints, especially when changing the lenses. My guess is the quality, but again, at this price, I am not complaining. There is a clear difference in these lenses and the Oakley lenses.Changing lenses is relatively easy, but you have to use a lot of pressure and I worry that I might break something. They are also easy to misalign, but once you get used to it, it is easy. They stay on and don't slip off, but also came with an adjustable strap, so they can hang. You get a lot for your money here.

This AmazonBasics tripod is VERY lightweight....almost too light. It is great for a novice, or if you are going on a hike and want to take it along without being over burdened. It does have a convenient carrying case, and it is very easy to put in and take out. Over all, this is a good, inexpensive, take along tripod. However, the problem becomes apparent if there is wind and you are shooting a distance or if you are trying to pan a shot. The stability is not the greatest when the legs are fully extended. They are so thin that I worry about them breaking, and so I am not taking shots as quickly as I normally would. I prefer my monopod (also AmazonBasics) which is really great, and very solid. My regular tripod is solid as a rock (but was more expensive and much heavier). The latches to extend the legs are easy to use, just need a bit of force to open them. The level is standard on most tripods, but is very small and the bubble on mine is REALLY little. They should have left out another drop (yes, it is that little). For the price, I don't think you will find better, BUT, unless you need something this basic or light, you might be better served with something a bit more stable.

I absolutely LOVE Burberry Brit Splash, Eau de Toilette! It is a perfect blend of sporty and mature-ish scent and is not overpowering. You don't have to use much at all, and yet, the fragrance will last all day, even after a night of dancing and stuff. The best is my wife loves it (her new favorite, she said)....It is clean, fresh, and still subtle, and as my wife says, "sexy." Fragrances are so subjective, and often depend on skin type, etc. My skin is usually dry and not oily. I also find that I always need to let a cologne (or EdT) kind of settle in before I pass judgement because things change for me after just a few minutes.This is a big bottle, and unlike some there Burberry products, this spray is easy to modulate so you don't get a huge spray. The only negative I can think of is that the cap is very tight a little difficult to remove, and because the bottle is so smooth, it sometimes feels like I might drop the bottle or fling something as I am pulling it off. Still, it looks nice. You see the Burberry design, but doesn't look stuffy.

I have had the same nail clippers for quite some time (many years). They were my favorite. Then I received these to review and I have to say that they are pretty amazing. First, they are long and the bend allows for a nice fulcrum to give you effortless clips. There is a slight lip at the ends to make sure you don't slip. I would like it just like that. Now, throw in a moving clipper head and I love it. It's almost perfect. The ability to change the angle makes clipping finger and toe nails so much easier! These are also very sharp and hopefully will hold that sharpness (it does come with a lifetime replacement warranty). So, why is it almost perfect? It doesn't have a file/cleaner (for under the nail). If it had this, it would be a home run! Still, I think it is worthwhile and a great product. It's a great clipper that is easy to use, and I am glad to offer an unbiased and honest review.

Quit Nit is a natural way of getting rid of head lice. It might take a little more work, and might take a little more time, but it is a much safer way than exposing our kids to harsh chemicals, or shaving their heads. My sister-in-law swears by it (her son has had head lice twice). We get notes from school a couple of times/year letting us know that our children might have been exposed to someone with head lice. We usually use a tea tree oil shampoo in the beginning of the year, as that seems to be the most common time for us to receive "the letter." So far, so good, but I am happy to have this as back up, and if it has worked twice for my nephew, (who has long, thick hair), it makes us feel better knowing we have this and an use it immediately if necessary.

This Margarita mix comes in a small can and is easy to take to the beach, etc.. It is an easy way to get a quick Margarita, but it will be sweet. Very sweet. We mix our own, and in a pinch have used mixes, and this is the sweetest we have tried. If you like it set, this is for you. We use beer when we make our Margarita's, and if this is too sweet for you, you might want to try adding some to this. If you haven't tried it, beer goes great, give it a try. Use a good tequila and this will get you by....but if you don't need a small amount, there are better mixes out there.

So, we are invited to a bunch of Halloween parties. I am planning on going as Dracula this year, but all the make up is a pain. I tried it out, put on the make up for a test run and it looked terrible. No problem, I used the remover wipes and everything comes off easily. Ok, so that's not the primary use, but it did work well. Next, ask my wife. She uses make up, though not a lot. She loves it. Says it takes it off quickly and easily. Neither of us experienced and rash or irritation, and my wife has sensitive skin. This will come in handy for after sporting events where my son wants to color up his face, or when he plays baseball and spreads the block all over his face. We will be keeping a pack in stock!

Preventing Cancer: Reducing the Risks, is an awesome book! I wish I had read this book years ago. This should be required reading in your senior year in high school. The idea of preventing cancer as a real option was never a thought in my mind....until I got cancer. Just over 4 years ago I was diagnosed with late stage oropharyngeal cancer, with metastasis to my lymph nodes. That was one of the worst days of my life. I had quit smoking and drinking 25 years ago. But I didn't eat well, nor did I take good care of myself. I didn't sleep much (4-5 hours/night). Looking back, I did almost everything possible to damage my body. I never thought it would happen to me. I do believe I could have done things differently to prevent it. Obviously, not smoking and not drinking, but more than that. When my oncologist told me that everyone has cancer cells in them, and that stress was a big factor, I realized that keeping my immune system strong was really the key. Eating right, and sometimes that means going against everything you are used to, is so important! But....who knew? I found out too late. Reading this book is important to keep yourself, your family, and your friends healthy. Make it so that your body will fight off those cancer cells and not let them take over. A healthy lifestyle is a healthy life, plain and simple, and this book will help you get there.....and even though I read it late, I am glad to have it now (it's never too late), and very glad to recommend it. I can tell you that I knew most of this, but learned it the hard way! Initially, I was told I had a 20% chance to survive 5 years. Ha! Now, my doctors are telling me that I am doing great and that I will be fine. Read this book, then give it to your family and friends and make them read it too.

The description says it all. ULTRA SOFT. Right out of the box, you can feel the difference! I never knew, but now I'm sold. These are the softest washcloths I have ever felt. All natural bamboo being soft? I would have lost that bet. I don't think I can go back to a regular washcloth again. They are packaged nicely as well, but really, that's not as important as how they feel. The Motherhood collection of bamboo washcloths are good for adult or child, and with 6, you don't even have to share! I love these and am thrilled that I was provided them for an honest and unbiased review and will probably buy more, and have already recommended them to friends.

The recommended use does not match up with the advertised use! It comes with leg, arm and bikini attachments. The problem is that it comes with so many disclaimers and warns to only use between the knee and ankle and elbows to wrist. Warnings abound for suntanned skin, pregnancy, menstruation, diabetics, etc., send a mixed message to say the least. I tried it on the back of my neck and it did not do a great job. I had to make several passes and left welts. I tried in different directions and nothing seemed to help. Often breaking the hairs (and the were about 1/4 inch long). It is comfortable to hold, but at the end of the day, using this in such a limited area is not efficient or economical.

The De'Longhi EN550S Lattissima Touch Nespresso Single Serve Espresso Maker is an amazing little machine! I have a Jura, that I love, and it's nice to be able to compare the two. This EN550S has a small footprint so it doesn't take up a lot of counter space. It looks amazing and works very well. The only real downsides is having to use the Nespresso pods (more expensive than using your own coffee) and a small reservoir (if you have guests you will be filling up a lot). With that said, there are so many good things that it is hard to beat. First, it makes a great cappuccino...and it makes it fast. This was the most impressive feature, and something that my Jura (at double the price) lacks! It is programmable, like my Jura, so you can set it up as you wish. The difference is that you have a lot more options than my Jura. It is touch sensitive which I like. Milk foams up very nicely. Removing that water tank is not as easy as the Jura, but since it is small, it shouldn't be a problem, just grab it right or it might slip. The nice thing is that it is easier to lift up (I have some room above it) and can tilt it a little, but the machine is small enough that moving it is not really an issue. I still love my Jura, because it grinds the beans and I can use any beans I want, but if I had to choose one, I think the Nespresso wins because of the cappuccino and smaller footprint, and half the price of the Jura.

This LED bulb looks good. It gives off a lot of light with little consumption (6 Watt). Having a bulb that is cheaper to run and gives off more light than my current ones is great (I like it bright). If you don't like it bright, no worries, these are dimmable. Perfect for setting the mood at dinner. I like that I don't  have to worry about glass.The only thing is that the minimum requirement for a 60 watt bulb is 800 lumens (one site said 900). The minimum for a 40 watt bulb is 450 lumens. This is rated at 550. I only use 40 watt bulbs in my chandelier, so for me it is great. If you are looking for more light, you will probably want something putting out 800 lumens. There are calculators out there that will help you figure out the exact wattage, but figure this to be over a 40 watt bulb and under a 60 watt.I was provided this item to give an honest and unbiased review.I am pleased with the performance of this bulb.

The Panasonic ES-ED70-G is easy to handle and contours to most curves/angles well. It is by no means, "gentle." I tried it on my neck and man did it hurt. Worse, it ripped the hair half way, so did not pull it completely out....so....I had to do it again! The next day, when the welts went down, it was fine, but there is no way I would every use it on my neck again. So, my wife was not willing to try it, so I put it on my legs. Same thing! It seems to hurt less if you put more pressure on it. I used the sensitive skin attachment, the regular one was just too much torture. The razor is useless, but the trimmer is ok. After all that, my wife said she hadn't shaved legs today and that I could try it on her leg. "You're not used to it," she said. Well, she asked for it. I tried it on her leg (with the sensitive attachment). "Ouch!" she yelled, "that hurt!" Maybe you have to get used to it. LOL.While it's nice to be able to take it into the shower, it's not that great if you have welts, tears, etc. I don't think it is worth the pain, especially when you have to make several passes. Of course, if you can take it, it will ultimately get you smooth. It is not what I expected. It was NOT comfortable, and it is NOT fast......and lastly.....it is NOT for us.

These hefty cups are the perfect size for a party or tailgating! They are relatively thick, offering good support. They hold 18 ounces, which is great for any drink and plenty of ice. The logo/ink does not come off and the cup is easy to hold and doesn't easily fold in on itself. It also pours well, without dribbling down the edge. Color and logo are also right on! Perfect if you are a fan!

For the price, this is a great Snorkel and Mask set. The snorkel is flexible, which allows it to contour well. It purges easily and takes in air well. It cleans up easily (rinse after every use and it should last you a long time). The mask is clear and comfortable and very adjustable, so it should fit anyone. My 10 year old daughter had no problem with it, and neither did my 12 year old son. It was fine on me as well. This is a great set to take on vacation. I wish I would have had this when we went to California. Snorkeling with the gear we borrowed from family (who snorkel all the time) was not as good. I was provided this to review and give an honest and unbiased opinion....and I am glad to say that I like it. It seems like it will hold up. If it doesn't, or if anything changes, I will up date my review.

I love my Braun. I have used Braun for over 20 years and have never found anything close to it. So, for me to give this Panasonic 5 stars should say a lot. Keep in mind that this is "just" a travel shaver. I will mention what I don't like first, and that is, no sideburn trimmer. That would make this perfect. I was thinking I would use this when I travel, but I have found the shave to be so close (maybe better) to my Braun (blasphemy, I know) that I am using it every morning. So far, this week, the batteries are doing fine. Please note the Braun I use costs about 5 times more! Everything here is smaller, lighter, etc. These are not negatives for me, because it is marketed as a travel shaver. They really don't mean it to be a daily user, even though that is how *I* am using it. The shave is very close, razor close. It goes around my chin easily and smoothly without pinching or cutting. It works well in the shower. It cleans easily, but doesn't come with a brush (you don't need one) because you can just rinse it. It comes with a foil guard and a little bag (that I wouldn't use). The on switch takes a little pressure, nothing difficult, but enough so that it won't easily turn on while you are travelling. I shave every day, and have not missed a day, so I can't say how it works on a couple of days of growth (I will update if it handles poorly). You can easily keep this I your care, briefcase, etc. One thing that is interesting, even though the foil is not as wide as my Braun, I didn't notice a difference in shaving time. It was pretty much the same. I had no irritations or reactions after shaving.

This is an amazing filter. This is the first time I have used this, because I never knew it existed. I will continue to purchase this ultra fine particle reduction filter as it has made a HUGE difference over the 2200 I used to use. It is amazing how much less dust there is in the house, and the difference in air quality. These are pricey, no doubt, but well worth it. I didn't notice that my HVAC worked harder (no difference in my electric bill), but I did notice that the filter needed to be changed sooner the first time, which means it pulled a lot of dust from the return, and that is dust that would have circulated in my house! Love it.

I didn't have a game plan for college. I struggled to get into a good school and wish I had had this book when I was in 9th grade. My son is in 7th now, and I thought it would be a good idea to take a look and see what a good plan might be. I took a Kaplan course for my post grad, and it was VERY helpful, so I was hoping the same here....This Kaplan guide did not let me down. There is quite a lot of helpful information and it is given in a very useful and helpful way.This book is not really written for parents, but for the student, and I think it will make sense to my son when he is ready to start reading it towards the end of next year. However, I think it is great for a parent to read and prepare and know what's coming, or what should be. The information is excellent, and it gave me a better understanding in how things work, AP classes, etc.This is a must read!

This is just an okay, basic guide, but it won't really help you with details, etc. I got MUCH better information from AAA. As a member they will map everything out, show points of interest, etc. I also got more information from the internet, so, for the amount of time it takes to read this, look online, etc., I would be better off just starting off online and doing everything that way.  This is NOT the way to plan a detailed, fun filled, trip along route 66. The pictures are nice and the maps are helpful (if you use maps). There is information to get you started, but not enough to satisfy. For free information (and maybe more than you are looking for) look at: http://www.nps.gov/nr/travel/route66/learnmore66.html

The Ivation Snorkel is great. It is very flexible, even in cold water it doesn't stiffen up. It is also very comfortable. I don't feel like I have to reset my jaw when I use it, very little jaw fatigue after almost an hour. Breathing is pretty easy, and I feel like I get good air flow in and out. Clearing after a dive is quick and easy.  Cleans easily enough, but the grooves are tough to reach into, so I use the hose with a strong jet to rinse it off and so far, so good. The quick release is helpful as well.

This rugged bag is pretty nice! It is made of thick canvas that appears like it will last. The zippers are smooth and work well. The handles are a comfortable rubber type with good grips. The bag is roomy as well as comfortable. There are several different storage areas, and I can keep my laptop safe and sound. It converts into a backpack easily enough. The lining is very soft. The center pocket is hard to open because the zipper goes underneath the flap and is hard to reach. Other than that, this is a great bag and I was happy to have been provided it to provide an honest and unbiased review. It looks like something Indiana Jones would have.....I love that. 4.5 stars!

The VETRA duffel bag is a perfect sized sport bag the holds my gear well. I can fir all my stuff with room to spare. It is comfortable to carry and seems well made. It can even function as a weekender bag. I was provided this bag for an honest and unbiased review. This is a very nice, and stylish, bag that I will be using a lot. The side pockets are great and offer separate storage for toiletries or snacks or sweaty clothes. It is also great for my son as a sleepover bag, he already has plans for it!

The Philips Norelco Bodygroom 1100 is a weak trimmer with a couple of attachments. It is battery operated and if you have very little hair, you will be fine, but if you have a lot, and/or thick hair, prepare to spend a lot of time trimming. I did not get any nicks or cuts, but it really takes an incredible amount of time. Also, get your batteries ready because they will probably run out quickly. It also works terribly in the shower....or rather, when your hair is wet. While it is nice to be able to cut in both directions, I found it awkward and unnecessary.

This is an amazing wine aerator! It allows the wine to aerate easily and quickly and does not back up when you are pouring your wine. It has different settings and is very easy to adjust. It feels very well made.  I love that it is so easy to clean. This is a great price and offers a lot of value. Its three stage aeration is great, and works perfectly without making a mess. I love it, and now all my friends want one, too! I'm glad to have been provided this to review for an honest and unbiased review.

I just went on a trip and there is nothing worse than having one of your bags over the weight limit. With this digital scale I was able to check and make sure that both bags were the same weight. It measure in pounds and kilograms. Insert the battery when you get it (not so easy to do, you really have to snap it in) and you are ready to go. The LCD is easy to read and bright. Fits over luggage handle. Make sure you have it at zero and you are ready to weigh! I'm so happy to have gotten this to review for an honest and unbiased review. It's great to take with you when you are travel, especially if you plan on buying things on your trip!

These Hershey's Caramels in Milk Chocolate are pretty good. They are bigger than bite sized, but small enough to fit in your mouth if really want to stuff yourself. The caramel melts in your mouth and is not too sweet, but there isn't enough chocolate for my taste. I would like the chocolate to be thicker. Not only for the taste, but most of the ones I opened had the bottom opening and the caramel coming out. That's annoying, and I am not used to having my candy stuck to the wrapper. I like that one square is enough for me, (especially because that is not my norm), usually I don't stop.  If there were more chocolate, I probably wouldn't stop at one, but it was still enough to satisfy my sweet tooth.

This shirt has kind of an odd fit, not the average cut, so it might work better for some people while not well at all for others.First, on the positive side, the material is soft and moves well with the body. My husband tells me it feels good against his skin.Now the weird stuff: The shirt has a boxy cut, so it doesn't contour well with the body. This fits my husband's shoulders and chest well, but there is a lot of excess material bagging out around the midsection. The shirt is also quite short. And the v-neck cut is a little too shallow, I think. It sits just below the hollow of the neck, making it not quite a traditional v-neck cut.

The necklace comes inside a nice cloth pouch, which is then inside of a pretty purple gift box.The chain is average quality, not so thin that it will break easily. It has a dainty, feminine appeal.The pendant is solid and seems to be well made. The engraved word 'Hope' is small, though, making it difficult to read while wearing it unless someone is examining you closely. The style of the ribbon makes me think of the ubiquitous breast cancer awareness ribbons. I mean absolutely no offense on that observation. It's just that those ribbons are everywhere, and so that was my first reaction when I pulled it out of the pouch. That aspect would actually work well for this to be given as a gift to a breast cancer survivor.

This pendant is even prettier than I expected.It comes in a nice pouch, which is set inside of a gift box.The chain is feminine, while also thick enough to be sturdy. The clasp is well made and latches well, with no risk of coming undone.The pendant is solid and has a nice spark to it. The angel is large enough to show, but not at all clunky. This is more of a subtle accessory than a showpiece.

This appears to be an excellent quality food. The first ingredient is pollock, which is a type of fish my dogs had never tasted. This also contains turkey, which is probably a least favorite meat source for at least one of my dogs. (Unless it's freshly cooked!) This food also contains a healthy and wide array of fruits and vegetables, such as carrot, apple, and cranberries. And I was interested to find this food has some probiotic strains for, I'm assuming, digestive and immune health.The nuggets are small square shapes. They look a bit like a bowl of Chex cereal.One of my dogs immediately took to this food. The other two were initially hesitant, likely because the pollock was a strange scent for them. It didn't take long for all three dogs to find the strange smell had (presumably) a great taste. My girl, which is the dog least likely to eat turkey, will go to her other food if offered the choice. The boys are enjoying the new flavor.

I take probiotics regularly for chronic health complications. Not only does regular supplementation help with digestive issues, but probiotics also help boost the immune system.This particular Viva Labs probiotic is a 6-strain blend. Some brands contain more bacteria strains, others less. You might need to do a little research and experimentation to figure out which is best for you.These do not require refrigeration and, especially good for me, they are vegetarian-friendly.I've had great luck with this brand so far.

CoQ10 is an excellent supplement, particularly for issues related to the heart. Many years ago, my mother's cardiologist wanted to put her on medication (complete with unwanted side effects) for palpitations, extra heartbeats, etc. I suggested she first try CoQ10, 100mg per day, which she did. She has since had the rare, minor palpitation, but no other issues, all without prescription medication or side effects. My husband takes it for his blood pressure, and I take it for complications with a leaky mitral valve. In general, this is a supplement I highly recommend.Specifically, I am happy so far with this company's products. I've only just switched to their CoQ10, but I've haven't experienced any problems related to the quality. The softgels are relatively small and easy to swallow. This supplement needs to be taken with food, or at least something with fat content (milk, yogurt, chocolate, etc.).My experience with VIva Labs products so far has been excellent, and I highly recommend giving this try.

The towel itself is fine, as far as quality. They're soft and absorbent. But the color runs horribly. I'm always a little leery of red towels, because red does tend to bleed. So I first soaked one towel in a little bit of warm water for about 10 minutes. The water was pink. I rinsed it, let it dry, and tried again. It still ran just as much. I also had a package of the tan color, which I hadn't even considered would run. But, just to be safe with this brand, I repeated the same soaking exercise with a tan towel. The same thing happened.I'm not comfortable using towels that run, even if I'm using them dry. It just feels unsanitary to me. So, based on that alone, I can't recommend these towels.

I love these dishtowels. They're 'bar mop' towels, so they're slightly smaller than a traditional dish towel.  I use this size for wiping dishes, but I also love it for general cleanup and while cooking and baking (instead of constantly using paper towels). They're absorbent, easy to wash and dry, and great quality.

Got this for my husband. It's solid, heavy duty, and durable. Adjustment only involves depressing the hinge and setting the head to your desired angle. It's simple. He's very happy with the quality and range of the claw.

I got this for my husband for work. Here are his thoughts:This eWriter is surprisingly thin and lightweight. It comes with a stylus specific for the product, but you could use any sort of blunt-ended object if needed. The great thing is that it doesn't respond to fingertips or other such pressure, so you don't need to worry about being overly careful in handling this while using it.The screen itself is grayish in color, and the writing is bright green. The contrast stands out well, being easily readable without a lot of bright light.Once you depress the 'erase' button, everything is immediately wiped clean from the surface. The downside of this is that you can't erase individual lines of notes or mistakes. I'd love to see this screen divided into one-inch horizontal lines, with an erase button for each line. That would allow far more flexibility. For instance, you could erase tasks as completed, rather than erasing the entire screen at once.There is no memory, so once the screen is full you need to copy the notes or, as I do, snap a photo with your phone if there are things you still want to keep but you need space for more notes. That being said, everything you write remains until you choose to click the erase button.I showed mine off the first day at work, and all my coworkers wanted one for themselves. It's a cool toy.Aside from work use, this is also great for people like me who need to draw while speaking. Drives my wife crazy, because I'm always snatching paper away from her to illustrate while I talk. Now I can illustrate and erase.

This is such a fun toy!The car is hard plastic. The pony is softer, maybe a hard rubber material. The pony can be taken off the car and played with separately. It's head turns side to side, but the rest of the body doesn't move. Putting it back on the car is simple.The remote is hard plastic, with three large buttons. One button is simply a horn, one button move the car forward, and one button turns the car in one direction only. It's quite easy to maneuver. All the buttons on the control also play music and make sounds. The remote is the perfect size for little hands.The car manages well on flat surfaces, with no tipping. We don't have carpet, so I can't speak to that, but it does go over our sofa without a problem.My five-year-old granddaughter absolutely loves this toy. Her cats are entertained, as well.

My husband, who isn't much into jewelry of any sort, went nuts over this watch.First, I should mention that, like all Invicta watches, this comes in a nice gift box, along with a small cleaning cloth.The watch is striking. It's fairly heavy, with a large face, but it's not at all clunky or cumbersome. The brushed gold and black, along with the white numbers around the edges and the bit of white on the dials on the face, makes for an eye-catching combination.The band feels soft. It's flexible but also sturdy. My husband tells me that it feels comfortable on his wrist.I expected this watch to be more suited to casual dress. That's not so at all. This watch could easily transition from casual wear to dressy.I've seen a lot of Invicta watches, and I have to say that this is my favorite so far. My father obsessively collects watches, but there is no way he'll get this one away from my husband.

These are nice dishcloths for the money. They're  a good thickness, soft, and absorbent.I noticed that a lot of reviewers are complaining about these dishcloths falling apart easily. I've only washed and used mine once so far. They held up fine in the wash with my other towels. Only one has a bit of thread fraying on a seam. The other five are fine and still look new. I assume they won't last an exceptional amount of time, given the price. But so far mine seem like they'll withstand quite a bit of use.

Every now and then a book comes along that surprises with me with its essence. This is one of those books.I'm going to start with a confession: I wasn't sure about this book at first. I connect to stories by connecting to the characters, and there isn't a lot of development here. We learn little about Leah or the people tracking her. I wondered, "Who is this woman I'm following into the woods?"Then, as I followed along, I learned that the journey here is the heart and soul of the story. Leah could be my mother, your grandmother, or that lady in line ahead of us at the grocery store. She is a symbol of each of us, and of the people we love. I hope I have that right. Ms. Doreen Cox, feel free to correct me if I've gotten it wrong.The animals in the forest and the way they surround Leah with love is truly beautiful. I don't want to give any spoilers, so I will simply say that the feeling of peace this story gives is powerful.This is a novella short on words but long on impact.

These are quite pretty to look at. I love the vibrant purple. Unfortunately, that's where the positives stop.These take quite a bit of time to initially absorb water. Once wet, they do okay in cold water. But if you plan to wash your dishes in hot water, beware. The color runs horribly. I had purple dishwater. I won't use them.

This watch comes in a nice gift box, along with a small cloth for cleaning.The photo here doesn't really do the watch justice. The crystals give it a pretty sparkle, while keeping it classy.I was initially hesitant about this one. The watch is fairly heavy and solid, almost like a man's watch in feel. Yet, on the wrist, it is definitely feminine. There is an elegance to the appearance, making it ideal for casual or dressy events.The only drawback is the length of the band. I haven't yet taken it to the jeweler to be sized, but it looks like I'll need at least six links removed before I can wear it. That's a lot of extra. I honestly can't imagine any woman needing the watch band to be as large as it is. This seems to be a trend with quality watches these days, and I have to say that I'm not a fan. That being said, it's not a big expense to have links removed and the watch is worth it.

I got this for my husband's truck. He smokes, I don't, and the stale smoke smell annoys us both. I'm also quite sensitive to chemical odors and hate those air fresheners you hang on the rearview mirror. You wind up with a heavy perfume scent covering up a stale scent.This bamboo bag is fairly large. I don't think you'd want to hang it on your mirror. My husband hung it from the clothes hook in the back seat area of his truck. We're both surprised at how well this works at cleaning the air. The charcoal does not mask odors, it removes them.Highly recommended!

My husband has a coffee addiction. He goes nowhere without his coffee, and has a mug on his desk at work all day. I got this for him to keep at work, so his coffee would stay warm and not spill over on his work as it sometimes does. He is disappointed in this mug. Here are his thoughts:The plastic feels thinner than what you'd get with a good quality travel mug. There isn't any insulation to keep the coffee warm, so it's no better than a regular mug and less effective than a travel mug.The mug itself is fairly large, but the cover is screwed deep into the mug and takes up a lot of space. There is also a lot of empty space between the outer part of the mug and the inside cavity. The open area between is where the mechanism sits that is supposed to open and close to prevent spillage. Consequently, this large mug only holds about 10-ounces of coffee, which is just a big sip for me.The liquid gravity mechanism doesn't work like advertised. When I tip the mug in closed position, it still leaks. Granted, it doesn't pour, but it would still make a mess.The mug is a nuisance to clean. The space between the outside of the mug and the inner cavity can't be cleaned effectively. And coffee does get inside there. If you overfill the mug by even a little, when you put the cover in place the spillage goes in that open space.I'm going back to my regular mugs and travel mugs. I will not use this at all.

Mrs. John Doe is a fast-paced thriller with a unique heroine. Nora is an actress and an acting teaching, and here she relies on her skills in ways she never expected.I liked Nora's character. She's tough and self-sufficient, and she doesn't allow fear to cripple her. At the same time, she's not an obnoxious superhero who can do no wrong. The originality of her character intrigued me most about this book.The plot carries us along at high speed, with lots of twists and turns. At times it feels a little too far-reaching, with multiple offshoots and ambiguities. The entire story is told from Nora's perspective, and her confusion becomes our confusion as we try to sort out the tangled strands. Events do come together and everything makes complete sense, but you need to pay attention to the details.The writing puts us in the midst of the action. I could feel the emotions and the bursts of adrenaline. I really enjoyed the exploration through small towns in England and France. I felt like I was there with the characters.For me, the only negative comes in believability. Granted, most thrillers require that we take a leap. But the premise of this story requires quite a big leap. I don't want to give anything away, so I'll try to be vague while still making sense. First, I found it hard to believe that Nora's husband would have involved her in this on any level at all. Second, Nora is surrounded by the best operatives in the world, good and bad, yet she manages to make them all look amateur. And, finally, given the magnitude of what her husband was involved in, I just couldn't believe that he would try to play hero and handle it all himself. The 'trust no one' theme was just a little too much for me to fully accept. But what do I know? A similar scenario could be playing out in reality as I type this.*I was provided with an ebook copy by the publisher, via NetGalley, in exchange for my honest review.*

In this sweeping saga, Maria Savva beautifully captures family dynamics, the secrets we keep from the people we love, and the damage caused by the lies we tell.Cara is the family matriarch, and on the surface she is not particularly likable. Then we look deeper and we see her damaged spirit. We find the broken part of her, long buried, and we learn how one event, one misunderstanding, changed everything. Cara covers her pain with strength, but also with secrets and lies.Cara's family, her children and their children, live in the shadow of her deception. When events force Cara to face that long ago truth she'd been hiding, the pieces of this story come together in surprising ways.This story is dramatic and sad, but also full of hope. It made me think about my own family dynamics, and about the things that shape the people we become.

This watch is even prettier in person. It's really quite stunning. The combination of the high-polished silver and the crystals give it a nice eye-catching sparkle, without being obnoxious. And the heart on the face is a unique touch.My one complaint with this watch is the extreme size of the band. It's incredibly long, more the size of a man's watch than a woman's. In fact, it fits my husband. I need to have several links removed before I can wear it, but fortunately the jeweler said this isn't a problem with this type of band.

What child wouldn't love to have his or her own little quad to ride? Heck, I want to ride this!The quad requires only a bit of easy assembly. Before using it, you have to charge the battery, which we did overnight. The track is mostly flat, with a couple of bumpy strips to add some life to the ride. The quad goes about one-mile-per-hour on the track, making it perfect for very young children and indoor use. The quad can also be driven without the track, outdoors, and goes a little faster that way. It does well on pavement and even manages in the grass.This is definitely geared toward very young children, just as advertised.

This is a well crafted umbrella.  The compact size works well for travel, so I can take it with me anywhere.One press of the button and the umbrella snaps open. Press the button again and it collapses.  The umbrella has a large span, and the edges dip down to offer more protection with wind and heavy rain. The hand grip is soft. It's a little small for my husband, who has large hands, but fits mine well. The poll part of this umbrella is quite short, so you need to keep your arm raised fairly high to keep your head covered. That's really the only downfall.

Okay, so I'm far from a prude. I have no problem with adult humor. But this game is a little more adult than I expected.When I got this game, I thought it would be fun for those adult get-togethers when we're all sitting around with not much to do. I have family and friends spread out around the country, and thought this would be a lot of laughs to play when they come to visit. While we're all adults, and far from shy and reserved, I would not play this game with any of them. There are some things I'd prefer never to know about my friends, and certainly not about my brothers and sisters-in-law. You couldn't pay me to play this with my parents.The game itself is simple. You have cards with statements that you read aloud. You secretly choose true or false to your statement, and the rest of the players guess your answer. Some of the statements are indeed funny. Most, though, are intensely personal and sexual in nature. Some absolutely border on crude. It's like teenage truth-or-dare on steroids.An interesting thing is that this game is designed for a minimum of three players. This isn't a game meant to play with your significant other, privately, for some laughs. It is, however, perfect for swingers and/or open-minded couples. It's the kind of game I'd expect to find at Spencer's store, in the back with the body gel that heats up when you rub it on.So, this game is not suitable for my intended purposes. If you do buy this, and you have kids at home, make sure you hide it. I'm pretty sure you won't want to explain most of this stuff to your 12-year-old.

This appears to be a healthy dog food with quality ingredients. There are no byproducts or hard to digest fillers.The nuggets are small, about the size of a pea, only slightly more flattened on two sides. My dogs are all under 15 pounds, and they prefer smaller nuggets so this food works well for them in that area.I put a bowl of this down beside their regular dry food. They tasted this one, then mostly chose to go for their regular food. Their preference might have more to do with the turkey flavor than the quality of the food. Their other dry food was lamb flavor, which I think they like better in general. Turkey just doesn't seem to interest them as much.

This is one of my granddaughter's favorite wrestlers, perhaps because he's so familiar. She watches wrestling with her father, and 'The Rock' is quite well known. This figure has the sculpted muscles, and the golden knee pads and boots. I don't really like his face. I'm not sure how much he looks like 'The Rock', but my granddaughter loves him.

My granddaughter watches wrestling with her father, my son, and loves that she now has action figures that are "real people". She now has a few of them, and loves mixes and matching their accessories. She has created some odd looking figures, but she loves them.The figures are well made and pose easily.  My son always loved action figures (still does), and it appears my granddaughter takes after her father. Now she makes her toys wrestle while she watches them on TV.

This train set absolutely requires adult assembly and assistance. It's not something you can hand your child and expect him/her to figure out alone. Little ones will need either an older child or an adult to help out.The pieces are all quite sturdy. This is well made and has a fun design. The track can be taken apart and redesigned in a variety of ways.The train goes faster than I expected. No lazy ride around the track for Chuggington. There is a lot to this set, such as the crane, the drawbridge, and the turnstile. It's a fairly large setup.The train requires two AAA batteries, so be sure to have those on hand.

This is a cool action figure for kids or collectors. My granddaughter has grown up watching wrestling with my son, her father. These figures are fun for her because they're familiar "people", and she can get her dad to play with her. This one comes with accessories that are among her favorites. She loves the guitar and the wings, and she also enjoys waving the snake at her little brother.

I don't play video games personally, but my son is an avid gamer. This is his review:Going to begin by stating that this wheel does not work for every racing game. I wanted to use it to play Need for Speed Rivals on my PS4. However, EA (producer of NFS) is terrible and doesn't allow/enable wheel function.I tested the wheel out by playing DriveClub, which is a more realistic racing game than NFS. It worked great and was easy to set up. The feedback function is cool. There's a feature that let's you change how much you need to turn the wheel, which is awesome.This isn't really something for everyone. More of an accessory that driving game enthusiasts should definitely consider.The wheel itself is well designed and is comfortable to hold and use. The weight is a problem, though. It's so light, if you don't have a surface that the grips on the bottom can hold on to well, you'll be pulling the wheel side to side instead of steering. The power cord is also quite short and thin.Overall, a fun accessory to have while playing a driving game.

Length: Print, 19 pages.This nonfiction book is targeted to people interested in a scuba diving as a sport or hobby.What was the Amazon Rank on the date this review was published? 14,064 among free books.Please join in the conversation by leaving a comment at the end of this review and also let us know if you find this review helpful. By all of us networking together, internet commerce can be a win-win for everybody, because producers can learn what they need to do; consumers can purchase what they are seeing; and reviewers can improve their analysis and can then be a part of the solution.Questions that might come to mind are: Will this book actually teach me something I didn't already know by surfing the internet? Unfortunately, rather than being a book with everything you need to know, this is a brief, very brief, introduction to stimulate your curiosity.Is this a book that I can read without having to read others first? Yes.Are there other books by this author that might also be helpful? On this subject, no, but the author has other nonfiction titles on other topics. One I purchase is Strawberries: Everything You Need to Know.Are there a lot of typos/misspellings, grammatical errors or other editing failures? No, I found no typos of editing errors. Well, unless you include the misleading title.Is it a quick, easy read and is the writer enthusiastic in his/her approach? The one bright spot of this book is that it is an easy-to-read book. The writer is encouraged to expand this booklet, as it is apparent this writer has talent.What sort of language does this writer use to amplify the points made? Plain English. No foul language and no confusing jargon.My biggest pleasure or disappointment was? It did stimulate my curiosity and I will be searching for a more in-depth work on Scuba Diving.EXCERPT:Due to the number of pages I opted to not include any excerpts.Bottom line: As written, due to the extreme brevity, I‚Äôm rating this as a one star. There just is not enough information to justify a selling price of $2.99. Even at free, as it is on the date I am posting this review, readers may be disappointed in clogging up their Kindle Library with this.On the other hand, if the writer does expand this and insert some photographs to amplify the points being made or to ease the learning process, I will gladly reconsider my rating.

Length: Print, 118 pages, not available at Audible, but would be a good venue for this subject matter.Please join in the conversation. Together, we can make a terrific community by networking writers/publishers with marketers/distributors and readers/reviewers so that everybody wins in online purchasing. How? By leaving a comment at the end of this review. Thanks.Amazon Kindle Sales Rank when this review was posted: 517,620.This nonfiction How-To book is targeted to people who are posting reviews at Amazon and other online sites, and to bloggers providing reviews to help other readers find good books.Are there a lot of typos, grammatical errors or other editing flaws? No. None that seriously alter the meaning.Language: Plain English. Absent any foul language or confusing jargon. She is clear and concise, as the excerpt below will show.Although I have posted a good deal more reviews and have been doing so for considerably longer, I learned several good points from this writer and will improve because of that. She knows her subject and, obviously, has good advice even for some reviewers currently in Amazon's Top 500.She has also written a book offering tips to people who want to set up their own web site for reviewing books, which I will read tonight, since I have got my site up and running...er, crawling. With her tips I hope to improve my design and content quickly.I appreciated her way with words. She writes in a calm, effortless style without exaggerating or making wild statements and with no malice towards other reviewers. More to the point, she makes solid points of value to reviewers and to people who enjoy reading reviews.EXCERPT:Clarity ‚ÄìHow clear is the subject discussed? Can you follow the writer‚Äôs thoughts or is there just way too much stream of consciousness that you can‚Äôt understand what is being presented?Biasness ‚ÄìNow, there is nothing wrong in a biased non-fiction, but it needs to be presented in the review. Is this a book that tries to be objective or does it take a strong stance either way? Let your readers know.Format/ Layout ‚ÄìA non-fiction book depends a lot on format and layout. It has to have some visual appeal as some of the information might be presented in graphs, pictures, and bullet points. Many non-fiction books tend to have little white space which can hurt the eyes. Note all of this in your review. In case of a cookbook, is the layout appealing to the eye and easy to read?Depth ‚ÄìHow in-depth does the author go?Visual aids ‚ÄìAre there visual aids: pictures, graphs, diagrams, etc.?References ‚ÄìDoes the author cite sources? Can you follow up on topics if you are interested and want to know more?Argument -How well does the author argue their point or support their topic? Or is it just a bunch of statements that say the same opinion over and over?Style ‚ÄìHow is the overall style of the writing? Engaging? Witty? Boring? Dry?I do have a couple points to note: the title of this book at Amazon is Writing a Book Review, but when it loads onto Kindle, the title is How to Write a Book Review.The other point is that the author links to her blog, abookloverslibrary but when I click on it, I am transferred to a site in either Japanese or Chinese. I trust this is not her fault, but I hope she can correct it in future.In summary, How to Write a Book Review may not be the last word on the subject, but it is a great place to start.Please join in the conversation and help us all improve the experience within the online community.

Length: Print, 62 pages; not yet available as an audiobook through Audible, but it definitely should be at some future date.Join in the conversation: leave a comment at the end of the review or to search my profile for more good books or my email contact information.This book is targeted to people interested in American history and, especially, in the struggle been Seminoles and Creek Indians to maintain their freedom from encroachment of pioneers from the new nation, the United States of America.What was the Amazon Rank on the date this review was published? 231,466.Questions that might come to mind are: Will this book actually teach me something I didn't already know by surfing the internet? Yes, definitely.Is this a book that I can read without having to read others first? Yes. This is a stand alone.Are there other books by this author that might also be helpful? The author has written other books about serial killers, but this is the only one regarding American History and about the Indian Wars.Are there a lot of typos/misspellings, grammatical errors or other editing failures? The only drawback with The Wild Wild West in the Deep South is that it would benefit from some professional editing. Please bear in mind, the editing that has been done is better than many books I‚Äôve read. It is even better than some reviews I‚Äôve posted, so, don‚Äôt let this point scare you away from reading this valuable tome.Is it a quick, easy read and is the writer enthusiastic in his/her approach? This is a quick, interesting book that I read in less than three hours.I also hope the writer will consider producing this as an audiobook through Audible. A recent book by Buck Flogging shows how easily and inexpensively it can be done and why every self publisher should consider doing so.What sort of language does this writer use to amplify the points made? The author relates the conflict in straightforward English, absent any foul language.I found this book especially interesting in the backdrop of current world events. It‚Äôs balanced, even-handed treatment of military leaders from both sides of the conflict is to be praised.EXCERPTS:Excerpt 1:At the age of fourteen, Horse would hang around the American military base, Fort Brooke, in order to see what he could learn from the Americans and possibly make some quick cash. Over time, Horse noticed that the American soldiers were fond of turtles, which they often made into a delicious soup or stew, so he decided to find a couple of the reptiles and sell them to the fort‚Äôs quartermaster. The quartermaster gave the young man a nice price for a pair of turtles, which turned into a daily occurrence ‚Äì Horse would show up with exactly two turtles daily. After a few days the fort‚Äôs cook noticed that there were only two turtles in the pen at any given time, which quickly led to the realization that the young black Seminole was selling the soldiers the same two turtles every day! Instead of being angry, the soldiers were actually amused and impressed with Horse‚Äôs guile and fortitude. The daring and reckless attitude that Horse employed in his deception of the soldiers at Fort Brooke is what later helped propel him to war-chief during the Second Seminole War.The daring and reckless attitude that Horse employed in his deception of the soldiers at Fort Brooke is what later helped propel him to war-chief during the Second Seminole War.One final Indian leader worth mentioning here was not a Seminole, but a Cherokee ‚Äì John Ross (1790-1866). John Ross was only marginally Cherokee, genetically speaking, as his father was a Scottish trader and his mother was a quarter Cherokee. Despite being considerably more white than Indian, Ross served as chief of the Cherokee from 1819-1826. By all accounts Ross was a thoughtful, intelligent, and erudite man who was fluent in both English and Cherokee and was responsible for writing the Cherokee nation‚Äôs constitution. Ross experienced the plight of Indian removal first hand during the 1830s when his people were forced to take the Trail of Tears to Indian Territory. He also faced Indian removal during the course of the Second Seminole War when he worked as an intermediary between the United States government and the Seminoles in order to try to reach a peaceful resolution to the conflict.Walker, Dwayne (2015-11-14). The Wild Wild West In The Deep South: The Second Seminole War (Native American History Book 2) (Kindle Locations 271-285).  . Kindle Edition.Excerpt 2:I write this from my sick room. Five days since, I was attacked with the dysentery again; and the Dr. cannot, as yet, control the movements of my bowels. I am writing this letter, supposing it may be the last one I shall write you. For I cannot conceal from myself that I am pretty sick. I have though much of dying lately, since my sickness.Lieutenant Smith survived that particular bout of illness, but hundreds of soldiers suffered from illnesses that left many incapacitated and scores dead. The deeper the Americans went into the Everglades in search of the Seminoles they found out that the Indians were not their only enemies. Diseases such as dysentery and especially malaria awaited to kill those who had little experience with such things and the Everglades are also home to a host of poisonous snakes and insects that many Americans soldiers found out could be just as harmful as a Seminole warrior.Finally, the U.S. forces resorted to tactics that had been used before the Second Seminole War and afterwards ‚Äì the targeting of civilian populations.As the Seminole guerilla raids continued, General Zachary Taylor and later General William Worth embarked on an aggressive counter-insurgency campaign that was directed at eliminating the Seminoles‚Äô sources of food and shelter. The American forces burned Seminole fields and villages and captured men, women, and children by the hundreds and put them in camps and prisons to await removal to Indian Territory. The counter-insurgency tactics employed by the U.S. army were brutal, but ultimately successful as John Horse surrendered in the summer of 1838. After a stint in a military prison, the black Seminole leader was then deported to Indian Territory. With Osceola and John Horse out of the picture the Second Seminole War was all but over, although a few bitter and brave warriors kept fighting.The Caloosahatchee MassacreOver the course of the Second Seminole War there were many massacres and atrocities committed by both sides, but a notable massacre perpetrated by the Seminoles renewed the American vigor to prosecute the war. In 1839, with the war largely contained to the Everglades and the surrounding region, Americans‚Äô and even Floridians‚Äô taste for the war was greatly diminished. 1839 may have been a good time for the Seminoles to approach the Americans with a new deal, but then the Caloosahatchee Massacre took place.Walker, Dwayne (2015-11-14). The Wild Wild West In The Deep South: The Second Seminole War (Native American History Book 2) (Kindle Locations 551-569).  . Kindle Edition.As shown by the above excerpt, and as mentioned elsewhere in this review, professional editing will may improve the overall quality and legibility of The Wild Wild West in the Deep South. Specifically, I am noting the misspelling of the word ‚Äòthought‚Äô near the end of the first paragraph in excerpt 2. Still, despite the occasional typo and missing comma, I found this book exceptionally interesting. So much so, in fact, that I had difficulty in tearing myself away from it even to jot a note here and there.Despite that difficulty, I did Google Apalachua to learn about the city and about the county in Florida. It is not often that a writer so stimulates my intellect that I do so. Also, I checked a suspect word that I felt was clearly wrong, only to learn that there is such a word as manumitted and what it signifies. I will avoid defining that word here, just to see how many readers look it up the definition online.My overall assessment of this nonfiction book? Despite the editing snafus, I am rating it as a Four Star, must-read for any historian or person interest in American History or the battle between New World aboriginal people and those who emigrated from Europe.One additional note:America and the world are currently at a crossroads in the battle between civilization and a small percentage of peoples comprised from another culture. It is imperative that we not repeat the atrocities mentioned regarding how the settlers and frontiersmen took out their vengeance even against Indians who were not involved in combating the new Americans. We must unite against evil, but let us not be also guilty of harming innocent members of other cultures.For this reason, I am convinced there are valuable insights provided within this book that I hope will not go undetected by others reading this interesting history.

Length: Print, 81 pages; Audible, 2 hours 32 minutes.Feel free to be a part of the conversation by leaving a comment and your vote regarding helpfulness.Amazon Kindle Sales Rank at the time this review was posted: 119.This fictional story is an intriguing mystery regarding smuggling of Lego sets. In addition to enjoying a good story set in the American Southwest, readers should be able to discard any apprehension they may feel regarding their dental or medical appointment, because this work by J. A. Jance isn't enthralling.Surprisingly interesting, but the author has an iPad doing what I believe to be impossible. At least I can't get my head around the little trick played with an iPad and a GPS at about 56% through this story. See the below excerpt.This novella is written in spoken English with surprisingly few swear words (no sh- or f-bombs.With no further elaboration, let's take a gander at an excerpt.EXCERPT:She opened a battered black leather case and pulled out a fistful of power cords held together by plastic tie-wraps. She plugged one end of the cord into an opening on the broken frame of the GPS and plugged the other end into the port on her iPad. ‚ÄúHere goes,‚Äù she said, punching what was left of the on/ off switch. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs see if there‚Äôs any life in this old contraption.‚ÄùA moment later, the screen on her iPad lit up. ‚ÄúBingo,‚Äù she said triumphantly, turning the iPad so both Joanna and Ali both could see the screen."It looks just like a GPS,‚Äù Joanna said in amazement."That‚Äôs because it is a GPS,‚Äù Cami assured her. ‚ÄúThis GPS,‚Äù she added, pointing to the damaged...Because this novella is so short, I kept the excerpt very brief.Despite the seeming error regarding the iPad, I'm giving No Honor Among Thieves 4 Stars.

Sometimes I am amazed by Amazon and Amazon Marketplace vendors.All too often though, a vendor will contact me, or Amazon's Vine, will offer me a product free for agreeing to test their product in exchange for an honest review just a day or two AFTER I purchase a similar product or just after posting a review.For mce though, a vendor got to me with a car seat cover BEFORE I bought one.So, I knew I'd love this. I use it in our Dodge adurango, not so much to protect the seats, but to keep my Egyptian-born Yorkshire terrier out of the front seat. Why, you may wonder?Buddy is about twice as big, and triple the strength and vigor of most Yorkies. He loves to make his mark on the windows and windshield. The Windows are easy to clean of his breath vapor marking, but, the windshield is tough.At last, our Durango's windshield inside the cab is as clean as....I know what you're thinking, but I won't say 'hound's tooth' ...as clean as the exterior glass just after passing through the local car wash.Yes, my honest opinion is, I love this. Wish I had invented it.

UPDATED/CORRECTED REVIEW:Please note that I initially wrote this review using my iPhone and was unable to see my many typos and grammatical errors. I also revised portions of this review to improve its clarity and legibility.I hope readers of this review will become part of the conversation by leaving a comment at the bottom. Also, I hope, you find it useful in your search for a hammock.I got an inquiry recently to find out if I would test and review their camping hammock, in exchange for my honest opinion.I thought about it for a New York minute...chuckling to myself...this is a no-brainer...what can go wrong. But, it if they want to give me a hammock...then I concluded, manufacturing hammocks ain't rocket science...Of course I replied in the affirmative.Little did I then realize I was going to get one free, but my better half called debs on it. It is that sleek and comfortable.Mind you, my days of trekking the wilderness by bicycle are a thing of the past. And out here in Dakota country, even summer evenings are a bit too cold for sleeping outdoors. But, bring out the sun on a lazy, hazy and this hammock is just the ticket to a blissful nap. Unless, of course, I‚Äôm not out hiking or fishing or touring a historical landmark, museum or bookstore.Bottom line: I love this hammock.

I recently started feeding my Egyptian-born Yorkie, Buddy, EUKANUBA Adult Hearty Stew with Beef and Vegetables in Gravy Canned Dog Food which he absolutely loves. The problem with that is the price, but, if fed on a 50-50 basis with a good dry food, the cost can be justified.Thus, when I found this Senior Maintenance Dog Food available, I though, perfect solution for my 12-year-old best friend.Well, if Buddy could talk he might give me a gruff, "Not so fast bucko! This is okay, but the canned food tastes lots better." I say this because, Buddy will eat this dry food after cleaning up his dish of the canned, he seems to slightly prefer another brand of dry food.Still, this variety produced under license from Iams seems to be a healthier food with, to my nose, a more inviting aroma than the other brand. The small chunks are a perfect size, it seems, so I intend to wean Buddy from the other and feed him Eukanuba, dry and canned, over the coming year. Well, unless he shows signs of illness or outright refusal, that is. At 12, one cannot be too careful.That reminds me, one of his sons, back in Egypt, died a couple days ago. My wife and I suspect his nutrition was less than optimum, but purchasing American-manufactured pet food over there is much more difficult, and far costlier, than here. I'd be delighted to find Eukanuba Senior Maintenance Dog Food available for just $2.00 a pound in Cairo, but, like many, I admit to be a little hesitant Stateside.The only justification I have to pay such a cost, though, is Buddy's health.
