The NUYU  looks like a well designed and solidly engineered sleep system with a very innovative idea: "you emulate the circadian rhythm's temperature cycle so that your body is kept at the warmest temperature when you first get in bed, then slowly drop it to it's lowest temperature in the middle of the night and then back to the starting temperature to wake up [paraphrased from the website].Okay, I was sold so now lets look at the process of getting it set up.1. Download the app BUT only if you have a phone later than iphone4 (which you wouldn't know if you didn't go to their website's FAQ), an iPad later than the iPad4 or all but a few Android systems.2. Fill the machine with distilled water. (about 500ml or a standard sized water bottle will be needed )3. Attach the mat to the water tank. If you can't get it to "click", then flip the plug over and try again4. Plug in5. Put sleep mat under the fitted sheet or over the mattress.6. open the app/ press the big green button on the water tank (don't look for the zzz symbol, you won't find it.) until the blue light starts to blink7. Start the app, answer the questions (i didn't know the answer to some of them) and wait until they are paired.The unit started with a motor noise that was somewhat muffled but got louder as the world around me started to quiet down. I could hear and feel water rushing through the hose and through the mat BUT nothing was warming up. Then I glanced down and the phone was turned off (in sleep mode) for lack of activity.  But when I woke it up it wouldn't connect without a hard reboot. When I changed my setting for the phone to NEVER enter sleep mode (lock mode), the connection continued.  I pushed the unit under the bed to minimize the sound of the water tank. I could feel my body energy drop. I could feel the movement of water under me and the call to go to sleep. But i did not feel any warmth from the unit (the app was set for 75) until I turned it up to 80.It is in these areas where it would have been helpful if the unit had more explanatory directions like, "You may not feel heat at first" or "You should feel heat instantly" just to help us know how to tell if the unit is working properly.It was too noisy for me and too bright, even pushed under the bed. Again,  I felt that there was just not enough information in the manual to address this.  I gave it 4 nights of trial and even though I did find the motor loud, I was able to use it as "white noise" by the third day and found my sleep beckoning me but still remaining elusive.  There was a gentle comfort in the subtle wash of water circulating under me and I could tell that It was starting to work! I consistently woke up before the alarm so I don't know how it wakes you up. One big problem I had was that during  the night, I was fully aware of what I was sleeping on.  I was afraid to turn onto my side. I did manage to mangle the unit once or twice by my tossing and turning so I suggest that you place this under the sheet and right on top of your mattress for stability.If you're having problems sleeping, this is an expensive alternative, but it could work!  I honestly think it is a little early. The generic directions,  (i.e. no where do they suggest turning off  the phone's sleep cycle), the unclear "What to expect directions", and the absolute dependency on the app contributed to the downgrade of stars.  I have gotten great sleep using a heating pad on low, one that kicks off during the night but I am sleeping on an electric field which the NUYU does not generate. That's another plus to consider.If you can afford it, it is definitely worth a try.  I suspect they're going to be looking for ways  to keep improving it.

Let me start off by saying "My cats love this flavor by this company".  I want to say that up front because I think it is not appropriate to completely 5star a product just because YOUR cats like it and of course the reverse is equally true; that's it not appropriate to one star a product because YOUR cats don't like it.  Of course it makes me happy that they like it but digging deeper into this company makes me appreciate their efforts and their consciousness.Both of my cats are 12 and after years of being on Raw food, the slightly older one has begun to show his boredom (I think it's his inability to smell) with the raw diet.  I will try to mix in other cans of food in small amounts to give him some variety but it wasn't until this turkey flavor for "I and Love and You" showed up that I started having success.I wrote to ask the company about a couple of practices and about their Rabbit blend which was suddenly missing. They answered very quickly and with very clear explanations. So, I'm comfortable letting the "oldest" make demands in his later years. He does seem really happier and I'm grateful for the consistency of I and Love and You's product.

1:47 MinsThe Classic Patio Table cover was very lightweight and easy to spread out from its attached bag. It is made of coated polyester with PVC on the inside. It works very much like a bed sheet though this is heavier, of course. Setting it up was a breeze. All I really had to do was decide if my chairs would be able to fit under it and indeed they did fit underneath but I felt it left the gap too open.  I do wish it was "weighted" just a bit at the bottom rather than have a pull string, it just doesn't pull very easily and for me didn't seem to do much.  The straps are great and can wrap around the legs of the table or chairs (if you put chairs in there). The color is a bit brighter than the images here would convey but is fine for me and my eclectic outdoor play area.

Perfect addition to a "Trick or Treat" bag for youngsters of all ages.  There is a monster or alien head that has a suction cup right below it. You press the head down so that the Suction Cup sticks to the base and in about 30 seconds it pops up to surprise you.These are seriously cute. The manufacturer recommends for ages 4 and up--  but I do get the privilege of being around my friend's unpredictable (shy/ not shy) 29 Month old and there is a genuine appreciation of these heads (of which he is not allowed to be unsupervised with) but delights in their surprise popup action!My concerns for the very young is that they don't get popped in the face, (although the pop up is very gentle) and that these do have tiny springs in them that could come out and be a choking hazard.They are well done, however from the coloring of theh heads, to the pop, these are sure to be a delight for all ages.

0:52 MinsI like Contigo's innovation. There appears to be a consciousness evolving in their new products that (perhaps in my imagination only) seem to be based on a continual re-looking at what might be needed by their consumers.  This Contigo Matterhorn is a slim and attractive addition. Think of it as a stainless steel thermos / cup without the fancy one flip buttons for the lid. This bottle seems to say, "Stop and take a drink". It holds both HOT and COLD beverages keeping the cold, really cold even when left in the car on a hot day (which i did).It's all human grade (BPA-Free) plastic and the removable mouthpiece is convenient both as a way to safely had a Hot Beverage but for washing purposes (they do suggest to hand washing but it will go into the dishwasher - it's just suggested that you hand wash.I think that the word SCUBA in the title is the color of the Blue handle and mouthpiece. Considering that we used to pay a lot more for these portable "thermos-type" containers, I think this is a great value, superior well thought out product.

4:39 MinsThis is a visually "Cute" cat tree with it's fabric bark and cushy components but my boys didn't really have a lot of fun with it.First off, the directions need to have a word or two on them. In the video, when I got to that part of putting the bottom tree on it took me 3 times as long to figure out to remove or "open" the fabric at the bottom.  This cat tree is light weight and made of particle board under the flat base at the bottom and the flat piece in the middle.  You can tell just by looking at the picture that this thing is going to wobble and it really does.My cats also dislike the Velour feel of the fabric, preferring the twine feel more traditional cat trees where you can tug really hard as if just sharpening your nails.This is a cat tree for kitties. The house is small the larger cats may not like the disorienting wobbling. It's a visual treat but a cat yard flop, at least in this cat home.  Look for the video shortly.

1:47 MinsThe Classic Patio Table cover was very lightweight and easy to spread out from its attached bag. It is made of coated polyester with PVC on the inside. It works very much like a bed sheet though this is heavier, of course. Setting it up was a breeze. All I really had to do was decide if my chairs would be able to fit under it and indeed they did fit underneath but I felt it left the gap too open.  I do wish it was "weighted" just a bit at the bottom rather than have a pull string, it just doesn't pull very easily and for me didn't seem to do much.  The straps are great and can wrap around the legs of the table or chairs (if you put chairs in there). The color is a bit brighter than the images here would convey but is fine for me and my eclectic outdoor play area.

My Videographer friend was so impressed with mine, She bought herself one.  This is just an awesome set (depending of course on what you need) but for me, shooting short videos, product reviews, or portraits makes it absolutely the perfect solution and at this price, even better.  The muslin bag drop is HUGE. It even has a sewn hoop (like for a curtain) so you can put the horizontal bar through it and have it hand securely. The tripod legs are adjustable to allow you to shrink them up if you don't have a mega-space and in my 10 foot room they do fine.I didn't have to use one of the four bars I was sent. That went exactly across the room. I can't say enough about how perfect this set up it for me.  Very generous and well made.

Looking for sugar-less alternatives for stuffing the bags this season.  This has a very neatly arranged assortment of pencils, erasers, stickers and really cute Halloween mini "rubber duckies".  Worth it just for those.
These are like little plastic slinkies with an expected life of about 1 evening (if you're lucky).  They do make great Halloween stuffer gifts and added to our festive "bag-o-gifts" perfectly.

I had hoped to make these guys packed for fun 'not so sugary' treats but the opening is about 2 inches wide. Only really young kids can get their hands in there  and it makes pulling the little treats out really difficult. Unfortunately, these miss the mark for most of the children that come to our house for Halloween.  Best if giving a single gift to a young child but remember, it can't be more than two inches around.Very cute otherwise. Perhaps a string of them like a banner or multi-faced monster flag could be fun. Just not as a bag

5:19 MinsThis is a substantially made fountain for "cats".  It is almost completely made of plastic, which I'm not opposed to but I like to know the kind of plastic that my water will be sitting in for the cats. The product is not listed on the Oster sight so it could be new but I didn't have an easy way to call the company to find out.  The blue reservoir is a recycle #2  HDPE (High Density Polyethylene) which is considered one of the safer plastics. It's the stuff Milk cartons are made of so it should be fine.There wasn't much I had to do, wet the filter, fill the bowl and reservoir and plug it in. It required no priming the pump just fill and plug. Maybe I'm being over the top about the plastics but I need to know before I can be confident.

Tired of my neck and upper shoulders not opening up for me each morning. And more recently they stay tight through the day. My chiropractor suggested I get one of these and I'm so glad I did. I lay on my back and place this under my shoulder blades and lift my bottom and push back and forth. Oh man, what a relief. Still figuring out how to do it for my neck but since the shoulders feel better the neck does too.I got the middle length and it's perfect and firm. No indentation from my 200 pounds weight, still looks good but not as good as I feel!

I'm still in disbelief that this set was under $70.  What an incredible addition to my Canon 60D.  I wasn't sure I was going to be able to get the flash to  work wirelessly without the wireless adaptors but when I put the flash in S1 mode, and raise the flash of the 60D, the both went off (the flash on my camera and it sends a signal to the Altura flash and well, it's amazing.The Altura flash comes with feet so you can stand it up on a table or it has a hot shoe bottom so you can put it in a soft box or umbrella tripod. I have so much to learn but to keep this whole system at under $70 when I was expecting to spend $400.00 is just wonderful. And the company videos are also great.  Love the company and the product.

This is a really (really) heavy piece of cake holder. It's what makes it trust worthy because you rarely feel it's going to fall over.  I use it to display cookies and different pastries when we host a reading club in our house or for most gatherings.  When I'm not using it to display and serve sweets I take the stand at the bottom and turn it upside down, revealing a place to put the handle of the dome.  It becomes a fruit bowl and at times even a punch bowl.  It's really the most flexible kitchen dish I have and I always find a use for it.It's heavy

I received a notice from the vendor that this is a unit that has been wired incorrectly and must NOT be used. It did work according to their description but I've lowered my rating to discourage attempts to purchase.  Once corrected, I'll change my rating accordinglyI love this power strip.Here's the things I like:1. it's got a long cord (6 ft)2. It's got intelligent USB charging so you don't have to worry about which plug you're in. But it is best to get the higher power hogs on that first 2.4 plug.3. It's fire proof.4. Securely fits all plugs5. Its fire proof6. Shuts down at 1250W for protection.Cons:  I like it when the red button lights up when it's on. But it does have a led blue light in the middle but it just looks "off"I would have liked to see  all the USB plugs go up to 2.4 because if it's intelligent technology it will know what needs what.None of my cons will count as star removals because those aren't "Mistakes" they are just wishes on my part and don't take away from the very effective and compact power strip that it is.  Even the plugs are spaced consciously to give good room for transformer type box plugs.***I received this for free in exchange for the review"

I simply love these batteries, the entire line!  Seems pricey at first but when you see how long they keep their charge and how fast they recharge you also realize you're saving money in the long run.  I just added the 9v to my collection because every time I hear that chirp from the smoke detector i cringe in anticipation of 1. the hunt to find the guilty detector, 2, the insanity of figuring out how to get the battery out and 3. Doing it again in two months.These batteries come fully charged and keep 85% of the charge in a year of storage.

This review combines the Wall Mount Purelux Standard Adjustable Replacement Shower Arm Mount Chrome finish and shower head Purelux Contemporary Design 3 Function Replacement Handheld Shower Head with Massage Function, ChromeI desperately needed an new shower head for the main guest bathroom because the one in there was just coming out like a dribble.** I was offered this in exchange for a review**  and I happily accepted.  The first thing to understand is at this writing they come in Three different orders that will soon be offered in the same package (if I understood correctly) I didn't consider this as part of my review decision, as the distributer told me about this in advance.The shower head is lightweight and has a face that is Porcelain white (it's not porcelain but a hard plastic). The head has a very east to turn dial for wide, small and wide, just small  (they call it massage because it comes out strong").  Installation was crazy easy. No tools needed and they provided the plumbers tape ( gotta respect that).  My water pressure came out beautifully. Strong, wide or both and the sprayer handle fits snugly in the holder- in fact, it's a little too snug to easily pull out but not anything for concern unless you are vertically challenged like me. Tip toes in the shower could not bode well so be careful.It also comes with a water saver washer if you want to be extra water conservative. Another nice touch.For the price point of all three parts for under $30 I think it's a straight up great value and the choice I would make if this were something I need for any bathroom.  So far it's only available in silver (chrome).For ease of use, great stream of water, and great value I'm 5 staring this.

It's hard to knock the price but what makes something that is inexpensive a real bargain is when it really works; unfortunately , this lens hood has trouble doesn't. The instructions come as little square pictures that took me a while to understand.  It also took me a while to figure out that there are 3 parts to this hood: the Screw-nut and the adaptor base  and the lens hood. It took a while to understand that they want to dismantle all three.Then you are put them back together and place on camera's lens. When I get the hood on the lens is doesn't fit well. I posted pictures of the sides leaking light. They also said that the lens cap would fit at the end and mine wouldn't, it just could find something to latch onto.I know there are people that can make this work and it's too much of a pain (the last time I went to take it off the lens came with it). It IS a worthy effort and great price point but not much "not an exact fit.

These guys are "the bomb" and they look like one too. It's really hard to imagine how big they are so I tried to put it in my pictures. I needed mine to seal outdoor cables for my surveillance camera.  When the package of 4 arrived I was kind of shocked at how large they were but if my cables are protected, all the better. I did combine my attempts at water proofing with this silicone tape Professional Weatherproof Self-Bonding Silicone Sealing Tape for Coax Connectors / Antennas (1.5" x 15' roll) and then opened the Safety Sealer and placed the cords in the middle and used their black tray inside for stability.  It's like you close the two capsules together and lock them in with the last latch.They are going to work just fine and yes, they're big but important for big plugs.  The only real con in my eyes is the name, "Extension Cord Safety Seal" etc.  This is so much more than for extension cords but I can see that as being a functional application.  But why not something like "Waterproof Cord Capsule"  I passed buying this up because the application seemed so specific. But it doesn't loose a star for that. I bought 5 and will put them to good use.

This is an amazing product and I was surprised that this wasn't recommended more enthusiastically at my local hardware store when I asked for Water Proof tape.  My surveillance camera went out!  It took me a bit to trace the problem to a rusted out connection. I replaced the wire on the rusted side and wanted to wrap it in water proof tape - if there was such a thing (you would think there wasn't with the answers I received at the hardware store).  When this tape arrived I was stumped by the lack of adhesion. No sticky stuff anywhere. One reviewer explained that you roll it on itself while stretching it pretty taut. Sure enough, there is a beautiful "Stick to itself" process that occurs and it stays tight and I read that I eventually bonds to itself.I wrapped my two cables effortlessly and could just look and tell it was sealed tight (see pictcure).  What's even cooler is the camera picture instantly improved. I tucked this inside Hot Headz Extension Cord Safety Seal Water Resistant Cord Cover, 8.25 x 3 x 3-Inch, Green and am fully confident that I'm waterproof!!

2:41 Mins Although this has some -- but limited directions, it's pretty intuitive to figure out.  It slides and locks into your CD player which will still play (but don't hit the eject button while the Ipow is in position).  My iPhone 6 Plus (the big one) fit in with no problem and I was able to at a glance, see a map or see what song was playing.You're essentially putting the thin slotted side into the same slot the CD would be inserted. Of Course the usefulness of this gadget for you would be if your car even has a cd built in.  Everything about it was perfect for me due to space restrictions of a Mini Cooper but a friend of mine who doesn't like anything, recommended that I get this because of my constant complaining about where to place my phone while driving.This doesn't block anything  else in my car (like the ones that clip to a vent). I'm new to professional photography and the deeper I go, the deeper I fall in love. I was talking to a Photographer/Friend. She asked me why I had a UV filter on my Canon 60d and I explained that it was to protect the lens when I was out on a shoot for my instructor (finally found someone to tutor me at home).  She Pfft'd that and said, "What you need is a Polarized Lens and if you are going to use a UV filter get a good one not one that costs $10."  Weeks later I show her this polarized from B+W and she said, "You just got the best!"We went outside so she could show me some tips. I have wanted to get a good picture of the birds eating from the feeder but when I go outside to take a picture the glare from the window just destroys it.  I was explaining to her that adjusting the f-stop and shutter speeds are not natural for me yet and I lose a lot of shots. She had me aim the camera at my feeder with glaring glass and all and she turned the lens and I was blown away. I mean I scared away every animal within a mile over the excitement of watching this glare disappear.The idea behind "polarization" is that when light is reflecting off of smooth or highly reflective surfaces tends to create a haze or "glare" because the light is "polarized horizontally" as opposed to normal light reflection which is essentially more "scattered" and allows us to see dimensions.  A polarized lens blocks horizontal glare and allows you to see more depth or what's "behind the glare".This makes these lenses great for highly reflective surfaces where glare is created. They have a turning ability to help you find the perfect amount of blockage for the most realistic or clear picture.I tossed the UV lens because after feeling the quality of this one I wanted to work with a better quality one. I'm going to get this one B+W 67mm XS-Pro Clear UV Haze with Multi-Resistant Nano Coating (010M) as soon as I master my polarized one. That way I can really see the difference of what they do. So I'm very happy and want to get one for all my lenses. I don't think you will regret the upgrade in picture quality and the improved ability to shoot in low light. B+W has a strong and well deserved reputation for knowledge and quality.

I'm a strong supporter of Raw Food for my two boys. they've been on it most of their lives. Before we got one of them he was just a year old an they fed him on cheap cat food kibble. So in his heart, he has a hankering for dry food. I've managed to quell the urges by grinding up his hard food and putting it as a  topping on he wet raw stuff, it does excite him.Now in my research I found that many theories support the idea that grains are not easy for cats because they don't have the digestive capabilities to break them down, resulting in bloating. I had overlooked that this bag had rice. So in an attempt to give a fair review I ground some up for the boys and they LOVED it but there was a distinct difference in their energy levels.  I think it was the rice but it could've been the new diet in general.  So it looks like this small shaped kibble is  fun and easy to eat. Yeah, rice is the only complaint I have regarding this product that has an amazing amount of  really good food, but it's a big issue for me because of my concerns regarding grains.  So if you already are giving your cat raw food, this stuff is off the charts healthier than most you've tried so give it to them in peace.

1:59 Mins The reviewers here have done a great job of explaining how these work so I'm just adding mine as a solid endorsement for a very useful product done in a very solid way. Brass is key!  Though looking down the brass chambers it does reveal a bit of white that could be PVC or other kind of plastic. Only time will tell.It is remarkably easy to install, I really did use one hand so I could hold the camera (too hilly for tripod).  First time install was flawless, (when does that happen?).So, Love it!  If you need a split valve, you'll appreciate the quality and the price.*** Received Free Sample in exchange for the review***

4:18 Mins My roommate has the Bose Wave 1. Which honestly looks no different than this one with the exception of the touch top (but between us, I think this one sounds better).There is virtually NO set up. It plugs in, you set the clock with the remote and enjoy radio or cd's. The bass is lush and the mid-tones are clear, and we played it during a party and people kept commenting about the sound but they could find the source which was on top of the fridge.I know the cd thing will have to be addressed at some point as we move beyond the digital era but I like "burning" special songs and moods onto cd's so I can be selective (cd's were like the first digital playlists). It looks like there is an adapter you can purchase for bluetooth so you may be able to connect your phone or sound device and have access to your play lists etc, Now that would have been a cool feature to include, alas.  Bose 727012-1300 Bluetooth Audio AdapterThe radio signal without help from an antennae was phenomenal and I live in the country. The Bose displays the message of who the artist is and the song they are playing.I do feel that this machine has been around a long time and some design tweaks are probably in order, but for me (probably JUST me), it provides exactly what I want for a bedroom alarm clock.  If you have the extra dough and need a beautiful sound machine somewhere in your house, this could be the ticket. (Bose is known for excellent customer service).  Hope whatever you decide, brings you an unburdened experience.

I'm not saying this in a disrespectful way but I've never had luck using products from Google. Especially online software. They seem to be made for people with a good understanding of how things work online - and if you have a problem, you Google it and cross your fingers you find it. So trying out this router had me quite dubious of it being as easy as they said it was.  But seriously, OMG!I've had an ongoing battle with Century Link DSL because it is the only company I can get out here in the country. But the speed is abysmal and the money I have spent to fix that or at least enhance it was more than the cost of a year of service. so the fastest speed we could get was 7mbps (Paying for 20 - perhaps in the hopes that some anomaly would come along and fix it, but no luck).I've learned to live with 7mbps but I ache when my friends talk about their speeds.  So I get the Google Hub for testing and download the app for setup, I'm told to plug in the power, plug in the ethernet cable to the modem  and it started updating the software, telling me every step of the way on my phone what phase they are on.  It lit up and the app told me we were ready after we name the network and give it a password.My roommate lives two stories below me so I asked him to try it.  Now he as accepted 7mbps as "what is" and uses it contently. His Zen-like acceptance drives me nuts but I get it.  15mbps!!!!  He lit up like it can't be true.  15mbps for realz- two stories below where the router is.We tested everything in the house from laptops to tablets, taking them outside on the deck.  Here's the funny thing, I had talked to C.L. about adding another modem and separate wiring in the lower part of the house, it was going to cost me $400 installation and 179 extra per month. I called to cancel and she wanted to know why, so I told her. She went to look at it and said she knows 5 people that could benefit from it.  And I know at least 50.So, I bow to you with a sincere apology, Google for presuming that you couldn't do.  You Did it!  And I am grateful for that.

This is listed a the #1 best seller on Amazon as of this writing (Sept 2015) and I can easily see why. A box arrives with a carrying case, two Tripods, two folded Softboxes (folded like an umbrella) and two HUGE 85w CFL 6500k Bulbs (huge).Setting up the tripods was easy enough and putting the softboxes on them was too, BUT figuring out how to firm up the softboxes was a little tougher (I didn't mention that there were NO directions came with the kit).What you do is: 'act" like you are going to screw in the lightbulb. You will see a ring that is elevated above the socket for the lightbulb - Push it (the ring) towards the socket and it locks in place and firms everything up. Really nicely.Put the bulb in and look in the softbox bag for a diffuser which will be a tiny folded cloth that opens big and fits perfectly over the softbox - be sure to match all the velcro strips.The price gives it the extra star that the lack of instructions took away. A fantastic addition to any portrait studio.

I"m a beginner who wants to learn the art of lighting and this book gives me goose bumps to read. The pictures set great examples of what the lighting does and what the effects we need to be looking for. I personally NEED this kind of direction because I can't tell what the problem is when I look at a picture. Like the cover of the book. It's a great shot, I know it because it's easy to look at and there is no part of me finding a flaw in it. BUT if it were a shot I took, I would wonder if the model has too much dark on her face or if  the lower part is in too much shadow. So right now, I'm relying on the pros to guide me and this book is really helping. I suspect it will be my "Go to" on lighting for a while.

After reading reviews on the plastic clamps I decided to try these by Ravelli, which so far has shown to provide a solid product at a great price.  When the box arrived it was heavy. I couldn't remember what I ordered that would weigh so much. When I saw that it was the clips I truly understood why people were saying to stay away from the plastic ones.They have a great grip and a firm pinch allows them to hold your cloth or paper backgrounds with ease.  I did think it would be nice if the made the inside of the clip Round so that it fits around the tripod pole perfectly but I am not an engineer, maybe his is the best way.A solid product and worth your investment of you are becoming (like me) are already are a photographer.

I'm really appreciating the consciousness behind the product. All Organically grown ingredients (This one is Sweet Marjoram, Ylang Ylang, Lavender, Clary Sage, Bergamot, Juniper and sweet orange).  I didn't think I would want to fill my house with it but when I put a few drops in the diffuser, I did notice an lighter tone to the day. Now, I using it everyday to invigorate the energy at home.  I admit, that some of this is possibly a Self Fulfilling Prophecy - they tell me it's for mood enhancement and I only look for that, etc., but I do see the effect on my guests and even my cats!It's a crisp almost tart scent that does give a feeling of lightness to the rooms where it is diffusing. My friend likes to put it on the soles of her feet with a little almond oil and swears by it.  But what makes it most amazing is the price - compared to the MLM brands (which are wonderful) this keeps me in stock, with greater piece of mind and a willingness to share it.

Fantastic value, great quality, more than half the cost of Canon's remote.  It comes in the Amazon Basics brown packaging and includes a velour bag and a clear set of instructions.  I am using it with my Canon EOS 60D and it's been flawless.

It's hard to be a fan of a show that will soon be gone for years but mementos like this almost feel like some kind of meager but effective consolation prize.  They are very slender and come in a plastic sleeve. The metal is lightweight and I already accidentally bent mine so shove it into your favorite book FAST. You won't feel it in your book but I honestly suspect that most people will just want to collect them and not use them. (although they do have a tassel on them through a small hole punched on the bookmark.It's fun to see "Mal" in his happy place, If you're a fan, it's kinda a must have.

This is a very retro looking mixer and a sweet idea.  Packed with 250 watts of power and a 3 year warranty it's hard to complain about - But - There is always SOMETHING.First the base is a sweet design and Oster was thoughtful enough to put suction cups as feet; and they really work.  Basically you are putting your foods to be blended into the top of the "mason jar" and pressing down to mix.  It's awesome. If you don't want to stand there and Press, you can twist it slightly to the left and lock it down. There wasn't much it wouldn't grind for me.Here's the "But" -  The "mason jars" are PLASTIC!!  And you are warned not to use the glass ones.  Such a bummer and just a teeny bit misleading when the name of the product is "Mason Jar Blender"  it's really more like "Plastic Mason Jar Imitation Blender"  but most of the power single serve blenders are made of plastic so it's not out of line.I does include a sippy straw lid so you can drink what you mixed and the jars are BPA-free.

My Sister's journey into Menopause was getting more severe. Her patience with anything was hanging by a thread.  Her hot flashes stopped her dead in her tracks, it was intolerable for her, regardless of the season, she would put the a/c  and just hover over it.  I got these for her because she was afraid of going the traditional medicine route.The results - astounding. She is a different person. No Hot flashes, Better Mood and wow. We have trusted SolaRay for years but this sealed the deal!

3:06 Mins This is a well made (sturdy) garden hose hand sprayer that feels very solid to the hold yet remains light in weight. It's smaller than the ones I usually get, which could mean a bit more push and less hand fatigue .  In the video I am going through all 8 of the spray types. My big test was to see if it could reach the bird feeder from my deck.  My previous handheld couldn't but as you'll see in the video, not a problem for this creatively named, "Garden Hose Nozzle".  It has a "Lifetime Guarantee" which was a nice touch.Turning the dials is solid and they have the written definition of the spray types clearly on the side.  The very back of the sprayer is a nob that just turns the water flow down. I was hoping it would turn it off just to have a nice double safety in case the nozzle would drip or the release of the handle dripped but less power is a good thing.Overall - a powerful little device that is easy to hold, easy to use and has 8 different patterns for most Garden and Lawn needs.

I honestly can't believe I actually bought the correct insulation strip!  It was for the inside of the door jam on the left as you leave. It was a mess in there and there was more wind coming in than there was outside. I watched a few of the Frost King Videos which were only good if they actually went to the job and showed us.They said for this to look for a long narrow slit in the existing door jam and if we saw it to get this product.  I saw it but had no idea it was made to hold this kind of product.  So I ordered it. It cam today and like a miracle (doesn't take much for me) it slid right into the slot and freakin' stayed there!!!  I cut off 4 inches at the bottom because it was longer than the door.That's it. That's really it. For the first time in a long time the thing I ordered did what I envisioned it to do. Only bad thing is now, I'll have to invest in a fan.

The first scoop I bought and reviewed was the bigger brother Rubbermaid Commercial FG9F7600CLR Bouncer Contour Scoop for Ingredient Bins, 64-Ounce, Clear a 64 Ounce scoop that I loved at first because the scoop I was using RSVP Endurance Scoop, 9 inch was simply too small. But the bigger brother was so big I didn't really have the flexibility to tilt my hand back to contain the food. Everything about it made me move slower.Enter the smaller sibling of the 64 ounce scoop (above) and we get nearly perfect for my needs. I use it to scoop the new cat litter into their Litter box (I use the Litter robot so you really just scoop stuff in and it empties the dirty stuff into the drawer below.This scoop is the perfect size for moving refills from the converted trash bin to the Litter box.  I've attached comparison pics.

Not tested on animals is what caught my attention.  I use a LOT of coconut oil for cooking, baking, face, arms and legs as well as dental care, but never have used coconut shampoo or conditioner.  Really love this product. The smell is light and it clean well. Also like that the containers and colour are gender neutral.

Being a plant based person, who watches serving sizes, I tend to take a wee bit to eat when I leave home, since I often have to wait fifteen or so minutes before meetings, or to pick up a family member or friends.  Love how well made this Joseph GoEat‚Ñ¢ product is.It's called a Joseph GoEat‚Ñ¢  Soup Bowl, but I use it for holding nuts with some small crackers, or two types of fruit, and even yogurt in the small green container and some fresh fruit in the bottom section.

Have put off buying a new iron for so long because I dislike the Teflon sole plate most have, and I wanted a smooth mirror glass stainless plate.Doing a lot of sewing, mending and simply loving the look of a fresh ironed dress, skirt, shirt, napkins etc I use an iron a lot.  And am so over the moon happy with this Black and Decker D3040 digital iron.The dry and steam setting work flawless.  The 1 2 3 steam setting is great because there are times I want a small amount of steam and times when doing velvet I want something stronger.And I love the spot steam option as well as the non skid tabs on the steam buttons. Easy water spout opening and cool to the heat handle. Beautiful quality made iron.

Was sent this to use and review. Am impressed with the quality material. construction, design, stitching. Easy to clean. And this is great on my bike and a family member who was in the hospital said it works great on a walker. So this is more of a universal, multi  use product which is great!And the black colour is gender neutral which is nice.

Pay attention to the small black glove that comes with this beautiful styling wand, because it will prevent you from burning your hand, fingers!This is an elegant styling wand and you can purchase separate attachments the lady at Nordstroms told my sister in law. Love the white with gold accents that make it beautiful looks wise.  Comes eloquently boxed.Yes, it's a tad pricey but when you factor in how fast the $20-30 ones can add up as they stop working, you will appreciate the quality of this product and that if you take good care of it, it should last you many years.

This was sent to me to use and review. This is the biggest jar of organic, virgin, cold pressed coconut oil I have ever had.Have taken it and split it up into multiple glass Mason pint jars, so that I only have one in the bathroom for face, hair and teeth, and one in the kitchen for cooking, baking at any one time. The rest of the jars are sealed tight and stored in a cold dark cabinet in another room.This is a smooth quality coconut oil. No grit or sandy bits. Appreciated the inner seal cover that you remove, because quality pure coconut oil like this will have an inner seal that prevents leaking when shipped as well as less possibility of the coconut oil going rancid which it can do is air gets in.While we use it on our skin, in our hair, for tooth care, a friend recommends it for preventing diaper rash.  Love giving shoulder massages and use a wee bit on my hands and my family and friends love the feel.

Was sent this to use and review.  Unlike other Moscow Mule 'copper' mugs this is the real deal. Heavy, heavy riveted handle, 100% copper NOT copper plated.Which showed when I poured a cold mug of 7 Up.  Immediately saw the copper ice up, and it held the cold for half an hour.  Smooth rolled top lip is the mark of quality. Cheaper faux copper Moscow Mule mugs have a cut rim.I hand wash these Krown Kitchen 100% copper Moscow Mule mugs. Comes nicely boxed with a coaster, small recipe booklet and copper polishing cloth.  Do NOT use for HOT liquids.  Do NOT use in a microwave!

Love these!  Well made, soft material, washable.  Love them not for mom and little girl but baby girl and older sister.  Would buy more than one pack of all white, all black and all dark brown, since those three colours are what we wear the most.Love that they offer these in different patterns as well as blue, orange and yellow, since I see a lot of baby girls, toddlers who wear pattern ones.  Like that the 'bow' piece has some type of wire inside so when you bend to tie it stays in place. Another reason why we wash in cold water and air dry.

Have included a photo to show how much of my face this awesome lavender/lavender sleeping eye mask covers.The lavender/lavender aroma is great and because I get horrid headaches and do not take pills to get rid of them, I always choose a remedy that is natural, which is why I chose this product to use and review.The one thing I will be doing is sewing a couple washable pillow cases for this item, so that I can keep the purple satin material clean, and so that I can have 100% cotton in a cover that will also prevent the eye mask from slipping off which did do a couple of times.

Love the traditional, clean lines, black leather strap, high quality glass cover and that one can see the internal workings. Love the crisp white background that has white pearlite mesh areas as well as dots for minutes.  Also love the clean clear polished silver accent rim, and in the internal area where the roman numerals for hour as well as hour and second hands. The only thing we did not like and do not like on any watch, is the stainless steel security clasp. It's irritating to the wrist and we removed it.

This is beautiful. Thin. Really thin. Mirror finish and so far the tiny opening that have the rubber like cover do prevent clogging issues if you have hard water which is a major plus.Easy to install and personally I think the water is fine enough to do a great job when showering while also preventing wasting water, which is important to us in this drought we are in here in California.Appreciate that they included a roll of Teflon plumbers tape which give you a leak proof seal.

WOW this is better than the Amazon photo shows.  This is NOT a wimpy citrus press.  Quality stainless steel.  Heavy but not bulky.  The silicon on he handles is a nice thickness and I appreciate that where the two edges meet when you press down to squeeze that they are flat so you get a tight press to get as much juice out of the lemons and limes you are using.  Hope they come out with a red handled one.

We backpack a lot and this is by far the BEST outdoor shower bag!  Not only does it heat water fast in the sun, but it retains heat longer than any other shower bag.Also has a good temperature gauge that shows you how hot the water inside is.  This is helpful for preventing scalding hot water when showering.Is also great for heating water for doing dishes or laundry when backpacking.  Especially in areas here in the Sierra where camp fires are not allowed and the small propane camp stoves waste valuable fuel heating water for anything aside from food.Easy wipe clean surface and folds up for easy storage.  Good price.

Unlike the Breville 800JEXL 1000-Watt Juice Fountain Elite that I paid shy $300 for, this one has a much better feed chute that takes a whole apple, whole tomato, whole pear so no need to cut apples in half. 2 speeds for maximum juice yield as well as the ability to juice softer less dense fruits and vegetables at a lower speed.  Easy to clean and unlike my Breville this one doesn't take up a lot of counter space.Love the more streamlined curved edge design too!  Very similar to the Breville 800JEXL 1000-Watt Juice Fountain Elite so why pay more when you can get this one instead?

This is a fun very basic tech toy. Be forewarned if your three to six year olds loves your Apple watch, iPad or iPhone like our two little girls do and the games and videos they can play and watch on them, this may be boring as all get out. It's also bulky for small wrists.  Bright fun colour. Comes nicely packaged.For a basic tech toy for the child who is new to tech it's a great start.

These are a nice size. Adults and children will love them. These arrived at the perfect time, since we have a major wild fire here in the Sierras and being able to hand some out to the kids and adults camping out at evacuation sites. These come in a great sealable container. And I LOVE the variety of colours.  Most of the kids liked using them as sticks rather than braclets.

Ivation is a brand I now recommend a lot!  This humidifier is neither to big or two small.  Great because you can do cool mist or warm mist, depending on the situation.  Because of wood floors, wood furniture this will be used daily to keep needed moisture in the air so the wood doesn't crack and dry out.Especially wood chairs, whose rungs can loosen in winter when the home is warmer and little humidity is in the air.  And this humidifier sure beats having to mist every wooden chair rung, table leg, or damp mop the wood floors and even the quality wood panels on the walls in some rooms.Appreciate the sturdy handle that folds down when not in use.  A few humidifiers we looked at had the indentations where your hand would fit to lift and carry, but the handle on this Ivation humidifier is easier and safer if you need to use two hands because of arthritis or because you are not as strong as you once were.Easy wipe clean surface. Easy refill design. Stable so it wont tip over.  Easy to follow instructions.

Quality polished ultra thin aluminum that is solidly built like stainless. Nice open, close feature. Soft feel in the hands.  Wipe clean with a damp cloth.Also like that with my minimalist lifestyle and Zen Danish style it has the look I appreciate.  And because I dislike big purses, this holds all the cards I need from drivers license, Costco, Starbucks, and credit and debit card. Gender neutral for male or female.Also makes me a tad more comfortable scanning my purse at the airport so my cards magnetic strips don't get messed up.

These are by far my favorite colour for swaddles.  Neutral colours are nice for boy or girl. Love the extra soft 100% light cotton that hold baby snug but wont make the baby get to hot. And in winter the cotton breathes and allows the baby to stay warm.  Like the design that allows for use in a car seat. Washes up nice and dries quickly. They say the size is for 0-3 months but one baby in our family still uses them at 4 months.  Comes in a nice box.

LOVE this  stainless steel Ivation Portable High Capacity Icemaker model. LOVE that the machine gives you two size choices, with the smallest size perfect for our sports bottles, and the ice pack we use after a hard workout and knees hurt.We live in a small house and chose a refrigerator without an ice maker because it would have cost way to much to run a water line.  So this Ivation ice maker is perfect for all our needs.And...you only make ice when you need it. So no waste! I make a batch in the morning and stick in the freezer.  It also encourages me to drink more ice water.

Was sent this to review.  Compared to the Amir¬Æ Aromatherapy Essential Oil Diffuser which is basically the same aside from being $2 cheaper, this is a good product.  If there were anything I didn't care for it would be the ripple style surface, but that is only because I prefer clean flat surfaces.  This is nice as a night light which you can select a given colour for.  We use either the white, or blue colours.

Will upload a photo later.  Love these bottles in the neutral colour best since they can be or either sex.  The blue is nice to have as an extra set or if you have two infants and want to keep their bottles with formula separate.  These are quality bottles. Already did a review for these bottles in the neutral colour.

This puts out a lot of light and the main downsize is it goes thru batteries so you do NOT want to use it for camping or any nighttime situation where you need light for 4-6 hs for 1-2 days.  Or do as we have done and invest in rechargeable batteries and a battery charger.  Highly recommend various solar powered lights that do the job and do not require the investment in batteries.

These are not only a great size but beautiful. And they are great and yes, they do come close to the way a baby breastfeeds, and as such prevent issues like gas.  While they come in pink and blue colour, I like the more neutral colour since they make a perfect baby regardless of gender.  They wash up well and reheat in a bottle warmer quickly.

Some pros and some no's.  The pro's would be the great size and  the colours which I love.  No's would be our cat tried it once and walked away and has ignored it. The ball doesn't always light up and it sticks sometimes. And... it is way to expensive!!  No way would I pay $42.96 for this and neither should you.

Am so pleased that the red silicon is a real red which matches my red iNeibo silicon spoon, ladle etc.  This is a quality food grade silicon that is thicker and not a wimpy thin product.  You want a thicker silicon with a spoon rest since a spoon rest is usually next to a hot cooking surface and may need to handle hot sticky food items which we found this silicon spoon rest could handle vs a cheaper thinner one we did the test with.

Am no great photographer so all I can say is this is a nice product and a decent price. Love that it has a nice little bag to hold the clip and the fish eye lens and macro lens and the easy to attach covers.  Easy to use!  Good price.

Am really loving this book!  It  is part Tom Clancy, part Ian Fleming and part Stephen Ambrose and will hold your attention. Never knew the AFL CIO had folks in Russia after the fall of the Soviet Union or how perfect the title is since he has such elements as the term Czar or Tzar in Latin which  denotes.Emperor in the European medieval  meaning or in modern terms a benevolent dictator.  And lately one hears (in the states) that Donald Trump is of the same mindset.

Have a few of these and they work well.  Being off grid we use a lot of solar items and even have two of these with us in the car in the back area where the solar pads get sun all the time so that if we need to use them at night for some reason we have needed light. Have even taken four with us when camping for solar light in the evening.  They give off as much light as one of our Coleman fuel lanterns. Love that these actually came with the screws needed for installing on the side of our cottage

WOW this is a bigger bulb than I imagined. Looks like a piece of art and a bulb you do not want to hide.  Have an art deco lamp that we will use it in.  Give off lovely light and is a tad pricey but if it lasts a long time well worth it.

3:58 Mins First off, you have three color options with this so explore a little if you want. I personally like the blue and would choose it again, but the other options also look appealing. Also note that this uses 18650 batteries and comes with two. Please review the instructions, specifically those involving the removal of plastic, before use.When it comes to the GRDE 2000 Lumens Headlamp, I like the options it has and the brightness it touts, plus the design wears comfortably and is easy to use.For settings, you have a bright, dim, and flashing light, and the lamp has a zoom feature that you can easily maneuver. The button on this is easy to find no matter how dark it is or if you are wearing it or not, and I find that very appealing. I also like the light on the back because it allows another person with you to see where you are whenever, which makes things easier when filming or stopping. We sometimes go exploring and we also check out older homes, and anything that helps you keep up with your fellow explorers is welcome in my opinion. Were you to drop this, you could also see it were the front light obscured.When it comes to comfort, this adjusts easily and it feels good, with the back fitting comfortably and the front contouring to your head. The straps feel good as well, which is important when you are out for an extended duration because the last thing you want to worry about is if the headlamp strap is fitting well, if it is breathable, and so on.I note something on waterproofing in the video, and again consider this water resistant. I am not willing to submerge it to try that out because I do not want to destroy something I consider extremely useful. It is designed will good sealing and would hold up in some unfriendly conditions regardless.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and that the opinions are my own.

1:55 Mins The SADES Gaming Headphone Cradle combines design aesthetics, functionality, and a simple design to give you something you really do need when it comes to your gaming setups.When this arrives, it comes with 5 pieces that easily snap together and can be assembled within a few short minutes to give you both design and safety considerations. I like the fact that the mount is long so you do not have to worry about your headphones touching the base, that the top is padded so you do not have any excess rubbing or wear on your headset, and the fact that it has the double tower design so you can run a cord around or through it depending on what you want.I also like the coloration and how the plastic designs allow lighting to pass through the red, highlighting your headset. This does not need to be limited to gaming, either, and could easily hang any other type of headset you have. You also do not have to worry about sizing constraints because you are simply hooking this on something and draping it down, so it accommodates a number of designs. The lack of overthinking in the simplistic design also gives you durability and extended lifetime, which is great for either yourself or other gamers/music lovers/etc in your life.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes. I am both a gamer and a music lover and I know how much time/effort we put into finding the right sets, so I really do see the need for something like this.

After seeing a few reviews for the pocket chainsaw, I  thought checking one out would be interesting and am really glad I did. There are quite a few uses for this that would allow use around the home cutting down debris, camping and setting up or cutting firewood, survival uses, kayaking and tying off, and much more.Basically, we are talking something that reminds me of a chainsaw blade connected by two handles with metallic connectors, so you have a very solid blade you can use with a comfortable handle you can easily manipulate. I like how easy it is to get started and how responsive it is, plus I was really surprised by just how easily it cut. I am not sure what I expected but I do know I expected my hands to hurt, and I am glad to find out that the straps fit comfortably and kept the effort from causing any discomfort.This comes with a carrying case, too, so you can easily store and retrieve it. This makes it good to stick in survival packs, to store in a kayak, or whatever you are carrying with you.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes.

2:03 Mins These 3-in-1 pliers are made well and pack plenty of functionality within their spring-loaded grips, making them the perfect tool to meet so many of your fishing needs. Looking at the non-slip handles, for example, you can see how aesthetics and functionality mesh to make an attractive-yet-functional item you can keep with you in the supplied carrying pouch. They are lightweight as well and add everything from cutting, line pulling, hook removing, sawing, and much more, allowing you to eliminate quite a few items when packing for your next fishing expedition.Please note these were supplied for sampling and that this does not impact review rating.

2:59 Mins Lately, we have been fishing for Gar a lot, and this is something that is not only nice to have but is also essential. Basically, you are adding a buffer between teeth and your fingertips, which is really nice to have considering something like a Gar is armored, thick, and has no qualms taking a little something back to the depths with it. Unlike simply using pliers and trying to guide a catch with the line, you have control over what goes on as well, meaning you are more likely to keep what you catch and do so safely.There are 4 different types of Gripper here, so check the specs for the model that best fits your needs.You have a good design, a build that is resistant to rusting, and a good spring that will last a while. You also have something that is easy-to-use with one hand, which is absolutely essential when you are trying to bring in something with one hand and trying to hold on with the other. The wrist strap helps with that, too; the first time I was using this, I had a fish struggle and knock this out of my hand, but luckily the guard caught the Gripper and the boat caught the fish.Please note this was provided for sampling purposes and has been fishing three times now.

4:28 Mins The Ivation E10 safe is a very good model for home use, with an easy-to-understand, simple-to-use design that makes it perfect for all types of users. To note, the E15 model is much the same except it comes with a 10-button setup instead of the E10s 4, which makes them great for anyone wanting a safe.When you first pick this up, you will notice a lock in the front for a key. Open your safe, insert batteries, and follow the instructions on how to set up fingerprints and the key reader. The default is 1-2-3-4 so it is easy to access at first, so you will want to change this as soon as you put the batteries inside.Something I found really great about the E10 is that it works. The biometric safe actually does read fingerprints and it does it well, so there is no real slipping up. Since you have 30 plus fingerprints that can be added, you can add multiple readings of your main fingers in case you hurriedly need to access it. I think this is a good idea and the sheer amount of reads allows me and my wife to put our fingers on it, plus more.As far as room goes, this will hold 4 pistols inside to give you an idea for room, or more if you want to remove the interior shelf. I placed a .38 in it for reviewing purposes because I like to see something in use, and you can see just how much room there is inside.For mounting, the safe is set up where you can mount it different ways, and it is thick enough to make anyone feel secure while also being small enough to put in a closet if you want or even sit it close to your bed. That is how I am using it; I wanted something to keep my firearm close to my bed, but I want to keep that well away from my child. This allows me both, plus it is easy to open so I can get inside quickly.Please note this was provided for sampling purposes and is very utilitarian. I am VERY pleased with it.

3:58 Mins The Ivation Adjustable Portable Computer Desk with USB-powered fans is awesome because it literally works as a laptop stand, a table, and more depending on your needs. I currently have mine set up in my computer room with a computer processing video atop it, and the video has it sitting with a game on because I was playing it right before the video.Positives for this include:-A good make, with solid construction-Easy adjustment, with degree markers to let you know about precise situation-Three levels of adjustment, making it good for multiple settings-Stable-Solid fan design-Easy controls-Attachable mouse clip (with an attachment on the other side of additionsThis is also an Ivation product, and I own quite a few of them and have had great luck with them. I personally feel they are one of the companies adding variety when it comes to almost anything, and I have been impressed with everything from ice makers and headphones to this, a gun cabinet, and more.Please note this was supplied for sampling and that this does not impact review rating. I love my items and will not hook up anything inferior.

When I was a new parent, I recall one of the most frightening things I faced was the fear of not knowing and feeling like I simply was not there. Aside from trying to grow accustomed to my child being in their crib, one of the worst times for me was when my child was in their car seat facing away, because I could not see nor comfort them. They would sometimes respond to that as well by crying, because they wanted to see me or simply know that someone else was around. Even if they were calm, I personally wanted to know what they were up to, if they were playing or being silent because of that sneaky way kids can be when they find something they should not have, and that made things difficult.The first baby car mirror I tried out was one of those items that was really small and pretty much only showed me the baby's eyes, and I found that neither I nor the baby liked it too much. The Bable takes care of that by being large enough to allow you to see pretty much everything, and because it is concave and the design shrinks things down a little and allows you to simply see more. If you have used a fisheye lens on a camera or have seen a mirror hanging in a convenience store, you know how that works, and I personally like that because it includes not only the baby but their hands and their seat as well.Another thing I really like about the Bable is the design, with it being very lightweight and portable while also maintaining that a larger design. That works really well for me because I can place it just about anywhere and effectively move it from one vehicle to the other without having to worry about weight or construction. The strap designs make it very easy to place while also keeping it secure, and this can be moved easily as well. It also includes a pretty much shatterproof acrylic mirror, soThe Bable is constructed out of ABS material, or Acrylonitrile butadiene styrene, which you commonly find in things like keyboards because of ruggedness. ABS is noted as a stable material that does not leech toxic materials, and is found in many types of items including some Legos, high chairs, and the like. Many reputable sources have tested ABS, too, and that is a very important consideration for me.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and tested in both my Jeep and in our Caravan.

The Soundpeats M20 are a good pair of headphones with a better-than-average sound quality that tout crisper bass while still allowing good tremble and ranging, a basic microphone setup, and a nice design including a tangle-free cord. I personally like the Soundpeats designs and say that having  tried a lot of different ones, from the Q800 and other wireless types to wired ones. Added to that is the fact that I actually picked these up almost 50 days ago and they are still going strong despite not only myself using them, but also other, less-careful members of my family.Looking at design first-and-foremost, you have a good earbud design with solid connectivity to the cording, which lends itself to longevity and a lack of fraying. Fraying has been an issue I have run across with other, lower-cost headphones, and that is why I mention it at all. I also like tangle-free headphones because you can stick them in your pocket and take them out without worrying about tangling. You may have to maneuver the cord a little, but knotting pretty much does not happen and this keeps fraying down, plus it makes things like working out a lot easier. Aesthetically, I think the design compliments the wearer, with the black blending in and with smaller details like the coloration of the ends or the brand design looking nice (it is a little musical note on the end, for those who have not noticed it). Cord length is good as well, and the 3.5mm jack is well-designed and does not put pressure on the device it is hooked to or sit oddly, which is equally important when you are talking both immediate and long-term use.As far as sound goes, these have a better-than-average sound quality that is made even better at this pricing point, because most headphones here are simply bass magnifiers or cheap treble boosters. The M20s do produce some higher levels of bass, but they also produce a good vocal sound, which also compliments phone use. When testing sound, I utilize some pretty strict standards so I can compare and contrast sounds, with specific qualities such as LOSSLESS or Flac being used (or 320 if that simply is not available), plus a genre cross-referencing to see if these work with everything from pop to rap. There is also a range testing of sorts, whereby electronic music by IDI bands such as Autechre or bands such as Haujobb are used to see if the headphones pick up eclectic ranging. I know that is a lot to note, but I feel it is warranted given the fact that substandard headphones (and you would be surprised how many are lackluster) would not pick up specific sounds, leaving you missing parts of music you might not have heard all your life.With microphone use, this is a very basic design that allows you to answer calls or switch songs. This does not bother me in the least because I personally do not answer calls and listen on the same device unless I am out-and-about and running/hiking, but if you want more control, this might be something to note. The positive here is that this is not complex so you do not have to worry about having to stop everything and drop off to answer a call, and the omnidirectional microphone type is a standard across many providers.Other specs, according to the product description: "mylar thickness I 6 an normal impedance is 1 Amp¬±20% at 1 kHz And normal power rating is 3mw. The maximum input power is 5mw. The output S.P.L: 100+_3db SPL at 1 kHz with 126mvrms input/L output difference is 3db at 1 kHz 1m. The distortion is 3% maximum, frequency response is 20-2000Hz."Note that these were supplied for sampling purposes and due to a posting issue, i ended up with these for double my normal testing timeframe. I gave them to my wife for continued use, and they have been stuck in the door of the car, in a purse, and other places I would never place them for fear of damage. They have continued to function, too, and admirably.

3:48 Mins The Sentey ThorX wired headphones are excellent headphones from a quality company that really impressed me with these. That says a lot for them.The headphones also come with a basic cord for phone use and a hard case, which is nice. 4:29 Mins The Brainwavz Kidwavz KV-100 are really good headphones for children with solid qualities including:durability of design,comfort,ease of use, andvolume limitation.I cover these in the video and think each of these merits says something on the quality of the company as well as the headphones and made me happy with their use. 3:02 Mins The Sentey Tyon LS 4205 headphones are a nice addition to jogging or working out, plus they have a solid sound so you can sit around and listen to them as well. For the pricing point, I was happy with the sound, with an above-average quality and good design. I also thought the cord removal was interesting, and I was surprised that this did not harm the sound quality in any way. Before, I had thought this might degrade it somewhat but it has not so far, and if it does I will revise the review (although I am expecting solid performance form these).When it comes to these headphones, the LS-4205s have an in-ear, looping type of fit, whereby you place the earbud and then contort the cord to fit. I like this type of fit in sports headphones, and I can say that having tried quite a few different types. One of the good things about this fit is that the earbud sits on its own and is not forced inside, and the cord holds them in place without pressing on the ear. This works well for keeping them from slipping, and it also provides comfort for the wearer.For sound, these worked well and especially while working out/running, with the headphone sitting correctly and delivering well. The quality of calls was good, too, with the easy-to-use button basically allowing you to answer and hang up or to stop and start music. This is not a lot of functionality in the cord, but I personally do not like being bogged down when I am out.This is the 6th Sentey brand item I have tested as well, and they provide a nice sound. I am personally using the Sentey Thor X brand wired headphones for a lot now, but these have also gotten some use as of late because I like their fit and the brand.Please note these were supplied for sampling, tested for 17 days, and then considered. Sampling does not impact review rating considerations.

We have recently been introducing my daughter to the world of painting and colors while also reintroducing myself as well, and we have been using MyArtscape products to do so. The reason we have done so is because MyArtscape supplies quality paints and supplies and they do so at a very reasonable price, and they provide very positive customer responsiveness.For the MyArtscape Paint Set, you have a range of colors including Titanium White, Lemon Yellow, Yellow Ochre, Vermilion, Crimson, Sap Green, Deep Green, Violet, Cerulean Blue, Prussian Blue, Burnt Sienna, and Burnt Umber. Each comes in excellent packaging, with tubes you have to pierce the tops of so you do not have to worry about your paints being older or diluted, and each applies well and does not dilute with use. It also did not get lighter as it dried, nor were there issues with paling. I was extremely impressed by this, and I was also impressed by the amount of paint you receive because 12ml is a nice amount.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and that I really do like the brand. Their brush sets have been great with great packaging and their paints have been impressive.

5:11 Mins The Brainwavz S3 in-ear headphones have quite a few things going for them including design, functionality, aesthetics, microphone and remote use, and sound quality.To note something on the remote, please look at the video to see what functionality is included on non-IOS devices.
