Depending on what you want from a selfie stick, this might be something you would consider because of its pricing point, the ease of use, and the fact that it has been a solid performer so far. Were this released a year prior, I would have given it higher marks,  but there are better types in the field in my opinion and this is not my personal choice because of grip style and connection. For me, I prefer a grip with ridges, and I prefer a remote type of selfie stick, but that also comes with higher price considerations and a smaller level of tech confidence. That does not mean it is hard, but with this you simply plug and go.Basically, for the average user, this compact model, pricing point, and easy use would probably equate to 5-stars.For anyone wanting to know, there are basically three types of selfie sticks available at this point, with those like this one connecting via wire to the phone, others synching and having a trigger on the stick like this, and those with remotes that require synching and a remote trigger. I use the last two and a more expensive setup with a remote for action camera use, but a lot of people default between the first and second. The benefits of the first (this type) is that it plugs into your device via wire and does not need to be synched. You also do not have any interference, so nothing can interrupt your connection and you know exactly how much distance is required. The downside is that it has a wire, so it has something hooked to your phone.When it comes to design, this has an above-average to good grip and a nice compact design, which means that you can hold it well and that you can store it easily. The downside to the compacts is that they are shorter, but if you are wanting something for vacationing and the like, this would work extremely well. I especially like packing something like this because it takes up no room, and carrying becomes simple. For grip, the handle is easy to hold and the wrist strap helps, plus the cradle design adds safety for your phone. With the cradle, you can see how it is curved outward, so  the cradle holds your phone in. That means you do not have to worry about it falling out. You also have an easy-to-use charging setup, so that makes it pretty user friendly.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and that these are my opinions, as the preference notes hopefully suggest. I am not knocking this, I just encourage people to know what level of need they have and what design they like to inform their purchases.

We have a bed in our home that has the best mattress I have ever slept on attached to the worst corners imaginable, and I cannot begin to tell you the number of times I have hit my knee or cracked my hand against it while walking by. That alone is annoying enough, but our daughter just turned two and is also actively exploring her environment and that adds a lot of concern. She had some walking delays and is a little uneven when she stands, plus she is tall and I worry about her falling and hitting one of these as well as other haphazard spots. Add those elements together and these bumpers, designed for a table but equipped to handle whatever, are just what the doctor ordered.Included in the packaging here is everything you would need to secure a few surfaces, whether they be tables, the bed, or whatever. You have 8 corner guards included in the pack, as well as 16 feet of edge guard and enough 3M tape to secure your child to the floor while watching you install these if needed. You get a roll of 3M tape, which is quite a bit, plus squares of it to secure your items.When we used the set, we placed some on the #M both sides of the edges and a strip down the length of the bumper guard and they stayed in place really well. We applied bumpers the length of the foot board, both edges, the edges of an additional table, and still have a massive amount of  bumper left over. To me, that is impressive and makes me happy because I can place it on other items. I included pictures, too, noting beforehand that I am not a professional at adding things in any way and that I could have done a better job. Still, the bumper was really easy to place, situate and cut as desired, and I was really happy with that.When it comes to cushioning, this is really good as well, with enough solidity not to give or end up feeling like foam, but with enough give to buffer any falls. I mention the foam thing because that was the way some of my earlier bumper buys were, and I was extremely disappointed with them. I tested this by hitting my leg against it softly at first and then somewhat foolishly amping it up, and it did really well, making me feel good about it for both myself and my daughter.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes, and that it is in-use in my home. I take safety seriously and especially things that impact my family, so my review rating is not impacted by sampling. Also note that the pictures were taken as an afterthought, so excuse the lack of forethought and lower quality.

The Leward Portable Strip Charger is a nice, easy-to-carry charger that you can take almost anywhere, with a lightweight, portable design that makes it easy to pack, unpack, and go. It has multiple charging options with it as well, including 4 5V USB charging slots and 1 Universal Socket. It is very lightweight and has a unique design, which is interesting about this. Were a couple of things modified, I would consider it a 5-star item.When it comes to charging, you have 3 5V/1A charger ports that are good for charging most items including phones, tablets, action cameras, and more, plus a 1 5V/2.1A that is good for charging tablets and the like. I like having both because items like Li-Polymer batteries are a safety concern when they receive too much of a good thing, plus you have slots for phones and/or tablets. Each of the ports was tested by first checking functionality to see if they would (1) work and (2) power something like an individual USB-powered LED for one hour, and they did that and functioned well. I then tested them with a multimeter to check output flow, and they worked well and correctly.You also have an additional universal socket with a maximum output of 300W, and it is convenient to have something like this when travelling. I cannot easily count the number of times I have looked for a place to plug in my laptop and other items, or when I have needed to plug up some USB-related and keep my plug for my laptop handy at the same time. It works for a lot of other items, too, and really assists travel.So, why 4-stars.First, the way this wraps and unwraps is due to have issues, with the plug hooking and hinging around an adjustable plug that can be positioned in a number of ways. This seems nice until you not how difficult it is adjustable because of a u-shaped restraint, and you think og how easily it would be to break that off were you to push it too hard or hit it when travelling. I have been careful with it so far and have not had that issue, but I figure this could happen pretty easily.Second, the cord has to be manually wound and I think that is a little mental. It is also held into place with the plug and its positioning, too, so were the plug to break, it would not secure easily. Again, this has not happened to me and I am deducting only because i think it could be designed smarter, but I would deduct more were this to break off and cause issues.Third, the bottom of the universal plug is wide open and could end up with something in it. I have taken to fixing this by using a child's safety plug cover, but I could see something small getting wedged in there and causing a blockage or something worse, depending on the circumstances.Fourth, the upper slot covers on the universal plug are difficult to manipulate, which can be trying. The first time I plugged something in, I honestly thought I was doing something wrong because of the resistance. That could end up being a pro, too, because this might cause the piece to  last longer and no wear down as quickly.All-in-all, I find this a good product and think, were these suggestions remedied, they would have a great product to use.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and was tested over a 14 day period, to give an example of time frame.

I want to note a few things about this:First, the pictures seem to give the false impression that there is a stand included. Unless the item I received is different, it only includes the Ocarina.Second, this has a white base with gloss blue paint covering it and a tiny Triforce painted on top of this. I think the product pictures do a great job showcasing the paint job on this, and it looks good. I also like how it handles and how it sounds, so it is something you can display or tinker with.The Ocarina has a decent size and weight to it; both my wife and I can handle and play it pretty well, and I can even do a few small tunes with it.With regard to songs, you have an instruction booklet included with the Ocarina that has some specific lines from the game and songs you can goof off with, including Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star, Happy Birthday, Mary Had A Little Lamb, and Auld Lang Style. I personally was glad these were included here because it gives me a feel for how the item is supposed to be used and how it is supposed to sound, and the instructions do a good job showing what holes on the Ocarina need to be covered and how breathing is spaced.For play, you position the mouthpiece with the Triforce facing up, making certain not to block the "sound hole," as the instructions laughably call it. You position a thumb over one of the two holes on the bottom and you position two fingers from each hand on the holes on the top. Depending on the song, you meter your breaths and move your fingers and the sound reminds me of a recorder as a kid.It is easy to play and fun to goof off with; in less than five tries, I had Twinkle Twinkle down somewhat and I was goofing off. Someone feeling motivated could have a lot of fun, and the tinkerer can, too.Please note that this was supplied for sampling purposes.

Looking at pictures of this pillow, I was unsure what to truly think about it. I mean, one reviewer noted how it looked like a tapeworm head, and to me it looks a little like a plush reimagining of Gypsy from MST3K. I also did not know what I thought about sticking my head into it for napping, and I almost passed on this. Still, I was intrigued somewhat and do have problems sleeping without something covering my eyes, so I wondered what was the worst thing it could do. Weirdly, this worked out well, just not in the way I expected.First thing, I am unsure I if could actually sleep sitting up at a desk, and my workplace has a VERY strict no-napping policy besides. I tried sitting at my computer desk at home with this on, and I could see sleeping with covering my head provided I was exceptionally tired. That says a lot about the comfort of this to me, because anything you slip on the way these are advertised has to be comfortable in order to use. You slide it on over your neck and can rest your hands in the top holes with your mouth and nose facing out, with a pose that reminds me of sleeping at a school desk. And the beaded padding feels really good against your skin, to the point where I actually liked that and use this as a neck pillow when just sitting aorund. Where that REALLY works for me is when travelling, though, and especially if I am tired and need to nap when riding.When I ride, I always feel sick if I try to nap and I have weird dreams of motion. The light mingles with moving features and I imagine road on pavement and it makes me feel really, really bad. I have tried masks and covering my head with a blanket, but getting hot is really problematic, and i hate taking medication to ride. That is where this helps out, because it is soft and comfortable, blocks light, and it allows me to breathe.The Leward slips on easily and it fits well; the neck seems constricting when you are slipping your head inside and especially that first time, but afterward it fits comfortably and makes a reasonable amount of space for your nose and mouth. I could put on a sleep mask inside this if I wanted to as well, which works out good. You can rest your head against the window or lean back and get comfortable, or you could lean your head forward and put your hands in if so inclined. The material breaths, as I mentioned before, and the make is really comfortable.When not using this, I sometimes place it on my bed and use it as a cup holder, too, and it interestingly provides a pretty stable platform.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and that I tested it for a period of 10 days before reviewing. I tried it out on one car ride and actually napped with it, which says a LOT for me. Note this is made for an adult, too, and while it might fit a child, I would handle with care around them because they can get inside and put their arms in, too, and could get stuck or worse.

6:13 Mins Apologies for any video quality issues beforehand. Current Amazon standards dictate that videos have to be under 100MB, so quality is normally compressed from 1080P to Medium Quality WM. Also, the review page currently lists these as white, but the products sampled here are black, as shown in the video.The Sentey Orbeat GS-4440 Gaming Headset is part of the Sentey Elite Gaming Headset line and is currently my favored headset for specific features. Comparing these to the Artix, you basically have a couple of spec differences, plugging differences, microphone design differences, and control distinctions. They are both nice headphones, however, and they both have distinct differences that make them viable headset choices.With regard to the Orbeat design, you have an outer framing that is sturdy and allows the rest of the design to fit a variety of heads, which is something I really like. Otherwise, you end up trying to find something to fit and everyone sees it differently depending on the size of their melon. You have an adjustable band that contours to the top of your head in a way that feels good and uses padding without going overboard, and you have proper ear padding so your ears are cradled, so you hear everything but the sound does not leak out, and so you are comfortable.For interface, you have a USB port and an audio and mic port, with the USB basically functioning for light control. I like this setup and think it does well, plus the abundantly lengthy cord helps with mobility and avoiding those fiascoes that get your social media acclaim for all the unwanted reasons.As far as controls go, they are all located on the cord. This is different than the Artix and is something I like, BUT there are times when I prefer one to the other or vice-versa. The control are easy to to use and include lighting options for the exterior, a control for the microphone, and volume controls. This does not come with vibration controls, so if that is a feature you want, the Artix has it.The microphone design is nice here, too, because you can adjust it to your desired positioning. This can come with a con depending on how close you adjust it to your face, so make sure to position it accordingly. With regard to the microphone, you have a lighting element attached to this that can be turned on or off, and I REALLY like that option. Otherwise, I get distracted by the lighting and it ends up getting me killed.The exterior areas around the ears glows as well, and the glowing is nice without being distracting. I like that about these because the glow does not distract others around me unless I really make it distract them, the color is nice and noticeable, and I can control whether it is on or off.Sound-wise, these are pretty nice sounding. I have used them for matches and for watching videos on social media, and the vocal use and range is pretty good. I do not mean that for music, mind you, but the things you normally consider for music are not the things you are considering for a gaming headset.Other specs include:( The Artix weigh in 385g, Mic sensitivity is listed at -46, and speakers at 107dB)Mic / Impedance ‚â§2,2 KŒ© / / Sensitivity -47dB±3dBSpeakers with 40mm Drive Diameter / 32Œ© Impedance / 10mw Rate Power / 20Hz~20KHz Frequency Response / ‚â•-60dB Signal to Noise Ratio 2% T.H.D / 92dB¬±3dB Sensitivity (S.P.L)Weight 350gPlease note that these were supplied for sampling purposes and that any opinions are my own.

4:08 Mins After 4 weeks of testing, I feel really good about the Enpassion LED Submarine Light.It is bright, waterproof, is mountable, and come with a number of useful items including a solid case, two battery options including an 18650 battery and a single charger, and the flashlight itself. The Enpassion Submarine Light works for underwater use, nighttime use, and emergency situations and the fact that the rechargeable battery lasts a long time makes me feel good about adding it to a car or taking it out for camping, diving, and otherwise. Since it is sealed very well, you do not have to worry about water damage, and underwater use is something that I tested by first submerging this and then using it to backlight underwater filming with a Dazzne P2 action camera.This uses a rechargeable battery and supplies a charger, and requires 3AAA IF you feel like you want some other option for some reason, like the battery goes dead and you have 3AAA sitting around and no 18650.Note this was supplied for sampling purposes. I have had this for 4 weeks and put it through a lot of abuse, which it held up well to.

2:33 Mins I like novelty items, and when I was offered this Fashion Badge to try out, I kind of jumped at the opportunity. It is kind of funny in a way, too, because I really did not know what it was until I received the item. (This is currently a little under 11 dollars, to note).What you have here is a Micro-SD USB music player. It has some basic features including stop/play, forward and back, as well as volume up and down. You also have a power button, a USB charging slot, and a Micro-SD slot capable of using up to a 32GB card. Now, you end up playing tracks in order each time it turns on and off, so I would recommend using a smaller card, but you could carry around a huge tracklist if you so desired.Something that surprised me was the sound quality associated with these. Now, I am NOT saying these are something I would turn to for music, but for a kid or for novelty, it is great because it can be used. I honestly think that it sounds much better than the lower pricing point MP4 players I have seen recently, and that makes me kind of happy. NOTE that this do not come with headphones.I will be using this as a gift in conjunction with some kid-friendly headphones, because they will be enjoyed by those around as well as my child. The Micro-SD card stays in well so you do not have to worry about it popping out accidentally, and there are few items that can be damaged on it.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and that this was rated as a novelty with some uses but as something I found entertaining.

The Zing Toy Legends Pop Gun is an interestingly fun throwback that reminds me of playing when I was younger. We would go outside and run around, reenacting scenes from our Wild West stories, when items like these were more readily available.The item itself is fairly simple; it is constructed completely out of plastic, with most of the frame made from one solid piece and the barrel being a moving piece, with a red cap on the end of the Zing Pop Gun. To use, you place the red cap in the end of the gun, press it down, and then pull down on the barrel of the gun. The resulting action will cause the end to "pop" out and hang via string, so it can be reloaded and utilized again and again. The process takes seconds, too, so there is no delay in playing with this.

What you need for operation aside from this is simple, too. You require:(1) A phone.(2) A VR application.(3) Headphones. Headphones are optional, but the experience is better with headphones.Suggested apps to test: (I'm prone to horror, so...) Sisters, Chair in a Room.With regard to phone, I want to note that I tested this with a Samsung GS5. Many, many other phone types are listed and the basic requirement settles on screen size, with 3.5-to-6" screens working with this. I am going to eventually test this with a 4K screen and see the difference in presentation quality, but the S5 was pretty awesome.When it comes to applications, there are a lot of VR ones out there. The product page here notes that there are over 300, and I could well believe that. More importantly, there are loads of free ones to goof off with, so your item is not simply a novelty. You can find split screen applications, which help with tuning the device, and other types you can goof off with including classics and more. The first thing I tried was a roller coaster, and the second was a haunted house, both of which were interesting. I really enjoyed the immerse experience added with some of the horror games out there, and the fact that you can turn and look around is kind of freaky sometimes.The addition of the remote "joystick" was interesting, and this became easier to use with time. It has a few dedicated buttons but the size was my issue; still, the overall impact it had was really impressive. Now, the testing product did not come with NFC, but it was noted that NFC will come with the finalized product, so that was not deducted but I felt needed to be noted in this review.Headphones, in my opinion, add to the immersion as well, and I really enjoyed their addition. You do not have to have them and they do not come with the set, but they are fun to have included. The fact that the set allows them to be plugged in is a great thing, too, and speaks highly of this setup.Operation of this is really easy, although the instructions actually work against rather than with you. If you really think about what the pictures and instructions are saying you will figure the use out, but I personally think some updates should be added to make that portion more user-friendly. That does not impact actual use, however, so I am not deducting anything for non-concise instructions. If I did, half our modern products would never make a good grade.What you do is open the VR goggles by folding the area in the front down. This does so easily and reveals the mounting inside. You had an adjustable bracket that grips the phone from the top and bottom, and it holds pretty well. I think the thing should have included a lock on the front as well but it holds pretty nicely, just keep an eye out if you get too involved or you give it to a kid who moves around a lot. You have adjustment knobs on both sides and an adjustment allowing you to move it back and forth, which really works wonders. I am farsighted and wear glasses, too, but I could use them (without my glasses on) perfectly. You can then adjust the three straps that are situated via velcro, which is a great setup for that.I also like having a chair that can turn all the way around, so I do not have to explore while standing because that can be disorienting and especially in horror. Since the environment is so overwhelming, you might also want to avoid friends that could try and prank scare you as well.Overall, I loved using these and still play with them. My family has loved them as well, and we had a lot of fun getting together and goofing off while playing. It added a lot of interesting "o my god" moments to family time, and I have to say I liked that a lot.Please note these were supplied for sampling purposes. They were tested for weeks and over dozens of applications, plus I have been testing this with other remote items. I really like them, too.

I am torn on this product because of its smell.The coconut smell is something that I identify in association with something like activator, and since I do not like heavy scents, this seems overpowering to me. Were the product solely for me or were it not good at tending damaged and frayed hair, I would have rated it lower than a 3-star for the smell. The results it offered for my wife have been great, however, and she notes liking the product despite its smell. I do want to note the despite, and say that this can be construed as a positive because, despite the smell, it works well enough that I want to continue use. Still, that is around a 3 to me for family and my wife's experience .The Luseta set comes with two large bottles of product, which is nice for those with short hair because it will last forever or for those with longer hair because they tend to mow through product quickly. Something else that helps is the design of the pump, because the bottle seals pretty well and the pump dishes out enough product without overuse. Something that did throw me off was that the bottles look the same in the shower, though, and that can be somewhat confusing. We normally avoid issues with something like this through placement, but since this is a new product, there has been a little confusion here and there.Hopefully the smell will be changed in the future because it really is strong. Were that switched out, this would easily rank 4 or 5 stars, and the usefulness of it can rate it that way for people not bothered by strong scents.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes. Hopefully the scoring here and in other reviews shows that sampling does not impact review rating.

I really disliked this product and felt that it was flimsy and did not sport the added protection/ recovery options that individuals like Brett Favre note during advertisement. This was supplied for sampling and I have numerous problems with my knees, and I ended up leaving this to collect dust and was not impressed at all.I am not going to spend a lot of time on reviewing this item, but I will say that my cons are as follows:(1) Fit - When it comes to fit, I thought that this constricted too much to provide the necessary comfort for recovery and that it restricted range-of-motion. When I would try to flex my knee, for example, I found that it would cut in and that I was much more inhibited than without it. That is a very frustrating feeling when you consider the fact that you are already dealing with pain and that this is not supposed to increase your discomfort. I have seen individuals claim that this is partially due to sizing, and some people may not size correctly. I had a good size for my leg, however, and have a thin, bony leg as-is. for this to be uncomfortable for me says a lot on the way it wears.(2) Assistance - It did nothing for my pain. When you take that into account, I think that say a lot by itself and a lot on what properties a product like this touts.(3) Material - Overall, the material was flimsy and especially considering what other products add to the equation. I have other assistance devices and this did not compare to them in the least.Again, this product was supplied for review considerations and these are my own opinions. Others tout this working for them, but I honestly feel it is a fad at best and would turn elsewhere.

My wife likes this item for driving and I like it somewhat, and I much prefer the HD yellow visor to the shaded one and tend to avoid the shaded one altogether and the HD one at night.For me, I think the differences in preference are in the way you drive and more so in the way you set, with the average-height, posture-conscious driver finding this more beneficial than someone like myself. For me, I am tall and ride with my seat arching back, and the placement of this ends up only partially coming into my field-of-vision. In the daytime, I can still use the HD visor and benefit from the magnification and light-blocking aesthetics, and enjoy it in fog. That is why I give it three-stars, because my wife likes it and I end up using it somewhat, but at night I end up not wanting it because I feel it allows headlights to stream in and out and only give me a small block for positioning.Were this larger and had an army to add to positioning, I think I would like it better and hope the makers take and modify the existing design. As it stands, I only use it somewhat and only then because I wear glasses, and think I would not at all were it not for the glasses addition.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and that the opinions are solely my own.

I picked this up for my wife to hold her purse(s)/bags when she drives, but have since taken to storing some of my work items in it depending on what I am carrying. My wife likes it for her Timi and Leslie purse/diaper bag, and I like it for holding my camera bag when we are travelling or my action camera holders when I am driving and have my dash camera hooked up and need somewhere to put the casing.Installation is really easy and the purse pouch holds a lot; now, I would question some of the more monolithic purses I have seen people carrying around fitting, but your average purse or bag equivalent fits in this well. It secures easily and well by hooking around the headrests of the front seat, so you can hold your purse/items evenly. It also makes the space that we sometimes omit useful, and would even work to keep items in like tissues, cleaners (which are great if the baby is in the car), excess toys you want easily on-hand, and more.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and tested in our Caravan.

I had seen these advertised so many times on TV and wondered if they really worked, so when I was asked if I wanted to sample them I was intrigued. Please note this was some time ago because I wanted to note the overall results over time, and that I wanted some weathering to see if the changes lasted. Also note that this was supplied for sampling purposes and that it was used on a 1999 Jeep to see what it could really do.Basically the process here involves a few steps, the first of which is washing you headlights to make sure they are clean and the second is putting on some gloves. You NEED to do this because of safety and follow all directions. Secondly, you are going to utilize the scouring pad, or wetsand, side of the pad provided to get the funk off. I was surprised by just how much of this was on there and this did take some time, but it was worth it. You can see if you have everything off if the light is wetted and it still appears murky, which did take me a little time to get right. After this is done, you are going to polish this down and further clean the lens, and then you will end up drying it. If there are any issues left, you repeat until cleaned.The set has everything you need in it (except a hose if you want to wash your vehicle beforehand), and is essentially a one-off operation. It made a huge difference on my vehicle's visuals, too, and I was extremely happy with the end results.

2:23 Mins I have always hated seeing a nice pair of headphones sitting on the floor or discarded on a desk and try to pick up something suitable for their storage/display. In the past, that sometimes meant picking up a little faux-head design or something that mounts to a desk or bookshelf. Those work out well enough, too, but I much prefer this because of the aesthetics and the overall sturdiness of the design.In the review, I am using a pair of H10s, but I also tried this with a few pairs including Monster DNAs. They all fit well, with different fits but all staying in place. You essentially have one large piece of plastic as the overall design, and you have 4 non-slip grips keeping it in place. I like the modern appeal this adds and I like the fact there is less here, so there is less to break long-term. I also like the fact that this is a shaped display, so I can roll any cording up under it and keep it with my headphones. That makes for easy access, and assists me in further uncomplicating what can be a cording nightmare.Please note that this was supplied for sampling purposes. I also love my music and figure that if you are looking here, you want something to assist you long-term as well. Accordingly, sampling is not allowed to impact review ratings.

I picked these up so I could use them for goofing off with my daughter, and they have been fun for that. From a distance, and mind you I noted distance, they do appear to be tattoo sleeves, with interesting work in each. Some of the themes are somewhat adult, too, which makes them more fun for costuming and for pictures, and some appear to be tribal designs.In the picture attached, this is my almost two-year-old daughter and it fits on her leg. It will not fit on her arm because it is a little too large for that, but these are built like they would be more appropriate for kids or a very slender female arm than even a skinny male arm. They fit like pantyhose and you can see the seaming up-close, but I personally do not find that to be a problem. I did deduct a star from the review for the pictures showing them blending into bulky-looking arms, however, because the image stretches for larger arms and distorts somewhat. Even for slender arms, you can see this transpiring; I am very tall, with slender arms, and they fit my arms tightly. For Halloween or parties, that still works out and the addition to a child is more entertaining than I would have first considered.Note that I picked up the 6-piece for sampling and that they also offer a 10 and 20 piece. The 6-piece are all different designs, but i cannot speak for the larger options.And please note these were supplied for sampling purposes and that this does not impact review rating.

When I was first ask if I would be interested in considering these for review, I admit to be intrigued not necessarily by functionality alone but by what this  presentation has to say about compact tech uses. Looking at them, you can see how they could immediately be added to any USB ported device for novice use, and how more skilled users could combine them to other items easily. I am thinking of placing one in a small enclosure to utilize as a small nightlight for tinkering myself, and I am sure that people with more imaginative skills could have fun adding them to tinkering projects. As I have been playing with these, I have found a lot of ways to use them, from plugging them into USB chargers for lighting to adding them to my power banks to see what I am doing to adding them to computer outputs for assistance. This would be an easy way to check output and see if something is working without getting out a multimeter or other tools, and they do provide lighting to allow you to see. I could not see reading by just one, mind you, and since they cannot be turned off, they would be a constant source of lighting. They can be plugged in either way to provide lighting in an upward or downward-facing positioning, and they are cheap enough that toting one on a keychain would not be terrible because damaging one is not throwing a ton of money away. They are also made on a thick board, so you do not have to worry about them easily snapping/breaking.Please note these were supplied for sampling purposes and that I have enjoyed tinkering with them.

10:05 Mins The Foxnovo 123 with 2 inch LED screen has some uses that it would work for including dash camera use, which does not require a large video sensor and is more about overall picture than clarity. It comes with items that would make this something easy to set up and have right from go including the cut-out of skeletal case and 32 GB card, and for that use I would rate this higher than my overall review.It also works as a VERY basic introductory camera, given that you prefer the ease of use features to image sensor, which is something I would not particularly be swayed by considering the fact that there are other introductory level cameras. I let my daughter, who is not yet 2, play with this for example, and I would allow her to film with this rather than a more expensive device. She cannot flip the waterproof case switch and open it easily, and that was fun to see her do while playing in her little pool. Still, there are loads of cost-effective models on the market.My video breaks things down more, but my main issues here are as follows:- Image quality. The video sensor here is around half of even the more cost-effective competition. Again, for dash use, this is acceptable to even good, but I do not like the idea of diving or taking it out and using it under a lot of touted conditions. I have stuck it underwater for quick use, but that is about the extent this worked for.- This is a 720P camera max, furthering video quality complications.- The waterproofing is 10M, which is 1/2 to 1/3rd of that offered by many other cameras.-The shape means that a lot of generic gear offered by several companies will not work with this. I do not like having to buy my supplies from one specific manufacturer because I like to shop around ANd I like my gear to work for multiple camera types.It does have some pros going for it that you may consider including:- Ease of use. You literally hit a button, flip the switch on the side, and click. I'd like to see this functionality ported over to another model with an updated sensor.- It is ready to go out of the box since it comes with all the needed gear.- It has a 32 GB card with it.This was received at a discounted cost and these are my opinions. I have tested it over a month in a variety of conditions and compared/contrasted it with other model types. Sampling does not impact my ratings pro or con.

7:15 Mins I am a fan of the newer-style metallic mounting that companies offer, so I like the incorporation of a metal tripod mount and screws with this. I also like the adjustment wrench because they help no matter what, and the metal accessory is a vast improvement over the plastic one I sometimes use.The set comes with two metal screws of differing sizes plus the tripod mount, and it comes with a plastic screw as well. It also comes with the monopod, which is a smaller model and good for taking this out and recording on land. The lanyard wrist attachment is nice to keep you from dropping it, and the added grip pattern keeps it from being easily dropped even if you hand is wet. The weight is good, too, with it having a bit of heft but nothing that is not manageable.The set also comes with mounts that allow you to stick them to all sorts of surfaces, and the adhesive is strong. If you have used a set before, these are comparable with the name-brand ones, and if not, they are tough. I like these mounting types as well because you can place your chest/wrist/head mounting and use the same bracketing with them.There is also a bag for holding, which I did not include in the video not because of quality, but because I combine all accessories into a larger hard shell bag. If you are going out and do not carry a hard shell, however, this works to keep things together and is small enough to fit in a pocket for use.Please note this set was supplied for sampling purposes, has been tested (the monopod, bracketing, and more have been out a lot), and that these are solely my opinions.

I have been really pleased with the Aquafree Dry Bag so far because it essentially allows me an extra bag on outdoor and/or fishing expeditions to keep my items dry. I had never consider just how difficult that could be until I was caught in the rain with a modern phone, an IPOD, a DSLR, and an action camera and needed to get them out of the rain quickly. And, yeah, it is nice to be able to carry a soundtrack with you and take pictures of whatever you accomplish, but destroying thousands of dollars of equipment can also ruin an outing, which i luckily did not but came pretty close to.The Aquafree Dry Sack folds up quite easily and stores simply, so I do not have to tote anything extra, which I am thankful for. I can add device safety or keep dry clothing while storing this at a camping site, in a kayak compartment, or even in my fishing gear bag, and that is nice because carrying recording equipment, charging items, and so on can make things a tad difficult sometimes. The waterproof material is thick enough to avoid smaller punctures that take out a lot of supposedly durable items, too, and that makes a lot more reliable than many of the items i have tried.Now, I tested this outdoors, taking it out and using it when a nice little storm blew by, and it worked like a charm. i was able to quickly put in  some dry clothing and my DSLR and IPOd (i already had my phone in a waterproof pouch) and nothing got wet. I cannot begin to tell you how good it feels to be able to change clothing after a huge rainfall when you are far away from everything, or how nice it is not to have to worry. The color makes it easy to spot, so tipping a kayak or a canoe would not be as horrendous, either. I am thinking of preloading it with some of my survival items like dry matches and other accessories, because even though some already have waterproofing, this would add further protection and make them easy to find.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and kept for almost three weeks. These included two outings over 4 days time.

For the kid that likes to hit everything or is simply learning how to play sports, here is a ball-and-bat combo that is perfect for them and the parents that sometimes need a helping hand. I say that as my daughter approaches those exploration years and mimics things she sees on TV, and when having a soft foam baseball bat definitely seems preferable to finding my television or tablet assaulted by a reenactment of last night's game. Here, you have an item you do not have to worry about being swung inside and hitting someone because it is super soft and still allows your child to play sports. It allows goofing off and working out frustration at the same time, which I again prefer to a wooden or metal bat.On the subject of being soft, I tried this out by at first wacking it against my hand. Finding that did not hurt at all, I continued to do so to see if it would at least sting. It did not. That surprised me because I expected the interior design to at least carry weight, but the soft foam actually more than makes up for it. I like the design because the blue sticks out without looking too kiddy or too safety colored, and because it is easy to grip and hold. Additionally, you have here is a bat that works great for teeball practice, since a teeball bat cannot be over 33 inches in length and more than 2 1/4 in diameter (according to the 2015 official teeball bat rules). You have something that can be practiced in most environments as your child learns how to swing and connect, plus there is a soft ball for your child to practice fielding with.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and was played with thoroughly by both a child and their adult counterpart before reviewing.

5:16 Mins The Sandmarc Telescoping Pole has quite a few things going for it including the quality of the design, the way it locks into place and holds without any issue, and some of the safety elements. It notes being a "selfie stick" in the product description provided, but if this is a selfie stick, it is the selfie stick that lords over all other selfie sticks. I say that because it is thicker than most other devices and that increases durability, plus it extends well and does not thin while doing so. This is nice because you do not have to worry about the upper portions weakening as it extends and giving out somewhere just out-of-reach.Speaking of extension, what you essentially have here is a 17" device that can be extended to 40", so you have quite a bit of reach with it. That is a lot of height or depth to control by hand, and you can control it through the easily-gripped handle and the adjustable wrist strap. What's more, it locks safely and securely, so you do not have to worry about holding it skyward or sticking it underwater, wiping out, and finding your pole lost or destroyed. I like the method it uses for locking, too, because the locks are secured in place and twisted/released when you want to compress it, so you do not have to worry about this giving way immediately or over time.Please note this has been tested for around two weeks, and was taken out with a Dazzne P2 to test how well it worked. I have been nothing but pleased by this, and think anyone wanting quality could benefit from the Sandmarc.

3:28 Mins The Ho Stevie Carbon Fiber Floating Grip Stick is perfect for a videoing both on the water and on land, making it a great addition to your action camera accessories. I personally use a Dazzne P2 and I love taking my Dazzne out fishing, and this allows me to get great angles while also adding control and stability. That means I can position my angle on the fly, dip my camera underwater without worrying about it being mounted well or not, and never have to worry about losing it if something happens and I let go. When you combine this with the Ho Stevie product guarantee, that makes me feel good about chasing that hard-to-get angle while landing a fish, kayaking, or just wading and having fun.I also like that the Ho Stevie has a place for accessories on the bottom, so you can mount it to something or use a tripod when setting it up. In the video I place a cheaper tripod on it to show just how easy this is to set and to detach, and quality ones are just as easy to place. You can also attach different types of mounts this way, and doing so will add numerous angles/vantage points while you are concentrating on other things.The Ho Stevie Grip Stick feels good when handled as well, and it is a good size to avoid being damaged while also being easy to place and store. That makes it something I really like and appreciate when I am out and trying to carry my camera pack and only one more additional accessory pack.Please note this item was supplied for sampling purposes and that it was used for three weekends before reviewing. This included taking it to a local fair and also taking it out on water. Footage can be provided to show further details if needed.

7:09 Mins When it comes to powerbanks, I feel like something of an addict because I pick them up all the time. To date, this will be the 27th powerbank I have tried out, and I note that to say that I have a method of testing them and look for specifics in their use. Testing includes the Digital LED multimeter shown in the video to note several things as well, including if it is performing correctly with output and if it cuts on/off like it is advertised.To date, this is one of my two favorite powerbanks, with the Zoom powerbank products ranking there as well.When it comes to the Kayo Maxtar, you have a combination of aesthetics and functionality coming together to make a lovely product. As far as looks go, I like the way the color blends with the different styles of design, adding gloss and flat features to the item. The size makes it appealing on both a looks and functional level, and the positioning of the ports and the button assist with dual roles, too. Added to that is the presentation of the LED internal lighting, which also compliments both areas.Functionality-wise, the Kayo is a beast when it comes to its size, touting 13,000 mAh. You see devices tout things like this and make erroneous claims all the time, but the Kayo delivers on its charging promises. It also cools well, which is something that a lot of the more compact models have trouble with, and this means a lot because I loathe an item that touts ease-of-use but then complicates it through modification.This model sports two output ports, one at 1A and one at 2.1A, so you have something for both tablets (the large number) and items like phones or action camera batteries (like the Dazzne P2, for instance). Both are clearly marked, so you do not confuse them. There is also an input for easy access when you are charging it.A feature I REALLY like here is the LED readout with percentage of charge. This is something that a lot of powerbanks do not come with, and it adds more concise measurements on what you need and how much power you currently have on-hand. It additionally has an indicator with a small light that notes when something is charging.Please note that this was provided for sampling and that it has the potential to be very useful or dangerous, so I accordingly test it heavily. Safety means a lot to me because it involves people I know and care about, so I accordingly do NOT allow sampling to impede review rating.

When you think bamboo, what are some keywords that come to mind? Well, if you are like how I was before I began exploring alternative children's products, you might not automatically think of "soft" as a way to describe it. After doing some research into bamboo for use in my home for cooking, however, I found that bamboo could not only be soft but that it also has qualities that promote health and agree with humans in ways many other items do not. That led to findings with other home and homeopathic uses, with headphone uses and how they promote sound and cleanliness at the same time, and then into kid's products and bamboo's potential. Add to that the way the items in The Motherhood Collection are crafted without pollutants and with care and you have something truly worthwhile.Without overly pulling up the soapbox, we know that our children should not be exposed to chemicals, dyes, and other irritants that we are not allowed to test on animals but that some companies still try to pimp onto our children. Diapers truly drove that point home to me, and other products marketed to those individuals that cannot speak for themselves continue such terrible trend. My daughter, who turns 2 at the end of October, first made me aware of this when she developed a rash at the hospital that would not cease and that was only fixed after we switched from their preferred brands to chemical-free ones. That is why I am glad for alternatives like these washcloths, because you can tell the difference.From packaging on, you have items that are presented in a way that seems to indicate that more time was spent on them, making them perfect for gifting or personal use. Each washcloth is wrapped by itself and all of them are extremely soft, to the point that I considered keeping them for me. Honestly, the baby even used the qualifier "soft" to let me know just how much she liked them. They are dye-free and you can tell that as well, and they have a look of quality to them. Even after washing them three times so far, they still look and feel perfect.Please note that these were supplied for sampling purposes and that samples involving children specifically are extremely important to me. Accordingly, I test them to the best of my ability and never allow sampling to influence rating.

3:01 Mins The EC Technology Screw-on Tripod is a nice little item to have for a number of different devices including monopods, telescoping poles, selfie sticks, action cameras, DSLRs, and more. I use a tripod in my reviews for overhand use, and I also use them for quick pictures with regard to DSLR use or setting my action camera on some type of mount.Unlike your cheaper tripod attachments, this provides a stable platform, with 3 metal legs attached by no-slip grips, allowing you to set up your device and go. The fact that the legs are made of metal means that there will be no stress added and surprise breaks later down the road, which is something I truly appreciate. The way it screws in allows it to work quickly and easily, so you are not left fumbling with a monster device while trying to snap a quick picture.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and used over almost 3 weeks. This included outings with all the devices named, and the tripod worked well. You can also review other reviews and see it attached; I only used a cheaper tripod for this review to make certain this could be seen and demonstrated.

2:59 Mins The Ruban 6.2 Foot Universal Security Cable is a great way to add security when you and your laptop are on the go. It's interesting and odd to type that, too, because a few years ago I would have considered something like this overkill, but as more and more people target consumers, you have to think deterrent. I say that because, if you are like me, you have 1000s of dollars in hardware and software combinations, not to mention the keepsakes inside your devices that cannot be replaced.The cable reminds me a lot of a bike chain in that it is basically cable coated with a smoother plastic overlay, thereby allowing you to handle it while also providing strength. You hook it into your laptop via the security port on your computer, flip the device into the locked position, and secure it to a desk or whatever you want. The extra-long cord allows you to place it just about anywhere, and the look of this works to confuse snatch-and-grab individuals looking for an easy mark.Setting this is easy; you have detailed instructions walking you through use, which is basically just starting with a 0000 default code, setting it to your preference, locking and going.Please note this was supplied for sampling purposes and has some great real-world uses. You could use it with other items as well; basically they just need a place to lock into, which quite a few items have.
