Meyer Lemon Cheesecake, Creamy Parmesan Risotto, Lime Cilantro Rice, Pulled Pork, Baked Beans, Weeknight Pot Roast & Potatoes, White Rice (much faster than my rice cooker), Steel Cut Oats, Beef Tips, Pork Carnitas, Refried beans. I like to keep those on hand. I soak pintos overnight in the IP's pot, cook them with a quartered onion and mash them with butter or bacon grease, cumin and chili powder, right in the pot after reserving the liquid. They cost half as much as buying canned beans and taste worlds better. Ribs are fall-off-the-bone tender in 30 minutes. It was easy to make a double batch for the wolfpack, chill them overnight and finish on the grill next day. Next week I'm making the classic Bolognese from the ATK book which is only one ingredient away from Marcella Hazan's famous all-day version of the sauce. Total time, 90 minutes instead of 4 hours.Best things about the Instant Pot, aside from how it makes food taste? It's effortless. Really, push Start and walk away. And the steel inner pot is wonderful. Most things I've made begin with the Saut√© setting before going under pressure. We get superior browning before deglazing the pan with liquid. Although the silicone gasket now reeks of chili it hasn't affected anything else. If anyone knows how to remove the smell from it, let me know. Silicone is stubborn that way. I have a 2nd gasket that I use for oatmeal, rice and cheesecake. The gasket is easy to remove and replace. The steel pot goes into the dishwasher. I'm considering getting a nonstick pot for rice and oats. This handy appliance has transformed my summertime cooking, allowing me to break away from our usual salads and grilled chicken rut. Can't wait to see what it does for stews and chilis in winter.

Living on a large pond in southern Florida we're treated to near daily sightings of turtles, alligators, herons, egrets and more. In spring and fall when the weather is cool we also get fly-overs (drift-overs?) by hot air balloons. It's a spectacle right in our own backyard. We've got a very nice but large and clunky binoculars (for which we paid a small fortune back in the day) that have taken up permanent residence on our lanai. When ZhiZhu asked me to review their new scope, I was  happy to, but skeptical, given the price tag.Well, color me happy! This monocular scope from ZhiZhu Optics is every bit as good as our older, WAY more expensive lenses, offering crystal clear close-ups of all our favorite wildlife, including Huey and Dewey, our 2 resident big dumb ducks. Sadly, Louie was eaten by the 'gator last spring, right in front of our eyes. True tale. Anyway, this monocular is solidly built, no cheap plastic parts. At 9.1 ounces, it's lightweight without being flimsy, and the optics are clear and sharp. It's black rubbery casing has a matte finish that provides for a completely secure grip. The wrist strap adds another layer of security, making it suitable for use on our boat. It also has a soft padded nylon carrying case with a belt loop and a small cotton cleaning cloth. Being a monocular scope, it is so much more portable than our old binoculars with their large bulky case. I have to highly recommend it, but suggest that you toss the cotton cloth and use a microfiber cloth instead to make sure you don't scratch the lens. Lens caps would have been nice, but not completely necessary as too often they're just another loose item to lose.At just over $10? I was floored by the quality, I truly was. What a great gift for any outdoor lovers in your life. I would proudly gift this to my friends and family and never tell them how little it costs.**Sample provided for review**

Extra power used to be thick, heavy and clunky. How times have changed. This Foxnovo Li polymer data bank is sleek slim and at just 8.1oz, not at all heavy. It takes a bit of time to reach it's full charge (using my MacBook Air) but it does carry a nice charge. It restored my iPhone 6 from 25 percent power to 100 percent power while only using about 25 percent of it's own power. Not bad at all.It ships in a nice plain but study box and is well-cushioned inside it. It also includes a wicked cool 1ft cord with charging heads for Lightning, 30-pin (old Apple), Micro-USB 2.0 and Micro-USB 3.0 tips. Add in the gray velveteen carrying pouch with outer pocket for the cable and you've got a very nice package. the pouch has a clear bead/satin ribbon loop closure that keeps the data bank perfectly secure. I wouldn't hesitate to give this as a gift.And lest I forget, it's aluminum paint job is a dead ringer for Apple's aluminum bodies. That's a very sexy thing to me, and the icing on the cake. I really like this charger, it's perfect for travel or extended day use. At under $30, what's not to love?**Sample provided for review**

This Foxnovo cable offers the best of many other cables all in one complete package. It's a bright lime green for easy visibility. It's flat cable guarantees tangle-free storage and use. It also has 2 charging tips; a Lightning tip for newer Apple devices and a Micro-USB tip for almost all the rest.This last feature is a real boon to people living in mixed marriages, as I am. My husband loves his Galaxy Note 4, I'm an Apple FanGirl. Our luggage has sometimes carried what looks like a bag of spaghetti. Foxnovo eliminates this with a cable that will charge all of our devices.Best of all, there's a tiny spring cable holding the Lightning tip to the Micro-USB tip, so neither becomes lost. This feature makes it even easier to carry this as our sole travel charger. I can see many uses for it. For the back seat of the car it can keep multiple kids happy. Around the house it saves checking the cable to see if it's got the right tip.Finally, at $12.99, it's a good value for an Apple MFi Certified cable. Trying it out several times over the weekend, it connected flawlessly every time. This is just about all you can ask from a cable.**Sample provided for review**

I can't apply screen protectors. Seriously, ever since I got my first iPhone 3S I've been relying on the guys at the AT&T store to put them on for me. When they frayed or got scratched, I'd do without or go see my phone guys again. I've tried, really I have, many times. And I do ok, if you don't mind looking through aquarium glass covered with CSI fingerprint lifts. I suck at it, smudges and bubble city every time.But needing to write a completely honest review I decided to tackle the Korton Tempered Glass protector on my own. I carefully followed the clear instructions printed on the back of the package, washing my hands, being in a bright lit area. Dust-free isn't an option in my house, but I made sure the cat was nowhere in sight to shed on my iPhone 6. Korton provides everything you need except the soap and water for your hands. I wiped the iPhone down with the included wipe, then dried it really well with the Korton's microfiber cloth. Determined to keep it lint/dust free, I held it vertically while I peeled down the top inch of the film on the Korton glass protector, which I also kept vertical. Then I laid the phone down and carefully aligned the glass with the top speaker. After that, I slowly and carefully peeled down the film while continuing to hold the glass protector in place.I cannot BELIVE that I did this, but I did! With nary a bubble, stray lint fiber, smudge or cat hair in sight. Remember what your iPhone 6 looked like when you first opened the box it shipped in? That. Since I promised brutal honesty, I must admit that I went ever-so-slightly off kilter near the bottom of the phone, and the Korton protector is very, very slightly misaligned around my Home key, by maybe 1/32", but not intruding on it's area at all. For this reason I highly recommend following the optional advice to secure the glass with tape at the top of the phone. But honestly? I don't know if that would have made a difference, because the misalignment is so little, but it wouldn't hurt. Anyway, I have full access to the Home key and NO, NADA, ZIP bubbles or dirt on my screen, with an actual second sheet of glass to protect my screen!! Yay, me!EDIT - After using it for a bit, I realized that this glass screen feels just like the Apple glass. Duh. What I mean is that it doesn't feel like a screen protector at all, but just like my phone.**Sample provided for review**

These baking cups are wonderful, easy to use, clean and store. They're a little bit smaller than the usual paper liners, but by no means "mini". They will not fit into the holes in my mini cupcake pan. I think HomeFlav should change their listing to remove the word "mini" from the description. This would stop the confusion and also make sure there are no unhappy customers. If the description is changed, I'd give these 5 stars.Their best features are related to how well they work and how economical they are. To get the best results, they need to be greased the first few times they're used to sort of "season" them. After that, they should be pretty much good to go (I'll update this review the 4th time I use them to let you know for sure). They clean so easily with soap and water that's it's laughable. Part of this can be attributed to how nonstick they are. Sprayed with cooking spray, cupcakes slid right out of them, leaving nary a crumb behind.This crumb thing is another HUGE plus, as the cupcakes don't shed nearly as many crumbs into hands, onto clothing and floors. Using paper liners when my 4 grandsons are around, I've always felt like I needed to mop the floor afterwards. This 'no-mess' aspect is my husband's favorite thing about them.I wasn't sure how much I'd like reusable liners, what with the need to wash them and all. But these are so easy to clean that I don't feel like I'm doing any extra work at all. Wipe once with a soapy sponge or cloth, rinse and turn them upside down to dry. Boom. Done. They're the easiest part of doing the dishes. I'm not a frequent baker, but still, with the average box mix making 24 cupcakes, I can easily go through 4-5 sleeves of liners in a year. Side note - why do most grocery store liner packs come with 36 liners when the cake mixes next to them make 24? These are like hot dogs and hot dog buns. Anyway, at the current price of $6.79, these will be paid for before you know it.**Sample provided for review.**

I'd never used meat claws to shred Barbecue before, always relying on a pair of dinner forks, because I don't have 2 meat forks and one dinner fork and one meat fork was ridiculous. Very advanced, I know. So when Kickty offered these to me for evaluation and review, I emailed back a "Yes!" before they could change their minds.Formed of hard shiny plastic, they're nicely finished, although with an open framework on the back (see photo). The back-side frame does have a bulge at the handle to make for a comfortable grip. But it won't matter, because you won't be using them long enough for grip comfort to become a factor. Really, it's perfectly comfortable.The business end (claws) measure 4.5" wide and 2" deep. Those 2" teeth are pointy, too. Not like plastic fork pointy, but honestly out-your-eye-out pointed to rip through barbecued meats with ease. Which they do. A big step up from my wimpy dinner forks, these provide 12 claws spread across 4.5" and bring to bear (yup, I went there) to so much meat-ripping power that my time to shred a 2lb hunk of pork butt was about 30 seconds, maybe. Could have been less.  There's also no hand strain involved. I'm a 61-yr-old female with weak wrists. I need both hands to lift my cast iron skillet. I ripped through last night's pork butt and went looking for more things to shred.One thing that I really liked about these was that the spread between claws allowed me to leave lots of little pieces of meat intact, rather than turning it all into true shreds. We like a little texture in our Barbecue. This feature will make these very useful for Carnitas, where you don't want shreds at all. I could have torn my roast apart into Carnitas pieces in about 5 seconds. Of course, it you want to, you can spend another 10 seconds or so and have fine shreds.I waited to get this review in, thinking I could try them as salad hands tonight. Well, that didn't pan out (burgers and dogs), but I promise to add that experience within the next week or so. I prefer multi-taskers, but given how often we shred meat for barbecue and tacos, I'm willing to give this uni-tasker a home. But I really hope they work for salads. How cool to only need one tool for barbecue and the coleslaw to go with it? That would be neat.So although I'm not a fan of uni-taskers and this isn't fully finished, I'm still giving it 5 stars because at the current price of $7.99, they're worth it.EDIT - Well, we finally made a big tossed green salad (romaine, iceberg, onion and tomato) and used our meat claws as salad hands. They worked really well, grabbing greens and tomatoes with ease. I was worried that when I dropped the portion onto a plate,half the greens would remain impaled on the Kickty's sharp claws. Not at all. Out of six passes, only one come up with impaled leaves, and only two pieces of iceberg. Not shabby, and it's nice to know  they can do double duty. Definitely worth 5 stars.**Sample provided for review**

Of the 3 Ipow Universal  CD slot phone mounts I've tried, this is far and away my favorite. Hand's down, no question. My iPhone 6 is in a simple, minimalist faux leather/silicone case, keeping it's weight down. The magnets in this mount hold it very well. It also holds with ease my husband's Samsung Galaxy Note 4 in a heavier protective case.Before inserting it into your CD slot (you'll still be able to play CD's, by the way), affix the little rubber pads to the top of the center flange and the bottom of the outer flanges. Then screw the whole thing into your car's CD slot, tightening up the wing nut to secure it. Easy as pie.This phone mount ships with 2 magnetic plates that can be slipped into your phone case behind your phone or can be attached right to the back of your phone by removing the cover on the sticky tape backing. Either way, you've got a strong, secure grip for 2 phones. My husband and I chose to put the plates inside our cases. There's plenty of magnetic force to hold either phone tight to the mount. They're not going anywhere until we pull them off the round magnetic disk.What makes this our favorite of all the Ipow mounts is that we can slap our phones onto the holder and just as easily pull them off. Some mounts require 2 hands to both insert the phone into the mount and to remove it when you exit the car. This doesn't work for us, as whichever one of us is in the passenger seat will need to be able to grab the phone for one reason or another. Today I needed to enter some new items into my shopping list. When I was done, I simply placed the phone back on the magnet. This is by far the easiest to use car phone mount we've tried and we can't see using any other.**Sample provided for review**

This is another Ipow CD slot phone holder and like the others, it does it's job very well, holding any phone securely, with easy access to music and nav apps, and whatever else you need to access while on the road. This one is designed with extra security, in the form of the bottom support. It is ideal for large phablets and may even fit some smaller tablets. If your phone is heavy, this may be the ideal mount for you.Attach the little rubber strips to the top of the center wing and the bottom of the side wings to make sure it will stay securely in your CD slot. The beauty of these designs is that you can still play a CD while the mount is in place. Brilliant!For my uses, with shorter trips, mostly 40 minutes or less, it isn't the best design, given that removing my phone is a two-handed operation. I prefer more of a quick-release mount (like the Ipow Magnetic CD Slot Holder) that allows me to grab my phone and go. Also, when my husband and I are in the car together, we use my phone for music apps. Sometimes I need to grab my phone to do an internet search or some other task. I don't want to fiddle with buttons and clamps to get at my phone.However, if you don't need to remove your phone from the mount while you're in the car, this kind of mount provides the best level of security, short of leaving it in the glovebox.**Sample provided for review**

This is a nice CD Drive for devices that lack them, like my MacBook Air. I'll be comparing it to my Apple SuperDrive.The ZhiZhu is lightweight, portable and about the same size (closed) as my SuperDrive. It connected easily, by which I mean that I attached it's cable and plugged it into my Mac. That was it. It was able to properly read both a Disney DVD (Cinderella) and a Dimension Films release (The Others).  Playback was flawless, with no skipping. The unit's cable detaches at both ends, which I think is a nice feature. I suppose Apple's cable is fixed in order to prevent loss, but I worry about breaking it off, with it sticking out all the time, although it's held up for 4 years.I do have some construction concerns that would apply to frequent users. Primarily, the ZhiZhu drive lacks the finish and ruggedness of the SuperDrive. Unlike the Apple unit (made of rigid aluminum), it's case body is hard plastic. The instruction guide warns against placing objects on top of it because it can affect playback. To test this, I pushed on the top of the case and noticed that it does give to pressure. I've used the Apple drive as a coaster, placed a heavy textbook on it  and dropped it, all with no ill effects.The disk-handling mechanism is my other area of concern. The ZhiZhu's disc tray drawer appears a little flimsy, as does the "Eject" Button, which slides the disc tray in and out.  I question how long either would last under frequent use or less-than-ideal conditions. The SuperDrive has no sliding tray; the disc goes directly into the unit and a keyboard command ejects it. This unit requires more flat space when loading/unloading because of the sliding tray. Still, the SuperDrive is twice the price, and the ZhiZhu drive does perform just as well.If you plan to use it with your MB Air while traveling or you use a lot of discs, this may not be the best model for you. It probably makes more sense to purchase the Apple SuperDrive. If, on the other hand, you're like me and rarely have the need to read a disc (part of the reason I chose to save weight and purchase the Air), this is a great little device, costing half as much as an Apple SuperDrive, which makes it easy to recommend.**Product provided for review**

I've been using these strainers for a little while now, and have found them quite useful. The largest is ideal for sifting large amounts of flour, rinsing rice and so on.  The smallest one is very nice for dusting flour over chicken or fish (this is really superior to dreddging with no flour waste and no mess!), and for straining tea. I haven't yet found a use for the mid-size one. I thought it might work for straining bacon grease into a jar, but it's too shallow.Which brings me to the drawbacks. With the exception of the smallest one, all of these feel just a little shallow, lacking in volume. They're also very lightweight, which means they may fail under a heavy load. On my first use of the small one, while flouring some fish filets, the third time I tapped the side of it to bring out more flour, one of the handle welds gave out. The handle is only attached at one point. The strainer is still perfectly functional (for now) under a small weight, but if this happened to one of the larger ones, the handles could break off entirely.  I still lack confidence that the other weld won't eventually give way, but it's holding so far.At the price ($9.99), they're inexpensive and likely fine for light duty, like straining liquids. But if you want to strain a puree, you'll need something more heavy-duty to stand up to the pushing and scraping that needs to be done to extract all the liquid and leave only solids behind.**Sample provided for review**

I've previously had the pleasure of trying Joyal Beauty's Hyaluronic Serum with Vitamin C and liked it very much. I like this one better. It has a 2% higher concentration of Hyaluronic acid and does a better job (didn't think that was possible) of hydrating my dry skin. I live in Florida and find it tough to use a moisturizer in this climate. By mid-morning, even the lightest begin to float somewhat on my face, rather like body lotions do. If you've ever experienced this with lotion on your legs or arms, you'll know what I'm talking about. Moisturizers are supposed to disappear, not remain on the face all day. But I digress.With 5% hyaluronic acid, this serum has helped my skin retain more moisture, thus reducing the need for moisturizer. I can use much  less and get the same effect. In fact, on some days I've not used any moisturizer at all and felt no difference in my skin. It has remained soft, smooth to the touch, plump and MOIST all day. This is a real boon when it's 95 degrees with humidity levels to match.Another reason I prefer this serum is that it has, quite literally, no fragrance at all. Joyal's Hyaluronic Serum with Vitamin C has a slight fragrance from the Vitamin C. It's mild and not at all unpleasant, but I like 100% odor-free better. There's really nothing I don't like about this serum. It's one I'll happily continue to use.As with all of their products, Joyal Beauty is proud to tell us exactly what is in the bottle, making it easy for us to make our own decisions about what to buy. Have an allergy? Mine is roses. Many products contain Rosehips, which can trigger my allergy. It is often hidden (although not through deception or malice) in a catch-all phrase like "Botanical Extracts". Because Joyal lists all the ingredients on Amazon, I can check any product before I commit. This practice is priceless to anyone with allergies and another reason to trust Joyal Beauty.**Sample provided for review**

I've had problems in the past using fruit acid exfoliators, as many of them, even in somewhat low concentrations, can irritate or outright burn my skin. I've had no problems at all with Joyal's Kojic Acid Leave-On Exfoliator. In fact, it has not caused any irritation at all, not even a mild tingle when I use it. I haven't noticed any change in wrinkles or fine lines, but that's not what I expect from exfoliation.What I have seen is clearer, brighter skin, with no dull areas at all. I don't think it clarifies quite as well as Joyal's Vitamin C serum, which I've also been honored to try, but for me, the exfoliation is the key, which leads to brighter looking skin. This serum keeps my skin smooth, shining and flake-free. I'll simply resume use of the Vitamin C serum now that I'm done testing this one.One thing I really like about Joyal Beauty is that they proudly tell us exactly what is in their products, without using made-up science-y sounding names to make us believe their product has a magical ingredient that no one else has. Every component is spelled out in clear, common terms. They trust that their customers can judge for themselves. And as with all the Joyal products I've tried, a little goes a long way.**Sample provided for review**

I was very excited to get these labels. They're very attractive, working well in my contemporary kitchen, despite their slightly old-time flair. A real plus is that the labels are very flexible and stay put, but can also be removed without a lot of trouble. I couldn't ask for nicer labels.Although the look is very nice, I wouldn't consider these for containers that you'll want to erase and mark again for other contents. Although the finished look is striking, exactly like chalk on a blackboard, they're not the easiest thing to use. After priming the pen, I found that I either had to write on the label and let it dry (this takes much longer than a few minutes) of write on the jar, which doesn't look very nice.For jars that you'll use in the fridge, these aren't a good choice, because the ink wipes right off with the tiniest amount of moisture. I erased 2 labels simply by reaching in to remove them from fridge.  I'm going to look at Michael's or a similar shop for semi-permanent white markers. With one of these type markers, I should be able to use these for fridge storage quite easily.I'm really torn between a 3 and 4 star rating, but because of the wait time for the ink to dry, it's got to be 3. Again, for items that are dry, and won't be relabled very often, these are a fine choice.**Sample provided for review**

I walk for fitness, my daughter-in-law runs marathons. We both have long hair. We liked how this Wailea Fitness Head Band felt, smooth and sleek, and the amount of coverage it provides. Neither of us was thrilled with the color, which is sort of traffic-cone orange. Neither of use were big fans of the twist front, because we had to fiddle with it a little before putting it on. In use, the twist wasn't as attractive as I thought it would be. Both of us appreciated the width, which allowed us to bring it down on our foreheads without giving us that 80's roller-disco look.I had the same problem with it that I have with most headbands, it kept slipping off my fine hair. I had to constantly tug it back into place. My daughter-in-law has more hair than I do, a mane if we're being honest, and although it's bordering on fine, the headband stayed in place a little better for her. It performed it's primary job well for both of us, catching sweat, keeping us dry.On balance, at the price ($7.99) we can recommend it for women with medium to coarse hair, because it's wide enough to be worn down onto your forehead while still keeping your hair corralled. but we really hope Wailea Fitness changes the color and design.**Sample provided for review**

I've worn a FitBit since December. I've never lost a band, never had one fall off or come undone. I do change my band from time to time, if I want to match it to an outfit or just want a change. And of course I remove them weekly for charging. All of my current bands are FitBit brand.These Wailea Fitness bands are very similar in construction. Although the mold marks on the underside of the band aren't as nicely finished and the silicone isn't as smooth as the Fitbit bands, the Wailea bands are overall pretty much identical in thickness and shape. The metal clasps appear to be of the same heavy metal (steel, I think) as the Fitbit brand clasps.I should note that the black and camouflage bands are virtually the same length as my Fitbit bands, but the solid green one is almost ¬Ω" shorter. I moved the clasp outward another 2 holes to get the same fit. If your wrists are large, this may be a problem. I'm a 5'9" woman with a 7" wrist. I wear my Fitbit loosely.Where I ran into problems was securing the bands on my wrist. Fitbit band holes have a slight bevel that makes it easier to align and push the clasp through the holes. The holes on the Wailea Fitness bands sit perfectly flush with the top of the band. I had a really hard time getting the clasp through the holes and had to enlist the aid of my husband. I hope that in time the holes will stretch a little, making it easier for me to secure the bands on my own.Despite these flaws, there is much to like about the Wailea Fitness bands: First is the value. They cost about 75% less than the "real" thing and are only slightly less well-made.Second, they come with a solidly-built metal clasp for each band. Fitbit 3-band sets come with a single clasp to share among the bands.Wailea Fitness has gone out of it's what to make sure you don't lose them. All 3 bands include a clear plastic slide that will pro-actively prevent them from falling off your wrist. Fitbit bands do not provide any additional protection from loss.Finally, the black band is absolutely unique with it's striking tumbling boxes diamond finish. I've never seen another band like it.Once you get them on your wrist, these sturdy, well-made bands aren't going anywhere until you remove them.**Sample provided for review**

I'm pretty skeptical of new topical skin serums. After all, I'm 61, and even though I possess warm, somewhat naturally tan skin thanks to my Mongol ancestors, a lifetime of living near the beach has taken it's toll. Although I lack age spots, my skin is a little uneven with some redness, and I've got my share of wrinkles. I rarely bother with sunscreen, because I don't burn easily and my family is at minimal risk for skin cancer.So when I agreed to try Acetyl Organics ARGIRELINE Serum, I wasn't expecting much. I was wrong. The combination of Argireline and Hyaluronic acid, at maximum concentrations, is doing some very nice things for my skin. The Hyaluronic acid is doing a bang-up job of maximizing the moisture content in my face. My skin is much more plump and soft to the touch than before. The Argireline is magically easing wrinkles. They're not gone, oh no, but they are less prominent, softer, than they were. Vitamin C is also acting to brighten and even out my skin, reducing redness. I have pretty sensitive skin but experienced no tingling at all with this serum. It is also completely scent-free, a rarity in a market where most products carry some scent.I really like the dropper it comes with, it is very easy to measure out just a few drops with it. The dark glass bottle will help prevent sunlight from reducing the effectiveness of the serum, so I feel pretty comfortable keeping this on my counter where I'll remember to use it. If this works on my old, weathered skin, think what it can do for younger skin to help prevent damage. Give it a try, I think you'll like it.**Sample provided for review**

Let me preface by saying that although I'm an accomplished cook, I hate the inherent uncertainty that goes along with poaching eggs. Will the yolks hold together? Will the whites shred? Did I manage to drain all the water off? So when ForPeak invited me to take their silicone egg cups out for a spin, I jumped at the chance.They're exactly as pictured, a lovely bright blue heavy silicone. There is nothing flimsy about them. Better, although they're perfectly rounded on the inside, they have a flat base on the bottom to hold them upright and stable on your counter, with zero worries about tipping over and dumping your raw egg onto the counter. They also take up a lot less room than your typical egg poaching pan in your cupboards. Mine store easily inside a gadget drawer. Costing about half as much as some other high quality egg cups, they represent a solid value.To use them, perfectly, from day one, follow these simple steps.1. Set water on to simmer. Don't boil it. Boiling water can splash into the cup, and you'll have to drain it out at the end. Bubbles should be breaking the surf, but they should be small, tiny ones. If the water is moving from the bubbles, turn it down a notch.2. Butter the cups. Sure you can use spray oil, but butter just plain tastes better. These are eggs, right? I used my favorite OXO pastry brush for this, brushing room temp butter into the cups. http://www.amazon.com/OXO-Grips-Silicone-Basting-Pastry/dp/B000JPSI8C/ref=sr_1_1?s=home-garden&ie=UTF8&qid=1434291833&sr=1-1&keywords=silicone+pastry+brush3. Fill the cups. Crack one egg into each cup, holding the egg low over the cup to prevent breaking the yolk. Be gentle.4. Lift the filled cups into the simmering water. You can do this by hand. Cover the pan.5. Set a timer for 3 minutes. Depending on how well done you want them, they'll take anywhere from 3-5 minutes.6. Use a spoon to remove the cups from the pan. I used my fingers and couldn't avoid getting a little water into the cup as it tipped when I grabbed it.7. Use a fork or spoon to release the egg from the cup.8. Break it open over your favorite breakfast hash, potatoes or bread and enjoy!That's it! I had no trouble at all with my very first attempt, although my egg was a little overdone, with a firmly set white. The yolk was a little too thick for my preference, but my husband though they were perfect.  They eggs were delicious served on top of beef hash for a rustic breakfast. A slice of cantaloupe brought some light sweet contrast. One of the best things is how easy these are to use, leaving you free to prepare the rest of your meal. It literally took me longer to type the steps than it did to perform them.Remember that poached eggs aren't just for breakfast. Try them over a Caesar or arugula salad. Over pasta with oil, anchovies and red peppers, on top of steamed asparagus, in soup, on top of mushroom polenta or risotto. Use them to make little individual layered ice cream cups, like vanilla with raspberry sorbet. Nestle that next to a slice of chocolate cake for an elegant dessert. Freeze herbs in water in them. I'm sure there are other things you can do with them, those are just the ones that quickly occurred to me.Yes, after only one use, I'm very impressed with these little blue wonders. I think every kitchen should have at least one pair of them. I'm contemplating ordering a few more, so I can use them for a small dinner party. I'm in danger of becoming a fangirl, I have to admit it. They were just so easy to use, and yielded such wonderful results. How many products carry zero learning curve? Try them for yourself and you might become a fan, too.**Sample provided for review**
Exactly the same as my factory original paddles. A perfect fit for my Zo Virtuoso PAC-20.

To say that my family was excited to test this Kindz Selfie Stick is an understatement. All 4 grandkids wanted to try it, but my daughter-in-law was most excited. So after charging it (very intuitive if you've ever charged anything) I handed the entire apparatus to her, without the instruction manual. She doesn't usually deal with electronics set-up, so I thought that if she could figure it out, anyone could. Well, color me impressed. Within about 2 minutes she had it paired to her Samsung Galaxy, had attached the phone in it's bracket to the stick and was ready to snap photos.In use, it was equally easy to use and allowed her and my grandsons to to take some impressive selfies.Build quality is quite solid, really strong, surprisingly so, considering the sub-$20 price tag. There are no flimsy components here. This is something that you can toss in a suitcase or stick in your back pocket or backpack without fear of it breaking. Rugged is how I would describe it.With it's solid build, simple pairing/set-up and easy operation, I recommend it very highly.**Sample provided for review**

I have come across many computer fans, and this one is quite unique. For one thing, there are five fans, with an option to use fewer. There is also an adjustable slant, so that the computer can be lifted. It has six settings for this. It is a very solid fan and I believe most efficient at keeping the laptop cook and well ventilated. Also, it is easy to transport. I was glad to be given this in exchange for an honest review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I have been having gut issues that can only be resolved with replenishing the flora. I found this to make a difference within DAYS, to my surprise! After taking a small handful about four days in a row, I have noticed more regularity. I love the fact that these survive stomach acidity. I was delighted to get this in exchange for a review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I really love these muffin holders. There is no spillover of the batter. There is no wastage of paper. The muffins remain firm in shape. My understanding is that contamination is not an issue with silicone bake-ware as it is for certain plastics. All silicone products intended for use with food must meet FDA standards. Silicone cannot react with your food -- and flameproof up to 450 degrees F, far hotter than the 300 to 375 degree F temperatures cake, muffin and cookie recipes usually call for. Silicone will not break if dropped, as will glass. It doesn't get all scratched up with use. These will last a lifetime!I was happy to receive this in exchange for an honest review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I was delightfully surprised by this book. Without a lot of fanfare and wordiness, the author cuts straight to the point on all 16 studies. He gives a simple, easy to understand synopsis of each study and how to use what is learned from the study. You will learn in this book (which is concise enough to read at one sitting) how to influence people, to read people, to make friends out of enemies, to be persuasive, to make people trust you and bond with you, to avoid judgments, to get into an inside circle, and much more. It all really makes sense when you learn the basic psychology. You can do all this without being manipulative: just be kind, friendly, and sincere. Be someone you would like to hang out with!Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

Finally, some nontoxic, glycerin and paraben-free condoms. These are truly eco-friendly, biodegradable condoms packaged in 100% recycled materials printed with vegetable-based inks. They are slightly ribbed so the woman feels she is getting a massage.  The company also donates one condom to developing countries in need for each one you purchase. I was glad to get this in exchange for a review.

I have ruined so many pans by forgetting that I have some veggies steaming or water brewing in the kitchen! I just get really busy and forget, till the smell of smoke reminds me. So I was very grateful to receive this in exchange for an honest review. I can testify that it works, as I tested it. But just having it there makes me feel more secure and somehow has reminded me to remember when I''ve got some water brewing for tea or something!Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I need a scale like this to measure herbs and supplement powders since I am an herbologist. I have found this to be amazingly accurate when tested against another scale. I was very pleased when given this in exchange for an honest review. This portable device enables me to keep it in my backpack or purse so that I can measure when I go shopping for herbs.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I love this diffuser. As an amazon reviewer, I have received essential oil diffusers which I could not figure out how to use! This one comes with directions and is VERY SIMPLE, so I was happy to have this given for review. It is silent, easy to operate, and soooo colorful! The colors change fairly quickly, and include pale to bold shades of yellow, red, pink, purple, green, orange and blue.It takes a bit of time for the essential oil to mist out but soon you can smell the oil fragrance. This is wonderful to have for your baby, or by your bed so you can relax (using lavender essential oil to help you sleep).When the gadget runs out of water, it will automatically stop running, so you don't have to worry about if it's full or not.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

A great quality brush made from bamboo! No cracking and breaking of the brush stem, plus it looks positively lovely hanging near my shower. I use it after showering and my skin gets very soft from the sloughing off of dead skin cells. It has another side for getting rid of cellulite. Since I don't have cellulite, due to a healthful diet, I cannot attest to its effectiveness in that area. But the brush part is superior to any brush I have used in the past three decades.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books.

You want ENERGY? How soon do you need it?If you want it fast, take some of this fractionated coconut oil! Fractionated coconut oil is very high in medium chain triglycerides, the part of coconut oil that not only gives you quick energy, but also burns fat. Whenever I am lagging, I take a tablespoon of this and within an hour I have tons of energy to get stuff done, or do anything physical such as fast walking, yoga, or dancing.Coconut oil has a long shelf life, and fractionated oil is even more stable. Because of that, you can mix this stuff with essential oils and other ingredients to use it in making toothpaste, skin creams, shampoo, and other nontoxic personal care products. It canbe an ingredient in homemade remedies, since coconut oil is antiviral and antibacterial. It can even be used in sunscreens and cosmetics.Best of all, however, I like to use it instead of cream in my coffee. The fat in the oil helps prevent the insulin response, making it great for keeping fit and healthy.  I was glad to have been given this in exchange for an honest review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I took this about an hour before engaging in a kareeza session. It did help increase the sensitivity. My partner said his orgasm was stronger, as well.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

Chocolate is a super and longevity food, very high in nutrients. Yes, you heard that right: Some of the most long-lived people were chocoholics (including a French woman who lived to be 122, and a Mexican woman still alive at 125).As the author of a couple of diet books and a life-long health enthusiast and foodie, I can attest to the value of chocolate in one's diet. What most people don't realize, though, is that to get the maximum benefit from chocolate, it must be DARK (at least 70% cacao, which is low in sugar) and RAW. This is not only because milk chocolate is high in sugar (which, as we know, is toxic), but also because when any food is heated, many nutrients are destroyed.That makes the FineNaturals Ultra Dark Cocoa Powder superior. It is not only VERY dark, but also organic, raw, unprocessed and unsweetened.Chocolate is also a mood-enhancer, an aphrodisiac (why given at Valentine's Day). Just don't eat it at night as the theobromine (similar to caffeine) might keep you awake.Currently I am on a very low carb diet, and since this chocolate is nearly 100% fat (the GOOD kind of fat), I can eat it to my heart's content. For a quick treat, I mix by spoon a tablespoon of this chocolate with a bit of coconut oil and stevia or a teaspoon of raw honey.I live in Ecuador which is the source of much of the world's chocolate. Unfortunately, the best coffee and best chocolate is exported. So this chocolate actually tastes much better than the chocolate here!Full disclosure: I was given this in exchange for an honest review, and was very happy to get it!Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I love ceramic knives, and this brand is as good as any out there! Ceramic knives are not porous so they don't transfer dirt or grime to the food. It is a clean cut, and this has been demoed by cutting apples with stainless steel vs. ceramic knives: the apples with the stainless steel often turn slightly brown on top after ten minutes or so. But not with the ceramic ones. I had heard that if you accidentally cut yourself with one, you will not bleed. I didn't want to test this, but I did accidentally cut myself and was amazed to find this is true! They do not rust and are very light in weight. They never need to be sharpened! On the downside, though, they do chip at times.I was thrilled to get this in exchange for a review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The LIve Food Factor and several other books

I LOVE this sunscreen. For ONE thing, I live in Ecuador where the sun is  most intense, and I can assure you that my face has been protected (the only place I use it). When I first moved here, I didn't use sun screen and I have many skin spots on my face to prove it!SECOND, I love how this feels on my skin. It is not greasy, but moisturizing. THIRD, the ingredients are nontoxic. This is CRITICAL because much (if not most) of skin cancer comes not from the sun, but the toxic ingredients of the sunscreens! This one contains no PABA, parabens, or fragrance. FOURTH, it is not tested on animals. FIFTH, I love how this sunscreen looks on me. I have tried some that make me look like a vampire! This one does not leave traces of white that are hard to blend in.I was delighted to get this in exchange for an honest review, and plan to buy one when this one runs out.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

This pepper mill is excellent for fresh pepper. I love it as I don't have to crank anything, but just press a button. I was glad to have been given this for a review. It is especially great if someone has arthritis in their hands. Less trouble!Susan Schenck, award-winning author of Beyond Broccoli and several other books

This is a TREMENDOUS boost for orgasm. It didn't work for me and my partner so much for the aphrodisiac increase in desire, but it was very powerful for increasing the duration and intensity of orgasm. I was delighted to have been given this in exchange for an honest review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and other books

This is a very unique fanny pack for a few reasons: It has a loop so you can hang it around the neck, for one. Secondly, it is much bigger and can hold more than most. It's really great for carrying cameras and their accessories. The only issue is that if it IS full, it sticks out a lot. It also has some nice padding, which fanny backs normally don't have but backpacks do.Susan Schenck, award winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I love this belt as it is reversible. But not only that, it has holes all the way through. I gave it to my boyfriend and he adores it. He can get a bit full or gain a few pounds, or lose a few pounds, and still use the belt, since there are holes punched all along! That is the best part. I do with they would make a thinner belt for women, as women's jeans tend to have smaller belt loops. I was so happy to get this in exchange for an honest review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I just love the feel of this truly soft silk pillowcase. It is important for me to use a silk pillowcase as this reduces the amount of  wrinkles under the eyes when you sleep on your side, as opposed to a rougher (even cotton) pillowcase. This one is nice as it zips up, so there is no open end. (I like that as it keeps the pillow cleaner when no dust gets in.) I was very happy when offered this in exchange for a review.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

I was very happy to receive these in exchange for a review. I loooooovvvvveeee chopsticks! They making eating a very slow and conscious event. Chopsticks enable a person to eat just a tiny portion at a time, instead of shoveling a heaping tablespoon at a time into your mouth. These are stainless steel, which means they are dishwasher safe. They are very lightweight, pretty, and easy to use. I not only use them at home, but sometimes even at restaurants. By taking these to Chinese restaurants, I am happy that I don't add to the waste of trees that comes from using the restaurant's disposable chopsticks.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

Rose hip oil used as a facial moisturizer has anti-aging benefits due to the antioxidants and nutrients, which include essential fatty acids, vitamin E, vitamin C and B-carotene, a precursor to vitamin A. The vitamin C helps stimulate collagen production and helps reduce fine lines and wrinkles. This oil is also good for treating sunburn and for diminishing scars. This oil can also be used for the hair: for dull, dry hair, or for dandruff in the hair.I found this particular brand (Jarosa) to be quite soothing for my facial skin. It is organic, cold-pressed and unrefined.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

This is definitely a comprehensive guide to prep for disaster. It includes having a safe room (and how to furnish it), equipment and communication networks to have in place, generators, weapons, food & water storage, and much more. It includes specific preparations needed for the following: hurricanes, tornados,tsunamis, landslides, avalanches, earthquakes, blizzards, volcanic eruptions, wildfires, chemical or biological agents, nuclear war, an asteroid from space, a burning building, and more. Instructions are given for what to do days before, just before, during, shortly after, and well after. It also includes info on how to survive a plane crash, a train wreck, a sinking ship, and a shooting.This is an easy read, and with photos, bullet points, and many useful lists. No wonder it has won nine awards!Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and several other books

Wow, a cleansing oil made from the oils of nuts and seeds. I am very picky about what I put on my skin, as this is the body's largest detoxifier and I sure don't want to add toxins. As a rule, I would not like to put on my skin something I cannot eat, and this sure looks edible! In addition to castor, macadamia, rose hip, and other fine oils, the ingredients I am most impressed with include astaxanthin (which greatly reduces inflammation causing wrinkles), lycopene, lutein and alpha lipoic acid (all fine and natural antioxidants/nutrients). My skin feels great, refreshed and clean when I use this.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor, and other books

This toner feels very refreshing on your skin! I am very picky about what I put on my skin, as this is the body's largest detoxifier and I sure don't want to add toxins. It has rose water as its first ingredient! It includes witch hazel, marine kelp and aloe extract. It feels good to know all the ingredients are natural. IT is suitable for all skin types and it definitely works for mine.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and other books.

I've read hundreds of self help books in my life, and what I loved about this one is that it is an entirely new method I'd never heard of before.Have you ever heard a song that took you to a sad time in your past? You may LOVE the song, but it reminds you of something you'd rather forget, which ruins it for you. Well, author John Benz states that the same thing applies to many of your possessions. They even keep you stuck to an old identity. He recommends clearing the possessions, and tells you step by step how to do it. This leads to real empowerment and transformation.The author has worked with people and by their deciding which ones to let go of, they have changed their lives, even lost weight or made more money or attracted better relationships.If you are worried about the money, he points to how you can sell things on consignment and assures us, "What you put into your Clearing, you will get back many times over."But even more powerful is part 2 in which you learn to clear residual thoughts. He provides again the steps to enable you to confront people, forgive, and apologize. It's like he is holding your hand throughout the process with this book.I am inspired! I plan to use his method to clear with an individual I had a falling out with.Highly recommended if you want to go further in your life and reinvent yourself, freeing yourself from the past! This is way beyond clearing clutter, and gets to the clutter of your heart and mind.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor and other books

While most of us are sleeping, we are on the brink of a sixth extinction. If you have any doubts, read Carlita‚Äôs brilliant book about how we urgently need to take back the planet from all the corporations that are systematically destroying it!As the author puts it:‚ÄúMany people  talk  about  humankind  witnessing  an  apocalypse, however, very few people realize that since the Cretaceous period, we are now living in the Sixth greatest mass extinction of all time.  It is an apocalypse happening in slow motion which affects all of the earth‚Äôs biodiversity which took 3.8 billion years of evolution to form. This extinction differs from previous extinctions in that it is caused by humans, not natural causes, as we are the cause, we can also slow it down or prevent it, if we make big changes. Yet governments are aware of this and we continue to accelerate it, each year, and that affects every single species and ecosystem on the planet.  According to recent scientific data, animals and plants are disappearing at a rate of between 75 and 150 species per day.‚ÄùMonsanto has single-handedly brought Earth‚Äôs life forms to the brink of extinction with GMOs and pesticides that are killing off the bees. (Without bees, we will not be able to eat much apart from grains and grass, two foods which cannot sustain us.)'The Silent Ecocide  deals with exploring solutions to many of humanity's environmental problems, in addition to exploring where we could move forward in human consciousness. The book is based on 15 years of the authors research, interviews and field work as an ecologist.It is an easy read, though not emotionally‚Äîthis book will fully wake you up to how our planet is being stolen from under us as we watch silly programs on TV and play with i-phones.Highly recommended.Susan Schenck, award-winning author of The Live Food Factor, Beyond Broccoli, and Expats in Cuenca.
