The advertised speed was around 4 seconds, and on average my readings took about 7-8 seconds.  Given performance, I felt like I did not get what I paid for.  So for how quickly it actually measures the temp, I'd say it's way over priced.Still, I like it and use it to measure bean temperature in my DIY coffee roaster, however I do have to account for the extra delay I was hoping was much shorter.  It was a gamble that didn't pay off.  Had I known this, I would have just gotten one of the $30 units that also claim to 4 second readings.

I like everything about this hub. It has ample amounts of ports for my device-heavy needs.  And all seem to be properly detected without issue on my computer (running Windows 8.1).The only issue I discovered was when I was coping files to multiple hard disks simultaneously. One device shut disconnected automatically, leaving a file corrupted on the disk.  I realize then that the power supply provided was only 2.5Amps, which is very little considering how many devices this thing is capable of.  This is a big caveat for folks who intend to use this for doing things like testing (I'm a tester by trade) many devices, or are a hardcore power user that needs access to all of their devices constantly and/or multiple devices simultaneously.Anyway I hope I can find an after market power supply to meet my needs but that should not have been the case.  Still I imagine anyone who might need something this big *is* a power user.  So, as they say on the internets, YMMV (your mileage may vary)

I gave this to my little niece for her birthday yesterday and she spent the entire afternoon  playing with it. She absolutely loves it.  She loves to sing and the songs are great.  By the end of the evening she had memorized several of the songs!  What an amazing 4 year old!The product is really cute, and well thought out. the buttons are very bright and easy to press.  The volume wasn't too loud so the rest of the adults had no problem socializing at the party while the songs played literally every few minutes.  There are quite a good amount of songs in this toy, which kept her playing with it the entire afternoon.

I've gone through many FoodSaver bag sizes, and this size is by far the most common size I reach for.  Typically I'll buy a pack of four steaks at Costco, and when I get home I use two of them and put the other two in one of these bag for the freezer.It's perfect for two small steaks or 1 very large (24oz) steak.Never had a problem with genuine FoodSaver brand bags. Always reliable.  I once tried aftermarket brand (Vac Pak) but my sealer seemed to be too hot for those bags, so I am sticking with the original manufacturer for them.  The may be slightly more expensive than generic ones but they've always worked well.

I really want to love this mouse.  Here's why:1. Even for my small hands, its profile follows the curvature of my hands quite readily.2. Lots of genuinely usable buttons.  Too many gaming mice have buttons just for the sake of having buttons however I find they are poorly laid out. The button layout on this mouse was well thought out.  Even with my small hands I had no issues accessing them.3. Design. It looks spectacular.  One of the better looking gaming mice, IMO, with the ultra cool matte black, vibrant red accents, and RBG lighting.4. DPI indicator lets you quickly know exactly which setting you're on so when you're selecting it there's no guessing like on many other mice, where it's a trial and error just to find out if you're at the lowest or highest setting.  Here you have explicit LEDs for each level of DPI.5. VERY fast mouse.  The polling rate is great and immediately noticeable as soon as I watched the cursor move across my screen.  It's so smooth, like it's rendering at 120hz6. Very cool looking, high quality braided cord.  And even better red/black color combo coincidently matched my favorite pair of Vans sneakers.7.  Instead of soft touch coating, they use a grippy texture coating for the matte black paint.So, why the low score?  What gives?!!The two issues I have with it are entirely tactile issues.First of all it feels REALLLLY cheap.  I know it's only a $45 mouse but that doesn't change this fact or how I feels in my hand, or how I feel about it. There is a hollowness about it that can only be experienced. I will try my best to explain it. It feels like cheap plastic and just looking at the red plastic you can tell it's cheap.  And every time you pick it up and set it down, there's a vibration it produces as if the internals weren't secured very well to the casing. In fact every time I pick it up and I set it down I feel the vibration of the internals reverberate through every fingertip.  Tactile sensation is extremely important with an input device, and any really good gaming mouse *just has to* feel solid.  This one doesn't, not by a long shot.  It's true what they say, you get what you pay for.But even worse, was that despite the grippy texture, the shape of the mouse makes it rather difficult to pick up without really having to squeeze the sides.  A good gaming mouse needs to be sculpted in a manner that not only feels natural, but can be gently lifted with little effort.  If you look at the front or rear profile straight-on, you will see that it see that all of the slopes with exception to the button yoke around the thumb, are sloped outward towards the table, so lifting the mouse requires some effort.  Picking any object up without some form of an under-curve means it requires you to lift up entirely with your grip rather than some of the weight resting on your hand. mice have an inward curve for this reason.  Having to actually grip the mouse to lift it is probably something I might get used to over time, but right now I feel my ring and pinky fingers sliding up on the mouse as I lift it. This has greatly impacted my performance in nearly every single game that requires rapid mouse movements which defeats the purpose of buying a gaming mouse by making me a worse player than I was.  My plan to correct this is to use Sugru to create a small ridge or overhang, if you will, along the the outermost finger contour so it 'hooks' onto my fingers, so I can lift it effortlessly.While I don't want to pay $90 for gaming mouse, the reality is you get what you pay for.  I own an Roccat Tyon gaming mouse and is as solid as ti gets, in quality (hardware AND software), features, and performance. A truly astounding piece of tech.  I cheaped out and bought this one to use for work, not really wanting to spend another $90 for the Tyon for just occasional gaming, but I realize there's really no other way around it. If you want good quality you gotta pay for it.  It is heads and shoulders above any mouse I've used, including the legendary Razer Death Adder which itself is a truly spectacular mouse, in terms of ergonomics and performance. It's the mouse I would definitely get if I wanted just a basic gaming mouse.

3:35 Mins The biggest draw for me was the sound output as the majority of HDMI to VGA adapters available didn't support sound..  Unfortunately the only one other I was able to found (and bought) did not work well. It was a LinkS-Active adapter; while it only cost me 9 bucks the video annoyingly kept re-syncing.  It's true what they say--you get what you pay for!Anyway I bought this so I could repurpose my old VGA projector to stream Netflix in my upstairs bedroom.  It worked great!  Before I did this, I conducted tested with my old Dell VGA monitor, as you will see (or saw) in my video review.The only problem I ran into was trying to use this on my JVC TV that had a VGA port.  It didnt' work as the resolution was not supported. So it turns out that whatever video source you intend to use should also be supported by the monitor you are using.. Not all VGA displays support HD resolutions (apparently my TV didn't).  I'm not sure how common that is, but it's a caveat you should keep in mind.  This device will not scale the video signal for you. It is sends the complete HDMI source as it is designed.Anyway I hope this review was helpful!  If you have any questions feel free to shoot me a comment.

All I had to do is plug this into my existing router (switch, actually) and connect to the WiFi hotspot "TRENDnet820_5GHz_V6ZS" using the password printed on the top of the doodad, and VIOLA!  My piss-poor 2.4ghz 802.11g connection is history!  The TRENDnet gave me double bandwidth, kicking it up to 90-94Mbps from a highly fluctuating 18-37Mbps on 2.4Ghz.For those of you who want to know how to diagnose and choose the right channel feel free to shoot me a comment and I'll post instructions on how to choose the best channel for your WiFi connection.  You might not even need this.

5:15 MinsLet me be clear and state something everyone should know: USB 2.0 is not exactly fast and will never get you the maximum speed that you get from a typical LAN connection.  This is not the fault of the device but the limitation of the USB 2.0 interface.Know what you're buying.  If at all possible buy a USB 3.0 network adapter, even if you don't have a USB 3.0 adapter, because at some point you will upgrade and be able to use it with the faster port.  There is really no reason you need to buy a USB 2.0 network adapter, when a 3.0 version exist for the same price.  Get this one: http://www.amazon.com/StarTech-com-Gigabit-Ethernet-Network-Adapter/dp/B0095EFXMCThat said, I am reviewing this for Amazon, based on how it functions.  It is slow, but again that's a limitation of the USB 2.0 spec, and applicable to any USB 2.0 device.  The first thing you will notice is that your connection speed may be lower than what you have available.  If you have a 100/20 Mbps internet connection, it shouldn't be that big of a drop.  But if you have a 300/20 like me, you will see it drop down to 90 (as demonstrated in the video).  Like I said, know what you're buying.This will certainly work for a game console network adapter, but as I stated, get the USB 3.0 version.  There really is no reason you should prefer this one based on really old tech.Anyway watch the video and let me know if you have any questions.

3:05 MinsThere are so many fails with this mop system I think giving it two stars is being generous!FAIL #1: The Two bucket system is pointless. Water will get dirty the moment you rinse.FAIL #2: Leaks like crazy.  Watch in my video when I spin the mop. It stars to leak from both sides.FAIL #3: You run out of detergent very quickly. To counter this, you could get your hands dirty by fumbling around with it to get it separated, then pulling the plug to return the water back into the first bucket.  Nonsense!Fortunately there are literally dozens spin mops on the market that do the same thing, and not surprisingly, none of them have this bone-head two-bucket design.Do yourself a favor, spend the extra $10 and get yourself this one:  http://amzn.to/1M4iTvIThe Twist and Shout is the best selling one on the market for good reason. For starters it has a much deeper single-bucket design that will hold 4 times the amount of detergent as this one. And the spin basket is much deeper (to prevent splashing). And it's balanced.  And you don't have to fumble with plugs or taking it apart when emptying it. And you never "run out" of water because its a one bucket design as they all should be.

2:10 Mins Hi guys, here's a quick look of this Catville Condo I got courtesty of Amazon Vine.The assembly was very simple but did take a while, in all about 30 minutes taking your time. Maybe faster had my dog stop wanting to go into it while I set it up hahaAnyway I hope the video helps but in case you can't see it, here's a quick summary:Pros:1. Uncomplicated assembly2. Very light and can be moved from place to place3. Provides nice shading and privacy4. Looks great for indoor use.5. Integrated features such as the scratch post and hanging furr ball are a nice touches.6. Mat bed affixed with velcro and can be easily removed and washed.7. My dog likes it too.  I think she'll be use it more, than my cat, actually .Cons:Can't think of any honestly. For what it does, it does perfectly and I can't really wrong with it. It can certainly be improved but not without increasing the price. It would have been nice if it came with an additional bed cushion, however it's no too hard to lay  down a towel or other cushion.Anyway my cat hasn't gotten acclimated to it yet so at the moment my dog is using it mostly.  In any case I will continue observe how it performs and provide a long term update in a few months.Feel free to shoot me any questions.

So, the last time I reviewed one of these was for a Norelco 9300 system (you can check out that review here: http://amzn.to/1KD6gXQ).  That one seemed to not work too well.  Strangely with all of the advances I found myself not getting a really clean shave, at least not without standing there for what seemed to be an eternity.Well along comes this Remington WetTech Rotary. Wow. What a big difference from the Norelco .  It shaved about twice as fast.  While the shave was still no where in the ball park of efficiency of a classic foil shaver (I still use my Panasonic classic shaver, over 10 years now!), it faired considerably better than the insanely expensive Norelco (MSRP@$250).  It taught me that in the world of shaving, the more bells and whistles, it seems, the worse the shaver actually is!Anyway, while my go-to shaver will still be my 10-year-old classic single foil shaver, this one is going into my gym bag, as I will use taking my sweet time in the shower after work.A week of shaving is not enough for me to give a truly accurate assessment of this razor, especially because any time you switch to a new shaver your skin needs to adjust..  So to be fair I won't give this razor a bad rating however I am required to rate this razor with a shorter timeframe than I actually need.  So I give it a four stars to start, and in about 3 months, I will provide an update on my real-world experience with this razor and update my rating if needed.From my purely empirical observations, the razor is well built, and is still running strong after an entire week. I had not recharged it since my first use, so it's really good to have high capacity razor.Keep in mind though that this battery WILL NOT LAST given it is lithium ion.  Most people don't know this but Lithium battery chemistry (all lithium batteries such as LiFeP04, LiMnO2, Li-Ag2CrO4, etc etc), while they have incredible retention, losing only 1-2% per year of inactivity,  have a limitation in that they will naturally start to degrade after 18-24 months, regardless of use, so after a few years, the battery is toast and will need replacing, whereas NiCd batteries willl remain usable so long as they are used regularly and drained completely once or twice a year).  My classic shaver is a Panasonic ES3041 and as you might have guessed, runs on nickel-cadnium battery.  So if longevity is something you care about you might consider a model with a replaceable battery (or one that runs on NiCd). These types of devices do one thing and that never changes, so you don't want to buy another one for as long as possible as the cost of electric razors has increased 5x over the last 10 years.  (My Panasonic ES3041 cost me $40 in 2005,  but the lithium version of it, ES3041K today costs $200).Anyway enough rationalization about the battery.  Moving on, it is pretty heavy but comfortable and not too heavy.  The pop-up trimmer could be a little wider. Lastly the thing, given the design of these types of disc blade razors, is very loud by comparison.I will update my  review in a few months, so check back at the end of the year if you're interested.I hope this helped.

There is nothing special about this sleeve case.  Just a neoprene sleeve and zipper.  But it doesn't need to be special.  It works exactly as you expect it would.As for construction, it's good.  no open seams inside. My Surface pro fits perfectly inside and the thickness of the neoprene is more than enough to prevent its precious lightweight cargo from damage.It could have been a bit more snug but I think the reason they made it a little looser is for eased of opening and to minimize rubbing of the inner plate of the zipper against the device.But is it worth the $29.99 asking price? Hell no. This thing probably cost less than $1 to manufacture in China.  There are a thousand knockoffs exactly like it. In fact I would not call them knockoffs because this is probably the same item except with a brand label.If the price doesn't bother you, it's a perfectly good sleeve.  But if you want something of better quality and is 1/4 the price, get Amazon's version for $6.50 here: http://www.amazon.com/AmazonBasics-DZS1311197-10-Inch-Tablet-Sleeve/dp/B00I8T4PUG/ref=sr_1_2?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1438159281&sr=1-2&keywords=neoprene+tablet+sleeve

I have a few Kill-A-Watt meters that are great but I find the display quite often very limiting because it is right on the unit.  This monitor has a remote corded display that you can place anywhere within the vicinity of the device you are monitoring.So for what it does it does quite well, but it's really mnssing a few things:- a means for mounting the display on a vertical surface. It is oddly shaped and can only sit on top of something. It's also quite round so it can be quite wobbly if moved.-show how many amps the device is pulling. This can be derived mathematically with the information given (using ohms law formulas), but such information should have been easily assertained.  Amps are important because you want to tally the total amperage being pulled by all devices on the socket so as to avoid exceeding the maximum amperage (15 or 20 depending on the breaker), to prevent tripping the breaker.-backlit display.-built in fuse for safety

Awesome grinder.  The burrs are ceramic white and very sharp.  While I have several travel grinders (OE Lido 2, Porlex, Hario Mini Mill), I think this compares very favorably to the Porlex. In fact the grounds are excellent. I think this would easily replace my Porlex for several reasons- first adjustment was much easier to dial in the grind than on my porlex. Second, the cap is not super tight, it was actually quite easy to remove yet tapered in a way that kept it confidently secured (on both ends).  I really do appreciate the clear window on the side.  The window isn't a necessity but a nice to have-something I appreciate greatly having used the window-less porlex.I made several pour overs at work this past week and I can say without doubt this performs just as well as any of my other grinders, Lido 2 included.Anyway for the price I think you will be quite pleased.

Loved this!!  A wonderful holiday tale of two people who have endured years of Christmas heartache but somehow find each other this year putting the Christmas curse to rest for good.  Emily and Griffen are great together and both deserve happiness, especially this time of year.  A great lazy day read.  I definitely recommend it.

Excellent read! With four hot Wilde brothers, the series should be very entertaining.  In this story we have Cooper Wilde coming home to help the brothers out with the family business.  He never expects Riley Smith and has no idea how is world is about to change. Lies of omission may end things before they have a real chance to begin.  This one was very entertaining.  It did move a bit fast in the lust to love department but overall a good read.  I would definitely recommend it.

Sexy hot, emotional, well written, and a group of characters that had me from the first page! Loved that Ben had to work to make up for his past with Mia - jerk!  What a great couple they make in the end. This is my first from this author and I feel in love with their writing style.  Can't wait to dive into more.

They are true opposites. Andree Bancroft has lived a sheltered quiet life on St. Barthelemy and Maximillian Chanteur is a world famous singer/composer that needs to get away from his life and just be for a while. Will they be able to find happiness as long as they are together. This is a wonderful story of finding love and discovering exactly what's important in life. I would recommend this one.

This was a very enjoyable read.  I would have like the female lead character Emily to be a bit stronger but overall I enjoyed the characters and the story very much.  Ed and Emily were teenage sweethearts but when he wanted her to leave small hometown with him eight years ago and she wouldn't he left and never looked back.  Ed's never forgotten her though and now he's back and will do whatever it takes to get another chance with her.  There is a little problem though.  She's with someone else and is pregnant.  Will this stop him???  I recommend you grab this one and find out.  It's a great read.

Absolutely fantastic!!  I didn't think I could love characters more than Drew and Anna from book 1 in this series (The Hook Up) but was I wrong.  Gray Grayson is perfection.  Sexy, sweet, loving.  I could go on and on.  Gray and Ivy's story is filled with fun witty banter, sexy times, and just a slight bit of angst.  Ivy's put Gray firmly in the friend zone but he has no intention of stay there.  Will she be able to resist him?? Hell no!!  This is definitely one I recommend.

This book completely blew me away! It is one of those that you consume in one sitting. There's no way your putting it down!! Fantastic writing made this fast paced story feel incredibly real. Cora's determination, dedication, and unflappable belief in her brother was amazing. Someone like her is who you want on your side. Always. From the moment Leo sees Cora he's a goner, but when he really gets to know her he knows he will never meet any else like her. The way they investigate and unravel the truth was fantastic. And now the long arduous wait for Beau's story *sigh* ok not that long but still....A great romantic suspense read that I recommend to everyone!

Loved this story! While it may be the typical brother's best friend trope with a twist, the excellent storytelling of the author and the great characters she created made this book a notch above the others. I could feel the conflict Andrew had between going for happiness with Jenna and the fear of losing the only family he really has. Jenna and Andrew's chemistry could be felt through the pages. There simply was no denying it and the family's reaction was perfect. This is a great read and one I will be recommending to everyone.

I love these Cold Creek holiday stories and this one is no exception. This one has us back on the Christmas Ranch. Celeste has always been happy living in the background but when her children's book character really takes off she is the spotlight whether she wants it or not. When Flynn Delaney (Celeste's teenage crush) comes back to town with his young daughter Celeste is immediately drawn to both of them. Could there be another holiday romance brewing??? You definitely want to grab a copy of this one and find out. I highly recommend it!

Awesome read!! Jeannie Moon brings us another well crafted story with a strong independent female lead character and a sexy, powerful, and slightly troubled male lead.Leah learned the hard way that work and relationships don't mix. So now she's completely focused on her career with no time for anything else. When she meets Tristan Ward, Reliance Software's new CFO, and sparks fly she decides that maybe she has time for a little fun. No strings type of fun only! When things start heating up and feelings begin to develop with Tristan, will she be able to trust her heart or are there things she doesn't know that will once again burn her???Definitely one you want on your must read list! I highly recommend it.

Really enjoyed this one! It's a quick read novella but it's packed with a wonderful story of past loves, betrayal, forgiveness, and new beginnings. Fifteen years of hard work have gotten Erik and Beryl exactly what they'd hoped for. They just always thought they would do it together but a decision all those years ago to put career ahead of love has kept them apart. Now they are working in the same office and keeping the past and present separate proves difficult.A great quick read perfect for the holiday season. I highly recommend it.

A Love to Last is the first book in what promises to be a great new series. Set in small town Prophecy, Texas it's filled with fun, quirky characters all of which are counting on the new Prophecy bootmaker to help save the town. Delaney Shields is back in Prophecy for a quick visit with Whit Maddox then she's on her way to an around the world trip she's been planning forever. The last person she wants to see is Cal Maddox, Whit's son and the only man who has owned her heart. Cal's roots are deep in Texas soil though and no way can Delaney stay in one place for long. When Whit implies that Delaney is the next Prophecy bootmaker, all she can think about is getting out of town. NOW! A sense of duty and a strong desire for Cal has her sticking around for a while. But for how long???This is a fantastic small town romance with just a bit of magic tossed in! Great writing and characters make this one you want to read. I highly recommend it.

I must say that until reading this book I had never heard of live action role playing (LARP). I can't say I completely understand the appeal but I at least understand the concept now, so for me this one was a bit educational! On top of learning something new, I got a fun, sexy romance with a ton of suspense and action thrown in. There's great chemistry between Carlos and Miko which has the pages sizzling! Even if your as naive as I was about the LARP world, you will still enjoy this one. I highly recommend it.

What a truly FUN read!! How would it feel to walk onto the set of a reality dating show you agreed to do for charity and see the one man who completely broke your heart standing there as the bachelor?? That's exactly what happens to Rochelle Ransom. Grant Drake ripped her heart out when they were in college so she's not sure she can go through with this. But when the producer guarantees her double the prize money win or lose, she's determined to exact a little revenge and get herself kicked off the show. Things don't work out quite as planned though....This fun, light read had me laughing out loud at Rochelle's antics. She and Grant were great together and made the book very entertaining. This is one I highly recommend!

This was an awesome read! A great blend of small town romance, a bit of angst, a touch of drama, and a whole lot of forgiveness. Savannah and Logan are great characters. I fell in love with Logan right away. Savannah took a little time to warm up to but in the end I adored her. This one gives us a great lesson of moving on with life and going after what you really want.Definitely one I recommend!

Alex McAllister has built a good life for her and her adopted daughter Cassie. While it's not without it's challenges they are happy and that's what matters. All that is threatened when a knock on the door brings a man in to their lives who claims he might be Cassie's father. Hayden Brooks is rich, powerful, and devastatingly handsome. He never planned on being a father but if Cassie is his, he plans on being there for her and raising her himself. After getting Alex to agree to a paternity test and waiting for the results, Hayden spends time with Alex and Cassie and comes to realize what an incredible bond they have and that he desperately wants to share in that bond. Can he change his life to accommodate them? Will Alex let him regardless of the test results?This is a wonderful story filled with great characters. It's a happy light read that you won't be able to put down. I highly recommend it.

This is a cute sweet read that has a couple of science nerds that are deeply attracted to each other. However, because of their personal baggage and job situation they try fighting the attraction with everything they've got. In the end though, the heart wants what the heart wants.While there is nothing really wrong with this story, it just didn't have the tug on the heartstrings I've come to expect from one of Ophelia London's books. It left me wanting just a bit more from the story. I was impressed with the way the author talked about one of the characters dealing with depression and the overall hope that chocolate could potentially help with that issue.Again, it didn't completely work for me but for anyone who enjoys sweet reads this may be perfect for you!

What an amazing read!! This book grabbed me from the very first page and there was no way I was putting it down until I knew what happened! The writing was superb, the characters fascinating, and the pace of the book is perfect. Rhy was a bit of jerk at the beginning but by the end I was in love. I love a book with a strong female character and trust me that description fits Nicole perfectly. She's a courageous and determined mama bear that will do anything to protect her child.This one should be at the top of the must read list! I HIGHLY recommend it.

An excellent read. I definitely would consider this more a romance than a romantic suspense. While it does have a suspense element to it and the ending of the book is exciting, there's not a lot of suspense or action in the middle of the story. It's a good opposites attract story Mary Alice is a pre-school teacher living a very conservative, protected life. Bridger is an undercover cop and works his way into her life to keep an eye on her neighbor. While they are very different there is still a spark of awareness and the more time they spend together the hotter the flame. One problem! She doesn't really know who or what he is and when she finds out all bets will be off.This is a very good read that I would definitely recommend.

This is an absolutely fantastic story filled with so much emotion you will need a tissue or two.  Never fear though, they are happy tears.  Its a story of a woman returning home after a terrifying injury in the military.  With a touch of PTSD, a new prosthesis, and an overprotective family, Maggie Benson isn't sure she will ever feel whole again.  Yet with the love and support of her family, friends, and a wonderful man by the name of Will Fitzgerald, she slowly finds herself feeling more confident everyday and dare she say happy??This is a wonderful story of bravery, hope, and love.  The perfect pick me up after the stress filled days during the holidays.  I definitely recommend this one for everyone's must read list.

Samantha Whitley has had one heck of a bad year. All she wants now is to get home to her family and enjoy the holidays. She can't believe her bad luck is continuing when she boards her flight only to find the man who broke her hear last Christmas in the seat next to her.Jase MacGregor can't believe his good luck. After deciding to return to his hometown and win back the girl of his dreams, he's shocked to find out she's on the same flight in the seat right next to his. Unfortunately, if her reaction to him on the plane is anything to go on, winning her back may be a little harder than he thought.I loved this wonderful story. Sam and Jase where great characters. The story is filled with snark, humor, forgiveness, and a bit of holiday magic. Definitely one I recommend.

Can I please please please give this book more than 5 stars???? I read a lot of books every year and enjoy the vast majority. Every once in a while, I read a book that really gets in my heart and doesn't let go. This is one of those books. While I normally fall in love with the hero in the romances I read, and trust me I am crushing hard on Curran, I must say it was Tess that completely stole my heart in this one. With the life she has endured, you couldn't blame her if she were bitter, nasty, and broken. Yet she is kind, loving, and strong. It seems that they were brought together at the exact time they needed to help the other heal.This is a fantastic story that is definitely on my top 5 this year and going on my re-read shelf!!And the truly wonderful part? There are so many O'Brien stories yet to come!

I'm really torn writing this review. I want to be fair to the author. The writing is very well done. There's great character development, nice pace to the story, and sadly I must admit the story itself is something that occurs all the time so it's definitely real. In addition to that, it definitely evoked a ton of emotions. So for all that, kudos to the author. Very well done.The story itself, however, I hated. While infidelity may occur all the time, it obviously is a real hot button for me. I tried to like these characters but in my opinion, Doug is a pig and deserves whatever heartbreak he gets. Marci I just wanted to take by the shoulders and shake. HARD! Jake, the only main character I really liked, I just wanted to give a big hug to and tell him to move on. This story for me just didn't give me the escape I look for while reading a great book. Quite frankly it just made me mad. The author did wrap the story up nicely and give me the HEA I crave but it still wasn't enough.

After the worst year of her life Angelique Barbetta needs a break. So when her law firm sends her to Red River to handle a case for them she jumps at the opportunity. If there's one thing Angelique knows it's that she's damn good at her job. In the past year she's dealt with breast cancer and a cheating fiancee. This case, piece of cake. That is until she meets Blake Holloway. He's one of the townspeople who stands to lose everything if they lose the case. Too bad the attraction between them is so strong. As Blake tries to show Angelique all that is good about Red River and exactly what her client is trying to take, feelings begin to blossom which leaves Angelique with some big decisions to make.This was a delightful story that is very well written. It took me a while to really warm up to Angelique but I loved Blake right from the start. It did have parts of the story that seemed to drag a little but nothing too bad. Overall a very good read and I would definitely recommend it.

I absolutely adored this book! It needs to go on everyone's must read list. It's the first full book in the new Echo Lake series and with all the incredible secondary characters, this should be a fantastic series.In this story we meet Ethan Miller and Josie Kendrew. High school sweethearts with big plans. At least Ethan thought so until the day Josie left and never came back. She's back now but very different from the girl that left. While her father recovers, Josie is forced to work for Ethan at the family business. However, the longer they spend time together and get to know each other again, the more surprises there are. Biggest surprise of all?? Sometimes love never goes away.This story is filled with emotion, humor, and a fantastic small town I can't wait to visit again. I highly recommend this one.

The King brothers couldn't leave Destiny, Nevada in their dust fast enough. The town always thought of them as trash and Colt King has been trying to prove they are better than that his whole life. Now they are back in town because when their elderly aunt beckons them back home they have no choice. They owe her everything. When he enters the old home and comes face to face with the loaded end of a shotgun, he should have known his world would never be the same. Zanna Jacobs is not even close to being his type but there is just something about her. You'll want to read this one and see how these two argue, fight, and love their way in to a happily ever after.A very entertaining read that I highly recommend!

This is the tenth book in the Eternity Springs series and I think each book just keeps getting better and better. And no one needs the healing powers of Eternity Springs like Daniel Garrett and Shannon O'Toole. Both have suffered tremendous loss in their lives and now live sheltered and hidden lives. Together, with the help of the residents of Eternity Springs, perhaps they can put the past where it belongs and begin living for the future. Or can they???Loved this story! It is packed with a ton of emotion, both heartache and joy. This one needs to be on everyone's must read list!! I highly recommend it.

After an NFL career-ending knee injury, Alec Grayson is back in his hometown of Falcon, Alabama. When his career ended he found out who his true friends were as well as discovering a heartbreaking betrayal by his family. Now he lives his life alone never getting to close to anyone. Working his day job and coaching the quarterbacks at the local high school is enough for him. That is until Lilliana Hancock blow into his life. She's in Falcon trying to restore the family mansion and turn it into a B&B. After spending the last few years in NY as a struggling artist, she's ready for something new. When long ago crush Alec Grayson shows up at her door to do an inspection things really get crazy for both of them!I really loved this story! While there is a wonderful romance at the core of the story there is so much more. That's what is enjoyable about this series of books. If you haven't read the other books in the series, no problem. Each stands alone. The characters are great and the pace is perfect. Definitely a must read. I highly recommend it.

A hilarious look at a young woman's journey to find satisfying sexual experience. This author's sense of humor is outrageously funny. In this her second book, Ellie is now out of school, working an unpaid internship, and sharing a flat with three of her friends. I really enjoyed her in Virgin but I found her slightly annoying in this book. While I didn't personally care for this story overall, it was extremely funny.

A very enjoyable quick sexy read! After the death of his wife two years ago, Carter Christensen has been struggling through life, doing the best he could raising his twin daughters. He doesn't think he will ever meet anyone who will interest him or stir his heart. That is until he meets Tess Adams. The new owner of the cottage next door to his lake place. She definitely has his interests and she's stirring all sorts of body parts! Can he get over his fear of loving and losing again??I really loved this one. My only complaint is that it is too short. Definitely needed more Carter!I highly recommend this one.

Another incredible holiday read from Tule Publishing!  Celebrating Christmas isn't something Jenna McIntosh generally does.  Being estranged from her father, the only family she has left, doesn't leave her in a celebratory mood.  This year however, she finds herself stuck in a cabin on a tree farm, with one very sexy (if somewhat grumpy) Sawyer Gallagher. Attraction and chemistry are not to be denied with these two and they soon find themselves hoping for more.  Will good intentions get in their way??  You want to grab a copy of this one and find out.  You won't be disappointed.  I highly recommend it.

I loved this one!  Emma McGregor has a a very bad time of late. First she suffered a life changing health problem then on the day of her wedding she overhears her fiancee confiding that he really doesn't want to marry her.  His plan is to go ahead with the ceremony then dump her in a few months. Definitely not the way to start out a new life. One long car drive later she finds herself in Marietta.  In need of a job and a place to stay. Luckily for her she stumbles upon the very helpful Mitch Holden and her life will never be the same.This is a fun, light, hope filled read that will definitely cheer your day.  I highly recommend it.

An awesome story that gripped me from the very first page. Superbly written with great characters make this one for the reread shelf!Crown Prince Demetrius Castanavo takes his position very very seriously so when he requests Zoe Sarris' interior design services she's shocked. Even more shocking is the fact that their secret marriage was never annulled and he plans on getting her back!This is one I recommend for everyone!

An excellent addition to the Bar V 5 series.  This is a heartwarming story and perfect for an afternoon read that will help you capture the holiday feeling.  The always chipper Ellie and the grumpy scrooge like Josiah were perfect for each other.  This is one I highly recommend.

A wonderfully heartwarming holiday read.  Willa and her young son Scout have had their share of bad times.  After making it through years of fighting cancer Scout is now healthy and ready to be like every other kid, Willa however still has a little trouble believing everything is ok.  The vacation trip that was left to her along with a check and an heirloom ring by one of her patients is just what they both need.  The last thing she expected was to meet Finn Knightly. He's kind, gentle and treats Scout like gold.  But neither is completely honest with the other.  Can their budding relationship survive their secrets?This is one I definitely recommend.

What an awesome read!  A very unique storyline and amazing characters pull you into this one and keep you there until the end.  After spending three years in prison for a crime she wasn't guilty of you would expect Lacey to be bitter and angry but she isn't.  Well maybe a little angry but she puts it behind her. And being crazy attracted to the person who arrested her originally is nuts, but the heart wants what the heart wants.A truly great story of forgiveness, hope, and love.  I highly recommend this one!

This is a wonderful feel good story that keep you chuckling and definitely lighten your mood. Set in a quaint little town, the author's very descriptive writing style made to town come to life in my mind. The characters are all a bit wacky, a lot lovable, and definitely entertaining.Libby Joseph is a romance writer who has been living in White Cliff Bay for months while writing her latest book. She believes that to write about a place you really need to live there a while. While living there she has meet a lot of great people who are now truly her friends. Her best friend would be George, her zany next door neighbor. George is head over heels for Libby but lacks the confidence to ask her for more. Libby is always encouraging him to date so he convinces her to "pretend" date him so he can learn exactly how to do it! It's fun to watch as this pretend relationship turns into much much more, but will Libby be willing to stay?A very entertaining holiday read I highly recommend!

FROSH is a unique, fun look at the lives of four young people as they make their way through their first year of college. It's unique because it is written from the POV of all 4 main characters.  There's Ellie - the good girl.  Always tries to do the right thing although she may want something else entirely.  Then we have Grant the jock.  Not your typical jock though.  He's smart, determined, and not as committed to the game as some the others.  My personal fav Charlie is the geeky science guy, thrown into the frat house for his GPA and tutoring. Lastly and my least favorite, there's Devon.  The rich mean girl with a bit of a wild streak.  Or is there more to Devon then she let's people see??I really liked this one.  I found the author's writing style very enjoyable and considering this is her debut novel, I'm expecting great things in the future.  While the 4 person POV was a bit confusing in the beginning, once I got all the characters straight it worked out great!This is one I definitely recommend.

An awesome story that reminds us that sometimes, when we least expect it, the one thing we really need in our lives can show up very unexpectedly!  This is a light quick read that left me smiling!  It's well written, has great characters and is one you will want to read.Alex Cortes is happy with his life.  Good career, plenty of women, and his heart is safe.  On a rainy Christmas Eve, Georgiana Kincaid shows up on his doorstep and his carefully crafted life will never be the same.I definitely recommend this one!

Loved! These! Books! And to get them all together in one bundle - perfect. This books contain the story of Cade Michaelson and Hannah Martin through various stages of their relationship.  From simple flirting to wedding day bliss with a ton of memories and good times (and bad) between.  I read each of these books individually and had to endure the wait for the next book.  With this set you have their entire story at your fingertips.  I highly recommend this set!

A very enjoyable book filled with some of the best sounding food around, some very likable characters, some not so likable characters, and a great deal of humor. Kelly seems to have everything, a great job, a committed boyfriend, and a well planned out life. It's all just a bit....boring! When her mother passes away and leaves her a letter telling her that she needs to shake up her life a bit and a phone call comes about an amazing ghost writing opportunity in London, she takes it as a sign that she needs to go for it. This will send her on a journey that will test her patience, culinary skills, and her heart.I thought this one was very well done. While I sometimes questioned Kelly's choices, in the end she found her strength and did what was right for her. I would recommend this one.

I loved it! It's the holiday season in Icicle Falls and the craziness is in full swing. There is no place in town that's as crazy as Candy Cane Lane. This is the story of three women, each trying to juggle the stresses of life, deal with crazy neighbors, and stay sane enough to still have a life!I absolutely adored this book. It had me chuckling all the way through and really helped rev me up for the holiday season ahead. This one needs to go on everyone's must read list. I highly recommend it.

Awesome book!  Years ago after a drunken night in Vegas Cameron Ondine and Zach Anderson secretly married.  Three days later it was over.  Yet after all this time, they are both wildly affected by that crazy event as well as each other.  Now as a sports reporter Cameron finds herself stuck on assignment covering the Sharks training camp and of course Zach is one of the defensive stars!  Their reunion after all this time makes this one fantastic read.  I highly recommend it!

A fun addition to a great series. This friends to lovers story is a sexy quick read that was completely entertaining.  Mick and Jan were great together with some sizzling hot chemistry.  This is one I definitely recommend.

This was a truly fun read! Sounds crazy since it's a story filled with strip bars, murder, and the mob but the characters involved are fun and light and the humor the author writes into the story keep it very interesting.Cassidy Jones is a cop looking to move up in her career. When the opportunity to work undercover comes up, she grabs at the chance. She working as a stripper while investigating a murder that occurred at the club. She expects to find a slimy old guy as the owner, not the over the top hot Lorenzo Polonco. Since she's never been one to push her libido aside, this could be a problem! As they get closer she knows she has to find a way to solve the case and keep Lorenzo. Easier said than done!This is a great read. I highly recommend it.

Holly and Roth are best of friends. They tell each other everything, hang out together, and agree that when it comes to relationships, it's not for either of them. Tired of all the fix-ups by well meaning family members, they agree to be each others plus one. No strings, no attachments, perfect! Until that one night....I really loved this story. Loved the interaction between Holly and Roth. The humor and closeness between the two was very believable. The evolution of their relationship was very interesting and probably more typical than we would all like to think. When communication shuts down and you start running scared nothing good can come of it. This book is very well done and I would recommend it to everyone.

Anna Weber is the new librarian in town and she fits the role perfectly. Conservative dress, quiet, old fashioned, but there's something about her that draws the attention of one very sexy Cowboy! Problem is, Anna has secrets. Those secrets make letting anyone get too close impossible. Cowboy is outgoing, fun, with a personality and reputation as big as Texas itself. He's determined to get to know Anna and he want's to know everything! Can she be the one woman who could tame this wild Cowboy or will her past and her secrets keep them apart???This was an amazing read and it had a bit of everything. A bit of mystery, a bit of suspense, and a whole lot of romance and sexy times! It's very well written and the story will grab you from the beginning and keep you turning page after page. I love this group of characters and Cowboy is one of my favorites. So happy his story is as wonderful as it is. This is definitely a book that should go on everyone's must read list. I highly recommend it.

This was a very enjoyable quick read. Although short, it's very well written with great character development and a story with several twists. Zack and Holly are great together and seem to come into each others lives at exactly the right time. He's dealing with the death of his sister and is looking for a distraction. A night with Holly would surely do the trick. Problem is Holly tends to give her heart away too easily. Can she risk one night with him??I definitely recommend this one.

My actual rating on this one would be more 3.5 stars.  It's a sweet story with some very interesting characters but it's short and feels very rushed! However, for a little holiday relaxation when you're short on time, this is the perfect read and I would definitely recommend it.Allie McHale is alone on the family farm.  Ready to settle in and ride out the snowstorm in the barn with her beloved horse. When she hears a terrible crash on the road, she fights her way out there only to discover the driver dead and the passenger handcuffed and trapped. She knows that no matter what he's done, she can't leave him out there alone.  One crazy night with a stranger and her whole world is changed!!

Due to troubles in his small island nation, Prince Nicholas Worthington is forced into hiding and finds himself in a small town in Alabama.  Posing as an inspector from the National Historical Society, he convinces Anna Lee to let him stay in her home to oversee the restoration and conversion to a B&B.  He's only there for two weeks but in that short time he has come to care for Anna very much.  Fearing he is putting her in danger, he disappears into the night.....Bad news - I didn't realize it when I started reading but this one has a bit of a cliffhanger with the story continuing in the next book.Good news - It's a great read and luckily we don't have to wait long for the next book.I would definitely recommend this one!

Be prepared... Much of this film is brutal to watch.  Although I admire his desire to 'tell' the story of his illness, this is in your face, close up, no holds barred brutal detail of parts of his treatment.  I had to turn away from the screen in a number of scenes.  Some of the scenes are haunting.Having said that, the film provides an interesting look at journalism and a larger than life personality over the years.  There's great archival footage.  I wish I could see the film again, edited to just the scenes which focus on his career, the man, and changes in the industry. As it is, I cannot see it again.If you are prepared for the stark reality of what you will see, I think you will enjoy the film.  I saw it early, and I wish I had known what to expect.  I hope this helps.

These playlists are great, and this one is no exception.  A nice collection of diverse jazz classics.  Perfect when you are looking for relaxing background music to keep you company.Check out the artist list, and play a few samples and you'll experience the 'flavor' of this list.Prime music alone make Prime membership with it!  Enjoy!
Totally relaxing... Great to turn on if you want to get things done, and don't want distractions!Enjoy!

Very nice... Lightweight, yet sturdy.  It's a much tighter fit than my previous shade.  Snug to the windshield, and provides better coverage.  I also like the fact that it rolls up instead of folding.  It also doesn't misalign my rearview mirror when I install it.I have a 2008 Honda CRV.  Well worth the price.Enjoy!

I saw the show three times.... It was terrific, and I couldn't wait to see the film.  I was disappointed.The show has  magic.  The movie lost that magic. I mentioned to someone:  "the show was music, music, story, music.  The movie was story, story, s...t...o...r...y, music."  It was boring!  At least 30 minutes of the film could have been cut.  Parts simply dragged.I doubt the film will play much better if you haven't seen the show.  I typically love Clint Eastwood's direction, but this did not feel like an Eastwood film.

This is an excellent film.  It's easy to get lost in the story... and then you remember that it's a true story.  Stunning.  Watching what these men went through, it's a miracle anyone survived.  On top of that, a helicopter crashed while attempting a rescue, increasing the toll of this tragedy.If you watch the DVD, don't miss the special features.  It's an opportunity to get the back stories of many who were lost, as well as vehicle through which to pay your respects to these heroes.

I ordered this blouse in a L and XL.  The XL was huge!  The sleeves are very long, and I have to fold the cuff back on the L.Fabric is not soft, but the pattern is nice, and the shirt has a long back (covers booty!)I'm glad I purchased it.Enjoy!

Latest update:I was sitting at my desk today, and saw lots of pink flakes on the desk.  I couldn't figure out what it was until I picked up this mug.  The paint is literally FALLING OFF the bottom.  I've had the mug for about 3 weeks, used it for that length of time, and only put the bottom in the dishwasher once (top shelf).  Otherwise, I hand wash it.  Simply not acceptable.  I have mugs from Starbucks that last for years without the paint peeling.I purchased 2 more of these, since I liked the mug.  Unfortunately, the new ones are going back.I hope this helps.  (Original review, and first update follow.)*********************************Nice travel mug...It works as advertised.  Nice size, and keeps beverages hot/cold.  One downside:  small amounts of coffee settle in the drink hole in the lid.  Often, it splashes when you close the lid.  Also, the lid is tough to seat when you put it on.Otherwise, fine, and the color is beautiful. It doesn't leak.Hand wash, or the color will deteriorate.Enjoy!****** update in response to others' comments about preferring the AutoSeal by Contigo:  (Here's why I don't prefer it.)... I have multiple Contigo models, also.  I don't like the auto seal, since too much gets trapped in the "middle space" (in the lid.... you know what I'm talking about if you have them).  Since I drink coffee with cream, it's too easy for bacteria to brew if lids are difficult to clean.With this one, I open the lid, and put the lid in the top shelf of the dishwasher, and there's no problem with getting it clean.  It feels much safer from a bacteria standpoint.  It's much easier to clean.***************

This actually works, and you can fill with a lot of stuffing (which surprised me).  The device is very well designed, and easy to use once you figure out which part is which.I was very surprised at the size of the indentation for filling.  I put in:  a slice and a half of cooked bacon, some sliced peppers, and small chunks of cheddar cheese.  DELICIOUS!  No leakage on my George Foreman grill.  Worked great.They are big burgers, so you might end up sharing.Here's what I did:  1/3 lb meat in the press, press to make the fill hole, stuff, switch the parts per the booklet, half of a 1/3 lb of meat on top, and press again. (Use small size chop for the filling)After I popped the burger out, I smoothed the seal with my fingers.  I cooked longer than usual, and used a meat thermometer to check that the meat was cooked through.  You'll get 2 half pound burgers from one pound.Enjoy!  It's a great tool, at a great price. You can make pizza burgers, Mexican burgers, whatever you can imagine.

completely addictive...and beautiful!  If you plug it in, you can hear the tinkling sound that you hear when snorkeling.  It's very relaxing.... great to plug in while working on your computer.This is a stunning game.  You build a reef including coral, living plants, ornamental rocks and plants, and most of the things produce (algae or sand dollars).  In addition, there are rare fish which produce pearls.  You have to keep them fed!The reef is beautiful, fish are cute and have personalities.  It's also educational.  You have to keep the reef healthy.  Some days there is homework, there are embedded games, and locked chests with mystery surprises inside.Really fun, interesting, and nice to look at.  One head's up:  the in app purchases can add up.  **** UPDATED **** REALLY add up!  In order to keep up with the fish feeding requirements (I can't believe I'm writing this!), you have to spend money.  I've ended up with over 400,000 sand dollars which are useless (except to add more stuff to an already overflowing reef), and not enough algae to feed the fish.  (Some fish require 20,000 algae to feed them every few days!)  If you could trade sand dollars for algae, it would help, but you cannot.  *****I've had no freezing problems, and I'm at level 24 (no performance issues at all).Enjoy!

I almost put it down at page 150-ish.  Lots of Japanese references which I found distracting, and disruptive of the reading.  I kept going, since I had borrowed it from the Kindle library, and wanted to give it a fair chance.  I'm glad I did!The story is excellent, and really is about life trade offs, regrets, and harsh reality.  It is a remarkable combination of grit and touching tenderness, with constant tension between the two.If you are interested at all in writing, the writing around his relationship with a woman in a wheelchair is stunning from a number of perspectives:  the pure writing, what it says about Rain's personality, the guts and depth of character to interact with a paraplegic in such an open, caring way, and the cost of the life he's choosing to lead pitted against his relationship with this woman.  It's breathtaking, and will leave you thinking.Aside from all that, the book is full of well woven characters and plots.  Lots of intrigue and character development.  I'm going to read more of Eisler's works.Enjoy!

This is all about relationships, and treats them with a depth that adds interest to the film.  It's about moms and daughters, husbands and wives (and exes), fathers and sons, and is woven in a way that it doesn't feel contrived.  It's interesting to contemplate how a person's insertion into others' lives can change the dynamic for a family.  Also, the assumptions one can make that may have no basis in reality, yet can destroy relationships.The film is set in "unadorned" Paris, the acting is lovely, and the subtitles don't feel intrusive.  This film will leave you thinking.Enjoy!

This is a nice device. Sleek lines.  Good sound. One heads up:  the sound is slightly "bass-y", and not adjustable (I.e. via an equalizer).  That was disappointing to me, since I would have preferred on some things to be able to adjust the mix. So, I found the sound slightly disappointing in light of the high reviews.One tip:  It's difficult to seat my iPod.  Here's what to do:  Lean your iPod against the small horizontal bar that sits on the front of the device which is meant to line up with the top of the iPod.  This will enable you to seat the device without damaging the connector (puts the iPod at the correct angle).Enjoy!

This is a nice product, but the instructions are somewhat obtuse!To set it up, do what the pamphlet says.  (Install batteries and place on hard floor.). Then, press with your hand, and remove your hand.  The scale will come on, and adjust to zero.  Tap it to turn it off (that's not in the manual).The instructions are very detailed, but stop just short of telling you all you need to know.  (How to turn it off, and how to adjust from lbs. to other measures:  there's a 'switch' which doesn't look like a switch... More of a lever, but it's not obvious how to use it.)The scale appears accurate.  If my experience changes, I'll update this review.Enjoy!

You can select a beautiful, artful background.  Everything from Vermeer to Van Gogh.  Nice change for an old guard tool.It doesn't have complex functions, but for a simple change of pace, it works!Enjoy!

This is a delightful film about a delightful man (albeit, an unusual one).As the film tells his story, it becomes more and more engaging.  The photos are wonderful.... You'll want to have the "pause" button handy.  Some of the best shots fly by.He manages in a very non-threatening way to engage with and photograph everyday people in their "everyday" fashion (not so much!), while documenting the trends of the day through many decades.  He also snaps great photos of celebrities:  JFK Jr and his wife Caroline, Princess Diana (you'll hardly recognize her.... She looks so normal.).  All the while living in a sparsely furnished space in Carnegie Hall, and driving around Manhattan on a bicycle at all hours of the day and night.It's a fascinating view into a captivating man.Enjoy!

I open the capsules, and mix the oil with food.  Even taken this way, there is no noticeable aftertaste, which to me is worth 4 stars!The best foods to mix with are ones with a strong flavor on their own.  It masks the oil taste if you need to open the capsules.  I use fish salad.  You cannot tell the salmon oil is in there.I hope they work for you!

Just what I needed ... One more addictive app.This is a game of pathways.  Shapes are presented with endpoints.  You have to figure out how to connect all of the shapes without crossing lines, starting and ending at the endpoint shapes without crossing lines.  There are unique "connectors" which allow you to pass through in order to complete a pattern.There are levels, and the puzzles increase in difficulty.If you just want to focus, and think about nothing, this is for you!Enjoy!

I feel compelled to change this review, since I'm having issues with this app across platforms (iPad and KindleFireHD).  Each instance of the app is unique to the specific device, so it gives you different playing platforms (in other words, not in one account, since I'm playing as "Guest" and the app doesn't know it's me across devices).  Here's the thing:  the app crashes, or in other cases doesn't credit purchases.  I've had to call Amazon more than once, to get credits for items I've purchased from within the app.  Also, it tells me "BINGO has stopped.  Redownload the app."  WHICH WILL CAUSE YOU TO LOSE ALL OF YOUR PURCHASED coins, playing dollars, power boosters, etc., therefore, you've wasted that money (and the accumulation regardless of whether or not you've paid cash for them).So, I'm sorry I have to modify this review.  It's a fun game which I really enjoy, but this has happened enough times that I'm probably going to deinstall it, or just play as long as I can without spending any more actual cash.By the way:  if any of this happens to you:  On the Kindle:  you can sometimes just wait it out, and it may (or may not) fix itself.  Go in and out of the app a bunch of times, and see what happens.  Redownload as a very last resort.  On the iPad:  try closing and reopening the app (without deleting it).  In other words, do it from the bottom strip of open apps on your iPad, not from the app screen itself.  Questions?  drop a note and I'll reply.Head's up... original review follows in case you are interested....********************************************Here's my original review:just fun, fun, funIt's fun and relaxing.  Keep track of your coins, boosters, etc.  (You can earn more as you play, and also have Bingo Coins which are separate from Amazon coins to use to purchase additional things.)Half a star downgrade since I wish they would explain what each thing is, and what it does.  I've been playing for a few days, and I still can't figure out what some of the things are for, and how they accumulate once you've earned them.You can purchase multiple cards to play at once (up to 4).Enjoy!

Looking for a simple to learn, very visual app to organize your projects, (and thoughts, to dos, etc.)?  This is it!Finally, an agnostic app which syncs across ecosystems.  I am now successfully running this app on my Kindle Fire, Samsung Galaxy S4, iPad, iPod, MacBook Pro, and my PC.  And it syncs!  And it's free, unless you want to pay $5/month for some additional features (not required to run the app.)What I really like about it is its slight learning curve, its clean lines, and its ease of use.  In two days, I laid out  (via cards displayed on boards) a large project under 'To Do' which visually allows me to see the long term picture.  As I begin to work on parts of the projects, I can move the cards to 'Doing' (in process) or 'Done'. (You can change those titles, but I like them.)  You can color code cards by labels, create checklists on each card, assign due dates, share boards and cards with team members, etc.If you love white boards, you'll love this app.I was using another system which was so complex that it devolved into a simple to do list which was not helping me with larger, long term projects.  This will.Really... I just downloaded this yesterday, and have planned out a bunch of projects along with downloading it to all of my devices.Questions?  Drop me a note, and I'll reply as soon as I'm able.Check it out!Enjoy!

4 buddy WWI pilots, out of work after the war, start doing stunt flying on a Hollywood movie, directed by the evil Eric Von Stroheim (in an enjoyably over the top performance).  Of course, as absurd luck would have it the leader of the squad‚Äôs ex-girlfriend is now married to Von Stroheim, though she hates him.Spoilers ahead!Von Stroheim plots to try to get his wife‚Äôs ex-lover killed in an impossible stunt, and is going to make sure by putting acid on the control cables, but another flyer goes in his place and dies, and the remaining 3 grab Von Stroheim to get their revenge, leading to a tense, dark but pretty silly conclusion. There‚Äôs a lot that‚Äôs cool here.  The photography is quite nice, with a modern, flowing feeling unusual in early sound films.  The last third of the film has a dark, moody sort of proto film noir  look and feel.  And the performances are pretty retrained and naturalistic for early 30s  Hollywood as well.  It only grew on a 2nd viewing.

Visually stunning, sweet, understated tale of under prepared young explorer sent to the Arctic region to observe wolves.With very little dialogue, just some gentle voice over, we trace his path with humor, tension, and sadness.  Even the ending is surprisingly quiet and gentle for a Hollywood film.  An honest portrait of the complexities of venturing beyond our limits.Sadly there's never been a home video release that really captures how beautifully shot this film is.  The DVD is OK at best, but made from a beat up print.  This cries out for a blu-ray re-mastering, as Criterion did recently or Carroll Ballard's other nature based masterwork, "The Black Stallion". (If you liked that film, you should give this one a try).

Visually stunning, sweet, understated tale of under prepared young explorer sent to the Arctic region to observe wolves.With very little dialogue, just some gentle voice over, we trace his path with humor, tension, and sadness.  Even the ending is surprisingly quiet and gentle for a Hollywood film.  An honest portrait of the complexities of venturing beyond our limits.Sadly there's never been a home video release that really captures how beautifully shot this film is.  The DVD is OK at best, but made from a beat up print.  This cries out for a blu-ray re-mastering, as Criterion did recently or Carroll Ballard's other nature based masterwork, "The Black Stallion". (If you liked that film, you should give this one a try).

Time has perhaps taken a tiny tick off the perfection of this for me (the ending is a bit abrupt, etc.), but basically this is still one of the best, most beautiful, most emotional, and most entertaining ‚Äòfamily‚Äô films ever made.Eschewing dialogue for large blocks of time, and then only using words sparingly, this is truly a story told in pictures; breathtaking wide shots (often tracking so fast, but so smoothly that it seems impossible) and intimate close-ups revealing subtle details of emotion.  The sequence with boy and horse making friends while trapped on an island is justifiably what people remember most, but there‚Äôs lots that‚Äôs great here, including what was probably the best performance of Mickey Rooney‚Äôs long career.And the Criterion transfer finally does justice for what was one of the best looking films of all time.  The DVDs were all downright awful.  The US version wasn't even widescreen enhanced. The 1st long awaited blu-ray was certainly a huge step up, but Criterion have really nailed it here, making this what is likely to be the definitive version for quite some time.  If you've never seen it, or love it and own anything less than this version, it's a very worthwhile investment.

A tremendously funny comedy, with Judd Apatow doing a very good job with Amy Schumer‚Äôs script ‚Äì the first time he hasn‚Äôt written one of his own films.  But Apatow and Schumer are a very good match, seeming to share senses of humor and senses of humanity, managing to mix up hysterical, low brow humor (the funniest throwing up moment since Monty Python‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Meaning of Life‚Äù), with heart and wit.  And, Apatow has managed to get some terrific performances from pro athletes, starting with LeBron James.  James‚Äô role isn‚Äôt just a cute 2 minute cameo, it‚Äôs a real , juicy supporting role, and he carries it off with aplomb.Indeed, in another trademark for an Apatow film, this is full of terrific performances, starting with Schumer‚Äôs bawdy, crazy, sexy, sharp and wildly neurotic and vulnerable Amy at the film‚Äôs center.  Bill Hader is also a delightful surprise as a sensitive, funny leading man (and how nice to have an onscreen couple who are attractive, but also look like real people ‚Äì imperfect bodies, faces that don‚Äôt come off a modeling floor.  Score one for the great majority of us).  And Tilda Swinton, Ezra Miller and a lot of other talented folk seem to be having a blast in supporting roles.The film isn‚Äôt perfect.  There are a few times when it‚Äôs humor crosses the line into forced (Marv Alpert ‚Äòsports casting‚Äô an emotional intervention seems to come from another movie ‚Äì specifically Woody Allen‚Äôs ‚ÄòBananas‚Äô, where that kind of Marx Brothers surrealistic absurdism made more sense when Howard Cosell did it).  There are certainly no surprises at all in where the story ends up going (a moment of doubt somewhere in the two hours would have been nice).  And if one looks too close, the morality is pretty surprisingly conventional ‚Äì it doesn‚Äôt quite seem the feminist embrace of a woman being free to live a crazy, sexy life without it being a sign of an emotional problem one might have hoped for from Schumer.  But when all was said and done, I laughed out loud ‚Äì a lot.  And I liked the people.  That‚Äôs a hell of a lot to get from a Hollywood comedy these days.

Unique, deeply disturbing pitch black combination of ‚ÄòLast House on the Left‚Äô type horror, darkly funny political satire, and fury at the sickness of one‚Äôs own society.  The film was said by it‚Äôs director to have been explicitly made to combat the growing nostalgia, fueled by Putin, for Soviet era Russia.Based on true events that occurred in 1984,  as the Soviet Union sank ever deeper into the Afghanistan quagmire (‚ÄòCargo 200‚Äô is the code names for bodies being brought back from the war),  this depiction of a ‚ÄòDeliverance‚Äô type grotesque family who sell illegal booze to finance their fantasy of one day creating a utopia in the middle of nowhere, and the complete psychopath of a police captain ‚Äòfriend‚Äô who protects, but ultimately turns on them, and ends up committing murder, along with rape, torture and kidnapping of a young girl who happens by ‚Äì all while being paid by the government.The slow build is handled pretty brilliantly, and we‚Äôre surprised over and over at exactly who turns out to do what ‚Äì although the feeling of doom hovers over the film from it‚Äôs first moments.  By the end of the film, the depravity is so insane, and depicted in such a matter-of-fact way, that the only reaction one can have is to laugh a terribly disturbed, uncomfortable laugh.  It‚Äôs as if Balabanov took torture porn, but turned it into pitch black comedy performance art by having it comment on the world in a bigger way (but isn‚Äôt that really what all the truly great horror films do?)Major plot questions are left unanswered, but that doesn‚Äôt feel like sloppy film-making, but rather an intentional (if frustrating) method of making us ponder what we‚Äôve just witnessed, instead of being able to walk away and forget.  Some of the acting is awkward, but there are images I that will stick with me a long time, and I have the feeling the film might grow even deeper on repeated viewings.  It isn‚Äôt often you read various critics comparing a film to both the Coen bothers and ‚ÄòSaw‚Äô, or a critic saying ‚Äòit made me want to puke, and I mean that as a high complement‚Äô, but it‚Äôs that much a one-of-a-kind film.  The cinematography is also ‚Äòbeautiful‚Äô in its almost loving framing of ugliness, both human and industrial.

Intelligent, mostly well acted filming of the stage play, as 6 people exonerated from death row tell their true stories, mostly as monologues, against a black background.A powerful argument against the death penalty, it feels a bit stuck between embracing it's theatricality of approach, and trying to work as a more cinematic piece both in the way its shot, the occasional awkward `flashbacks' and in the `size' of the performances, which range from understated and small to quite theatrical and presentational.But whatever questions one might have about the stylistic choices, there's no question that these are powerful, important true stories in that every rarer thing, a dramatized American film that head on addresses an issue with passion and intelligence.

Actually, far from a great film in terms of technique - arbitrarily cross cutting between Lily Tomlin on stage, without costumes or sets (and oddly, also without an audience, but with over the top sound effects) and her playing the same characters in costumes and on sets (some naturalistic, some stylized).For me it was a clunky and distracting approach.However, the writing is so great and Tomlin's performance as her different characters is so memorable, so funny and so touching, that even a damaged version of this amazing one- woman show is better than none, by a long shot.

Stunningly beautiful and powerful images highlight this examination of how mankind re-shapes water and how it flows ‚Äì for good and ill, more often ill - and in turn how the water re-shapes civilization and human behavior.There's no real story, just a series of visits to locations around the world where water powerfully interacts with humanity, like the pilgrimage of 30 million people to bathe in the Ganges river.Without narration and a specific focus the film could be accused of being too diffuse. But for me the raw power of the images ‚Äì Burtynsky is one of our greatest still photographers who has spent much of his career creating huge images of humans and nature clashing and interacting - give the piece a poetic, if not literal, power and solidity. The film manages to be a wake-up call about our use and abuse of water while rarely giving in to traditional lecturing. It trusts us to look into its images and interpret for ourselves.

"Goodbye Solo' manages the near impossible feat of taking an over sentimental, almost sappy set up (a sweet young African cab driver trying to save a depressed white old man he often drives), and turns it into something delicate, touching, complex and open-ended.The acting is terrific (non-pros?) and, much like Bahrani's excellent earlier film "Man Push Cart", he's melded a neo-realist approach to the drama and acting with a beautifully controlled use of the camera to create beautiful images that tell a story, while working on a tiny budget.A couple of the smaller roles are weakly acted, and that hurts a bit, but doesn't keep this from being a special film. Well worth seeking out.A side note; if you are at all impressed by director Bahrani's work, I'd strongly suggest you search out his wonderful short film "Plastic Bag" which is viewable on YouTube, and other sites on the web (a quick Google will find it). He teamed up with the great Werner Herzog (who narrates) totell the first person story of the life of an unwanted plastic bag in a film that is visually beautiful, very funny, and very sad. One of the best, non-preachy films on ecology I've ever seen, it feels like this generation's answer to the classic short "The Red Balloon"

Funny, frightening, informative, sad and triumphant, it fully captures the madness of creating one of the great epic films of the last 50 years.It also offers insight into how much of art is accidental or discovered instead of planned.If you are interested in film, the artistic process, Francis Coppola or anything else about 'Apocalypse Now' this is a must see.Indeed, it's pretty much a must see for anyone.While you can buy it separately, it also comes as part of the great Apocalypse Now 'Full Disclosure' 3 disc blu-ray set.

This fun, informative documentary covers the taking of a classic photo in 1958 for Esquire, that had almost every great Jazz star of the era, from Dizzy Gillespie, to Count Basie to Thelonius Monk, etc etc.While the film is too short (just under and hour) to go into any great detail, and maybe a little too much time is spent on various greats 25 years later saying how great everyone else was, there's a sweetness and infectious enthusiasm that director Bach (no spring chicken herself) brings to this collection of memories of a time and place.If you have any interest in photography or jazz this is a must.

Fascinating, sometimes maddening mix of wonderful and silly, intelligent and dumb, insightful and obvious.At it's best it's the 'Wire' of science fiction, challenging 'Battlestar Galactica' for intelligence and emotional depth. At it's worst, it's like an OK episode of 'Lost in Space'.Generally far more intelligent than most TV sci-fi (or recent sci-fi films for that matter), with stories based more on ideas than laserbattles. In that, it's a little reminiscent of the original 'Star Trek' series.The most interesting thing; this was an early case of a series having a pre-planned multi-year arc, so throughout there are sometimes intentionally confusing or mysterious details that return to be finally explained as having great importance a season or two or three later.On the other hand, because this preceded the acceptance of truly serial cable shows, each episode is more self contained than more recent shows in a sometimes annoyingly neat way.The show is also full of allusions; Shakespeare, the Bible, Buddhism, King Arthur, the Koran. Certainly the writing is grounded in pretty heady stuff.
