I was offered a coupon to provide an unbiased review of this product.  Here‚Äôs the deal, I really don‚Äôt have a need for a finger pulse oximeter.  It‚Äôs just that it was the timing was wonderful, so I said that I would review it.  Our family friend just recently had open heart surgery, my mother was staying with her, and one of the expectations with a surgery like that is that you take a person‚Äôs pulse so many times during the day.  Initially, my mom, who is not a trained nurse or has any medical training, was trying to take her friends pulse.  Then I was offered a coupon and realized that this would be amazing.You know what, it is.  Taking the pulse now is ease.  The device was also really easy to use, so much so that my 70+ old mother was able to operate it; this coming from a woman who has aversion to all types of technology.  If you‚Äôre in need of a product that takes pulse, I‚Äôd recommend this, mainly because of the ease associated with it.  There were often times in the beginning where we would take clusters of readings, such as three at a time, and we found that they were very close to one another, helping us to feel more confident in accuracy.

I admit, I‚Äôm not the biggest fan of selfie sticks in theory, but this one has been really easy to use.  I have a Note Edge 4, and my phone, along with its case, has fit into this selfie stick.  It was easy using it and setting up, but I have had some issues with the blue tooth extension.  It wasn‚Äôt as clear cut for me to figure out, and I only had it work some of the time.  I am note entirely sure if this was my phone, or the product itself.  It also works with Android devices, which is nice, because I find that usually Android is the product left out in favor of iPhones.  The wrist wrap is thing, but meets it purpose.  For the price and if looking for a higher quality self-stick, I‚Äôd say that this is one of the better bets.I was provided a coupon for an unbiased review.

I liked this case; the only issue that I have with it is that the case itself feels a bit flimsy, but it has held up well.  I‚Äôve been using the case for about a week now and haven‚Äôt had any issues with sustaining damage to the phone.  I wouldn‚Äôt necessarily trust it to the extent of some the military grade cases that I‚Äôve gotten in the past, it just doesn‚Äôt have that ‚Äúfeel‚Äù of security.  However, it is a case that has set my mind at ease in worrying about protecting my phone in my pocket.  For the price and what it provides, I‚Äôd recommend it.I was provided a coupon for an unbiased review.

I debated between getting the regular and the extra power; I wasn‚Äôt really sure what the difference would be.  I found that the extra power sponge was a bit sturdier, but it seemed to have more ‚Äústuff,‚Äù I guess, ‚Äúpower‚Äù in it.  This helped a little bit for me because I am someone who likes to develop a bit of foamy layer when I clean.Regardless, the magic eraser product is amazing.  It is designed to wear aware as you use it.  I highly recommend, especially if you have any scuffs throughout the house.  It may take some elbow grease, but it‚Äôs not going to ruin the table top or the paint finish on whatever it is that you‚Äôre cleaning.  This was also one of the best products I could have bought for moving; when we were moving out of our rental it was an excellent investment to help us get all of our deposit back.

The leash came very nicely packaged in a high quality cardboard box with a pull out drawer.  Included with the box is a small cloth bag for the leash itself.  This would make for a pretty gift for your favorite dog owner.  The leash itself is short ‚Äì about four feet long ‚Äì which make it ideal for walking a dog in an urban setting.  Overall the construction is excellent with a swiveling D-ring hook which latches firmly into place and a wide, padded handle that fits comfortably in the hand, especially when the dog is pulling on the leash.  There is a second, unpadded handle towards the base of the leash.  This second handle is useful either when sitting with the dog, and the owner could use it to maintain control of the dog closer to its body.  It also would be useful when heeling with a taller dog on the leash, and using the second handle to keep the dog physically closer to the owner's body.My only complaint has to do with the length of the leash.  I prefer a six foot leash because it gives more lead for the dogs (both beagles) to sniff during our walks.  Otherwise I recommend this product.I was provided a coupon to review this item.

I admit; I don‚Äôt really know how to write a review about marbles.  I‚Äôm not a marble expert, I can just tell you what happened with my experience with the marbles.  There‚Äôs a large marble, which I believe is called the ‚Äúshooter‚Äù and it‚Äôs fairly durable.  By ‚Äúfairly‚Äù durable, that would mean chunking it at the cement multiple times while playing aggressive adult marbles who may have been slightly intoxicated.Anyway, the marbles are a pretty color, they are not really what is shown in the pictures though.  They are more of a foggy color, with a heavy emphasis on green/teal. I did get three marbles that had crack on them, but none of my marbles developed cracks or chips while playing with them.  So, I‚Äôm not sure if it is a production issue or a shipping issue.  The marbles come in a plastic bag, that is within a pseudo velvet bag, which is nice because they won‚Äôt fly all over the place once opened.In terms of other commenters mentioning the uniformity of the marbles being off; this is correct.  So, be mindful of what you are using them for.  If you‚Äôre putting them in a vase; cool, no foul.  If you‚Äôre non-professional adults who just like to play sometimes, they aren‚Äôt that bad because the variation can offer some different challenges to the game.  If you‚Äôre a pro, or play a lot, then you might want to focus on a different set.  Altogether, a good option, as long as you‚Äôre aware when purchasing them.I was provided a coupon in exchange for an unbiased review.

Jenny Lawson is back in another spectacular book in which she chronicles her life, but this time through the lens of someone who struggles with anxiety.  Well; she did that last time, but this time, it is an underlying theme/focus of her writing, and I might add, it‚Äôs quite spectacular.I actually do not read Lawson‚Äôs blog, my partner is unabashedly committed, and I just realized that we will probably end up with three copies of this book; the kindle version I just read, the hard copy my wife probably ordered and didn‚Äôt tell me about, and a third copy my wife will probably buy at the book signing.  I admit, I‚Äôm comfortable in the knowledge of having a few extra copies of this book; it‚Äôs one of those books I want to shove in the face of others and say, ‚ÄúI think that this is a great way to understand anxiety and depression.‚ÄùI discovered Lawson‚Äôs books while driving with my partner and we listened to the audio book.  Later on a few friends mentioned that the audio book was probably a better option at the time because it was a lot easier to follow Ms. Lawson‚Äôs stream of conscious thoughts in an audio form rather than a written form.  In reading this book, and comparing it to ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs Pretend This Never Happened,‚Äù I found that the format is much easier to read and easier to follow for those who are not as familiar with her style found on her blog.  Lawson‚Äôs thought are still spectacularly entertaining, insightful, and seemingly random (I too sometimes refer to time as ‚ÄúBefore Kirk Cameron Went Crazy‚Äù or BKCWC, but apparently Advanced Placement won‚Äôt accept that response for my students.)The tone of this book starts of different than her other writings, at first it seemed a bit dark, but it is not, by any stretch of the imagination, Lawson does this wonderful job of taking the reader through understanding some elements of depression and anxiety.  I don‚Äôt struggle with depression and anxiety, but the way in which Lawson presents the topic is one in which it builds compassion and an open dialogue.  I admit, my comment about ‚Äúit starts off dark,‚Äù is a bit misleading, Lawson clearly outlines; I have depression and anxiety and here is a bit of the journey I have been on with it (that may involve two Rory‚Äôs who are stuft raccoon's).To some people, this may scare them away, but, in the case of Lawson she speaks frankly about the situation while doing it in the context of hilarity.  I guess what I‚Äôm saying is, she talked about depression and it didn‚Äôt scare me away, but actually gave me some really awesome insight that will hopefully make me a better and more compassionate person to others.  I think that one of the reasons why Lawson‚Äôs blog is so popular, and other writings, has to do with the sense of fellowship that others may feel with her experience, even if it is standing in line at the pharmacy or talking to a shrink.  ‚Ä¶granted, Lawson does it in the context of some pretty awesome stories.

I'm a big fan of Stargate and I thought this shirt was great.  The print on it is a little on the light side - not for color but for thickness of the print itself - so it makes me believe that it will fade away after a while.  For now though it looks great.  Also the shirt itself is just a little bit on the small side.  Still a good buy, happy I have this shirt and I do wear it!

These are perfect, exactly what I needed.  I have these on several lamps and a window air-conditioner (non-digital, so it turns on to whatever setting I have it on).  Provides you with remote on/off switches for your devices.

Works exactly as advertised - I had a fruit fly problem because I had a bag of onions turn "mushy" on the counter when I went away on vacation .  Came back to a near nightmare.  Cleaning everything and spraying around didn't do enough, so I got these.  Overnight I killed over 20 with 2 traps laid out in separate places in my kitchen .  A couple more around the house got some others that were probably looking around for something else to survive on.  Took maybe 4 days and I never saw another.

For those that aren't sure who Felicia Day is, she is an actress, an author, an entrepreneur, an innovator and a gamer.  She has in her resume, among many things, the experience of revolutionizing the internet in some ways - namely the creation of her web series, The Guild, that was posted for everyone to watch for free on YouTube back in 2007 (and later expanded to other media such as Xbox and DVD).  This web series, based (whether loosely or not) on many of her experiences both in real life and through online video game playing, launched her self-made career and popularity.  Since then she has done so many things that I won't list here because I think her story is worth reading or listening to (honestly it's my opinion that you should get the audio book since she reads it herself).  Felicia details her life from childhood to current, describing her home schooled upbringing in just the right amount of detail to give you a good understanding of why she is who she is today.She didn't get to where she is easily - while I've been a fan of her work prior to this book, I now have a much better understanding of the many struggles she's had to go through.  I listened to this book with smiles, laughter, tears and pride for her accomplishments.  Through it all, she doesn't harp on the problems she had or the troubles that people have given her - instead she borderlines on a helpful attitude and gives advice on how to push through problems and adversity.There is one chapter near the end of the book where she discusses online harassment and threats that she's experienced - in particular related to Gamergate over the last couple of years.  I found this to be the bravest of her chapters, because even my bringing it up here in this review could potentially incite negative responses toward myself, such is that topic's volatile nature.  Felicia Day's story isn't just about a female gamer who made it in the online world, it's about a person who - through damn hard work and determination - succeeded in her wildest dreams.From social awkwardness, through depression, through adversity and onward to success - Felicia Day's book is worth a read by anyone.  I applaud you, Miss Day, for sharing your life with all of us.

Just wanted to write a quick review about this thing answering some questions that I had about it myself but didn't see in the top 10 reviews or so, plus I wanted to throw in some other points.1) This does NOT light your fire.  You still need to light your wood or charcoal through your normal means.  This just helps it to get it to its "ready state" a lot faster.2) This does NOT blow hot air at all.  In fact it was a hot day today and I even caught myself using it as a little portable fan twice.3) This DOES blow a focused stream of air that can be felt by the hand around 2 feet or so away from it.  It focuses air blowing on the coals so that they get hotter faster and in turn light up the other coals around them faster.4)  EDITED (based on product videos and manufacturer comments on this review):  You can put the tip pretty close to the coals as they first heat up, but you should pull back of course as the heat increases and spreads.5)  You need to supply the 3 AAA batteries for this unit.6)  It makes noise but it's not super loud.  I'd say a little quieter than some blow driers on low.7)  It does help, but I wouldn't call this a must have.  Good product, I'm not disappointed in it at all, pretty much got exactly what I was expecting.

The game is fun, but set up is a BEAR.  There are so many cards (various decks), pieces, etc. that after playing twice I've got one friend that's given up mainly for that reason.  We're going to still be playing it, just without him.  Until you're very familiar with the game, plan on up to 30 minutes of set up time just to get the various decks understood and in place (some you won't use depending on which "bad guy" you choose to fight), and you've got to set up a special deck for the bad guys (based off of card types in one of their assigned decks).It's fun once you get going but there are so many parts and pieces to remember during game play that you have to be a pretty dedicated player (all of you do really) if you're going to get to the point where you can get a game over and done with in under 3 hours.

After reading many reviews of different streaming media players (amazon's, apple's, this one, etc.) I went with the Roku for many reasons but here's the reasons I like it so much:1)  SUPER fast, no wait between menus, loading movies, etc. ‚Äì it all happens immediately at the touch of a button.  a.  Also super fast is the FF/Rewind/etc. ‚Äì on both the PS4 and the Blu-ray player, rewinding was a pain in the butt and it would sometimes skip so far back or forward we‚Äôd just end up watching the same stuff for another 5 minutes to get to where we wanted instead of keeping on trying to get the spot right.2)  The menus between apps/channels all work the same.  Netflix has the same basic menu format as Amazon Prime, for example.  It‚Äôs really quick to move through menus.3)  Lots of channel choices/apps.  You can add/remove them from your main menu as you wish (there‚Äôs one that has to be there, some movie rent/buy place that clearly they have a contract with but I don‚Äôt care).4)  They even have games.  For example, Tetris.  There was a free trial where you could just play the game for one level and it costs $4.99 to buy it permanently.  It was perfect, classic Tetris played the way it‚Äôs supposed to be played.  I saw a few other games you could buy but can‚Äôt recall what they were exactly.5)  Awesome remote!  a.  Very simple, not a crazy amount of buttons, small but fits in your hand well.  Has direct buttons for Netflix, Amazon, Hulu and RDIO or whatever it‚Äôs called (a music channel/app).  b.  Takes 2-AA batteries‚Ä¶and not only did they include them but they‚Äôre Duracell, not some crappy off-brand that won‚Äôt last.  c.  WI-FI!  It‚Äôs not a radio remote, it connects and pairs automatically with your Roku via Wi-Fi ‚Äì I tested it out in other rooms, fully covered, etc ‚Äì and it works perfectly every time no matter what.  This was a problem for me with other remotes because sometimes I sit in my desk in one room and watch the TV from there while I‚Äôm on the computer or something.  Sometimes I have to get up with those remotes and go into the living room because something is interfering with the signal.  d.  Voice searching ‚Äì yep, the remote apparently has an open mic for when you are on a search screen.  Works great, tested it with DJ several times and it‚Äôs spot on.  e.  Phone Apps ‚Äì free Roku app that lets me control the Roku, and has a full keyboard piece for searching stuff so you don‚Äôt have to type everything in (not that this really is generally necessary after setup (using it for passwords was helpful) because it already has the voice feature).  f.  Phone/Tablet Mirroring ‚Äì I think this can work with laptops too, but you can take whatever you have on your screen (if you have the app of course) and show it up on the TV.  Dj and I watched a couple movies from his phone (like from the renaissance faire last year) and it looked amazing on the screen!  g.  Headphone Jack ‚Äì it comes with headphones or you can use your own ‚Äì so you can listen to everything without having the external sound up.  Pretty cool.  h.  Price Scans ‚Äì so if you search for a movie to buy or rent, for example, it will show you how much it costs on any of the channels you have loaded.  You may find Insurrection for $4.99 to rent on Hulu, but Amazon has it for $2.99, so you can make a choice as to which service you get your movie from.6)  It‚Äôs tiny‚Ä¶.literally hockey puck sized, a little thicker.If I had anything to complain about it would be:1)  Didn't come with an HDMI cable‚Ä¶but I got a great one from Amazon for under $102)  During initial set up you are required to either put in a credit card or link to your paypal account.  I‚Äôd rather not have done that and had to put it in at some time later.  It doesn't cost anything to use it unless you are buying/renting movies, adding games, whatever.  But it still makes you do that first before you can use it.  a.  You can program it also to require a PIN to be put in before anything can be bought, which is nice.3)  It does get pretty warm ‚Äì but I haven‚Äôt seen anyone complaining that they overheat.  I‚Äôll have to monitor closer going forward.Overall I love this thing and will be using it a LOT in the future.  It doesn't replace cable for most folks (especially those that want to watch sports, etc.) but it's a great buy.  Probably my favorite feature is the remote and how well it works from any angle.

Nothing in this item's description indicates this - but you get 2 instead of one. It does say "set" in the title but it doesn't state it - I was surprised to get 2.Made of plastic, pretty well built with working parts.

Nothing in this item's review indicates this - but you get 2 instead of one.  Sure it says "Set" at the top but that could mean you get the catapult and the little rock (which you do by the way) as a "set".Working catapult where you press down on the front of the lever and whatever's in the bucket will go flying.  The rocks that come with it, if placed in the bucket the way it looks in the picture, will usually stay in there as it's wider on the bottom and you almost have to force it into the bucket to get it to fit.  Not a complaint though, just being informative.

Good little package of trees I use for tabletop RPG playing.  The one tree that looks kind of like a cactus or maybe a pineapple is definitely out of place in this pack but unique.They are small and very light, tip over fairly easy - but all that is worth it for the price of this pack and how many tress you get.

Good little table.  It's light, completely made of plastic.  Sturdy to an extent, but I wouldn't put a whole lot of weight on it.  It's also pretty short.Just an FYI, after I purchased this for ~$15 here, I found it at a Rite Aid drug store nearby for $9.99.  Look around locally and you may find a better deal.

Plant arrived very well packed with a heating pack since it's February.  My first impression was that it was huge compared to what I expected to get - My Venus Fly Trap has 13 "traps" on it - I assumed it would only have a few.  I followed the instructions given and I've been moving the plant to a window during the day (where it is a little colder) and into the living room during the evening (so it can stay warm).  It started getting lighter in color within the first day or two and I started worrying, so I emailed the seller - at 9AM EST on a Friday - he got back to me within minutes and asked if I could take a picture of the plant for him.  I did and he responded that it looks great, the lighter color is natural for the plant and that I did a good job of setting it up.  I was shocked to hear back so quickly and that he was willing to review my particular plant's condition for me.Very highly recommended seller and product both.  Couldn't be happier.

If all you are worried about with these shoes is comfort, especially because you have flat feet like me - they are fantastic.  They are very comfortable and I wear them to work every day for the most part.Unfortunately after a few months the bottom layer is pealing from the front - I have super glued them once already and it's doing it again now.  They are still comfortable though, but if this continues I won't wear them to work any more because it looks...cheap and sloppy.Overall the look of them isn't very dressy - they really do look just like you see in the pictures.  They're more like a sneaker than anything but it works for business casual.  Just not very stylish looking in my opinion.For my next shoe I'll try to find a different style or something, but I definitely need some that are as comfortable as these.  I recommend them, but I have to take a star away for them breaking up a bit already.

These work perfectly with my Sonicare toothbrush.  They don't snap down quite as flush as the name brand ones but you get so many more for such a lower price these are a no-brainer going forward.After a little over 1.5 months of use I can tell they wear down a little bit quicker than the name brand but this isn't a problem when you get 9 at half the price of 4.Great product, highly recommend buying these instead of the super inflated refills from Philips.

Figured I'd give this place a try - will never go back.  We walked in commenting to each other "Wow this place looks very old" hoping it would have some sort of ambiance to it - but you feel like you're in a box with no windows.  The place was just clean enough to get by without getting in trouble.  Service was not very good - took forever to get anything including the attention of our waitress who spent a lot of time sitting with a family at another table.  The food tasted almost like it had been freezer burned before cooking it, there was just a bad overall flavor to it.  They were also out of the first 2 items I ordered off of the menu and it was only about 6:00 PM.  Not quality food at all, had more of an assembly line like Boston Market or maybe Bob Evans type of meal.  Girlfriend felt the same way about everything.BUT...this is why you use these coupon deals, to try out places you normally wouldn't have gone.  I would not recommend this place at all to anyone.

Lots of cloths that I have placed strategically around the house.  I'm a nut about keeping my glasses clean when I am wearing them (for reading only) so I like to have easy access to good cloths.The quality of these is good, I don't think there's much special/different about them then most of the microfiber cloths out there, but there's certainly nothing wrong with them at all either.  The very large cloth is definitely the best, I prefer to have those to the smaller ones even for smaller eyeglasses.-D

Bought these for a speakeasy themed party.  Placed them all around the house in different locations and several into a bowl on the dining room table.  They were a big hit and added to the atmosphere quite well.The cigarettes are the exact same thing we used to get from the candy store when I was a kid - nothing at all has changed about them.I feel it's important to note that these aren't the kind you can blow air through and dust can come out the other side - these are a solid stick of candy the whole way through.-D

Spongy cushioned case will protect the tablet from basic scratches and such but don't expect this to protect from a drop.  That's not what it's meant for.  My son puts his tablet in this case and then in his backpack for transport and it's worked out perfectly so far.It fits the Bamboo tablet perfectly and covers it nicely.  Good product, reasonable price.-D

The sound quality is pretty good on these.  My son uses these so several of his friends can listen to music at the same time - he actually has one of these plugged into another one so he has 5 total headphone ports, and says there's no sound degradation from doing that.My concern is a little more on the materials - while it LOOKS like they're built to support the wires from being pulled out of place, the wires themselves are soft and "mushy" and the wire covers at the connections have a little play in them.  Honestly, though, at this price it's not much to complain about and as long as they last him a while he'll be very happy with them.-D

A good set, similar to their larger versions of each dragon.  The wings are clear though, would have liked them more if they were colored, but I purchased them knowing that so it wasn't a problem.  Decent detail, good quality and not easily broken.  I'd be careful with very small children though, for sure.  Small parts and CAN be broken by someone who's trying, for sure.-D

Bought these for my son to wear at work (waiter).  He says they are very comfortable and fit perfect.  I waited a while to post this review because over the first couple of weeks I noticed the treads were smoothing out very quickly.  After the first month or so, though, that stopped and they seem to be wearing at a normal pace now.  A little hard to tell at this point if the life of the shoe will be affected, but I suspect it won't.The shoes look great and have otherwise held up quite well over time.  He generally wears these all day every day and loves them.-D

Overall a great product, would order again maybe yearly.  I like that there are several separate steps to the program, it's not just "drink this every day for a week" or "take these pills for 2 weeks' or whatever.  It gradually moves you through the system over time.I coupled this with a vegetarian (I'm normally a carnivore....) diet including lots of home-made vegetarian broth to drink and lost an average of a pound per day through the system for the first 9 days then just 1 more pound for the last 5.  10 pounds in 2 weeks, pretty darn happy about that but it does show that I should do a cleanse more than once every few years.  I'll do this one once/year and another one 6 months later probably, to mix it up.  I've kept all but 1 pound of the lost weight off.Another thing, the purging with this cleansing system wasn't bad whatsoever.  Sometimes you end up with a cleanse that makes you run to the bathroom all the time, this one is pretty gentle by comparison.last note, the pills will probably make you burp a lot like they did for me, especially for the first 30 minutes or so after you take them.  Just part of what you have to deal with, luckily I was usually in my car on the way to work during that time and not in a meeting with 10 people.I will buy this product again.-D

Standard glasses with a Marvel comic character theme.  Iron Man, Wolverine, Captain America, The Hulk.  The shot glasses are standard size and weight/thickness, not easily breakable.  The designs are decent but nothing particularly special about them.  Comes in a single box with all 4 shot glasses visible from the outside.-D

Good, solid glasses.  heavyweight glass, not cheap or thin.  You get what you see, pretty basic designs on them but not bad at all.  Nothing "outstanding" here to warrant a 5-star rating, but definitely nothing wrong with them at all either.  Good product, fair price.  Comes in a DC-themed box that shows all 4 glasses side-by-side.-D

A nice full-sized wireless mouse (not one of those little tiny ones) that works very well.  The accuracy is superb, the quality of the product itself is great too it feels good in the hand and is made solid, which is important because it will spend a lot of time in a backpack being bounced around.The USB receiver for this is very small which means you won't have to remove it every time you take your laptop somewhere, it can stay in there and not be in the way.-D

Bought several shirts of different brands at the same time, all the same size - 18.5/34-35.  Unfortunately this one was a little snug in the front where the others fit great.  Otherwise this is a great shirt, the quality is superb, the cloth isn't overly sheen like a lot of sateen shirts are (especially black ones), and the collar stays put.One other thing about this, but it's more because of the sateen cloth style, it collects dust and dog hair easily.  On most shirts that wouldn't even show but on the black one it does.  Have to keep a lint roller handy, especially if this has been on the rack for a while.-D

Like the subject line says if you liked the first one you'll like this one too. It's like reliving the first movie but unlike some movies like Hangover, etc - this sequel isn't just the same thing as the last one.Most importantly though - the special features on this DVD are fantastic! There is a 2-part gag real that's very full and hilarious, there are several line-o-ramas as well. But even better than that, there's 2 DIFFERENT versions of the movie! Not just a longer/extended version or whatever, the Super Sized and Theatrical versions are actually different - they used the improv and line-o-ramas to actually change many scenes!Very happy to see a movie that actually gives us those type of "extras" - everyone should do it. So disappointed any more especially when I buy a comedy and there's no gag real or anything with it. This movie isn't just a great movie, it really gives back to the customers and makes you feel like you seriously got your money's worth for the first time in a long while.-D

I bought this for my son to use with his graduation present - an Alienware 18. Exactly what this bag was made for although of course you could use it for many other purposes as well. I had high hopes that it would have a lot of room and organization options, that it wasn't made cheaply, that the level of protection provided for a $4,000 laptop would be very good and that the weight distribution for the 13 pound laptop would make it easy to carry.Much to my surprise, they nailed it on all accounts!My son carries the huge laptop and the very heavy and large power pack along with his iPad, a Wacom drawing tablet, some books and several smaller items like a headset, a wireless mouse and more with ease. If you have the bag on the floor and pick it up using the top handle it feels very heavy and not like something you'd want to carry around on your back - but the weight distribution is wonderful and the straps are superb. Upon placing it over one shoulder it's shocking how much lighter it feels (still clearly heavy but not nearly as bad as you'd expect) but if you put it over both shoulders you seriously can hardly tell there's much weight to it at all.The front of the pack, the part that looks to be molded and has the alienware logo on it, is not solid. It's firm and will protect it a bit but it isn't a hard plastic at all. You can push it in, bend it, etc - but that's not where the laptop goes anyway. It goes in the back and is very well padded on all sides and the bottom as well. There is a lot of room for other items as well, lots of little pockets for supplies, pens and more all over the place. The straps are thick and cushioned very well and curve to fit you better.Overall a great buy - I've spent $250 in the past on a Mono backpack that wasn't as good as this one. If I can trust it to protect a very expensive laptop for my son, then I can only recommend it for others.-D

I'm on a real tea kick right now and purchased these to go along with various infusers that I have.  They work perfectly every time and each one has a distinct different flavor that is very enjoyable.Organic English Breakfast:  This is a black tea and is pretty robust.  Not super strong but it does make a heavier tea than the others.  This tea has very thick leaves and is fine for your larger mesh infusers.Organic Green Tropics:  Let me say this - I am not and never have been a big fan of green tea.  Hot or cold.  But this is fantastic - the other enhancers with the tea really make a wonderfully flavored beverage.  Standard infusers are fine with this medium sized tea.Organic Serenity:  This is your red rooibos tea and I believe is the only one that could be considered an actual "herbal tea".  The particles on this one tend to be pretty small so you'll need a finer mesh infuser to use with it.Tropical White:  Probably my favorite, although with this selection I go back and forth depending on the day.  This tea is lighter (as a white tea will be) but very aromatic and flavorful.  Standard infusers are fine with this medium sized tea.Each tea comes in its own can, labeled and with a different color on top to easily identify them during your morning haze.  You can probably get 2 cups from each standard infusion if you wanted, but I generally like a more stout tea and allow mine to steep longer.  The "25 servings per can" is certainly possible unless you use more than the standard 1-teaspoon per 8 oz cup.I highly recommend this tea sampler, and this company's products based off of this purchase.  I plan on purchasing more in the future from them.-D

The first day I used it, no problem.  Starting the second day and every time since, this thing leaks.  The bottom piece screws on sideways most of the time so you have to remove it and keep trying over and over until you get lucky and it screws flat.  Even then, it will stay sealed only until you open the top.  Once that pressure leaves it, the tea flows from the bottom.  This happens with or without the infuser being in place and the seals are not broken, the threads all seem fine, there doesn't appear to be any damage at all with this product.  Everything looks like it is built as designed, but the seal on it is not good at all.Cannot recommend this product, will only give it 1 star because it's useless to me.UPDATE / CHANGES TO REVIEW:The manufacturer contacted me based on my review above, asking for an opportunity to send me a replacement bottle and in hopes of changing my review.  Well it worked - the new one works much better and so far no leaks at all.  There is a significant difference between the bottom "cap" from the old one to the new one - where the old one was clearly looser and the new one fits very snug.  The threads seem to be the same but the seal on it is larger and fits much better.  Not sure if this is a change in their design or if the first one I got was faulty.The mesh on the infuser is great, and the infuser can be removed.  I have used this for very fine grade tea and haven't seen any escape to the liquid yet.  However, the bottle is still glass so you have to be very careful with it, and it's not double-walled so even with the sleeve that comes with it you will find it quite hot to hold unless you are holding it by the tag at the top of the sleeve.  You have to be careful with this for the heat and for the breakage potential.Due to the customer service of the manufacturer and how well this second product works, I've changed my review from 1- to 4- star.-D

If you know how to play Solitaire it's pretty easy to pick up on this game.  We played with 3 people so left one colored deck out of it.  Everyone's deck is the same other than the colors on the back.You play solitaire yourself, but with 3 piles.  Plus you have one part of the rest of your deck face up to draw from, and you can flip the others (which you keep in your hand) 3 at a time to draw from (again, just like solitaire).  As you get 1's, you place them in the middle and everyone can draw from the top of any of their sources to place on any of the piles in the middle.The piles in the middle build from 1-up and always have to be the same color.  The 3 piles you are building on in front of you go from the top down and alternate colors.Very fast paced game, if you aren't quick or don't like fast paced card games like this then you may not like it much.  It's a great game overall though.-D

Fast....because I left them on the coffee table overnight!  Gone by morning of course.Before it got to that point, though, I had wrapped a few of these in a little paper for my dog and my girlfriend's dog - both went nuts for them and a couple more as treats through the night.  They have the look and pretty much the smell of sandwich cookies you'd buy for yourself.  The dogs probably thought they were getting people food, to be honest.Very recommended as a special treat for your dogs!-D

NO SPOILERS IN THIS REVIEW!Lots of bad reviews and quite a few 5-star reviews as well here.  Overall I feel it was as good as I expected it to be - and that it was time to end the series anyway.  Most of my reviews for the other seasons were 5-stars, this is a fantastic series!There are some fantastic, very memorable scenes in this season, and some that you will feel you they could have done without - but honestly it's like that every season.  Season 2 was probably my overall favorite, Dokes and his interactions with Dexter really made it great.  This season focuses more on winding everything down with the story lines, filling some holes in the history of Dexter and how things came to be with him, and of course building up to the ending.  The problem I think most folks have is that it had a slower feel to it because of all the holes they were trying to fill for those of us who really wanted to understand Dexter more.  Some of the folks that I talked to who were disappointed were hoping for huge fireworks of slaughter with Dexter laying person after person on his table every episode - it wasn't like that (and I don't consider that a spoiler, more of a warning to the folks who are hoping for it).  Character development did seem loose at times - but again, this is the final season - developing characters wasn't much on their minds, it was about closure.This wasn't my favorite season, but it wasn't my least favorite either.  And I loved every season!  Go into this seasons looking for drama, story telling and closure and you'll be very happy.-D

I used these 2 ways - baked some cupcakes in the cups, but others I baked in the pan and transferred to the cups.  Both ways worked great, and you couldn't really see a difference (so the color and shininess holds up in the oven well).  Cupcakes didn't stick to the insides whatsoever either which is especially great for the ones you cook in the cups themselves.Very recommended all around.-D

The good:-There are 6 different tips for different shapes.-There is a coupler (the tips screw onto a plastic coupler that goes inside of the bag).  This leaves you very confident that the tip won't just pop off in use.  This also means you can use the tips (and coupler) on other bags.-The bag is washable (see below though) and replaceable if needed.-Very inexpensive set for light use or for starters/children.The not-so-good (Or, the reasons why this set is so inexpensive):-The bag stains if you use chocolate, food coloring, or probably any other color than white.-The coupler is a bit cheap feeling, it works OK but there are better options for people who would be using a decorating set a lot, or folks who use very heavy icing in their decorating.For the price, you can't beat it.  Just don't expect the world of it.-D

I got 6 pieces of each type in the bag - honestly it could have fit in a bag less than half the size of this one.  But they were great tasting, mine weren't melted or broken like other folks have complained, and they're festive (which is why you really get them anyway).  The Santas are straight chocolate with Santa printed on the rectangular bar, the Reeses are shaped like little trees and the peppermint patties are shaped like snowflakes.-D

Overall this is a fantastic product.  Wish they made unwrapping them easier though, By the time you have them unwrapped they're usually in 3-4 pieces unless you're super careful (or super lucky).Recommended product even with that minor problem - I haven't found a candy cane manufacturer yet that made it easy on you!-D

Overall I like this calendar a lot. If I could, I would change the way the graphics for the calendar/date boxes are skewed.  I'd rather have them straight up and down, as I like to make notes on them throughout the year.  I can still do this of course, but because of the angles and the "depth" of them are set in the layout, the boxes for the days that come later in the month are significantly larger than the ones early in the month.  Plus they're angled as well, which just kind of screws with your eyes a little.Not the best calendar they've had for BBT (I've been getting these for years) but it's still overall good.  I like that they have cartoon superhero outfits for each of the main characters, and that the whole calendar has a comic book feel to it.Just a little disappointed as well that Stewart (the comic book store owner) isn't represented anywhere in this comic book adaptation of the calendar....would have been a nice shout-out to a great supporting character!-D

Exactly what my son had hoped for, it's quite heavy and durable and still shiny. The lettering is on the inside AND the outside of the ring, and it's visible but doesn't stand out unless you're looking for it - pretty much exactly what I'd think you would want.The ring is perfectly true-to-size and looks like it will last a long time. Didn't want to check the scratch-effect on this Tungsten ring for obvious reasons so I can't testify to that but as I do with other interviews I will update here if I find something that should be communicated as time goes on with this product.-D

These are rings that you can put on your finger. One review complained that they were "sideways" - the reason for this is so you put it on your finger and put your finger under your nose to make it look like you have a mustache. Have you seen anyone (or pictures of someone) draw a mustache on their finger and put it under their nose as a joke? This is like that. Having them sideways is a plus! :)I actually used these the same way as described - to put onto cupcakes because a friend was having a "wig" party and I told her if I have to wear a wig you have to wear a mustache.They are cheap plastic, but really do you need anything made of super high quality materials for something like this? No. But they are made sturdy and can be used as party favors or for kids or whatever you want.Good product, exactly what I expected.-D

Great memory - it flies and looks great.Easy to install, it's just a little bit taller because they come with heat shields to protect them and keep them running hard. But it's not really going to be a problem in most machines.They look great too, most of the interior of my case is black and these still stand with the lighting.Highly recommended.-D

Great stylist overall.My son is an artist and has several programs on his iPad to draw with.  He's been looking for a good stylus for a while and I think he finally found it in the Mobius Pro Stylus.  His last stylus was an  Adonit Jot Pro and after a few days it just stopped working - plus the disks are too much of a pain to deal with because they come off too easily.  I returned that and got him this one and he loves it.The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because the tip is a little long which feels just a little bit "off".  Still works well but the actual way it feels while drawing takes a moment to get used to.  I think it's great that it comes with its own case AND 2 replacement tips (so you get 3 total).  Not sure exactly how long this will last until one of the replacements is necessary but so far so good after a couple of weeks there appears to be no wear on it.Great product and much better than the Adonit disk-using stylus pens for sure.-D

I have 2 of the old wired style trackballs that are not made any more. I tried to find another one when one of my 2 went south, but people were trying to get over $100 for them because they are hard to find. I decided to go with the wireless and man am I glad that I did! It works perfectly, feels almost exactly the same as the wired style I've loved for so many years, and the battery life on it is superb.Highly recommended, this mouse is so comfortable and doesn't require you to move your arm around so much while you are at the computer (don't even need a mouse pad either!).-D

My son is an artist and has several programs on his iPad for his creations.  He has tried several different stylus pens and at first he thought this one would be the best.  It worked great - then suddenly, for no apparent reason, it stopped working at all.  This doesn't even make sense because it's not like it's battery run where it can just "Die".  We even bought extra disks for it but none of them helped either.Even outside of the problem above (which caused us to return the product - thank you Amazon for making it so easy to do that!!) this pen can be a pain because of those disks.  They are small and clear so hard to find if you drop them - and more importantly they don't even stay on the pen very well.  You'd think they would clip on tightly but they barely grasp the end of the pen enough to stay on - shaking the pen will drop it.  This also causes you to need a case to carry it in because you can't just clip it to your iPad case or put it in your pocket without a solid chance of losing the disk.I do not recommend this pen for anyone.  When it worked it worked well - but it didn't last long and the disks are too easy to lose.-D

Really good treat, took my jack russell several days to gnaw away.  I don't use the ball or toys that you can put these in, just gave it to her as is and she loved it.The smell isn't overly strong but it's there.  Because they're gnawing and licking it, it can get wet so you may not want this on your good furniture or your lap for that matter.-D

Not sure what the complaints are in the cost-to-volume ratio because this is sold here a bit cheaper than in the store when you buy 2.  I receive free shipping as a plus member so it's inexpensive and convenient.The quality of the softener is great - the smell is pretty strong though compared to some other options.  Maybe I actually need to use a little bit less (I know it's the Ultra version and it's concentrated but I have other Downy fabric softeners that are as well and I use the ball that has a measurement line so I'm using the same amount).I do recommend this product overall, I just may get a different scent next time.-D

Very good rack.  I got tired of those regular store-bought racks for my clothes that would break if you moved them over the carpet while full.  The standard caster wheels just don't work with heavy weight on them.  The wheels on this rack are larger and much better, the stand is all made of metal (no plastic) and the whole thing simply couldn't fall apart if there was an earthquake.The posts are steel and clip together easily.  Installation took about 15 minutes doing it alone.Highly recommended!

First - the product is exactly as described and works as intended.  Recommend the product.Word of warning though - at this time the product is being sold non-Prime and with a cost of "$4.07 + $8.12 shipping ".  This product is not worth over $12.  You can go almost anywhere that sells these and get it for less.I purchased this for $6.75 and it had Prime free 2-day shipping so that was my final cost.5-star review for the product itself, but a word of caution around the pricing changes..-D

Purchased this to replace a ThinkSport bottle that has the paint pealing so badly I don't want to be seen with it.  So far this one seems to be holding up - it's been washed in the dishwasher several times but usually with a brush by hand.  The only "wear" I see is that the "h" in "hydration" has started to come off.  Looks like the whole decal will eventually - but as long as the black base doesn't peel off like the ThinkSport bottle did, I'm fine with that.This is the 3rd type of 25-oz bottle I've owned - and this one definitely holds a little more liquid than the others.  I don't have an easy way to measure the exact amount, but when I pour one of the others (full) in to this one there's a good amount of space left for more liquid.The spout is perfect for drinking from, and the "screens" on the inside snap in very well (the ThinkSport bottle's work fine but don't snap in as tightly as this one).  There are also 2 screens, one with larger holes than the other so you have a choice.I use this for my coffee every morning - it keeps the liquid at a great temperature as long as I want it to - but it's usually gone before 10:00 AM (about 2.5 hours after I make the coffee).  It's usually open that whole time as well so it's REALLY good at keeping liquids at temperature then.Good bottle, I do recommend it - I just hope the outside doesn't strip away.  Only time will tell.UPDATE:  After about 3 months of use every single work day (Mon-Fri) plus some weekend days here and there, I've decided to upgrade my review from 4- to 5-stars.  I had been worried that the color would fade or peel away and it hasn't.  The "Pure Hydration" logo has mostly been rubbed off but the black underneath has no problem.  I don't have any fear any more that the outside paint job will strip away like the ThinkSport bottles did but as I can see a little wear on the very bottom of the bottle I can tell that it's just not painted the same way as those other bottles were, thus no stripping.  I beat this thing up going from my counter to my car to my desk to my backpack to the dishwasher or sink - and it works great.  The strap is still in perfect conditions, no fear there either at all.  Highly recommended.-D

Purchased this to go along with a belt for my Halloween costume (Scottish Highlander, kilt).  It was perfect for the costume and was surprisingly good quality for such an inexpensive item (~$8).  Will fit any standard snap belt using a single row of holes.  Recommended!-D

This Pope Francis book is beautifully done.  It is essentially a coffee table book filled with gorgeous photography and little bite sized bits of information about Pope Francis and the liturgical year.  There are some longer sections of text on Pope Francis' background before he became Pontiff and there is a section for each month as we follow a year of Pope Francis.  Overall, the book is very well done and the photography is stunning.

Green Toys have been a kid favorite in our house for the past couple of years.  This little dump truck is just as well made as all of our bigger Green Toys trucks.  The colors are fun and bright.  This truck is about half the size of the big dump truck and is nearly identical to it with the exception of the cab roof which is missing on this smaller one.  There is a little construction worker bear that comes with this truck which little ones can easily pop in and out of the driver's seat.  On some of our bigger trucks the wheels don't move as smoothly as I'd like them to, but this little truck doesn't seem to have any issues like that.  It was able to roll easily on a vinyl floor.  One of the things I like best about this toy is that it is made in the USA out of recycled plastic.  So it's domestically made and it's green.

This power pack is a lot bulkier than others that we have, but it also has the ability to charge more devices than the little compact stick ones.  It took several hours to charge it using my laptop.  The cord it comes with for charging is no more than three inches long which I found rather annoying.  The powerpack has a flashlight feature that while it's not the most powerful light, it's good enough to give you some light in a situation where you don't have it.  Overall, it's good to have on hand for situations where you need to boost your phone or iPad.

I had another Scotch Laminator that was nice, but paled in comparison to other laminators that I have reviewed since then, so my expectations for this machine were on the low side.  When I opened the box the first thing I noticed about this laminator was that it reminded me of the compact Swingline laminator that I really like.  I'd say size wise they're about the same, but this one has an area where you can wind up the cord and store it.  The cord storage feature alone makes me like it better for when I have to transport it for teaching CCD.  The laminator heats up within a couple of minutes and produces nice results.  I was really expecting the not crystal clear results that I was used to with my other Scotch laminator, but I was surprised at how nicely this machine performed.  The results were as good at the Swingline laminator and really not far off from the Fellowes laminators I have previously reviewed.  The other feature I needed to test out was the release lever.  Several laminators I have don't release easily which is a big problem if you wind up with a jam or a positioning issue.  So I was really happy to see that pulling the laminating sheet out of the machine once I slid over the release lever was a snap.  I think it's the easiest release I've encountered so far.The bottom line is this is a really good compact machine for a decent price.  It's easily portable and won't take up a lot of a space on a desktop.

My three year old daughter loves Star Wars, Chewy in particular, so this Millennium Falcon set from Playskool is just perfect for her or any little Star Wars fan.  There are a few pieces that you have to snap on to the Millennium Falcon but that assembly is a snap.  The play set comes with three figures Chewbacca, Han Solo and R2-D2.  They're chunky little plastic figures that will be easy for small hands to manipulate.  The figures can be stored in the Falcon while it's not being played with and it has a carrying handle that makes it ideal for transporting.

I really like this hide and seek mobile.  The little animals are cute and the option to allow the petals to rotate for hide and seek adds interest.  There is a good variety of music and sounds with the music box portion of the mobile.  The volume control is located on the front of the unit so an older baby who likes to play with buttons can adjust the volume which could be problematic if your child decides it's music time at 3AM and turns up the volume.  Of course, you can stop that by just shutting off the unit, but that only works if your child doesn't use this to fall asleep to music.  What I like least about this mobile is you cannot shut off the music just by hitting one of the buttons.  Our 14 year old Tiny Love mobile operates like that and getting used to this one not operating like that is taking me a bit of time.  I do like that it has a light option. The music box can detach from the crib bracket for playing outside of the crib.  If you have a curious toddler, he or she may be able to detach the music box by himself.  My son figured out how to take it off and play with it after the first couple of days.  Overall, this is a nice mobile.  It's easy to set up and attach.  The music is nice and the overall look of the mobile is cheerful and gender neutral.

This speaker from iHome is pretty decent for the price point.  The sound quality is pretty good (it's not as good as our Bose speaker, but it's not bad).  Even at louder volumes it still performs pretty well.  Connecting it to an iPhone using bluetooth was very easy; it took very little time to pair.  My only real gripe about this speaker is it didn't actually come with an AC adapter to plug it into the wall to charge it.  You can either use a charger that fits a usb cable (like an iPhone charger) or you will have to plug it into your computer to charge it.

This Christmas (Santa) themed railway crossing is a cute addition to the train set of your favorite Thomas fan.  The little tower has lights and makes bell sounds when you raise or lower the arms.  The roof and the tops of the rail signal and arms are painted to look like they have freshly fallen snow on them.  The quality is just what I would expect from the Thomas Wooden railway line.  I was a bit skeptical at first when I saw the Fisher Price name on this.  The Thomas trains that we've accumulated in the past 7-10 years were all made by Learning Curve so I wasn't sure if the quality that we came to know and love when our older children were into these trains would be the same, but I was delighted to find out that everything seems just as good as it was back then.  The track fits perfectly with our original track and I know our two younger children will be delighted to play with this new piece.

The first thing I noticed about this light was it's substantial weight.  It's solid and I would hope that's a sign of its quality.  The charger for the batteries for this light seems to be of average quality.  It flashes red while charging and turns to solid green when charging is complete.  Opening the light to add the batteries was a bit more challenging.  With no instructions, I wasn't sure where I was supposed to be attempting to unscrew the light, so it took a bit of trial and error before I finally found the right spot.  Quite frankly, I'm a little annoyed that this didn't come with any instructions.  For something as important as a diving light wouldn't you want some instructions so you make sure you have everything right?This throws a lot of light.  Even on the lowest setting this thing lights up my pool, where I tested it out better than the hard wired light for the pool.  The push button switch for adjusting the light is easy to use.

This lip and face moisturizer does a good job moisturizing, but I didn't particularly care for the strong lavender.  If you don't care for lavender scented products, this likely won't be the lip and face moisturizer for you.

This ACT test prep book and CD seems pretty comprehensive.  It walks the student through different scenarios and gives test taking tips and strategies.  It's a good way for a student who has never taken the ACT to prepare for what he or she will encounter on the test.

These dish towels are more for decorative use.  They're on the thinner side so they're not very absorbent like a terry cloth dish towel.  They are very soft after washing, but they come out pretty wrinkled so you'll need to iron them if a crisp looking dish towel is what you are looking for in this set.

This is a nicely sized versatile play gym.  You can set it up so it's a cozy four sided play area for a newborn or you can open up all the sides for an older baby so he or she can move around and explore.  The toys can be attached to the arches, the tummy time pillow or the play mat itself.  These included rattles and toys for this play gym are decent quality.  I particularly like the teething leaves, the giraffe and the monkey rattle.  The light up elephant that plays music is cute.  The elephant can also be attached to a car seat, although I'm not a fan of the idea of attaching a hard plastic toy on the handle of the infant carrier.  Overall this is a good and versatile baby activity gym.  It's a much better quality than the Fisher Price Moonlight gym I also reviewed recently.  The Sunny Safari theme is gender neutral so it's a good pick for first time moms who hope to use it for more than one child.

At the time I'm writing this review this play gym is listed at $69.99.  That said, it's priced to be within a few dollars of a Skip Hop or Tiny Love play gym, but the quality of the mat and toys included with this Fisher Price set don't necessarily stack up.  The round play mat really isn't "large," in fact, it's kind of small compared to my Tiny Love activity gyms and even the ones I have or have had from Bright Starts and Skip Hop.  The toys it comes with are ok, but they're not anything spectacular.  I much prefer the quality of the rattles and toys that you find in an Infantino, Skip Hop or Tiny Love gym.  I will say that the little tummy pillow is one of the nicest one's I've seen with a play gym, but in my experience I've always found these items to be useless.  My children have always wiggled off of those things preferring to just do tummy time on the floor without something to prop them up.The music on the toy is something I could do without.  It's just a very cartoony kind of sound.Overall, it's a cute, but small play gym.  The toys are ok, but nothing spectacular.  There are baby activity gyms out there that have more to offer by way of size, and nicer toys for the same price or less.  Unless you're really sold on the meadow theme or the color scheme, I'd check out other play gyms before setting my heart on this one.

I'm not overly impressed with this crib toy.  The daytime side has some buttons and gadgets for baby to press and hear sounds, but there's no option to have songs play for more than a few seconds so this won't do much to entertain a very young baby who can't yet manipulate the toy.  The fabric has a bit of texture to it, so it will not be the easiest to surface wash which is a big problem if you have a baby with reflux since this will wind up covered in spit up.  The night time side features soothing music and lights to help your little one drift off to sleep.  What I like best about this toy is the ability to use it either on a crib or a play yard.  Attaching it to the pack and play was an easy process.Like another reviewer, I also found the battery installation to be a bit odd. You need to slide one battery to the left, another to the right and then pop on in the middle.  I suspect they could have engineered the battery compartment so installation would be a bit easier.  I wouldn't want to be navigating the battery compartment while sleep deprived.

The SanDisk Internal SSD drive is a welcome addition to my in home server.  I was expecting a slightly larger drive but was happy to see that it was small and sleek and fit into an available drive bay with relative ease.  I had the drive up and running in minutes and did a fresh operating system install that typically takes 20-30 minutes (with a drive having slower write speeds) in 12.I am very happy with this drive and would recommend to another.

This two point plumb laser is a nice compact size and is easy enough to lug around.  The carrying case, on the other hand, seems a bit excessive size wise given the size of the laser.From a feature function standpoint, the magnets seem to have too much give to always ensure an accurate top to bottom result. The self-leveling feature seems to work ok. The instructions for this aren't exactly the best and could stand to be better.  They offer very little by way of telling you how to use it properly, and they don't even reference a tool that is included in the box.

This Cuisipro Fine Rasp Grater is good sturdy construction.  It has a nice weight to it, but if you'll be using it for more than a short period of time, it will likely become tiresome to hold.  It is designed in such a way that you can lay it across a mixing bowl and it stays pretty stable while in use.  The teeth on this thing are super sharp.  That's great for grating up things quickly and effortlessly, but it also means you can slice through your fingers easily, too.  Thus far, our fingers have stayed safe, but I suspect it's only a matter of time before one of us makes the mistake of grating a finger.  Even the teeth on this grater are serrated, so I'd caution you to be careful while using this, especially if you are accident prone like myself.

My kids and I really like regular Starburst candies, so we figured the mini FavReds [unwrapped] would be just as tasty.  Unfortunately we were wrong.  These don't taste like the regular Starbursts.  They're a different consistency and have an odd after taste.  My daughter remarked that they taste just like the Starburst candy corn that we brought around Halloween.  After trying them again, I realized that she was right.  The same awful waxy flavor and crumbly texture found in the candy corn was present in the minis.  I wouldn't recommend these at all.  My three year old, on the other hand gobbled these candies up.  But the rest of us who are a bit more discriminating when it comes to candy opted to stop eating them after trying each of the different four flavors a few times.

My husband enjoys playing ping pong, so he was excited to test out this pro quality table tennis racket.  He found this one to be very comfortable to hold and felt that weight wise it had a decent, but not too heavy weight to it.  He has only ever played with the run of the mill paddles that you could pick up at Target so the comparison between this racket and those are looking at completely different ends of the spectrum.  The surface of the racket allows for much better control than the basic bottom of the line paddles.

This keyboard is incredibly easy to pair with your tablet.  It took me less than a minute to have it working with my Kindle Fire.  The keyboard is pretty small, so if you have bigger hands or are just used to using a larger keyboard, this keyboard may take a little getting used to.  It's about the size of a tablet, so you can easily slip this into a purse and take it with you.  The keyboard comes with a little stand that you can prop up a phone or tablet in.  With the Kindle Fire, I found that the device sat up a little too straight so it wasn't exactly easy to see what was on the screen while typing with the keyboard.  The keyboard isn't an absolute necessity, but it is helpful to have if you're typing up an email or writing a blog post or something of that nature that is more than a few lines long.

This is a fun apron!  I don't usually wear aprons when cooking and baking, but my kids do.  While this apron is intended for adults, it does fit kids.  The apron has one of those continuous strings that runs through tubes so you can easily adjust it to fit a child.  It fits my petite ten year old quite well.  My three and a half year old was able to wear it by me just folding under a few inch section of the mid section of the apron.  She was quite pleased to run around the kitchen while I decorated a cake pretending to be Elsa.  The apron seems to be of decent quality.  It's not super heavy weight but it's thick enough to protect your clothing from small splashes.  My only gripe with this apron has to do with the continuous string tube design.  The strings can easily come out of the tube if you don't knot the ends and it's a pain in the rear to feed the string back through the tubes.

Most new moms-to-be register for a few different bottle types.  This Avent infant starter set will give you a nice variety of what the Avent Classic+ line of products has to offer.  The set includes three 4oz bottles with stage 1 newborn nipples, two 9oz bottles with stage 2 slow flow nipples. Using the included soft spout sippy insert and trainer handles, you can easily convert a 4oz bottle into a training sippy cup.  The starter set also includes a powdered formula/snack dispenser with removable divider, a newborn pacifier and a bottle brush.  The bottles in this set and the pacifiers are all blue, so if you want some color instead of the plain old clear bottles, these are nice.  It's a pretty blue, so you could really use these bottles for a boy or a girl, although I'm sure most would probably opt to use them for a boy.I've used Avent bottles for all four of my children, although my youngest baby isn't exactly be biggest fan of them and seems to perfer the Medela bottles over Avent.  The Classic+ bottles have one less piece to clean than the previous version of the Avent Classic bottle (In the 13 1/2 years that we've been using Avent bottles, they've come out with a few different versions.).  The Classic+ reminds me of the original Avent bottle minus the BPA.  The skirt of the nipple on the Classic+ is different from the old Classic design.  Avent says you can use the older style nipples with this bottle, but they recommend the Classic+ for this bottle.  The bottle brush that is included with this set is one of the best.  I tried many bottle brushes with my older children and this was my favorite hands down.  The pacifier is one that my children never particularly liked (our preference is Mam).  While my children never took to the Avent pacifiers, I did like that they come with a nice snap on cover to keep the nipple clean while it's in your diaper bag or purse.  It's a nice touch.  The soft silicone sippy spout is good for a baby who is just starting out with a cup, but I have found that over time,  the spout will begin leak.  The spout is essentially a flattened out nipple with a slit instead of holes so liquids will flow quickly through it.  The trainer handles are another accessory that never particularly impressed me.  My children never cared to use them, and I saw them as just another part to wash.  The handles make slipping the cup into a diaper bag bottle pouch difficult or near impossible.Overall, this set is pretty decent and would make a nice shower gift.  It's priced nicely for all that it includes.  This set will get you started with some of the essentials.

I have other Martha Stewart craft tools that I really like, so I was expecting this fringe cutter to be pretty nice.  I was pretty surprised when I tested it out and got sub par results.  It doesn't cut well at all.  One of the blades just falls out very easily and another one doesn't even cut the paper.  So much for evenly spaced fringe!  The shuttle safety lock on my fringe cutter doesn't work, so there is no way to lock the shuttle in place.  I'm disappointed in this product and I wouldn't recommend anyone spend money on it.  If I had purchased this instead of getting it free for the purpose of writing this review, I would have promptly returned it to the store.

When it comes to disposable training pants, Pull-Ups have always been my preference.  The Cool and Learn Pull-Ups are designed to give your child a cold and wet sensation when they don't make it to the potty in time.  It's essentially a potty training alert for your child.  The Pull-ups come in fun Disney character designs like Mickey, Tow Mater and Jake that little guys will like.  Mom and Dad will appreciate the velcro sides that allow you to remove the pull-up easily in the event of a #2.  Other brands don't offer such easy removal.  These are less absorbent than the night time pull-ups, so I'd only use these for bedtime if you have a child who isn't a heavy wetter or stays dry most nights.

When it comes to disposable training pants, Pull-Ups have always been my preference.  The Cool and Learn Pull-Ups are designed to give your child a cold and wet sensation when they don't make it to the potty in time.  It's essentially a potty training alert for your child.  The Pull-ups come in fun Disney character designs like Mickey, Tow Mater and Jake that little guys will like.  Mom and Dad will appreciate the velcro sides that allow you to remove the pull-up easily in the event of a #2.  Other brands don't offer such easy removal.  These are less absorbent than the night time pull-ups, so I'd only use these for bedtime if you have a child who isn't a heavy wetter or stays dry most nights.

Just like the regular pull ups, the night time pull ups feature fun Disney characters that little boys will like, only the night time ones glow in the dark.  If your child is wearing PJ pants over the pull up he's likely not going to see the glow in the dark design.  But I suppose there are kids who think it's pretty cool that the pull ups glow. The night time pull ups are more absorbent than the regular day time ones, so they're ideal if you have a heavy wetter.  I like that they have velcro sides so they can be easily taken off if you have a #2 incident.  Other brands, like the Pampers Easy Ups don't have velcro sides and I've found the design to be really awful since you have to tear the sides apart to get it off in the event of a #2.  Huggies has the better design.  I also find that these don't bunch up like the Easy Ups do.  These pull ups fit very true to size.  If you have a child in the 3T size range, the 2T/3T ones will be a bit more of a snug fit on the hips vs. the 3T/4T ones which will be a bit easier for your little one to pull up and down on his own.

My three year old is potty trained during the day, but she's not 100% there for night time.  So while she's less than thrilled to have to wear a pull up to bed, she does like that the pull ups have some of her favorite Disney characters on them.  The night time pull ups glow in the dark, but I find that feature a little odd.  If your child is wearing PJ pants over the pull up she's not going to see the glow in the dark design.  But I suppose there are kids who think it's pretty cool. I like that they have velcro sides so they can be easily taken off if you have a #2 incident.  For a while there, we were using the Pampers Easy Ups when my daughter was first starting out with potty training and I found the design to be really awful since you have to tear the sides apart to get it off in the event of a #2.  Huggies has the better design.  I also find that these don't bunch up like the Easy Ups do.  As far as fit is concerned, my daughter who wears a 3T/4T in clothing can fit in both the 2T/3T and 3T/4T sizes of pull ups.  The 3T/4T ones have a bit of a looser fit on her, but the 2T/3T ones still fit her comfortably.
