Into this project I placed a daring spline-defined squiggle, some gradient-filled shapes, and text in both Arial italic (which both programs offer), and Accent SF, which is only available in Adobe programs. I saved the file as an Illustrator file (.ai).Upon first opening the file in CorelDraw, I was informed that Accent SF was unavailable, and offered the option of replacing all instances with another font (one was suggested), either this one time, or in general. All text remained editable, as did the shapes and the squiggle, including re-splining. All good. (The Corel site offers more complete information about what kinds of effects are brought forward, and what isn't).While the content translation was good, however, the workspace translation was not. The art boards were transformed into pages, which in Corel are tabbed, not side-by-side, and the main layers were retained, but not the sublayers. Most people won't care. Wizard-level Illustrator users will be frustrated. (Using the Adobe-style workspace doesn't really help, though "page sorter view" will show you all your pages).* PHOTOSHOP TO PHOTOPAINT *To test the Photoshop/Photopaint transition, I prepared an eight-layer drawing in Photoshop from my CS5 package, in 32-bit RGB (Corel offers 24 and 48 bit), including one weird spline-based curve, and using some hard-to-replicate glows and shading, and some text again in Arial and Accent SF.  I rasterized and smudged some of the text in one layer just to be ornery, and stretched the text in another. Then I saved the file in native (.psd) Photoshop mode.Opening the file in Photopaint, I was delighted to see a very accurate rendering of the original, somewhat brighter, and now in 48-bit (one of the choices for color here is "Adobe RGB." Bravo). Corel's "What the font" feature even managed to identify the Accent SF font, with a little help from an online database. Editing the text was another story. Maybe because Photopaint opened the file as the background? Corel's Help file counseled me to use "Import" instead. Ok. Nope. I still got only one Photopaint "object" (what Photoshop calls a "layer," according to Photopaint Help, though there isn't really a 1:1 correlation here). Using the magic wand mask tool let me (tediously) separate the graphics into separate layers/objects, but (maddeningly) left some drop shadows behind, and the text was still unrecognized. Yet, the Photopaint help file says that Adobe text is imported as a text object, and therefore editable? Well, I did visually alter some of the text, and Corel doesn't like that. Maybe if I saved each text layer as its own file? I give up.* OTHER TRANSLATIONS *Just for grins, I opened the Photoshop file in CorelDraw, which produced an error message suggesting I use "Import" instead. Kudos to Corel. Importing, however, produced the same problems (no separate layers/objects, so no ability to select or edit text), as well as some awful distortions. Opening the Illustrator file in Paintshop Pro (X5) gave me a nice rendering, and I could then use the magic wand tool to salvage the graphics, though the text was a lost cause. Unfortunately, Paintshop Pro isn't part of this package. (Further online research indicates the best option may in fact be Corel Painter, which I unfortunately don't own).* CONCLUSION *Overall, I think this Corel suite will be useful for general users who don't want to (repeatedly) shell out absurd amounts of money for Adobe software. Real high-end graphic artists who want to continue to be able to access their own work, done in Adobe, are between a rock and a hard place. Adobe is in the process of alienating the entire industry, and Corel doesn't quite cut it (yet...).

It's telling that the Getting Started guide for the HTC M8 has a section titled "Your first week with your new phone." Because I've had this device for way more than a week, and I'm still finding features. Some highlights:* USER INTERFACE/CUSTOMIZATION - The phone has a free 6-month screen-replacement warranty, which is a good thing, since the first time it vibrated in my hand I almost dropped it. Vibrate is used as tactile feedback for input, which I personally hate, but this can be turned off, as can the "Blinkfeed" news and social media app which is the default homescreen (HTC is quite proud of Blinkfeed. YMMV.). Coming from an iPhone background, I found many small delights, like the fact that the analog clock icon not only keeps time, but can be made double-sized to make it more readable. Widget management is in general remarkable. The phone also comes pre-installed with many Google apps, but, like Internet Explorer on Windows, it's easy to download more palatable options.* MUSIC - The audio on the M8 doesn't so much raise the bar as launch it into low-earth orbit. Coming from an iPhone background, as noted, I was thrilled by the two user-facing speakers, and amazed at the sheer volume they could produce from such a tiny box, with relatively minimal distortion (also relatively minimal bass response, but nothing is perfect). The speaker sound is notably better if the phone is on an slightly absorptive surface (a wooden desktop or book, for example, instead of granite countertop). Populating the phone with my music involved copying MP3 files onto a microSD chip (using my laptop, via micro/mini SD adapter), and then putting the chip into the phone. No synch, no iTunes, no translation, and trivially upgradable. I'm not the type to profess romantic attachment for inanimate objects, but I am sorely tempted.* Harman/Kardon Music - This edition phone adds some additional music features, namely two filters (Clari-Fi, which enhances low bit rate mp3s, and LiveStage, which supposedly creates a more life-like experience when using headphones). A set of Harman/Kardon headphones is included. The phone also has the ability to play non-lossy formats like FLAC (and if you've ever priced a FLAC-dedicated player, you understand the value here). I did find that the filters made a difference when listening to most audio, though "difference" isn't necessarily "better' (LiveStage makes stuff louder and brighter, which isn't always what I prefer). Since I typically use Bose MIE earbuds I took this opportunity to compare them to the HK buds, and found what I usually find when comparing Bose and Harman/Kardon, namely that HK enhances the midrange and foreground, and lets the ends of both the pitch and volume spectrums fall back. This means that the Bose renders things like the glockenspiel in Danse Macabre or the bass line in Desert Rose with much more clarity and better imaging than the HK (the HK buds pretty much ignore deep bass). In Harman/Kardon's defense, this also means that dialog and speech will be more comprehensible. So, Bose for classical music, and HK for videos. (The HK are also earplug style buds, though that's not sufficient to explain the differences in rendering)* WATCHING VIDEO - The crystal clarity of the screen and user-facing speakers make watching video a pleasure. My pleasure was dampened slightly by the fact that the device doesn't support Amazon streaming video, or perhaps vice versa (Jeff, can you get on that? Thanks). The volume rockers are on on the right of the phone in portrait mode, which means when they are on the top of the device in landscape mode they are backwards - left is up and right is down. A minor annoyance. More of an issue is that the default is for the volume buttons to pop the phone into camera mode when the phone is in landscape mode, which is not what I want when watching YouTube. Fortunately you can turn that off.* CAMERA - For basic camera work, the phone rivals my Lumix (an actual camera). There are two lenses on the back of the device (thus providing parallax and the potential to focus after the shot), along with a dual flash, and one user-facing lens for selfies. I was particularly delighted to find a picture-in-picture mode, where you can put a selfie in a lower corner of the larger shot. This phone supposedly sacrificed some pixel density in favor of low-light capability, but most people won't miss it (I'm guessing one of the use cases was "nightclub"). The phone can in fact save pictures and video (and "Zoe" video) to the removable chip, and warned me that my music chip wasn't fast enough for optimal video. Nice.* PHOTO FIXING - Once you've taken the shot, the phone offers after-effects, for example different decorative frames, filters like tints and black and white, and an itty-bitty paint program with cut-and-paste, straighten/tilt, and a handful of brushes and colors to use to draw on the photo. I was surprised, given the brushes, that there was no function to place and enter text. Right now the photo manipulation is a nice social media toy, but there are users out there (insurance investigators, architects, etc.) who would happily embrace the ability to label photos as a serious work tool.* GAMING - Not since my old Game Boy Advance has a handheld gaming device felt so big and comfortable. My only beef is that the power button is a bit too easy to accidentally push if you put a little too much english on an angry bird, and that the edges of the enormous screen are a little too easy to accidentally activate. Both of these issues can be fixed with a nice case (I personally prefer the Otterbox Commuter).So, what can't it do?* Well ... erm ... uh... It's not so great as a PHONE. Not because of the audio or microphone (which is actually a bit too sensitive), or the contact management (which will import your iPhone data, along with anything else it can get its little electronic hands on), but because of the form factor. First, the device is huge, almost 3"x6" (see my picture above), smooth, and thin. As such, it's really uncomfortable to hold to your ear receiver-style, and hard to pick up from a smooth surface, which confounds the ergonomic niceties like automatically decreasing the ringer volume when the phone is moved, or muting the ringer when the phone is flipped from face up to face down (a great idea, BTW, but not useful if I have to fumble to pick the phone up in the first place). Second, the headphone jack is on the bottom (and the HK buds have a straight plug, unlike the Bose). Which means you can't use the device in standard cellphone position - held in the hand, hand resting on table or desk or stomach. (Autorotate is three-way, not four). You also can't have headphones attached when the phone is in a charging stand, which in my case seriously interferes with using the phone for Skype. The iPhone 5 also has this non-feature, so there must be some kind of rationale for it, but I can't image what.So, this is a great player, gaming device, and camera. But (sorry folks) only an OK phone.(Oh, and for those who care, the packaging is mostly pressed paper, and there is an envelope included to send your old phone back to Sprint for recycling. All good.).

As the title of the review says, this stylus is great for device cases that have an included pen/stylus loop - the thick part is about half an inch wide, the thin part is about a quarter of an inch wide, and the stylus will slip right in.The molded-in clip works on manilla folders, but not on any clothing I've tried it on (too tight), and is pretty much redundant. A hole for a cord would have been better, and you can in fact put a cord through the top of the clip. The stylus body is just a hair under 4.5 inches long, which may be too short depending on your hand size.Also, for some reason my Kindle doesn't like it. The stylus works great on my phone (HTC M8) and on my partner's iPhone, but for the Kindle you really have  to mash the tip down to get it to register. This isn't a screen protector issue - the phone has one, the Kindle doesn't. Maybe it's just the relatively small diameter of the tip? The tip is also pure rubber, not the nylon composite of the more expensive styluses, so does catch a bit if you swipe with it.So, the stylus is a nice mid-range tool, if it works for your device.

Given that this case is built like a snow tire, I expected it to provide the best protection for my new HTC One M8.  After trying it out, however, I've switched to the Otterbox Commuter. Two major issues -- First, the screen cover is a hard sheet of plastic that's part of the case, not the typical screen protector film. Since it doesn't adhere to the screen, rather sits slightly above it, every interaction with the phone feels like a little double tap - first to touch the protector, and then to press it down a fraction of a millimeter to touch the screen. This is driving me nuts.- Second, there's no protection for the lenses. The thickness of the case puts the lenses down in a little well, which helps for some kinds of impact, but the Defender case snaps into an included belt holster, which holds the phone with the screen inward and the lenses outward. Are you kidding?The Otterbox Commuter series doesn't protect the lenses either, but that case is slim enough to put into a pocket, and doesn't have the screen issue. I'm keeping the Commuter.

I adore my new HTC One M8, but it has three problems - one, it has a bit too much screen glare, two, the excitingly smooth and rounded body is a pain to pick up from a horizontal surface, and, three, it costs more than my laptop.  This case addresses all three issues.The case is three parts:- Screen protector - Comes with a tiny microfiber cleaning cloth, and an itty-bitty smoothing card (a credit card would be too big). I used some canned air to further de-lint my screen, which helped a lot with the install. I do wish the positioning tabs were clear, not opaque. I wound up with a bubble right under where the second tab was attached.- Soft silicone case - Has some nice structural re-enforcement at the corners, which is good, and puts the power-button in a little well, which keeps it from being accidentally pressed when you're playing Angry Birds, which is also good. Also has a flap to cover the power and headphone jack, which I'm thinking of cutting off, since it's interfering with using a charging stand.- Hard shell over-case. This snaps over the soft case. I had a little trouble getting it to seat properly, until I gave a firm yank on the above-mentioned flap, at which point everything snapped into place.Overall, the case makes it much easier to grip and pick up the phone, in addition to making me much less afraid of dropping it. I should note that the case doesn't cover the lenses or the speakers, so it doesn't provide 100% protection. For my purposes I'm happy with it, and in fact I prefer it to the Otterbox Defender series case, which I have also reviewed.(Aside to Otterbox: everybody who reviews charging stands complains that they don't work with Otterboxes, and vice versa. Just sell the damn charging stands already.)

Inasmuch as we live in earthquake country, I'm always looking for good flashlights. This one will be joining the hang-them-on-the-bedroom-doorknobs collection.FORM FACTOR:  The device is quite small actually, not as tiny as my Maglight Solitare, but it won't be a burden to tuck it into a backpack or purse. The case is metal, with much ergonomic knurling. The belt clip is removable, but pretty well finished, so it shouldn't catch on stuff. The button switch is recessed.  I was miffed that my flashlight had a hole for a lanyard, but no actual cord included, until I opened it to put in the battery. The cord, spare o-rings, and spare switch cover are tucked inside. (Fortunately I have small fingers). I appreciate the spare o-rings, but there are no instructions on how to change the switch cover, and no obvious way to do this.BATTERY: The device takes one AA battery, which, according to the package insert, will give you 1.5 hours on bright mode, and notably longer in the dimmer light modes. (See below).LIGHT MODES: The light beam isn't focusable, like my Maglight, but there are five light modes available - High (the insert says you'll get 1.5 hours from a fresh battery), medium (2 hours per battery), and low (12 hours per battery), as well as strobe and "SOS". Switching between modes involves turning the flashlight on and off, and waiting three seconds to "memorize" your choice. Ok. In theory there's a manual flash function for "momentary" operation, but all I ever got it to do was change modes, so, despite the military styling, this may not be the best choice for Morse code.Overall, I like the flashlight, though I wish there were a better way to change modes (chips are cheap, switches are expensive, I get it). Four stars.

I've been using a Fujitsu Lifebook since the iPad was just a gleam in Steve Jobs' eyes, so I knew when that died (the Lifebook, not Steve) that I would be looking for another convertible tablet. This one has the same multi-use advantage as my old Fujitsu, and the same slightly smaller pitch keyboard, in a lighter, cooler, and slightly more violent package.Pros:- Nice click-tactile keyboard. Not quite as much key-travel as my old (and THICK) Lifebook, but not the mushy mess of chicklets that some notebooks offer.- The trackpad has buttons. For some reason, hardware vendors think that supporting multi-finger gestures on touchscreens and trackpads means you don't need buttons on the trackpads anymore. I was raised on mice. When I'm selecting or moving things, I want buttons.- Surprising good audio. When I was looking at notebooks in the store, I knew this one had a nice clear display for video. I didn't expect that the audio would be quite so good. The speakers are on the bottom of the machine, which means that in tent mode they are roughly vertical and behind the screen - great for movies. Also great for firing up Amazon Cloud drive (or your favorite online player). The sound is notably better if you give the notebook some acoustic assistance by putting it in a bookshelf or in a similar stable (ideally wooden) box.Cons:- The edges of the notebook, where the black plastic of the case transitions to the silver of the keyboard area, are SHARP.  When I'm typing with my wrists resting on the lower corners of the machine, to either side of the touchpad, I actually wind up with red indentations in my skin. I'm seriously considering duct tape.- Out of the box, the touch screen is actually a little too sensitive. I kept having things read as a double-click when all I wanted to do was a little drag. Some of this can be mitigated by adjusting the settings, and I did a lot of that in the first few weeks of use, and not just to get rid of the goddamn "Charms".  (But don't blame Lenovo for Microsoft's mistakes).- Takes a while to come out of hibernate or sleep. The processor for this notebook isn't the fastest, and one of the ways this manifests is when you try to awaken the machine from suspend mode. The screen stays dark for a few moments, and there's the urge to assume the machine is hung and restart. Just wait.- The power button is really easy to accidentally push, inasmuch as it's at the front of the right edge in laptop mode, right where your hand falls when you pick up the machine to move it. Part of this is the constraints of tablet design, but I really wish it had been closer to the hinge. (Or even on the other side, next to the power cord).- Speaking of the power cord, I really wish the connector was angled. I like to type crosslegged, with the notebook on my lap, but with this machine this position puts unreasonable stress on the cord. So, no doing yoga when you are using the Yoga. (I would totally buy an angle adapter if if were available).- The machine is very quiet, but not totally silent, inasmuch as there is a bit of hiss from the internal mechanics.Foibles aside, I think this is an excellent notebook, especially at this price point.  I hope the ergonomic stuff will be fixed in the next iteration.

With all the other reviewers singing the praises of these zipper bags, I actually thought Amazon might have sent me the wrong box. I find the bags useful, but I have some notable quibbles.Pros:- No pesky slider to get in the way of fully filling the bag (also, Con: No slider).- The stippling on the bag keeps the plastic film from clinging to the contents, which helps with produce storage.Cons:- No slider (as noted above).- The plastic of the bag is tinted blue, which makes some food less than appetizing (minor), but also confounds the blue-and-yellow-make-green trick. From the yellow side, the zipper pretty much always looks green.- The plastic is not really so thick. It has a stipple pattern embossed into in, which may make it feel thicker, but it's not nearly as thick as the Ziploc freezer bags I'm used to using.- The stipple pattern weakens the bag. Since I now have a lot of these, I tested half a dozen by filling them with between two and three quarts of water, and dropping them into my acrylic shower stall from about five feet up (freezer height). Five broke along the line of the stipple pattern (the sixth landed perfectly on edge and the zipper opened). In contrast, a similar Ziploc combo bag, bought at Costco in the four-pack, had to be dropped several times before it broke.I think these bags will be useful for produce, since they open wide and don't cling, but I won't be buying them for freezer use.

I had an itty-bitty Maglight on my keychain for years before it died, so I had high hopes for this as a replacement.  It's a  useful flashlight, but not suitable on a keychain.Pros:- BRIGHT. As in "I can't believe this tiny thing is lighting up my bedroom."- Convertible. The flashlight throws a good beam. Deploying the lantern is just a matter of pulling out the ring around the bulb guard to expose clear plastic, and then putting the flashlight face down.  Putting it face down on a white surface is notably better than on a dark one.- Pretty well made. The flashlight body is machined aluminum, not plastic. The on/off button is nicely recessed to avoid accidently turning it on in a pocketbook or backpack.Cons:- As noted, the flashlight is almost an inch in diameter, and 2.5 inches long. Way too big for a keychain.- Lousy caribeener. I've seen the same clip on dime store keychains. Worse is the split ring that attaches the clip, which is just a loop of wire. I replaced both with a large paper clip. (The hole for the ring is unfortunately too small to put in something better).- Button batteries.  Not impossible to find when they need replacing (thank you Amazon), but not rechargable and not recyclable. The flashlight body is big enough to hold AAAs. What gives?Overall, I consider this a good light but not a great one. I probably wouldn't get another one. (For keychain purposes, I recommend the new LED version of the Maglight - Maglite Solitaire Led 1AAA - Black Han - SJ3A016.)

I came to this book by way of "Unorthodox," another story of a young woman from an ultra-orthodox Jewish background who broke free to join the secular world. The author of that work dared to wear jeans and go to college, in a community where doing so was tantamount to checking yourself into a mental hospital, or having sex with random strangers in bars.The author of this work, did, in fact, check herself into a mental hospital, and have sex with random strangers in bars. (But at least she was still modestly dressed...). I'm a hard person to shock, but I'm frankly astonished she is still alive.The book is an extraordinary glimpse into a life and lifestyle most Americans can't begin to comprehend. And of how that lifestyle implodes at the hint of even the slightest transgression (as a side note, readers from individualistic cultures may gain a better understanding of Islamic "honor killings"). The author matter-of-factly recounts her downward spiral and the men associated with it, from self-serving sleazebags, to Rastafarian drug dealers, to kinky professors. Having hit bottom, she decides her social redemption will lie in getting into Harvard (where, presumably, there are no self-serving sleazebags or Rastafarian drug dealers or kinky professors).My only complaint about this book is that the individual events are not explored more deeply. I understand that there is a lot of ground to cover, but it feels like the author is treating us to a slideshow instead of a walk-through. Compared to the other book noted above, however, this work is clearly by a more mature author (in all senses of the word), one who doesn't fall quite as much into the common trap of dutifully recounting the latest social psych theories instead of the appropriate b'rucha. She has owned her past, has placed it into a real social context, and has moved on.

Post-apocalyptic novels are nothing new in science fiction, and this one falls true to classic forms - enclaves of civilization, lawless outlands, a society built on the potsherds and ruins of the previous one. But the ruins are ours, the apocalyptic event wasn't a nuke or a plague, just an economic fizzle, and the enclaves of civilization are (more or less) Chinese. The result is not unlike Mad Max meets the Joy Luck Club.Into this society, as a farmer/fish wrangler, is born Fan, our heroine. And also her boyfriend, Reg, who up and disappears one day, whereupon she sets out into the badlands and 1% enclaves to find him, whereupon hangs the (intricate but not convoluted) plot.The world-buildng is fantastic (in both senses of the word). The writing is lyrical, bordering on poetic. Though, lyrical not being the easiest form to parse, the reader sometimes forgoes enpassent simplicity in favor of ultimate linguistic satisfaction. (And if you didn't like the previous sentence, you won't like the book).I found it very satisfying.

Standard grab bars look too institutional, so Moen and some other companies have started making designer versions. But, since I didn't really want a grab bar with a Victorian look, I found these. Which are only sorta institutional. Functional realism and all that.I appreciate the slightly smaller diameter on these compared to the standard 1.5". I was concerned about the corners (like some other reviewers), but there is a bit of a radius, so they're not really that sharp.I was also concerned about where the bar was made, inasmuch as Moen sources a lot of things in China - my package had no indication of origin.  The bar also came in what appears to be a vinyl bag, if you care about such things.

I've always thought the colored stripes on toothbrushes were like the colored stripes on running shoe soles - mostly about marketing, not engineering.  I have to admit, however, that the different types of bristles on this toothbrush really do make a difference.  I can feel the pointy white bristles going between my teeth as I brush, while the blue are polishing the tooth surface. Some further observations:POLISHING - the compact tuft of blue bristles does an excellent job of polishing buccal (that is to say, cheek) and chewing surfaces on my teeth. For lingual (tongue) surfaces, however, I'm not getting as good a result as my old basic Colgate toothbrush (also soft and compact head). I brush the lingual surfaces with the brush held vertically, so this may be part of the problem - the tuft isn't being positioned quite right.GUMS - the longer white bristles have a nice point on them, and do slip between and around my teeth and stimulate the gums. Nicely done.HANDLE - the base of the handle is a tad over half an inch wide, which means I had to whittle it down a bit to fit in my toothbrush holder.  The thumb grip is much wider, which prevents the toothbrush from falling fully in (a good thing - I hate when a toothbrush head rests on the icky holder top).TONGUE AND CHEEK SCRAPER - I'm one of those few Americans who actually uses a tongue scraper (I prefer the Oolitt), so I was looking forward to trying this.  The touted built-in scraper is actually a bit of rough patch on the back of the brush head (a lot like sharkskin). It does nicely on cheeks, but when scraping the tongue it loosens crud but does not collect it, which makes for a slightly icky result.  I also gag on the brush bristles if i try to scrape too far back.  I'll stick with the separate tongue scraper.Overall, the brush is good but not perfect.  As with all personal hygiene products, YMMV.

Cats are in at the moment, and so is Buddhism, so of course a combination of the two would be a natural.In this charming work, we are introduced to some further basic precepts of Buddhism (and life in general) via HHC, his holiness the Dalai Lama's cat. Not from the teaching throne (teaching litter box?) but rather through overheard conversations and general knowledge and feline introspection.There is a well-created if slightly fictionalized setting, and plot, and characters. None too complex. But also much to meditate upon.In addition to Eastern philosophy, HHC's perambulations also bring her conveniently into contact with discussions of modern social psychology experiments. Unfortunately, the validity of some of those experiment's findings has been subsequently challenged.  The notion that new discoveries in western science support ancient Buddhist beliefs is also in at the moment, and I wouldn't want to throw the kitten out with the bathwater, but I do wish the author had run the book past a professor or two.

I must confess, I haven't read the Faith Club book. So, my disappointment with this this work may be my own fault - maybe I just didn't do enough research.I was expecting this book to be about what it is like to be an observant Muslim living the American lifestyle - juggling Friday night mosque with Saturday morning little league, working during Ramadan, the momentous day when the author's daughter started covering her hair, perhaps some Iftar recipes, and so on.  Not so. The author does not wear a headscarf, and is more of what a completely different tradition would refer to as a "solo practitioner."  And, as she herself notes (repeatedly), her kids have been to more bar mitzvahs than events at the mosque.So I guess I'm one of those clueless Americans that the author is trying to educate - not all Moslems wear headscarves, much like not all Moslems are terrorists.Unfortunately, the "not all Moslems are terrorists" meme isn't just a recurring theme, it's a literary club that the reader is bashed with throughout the length of the book.  I do sympathize with the author's need to do so - while the defining watershed events for the Jewish community and the Gay community were differently horrific (to provide two examples, among many), neither of those quite galvanized the American psyche as much as the events of 2001. (I personally had to take a break at the end of Chapter 2 to have a little flashback. Caveat lector.)Its good to know that there is a feminist movement within Islam, and that not all Moslems are Wahbists, and that the Imam who wanted to build the "ground zero mosque" was simply being clueless.  But I would have been happier to see these things in the context of everyday life, which here only shows up when the author is recounting how her children grew out of not wanting to be Moslem. There is no doubt that the author writes with passion, but she keeps coming back to 9-11 like a tongue comes back to a missing tooth, which makes the whole book read like a loyalty oath.Given the subject matter I hate to criticize, but potential readers should be aware of what they're getting.

I will admit, we finally got this up and running, and it's faster than the old Synology box. Some foibles along the way:- You absolutely *must* install the firmware upgrade (as noted by other reviewers).- Give up on using it with an XP system. We have both Windows 8 and an older XP computer in the household. The installation went fine on the Win 8, with multiple failures on the XP, and the error message to install Buffalo NAS Navigator first (but I already did...). Perhaps a greater wizard could solve this.- There is no easy graceful shutdown.  The other box (Synology DS209) has a pushbutton shutdown that will check mirroring on the two disks. It's possible to do this with the Buffalo, but it's not a single-step operation. Perhaps an artifact of the more configurable RAID arrays, perhaps just a cost-cutting measure.- Oh, and some of the interaction screens in the English install are in Japanese (see my photo above). This will probably be fixed as soon as Buffalo sees the Amazon reviews. But why am I doing their QA for them?

For the first couple of chapters of this book, I was worried it was going to develop into a "Teachings of Don Juan" or "Way of the Peaceful Warrior" type exposition. It didn't, thankfully.The oppressed people/golden child/old ways trope at the center of the story is a common one (biblical even).  But, while there are spiritual events here, the author intentionally keeps the story line remarkably matter-of-fact and grounded in the modern era.  And the plot lines (including one notable event I won't spoil) do acknowledge the Colgate Wisdom Tooth problem (if you have to ask, you wouldn't understand).No cigar store Indians here, just real people. I would be happier if there were fewer generalizations about white folks, however, and less of a different kind of preaching (getting almost as odious, in its own way, as the CWT problem). Nothing is perfect.  Still worth reading, especially if you've been following the series.(Aside to the author - the string-your-own-beads vendor at Powwow does in fact sell crosses. And stars.).

In function, this juice box is pretty typical - it charges fully from my usb wall adapter in about five hours, will just barely charge my iPhone twice, has a button to push to see how much charge is left, and gets nice and warm when it's charging the iPad (I'm getting less than a 25% charge for that). The only notable issues are that it's not particularly good at holding a charge (one week lost a full pip), and that the charging lights will continue to flash as long as it's plugged in, even after the charge is full (once you uplug it and push the button it will indicate a full charge).I selected this battery because of the form factor - the USB in and out are on the device itself, with no need to mess with cords (though a short cord is included, presumably for outlet convenience). And, joy of joy, the end caps screw off and are supposedly replaceable with other tips. So, I can get a USB-OTG tip for my camera and powermat case, and fully ditch the cords, right?  Nope. As of this writing there are no additional tips to be found, either on Amazon or on the Goal Zero site. My email to customer service wasn't replied to (after almost a full week).  What's up folks?  Still waiting.UPDATE: after more than a month, i finally heard back from customer service. It's possible to order a "mini cable kit" directly from the company (by phone - it's not on the website.). They also have a multitip cable called a "medusa cable". Neither of these is a form-factor advantage over any other juice box.  Not sure what happened to the above mentioned tips.

My wife really enjoys this case. Good protection, without a lot of added weight or bulk. The clasp works great. Keeps it secure but easy to unlatch. It is a little subdued and she found it hard to find in her purse. So she added some colorful tape. But perfect if subdued colors is want you want. Recommended.

We had to wait for some cooler weather to test this on an actual camping trip rather than just the backyard. It was a very good experience even though it was car camping. Less room then we are accustomed to, but myself, wife, and daughter were able to sleep comfortably.So lightweight and easy to carry. Incredibly easy to set up. The rain fly is wonderful. Not a lot of pockets inside, there could have been more. And on an subsequent set up for camping in the backyard our puppy did pretty much destroy it. So be careful with it and it should give lots of good service. But not puppy proof for sure.

Fantastic product. This works very well and is so much fun for our daughter. And also we feel it has a significant safety component as she really is interested in bugs and we are not knowledgeable on which ones are safe all the time.Simple but effective design. With just a few twists the bugs get in, they get trapped. You open up the barn and they go in. We have her return the bugs. This has just heightened her interest, we feel better, it is a lot of fun. I just can not recommend it enough. It works, it is fun, it is educational.

This was much better than expected in terms of bulk and feel. I was thinking it would be much larger.However mine had a fatal flaw. It would beeb constantly when in recharge mode. I called the company and they said it was not normal. And they would call or email me back. They did neither.One other thing. In order to use the headphone slot you need an extender, which is supplied. But easy to use. Without the beeping, 4 stars for being a nice case and a camera case.

Good for not little hands, tough, and not too expensive. This isn't a great binocular, of course, but it is a fun binocular and great for kids. My regular ones are much too heavy and big. Plus a bit expensive and I'd rather not take more chances then I can.I've looked through them and they give a decent view. Most of all our almost 5 year old daughter likes them, recommended.

Really like how vacuums are evolving and this is no exception. I like the application of newer technology in vacuums. And Electrolux has made an extremely user friendly vacuum with very useful design features.Cordless and light weight are great features. But this is still powerful. The charge lasts a long time. And the detachment feature has worked well for stairs, and furniture.If it holds up, unknown at this time, it will be one of favorite items. I find the charge time adequate. With a child and dog, the handheld has been very useful. Recommended.

We received the 6 inch one. It has been worth the extra cost. It is very well made, and noticeably faster in charging and transfer of photos/ video than an average cable. The 6 inch size is perfect for laying right next to a computer. But obviously a bit more limited when charging.But easy enough to make do in most circumstances. Good quality, recommended.

I thought this was a cool idea. We are eating Paleo now and constantly coming across new recipes and trying them out. So we wanted to create our own cookbook so to speak.This helps. The sheets and recipe cards help protect and organize. But at best an OK value and you need to supply your own binder.Not necessary for your own cookbook but helpful.

Good variety of vegetables and good intermediate from seeds and already growing plants. Typically we buy plants but they cost more.Also something to our child planting seeds. These all sprouted but may not survive due to late planting. For those without a green thumb the combo of seed and fertilizer did seem to help.

A product that has enhanced our family enjoyment. First the speaker is good quality at any sound level.Then Alexa is very functional. Not a gimmick but a very real breakthrough in functionality. We use voice commands all the time for music, playing audio books, scheduling meetings.And more functionality is added all the time. One of our favorite household items.
Nice quality. Better quality then we normally get at our outlet kids stores which have some good deals. This one has good construction, looks good, is solid, comfortable but sturdy. Recommended

Five stars because it works well, decent size, and good value. Some puppy pads have tape to make them less likely to move around. A consideration for how we use pads. This one doesn't. But as long as you are OK with that going in, it should not deduct from product.It did absorb very well and was of high quality. Which is what we wanted. Combined with cost, this is a good value.

One of my wife's all time favorite beauty products, I like it as well. First off most of the ingredients look high quality and non-harmful. Not an insignificant consideration for today's cosmetics. I liked the list of ingredients.Second it works, no first use. I could tell it helped really deep clean my skin. My wife who has more use of these products said it was the best exfoliating product she had ever used. Highly recommended.

Unique in the blasters we've had in that it can be hooked up to a hose. Which is cool if you think you can use it. Also can hold a lot of water and it blasts pretty far.The one thing to keep in mind is that it is large and younger kids might not be able to handle or use it that well. Our 4 year old daughter can use every previous model we bought. But this one is too big for her. But for older kids a fine choice with strong spray and the hose feature if wanted.

Chuckit are my favorite dog toys. Durable, well made, quality. This one is no exception. Rugged, bouncy, bright, and loud squeaky for added appeal. Too big for our thrower, but great stand alone ball.

Fit our largest top mattress well. Seems well-constructed. Lays flat well. Takes nothing away from my sleeping experience. Waking up fine but no noticeable improvement in allergies although they aren't bad now. No spills yet so cannot comment on that. But for a well-constructed protector, worth your consideration

One of the more functional covers I've used. Well designed, functional, easy to use, reasonably priced.I have an iPad 3. This was a breeze to put in, yet is snug once in. All buttons easily accessible. The stand works well as do the straps for hanging on a car seat. It seems it would be above average in protection from a fall as well. Velcro works well throughout. Background available as a download as pictured.Frankly I don't mind it as a cover also. Recommended.

Video quality is meh. But as good or better than any other system I have used at this price. And ease of set up and the app is better than other monitors. I like the remote features, we use this mostly for our dog. Was very pleased with ease of set up.In my experience of monitors I think it is a good choice for price. If you go up perhaps you'd get better quality, but I think it will will be enjoyable to most.

For Texas this is fantastic. Just able to review this is something I really wanted. An auto shutoff for middle of the night. It just started getting humid and my wife in particular hates it. I hate running too much AC at night. So far this is a good compromise and has run all night.Really like not having to run a hose. So far noticeable difference and is handling early May in Texas just fine in a large bedroom.

Our family has been Primal, Paleo plus dairy, for two years. Life changing. From sick and obese to thriving, healthy in body and mind. It is completely based on evolutionary biology. It is the best nutrition science in the world. Not a 'convert' yet? I suggest Primal Blueprint by Mark Sisson.One of the awesome things is how great food tastes and yes nourishes you. Shouldn't food do both? And yes leave you full. This book stands out because it is autoimmune aware and recipes follow that protocol with variations if you aren't.I also like that many recipes use the same ingredients in different ways. So if you buy plantains for instance, half a dozen recipes. I think most of the recipes are very mainstream. Confused by some of the other reviews. But when you are ready to try the sardine one is maybe my favorite. Complex flavors yet most recipes simple to prepare. Highly recommended.
Puppy loves it. This is good quality and a puzzle. Great price here.

Good value and good paper. A bit thin for 2 ply but the quality and nice feel is still there. Not sure what some people are comparing this to but perfectly good, soft, quality paper for the home or anywhere else. Recommended.

Quality construction, warmth without bulk, and looks good. The fleece lining really does help make this warmer than a regular hoodie. Note lining is not in the arms, but core warmth more important anyway.Like the look, recommended product.

Mixed feelings about using this at first. A child's bladder control develops when it develops. But there are some downsides to this. We were using for our 4 year old, training pants at night in case which are costly and not environmentally friendly. Also she went occasionally during school naps.This did remarkably help. The theory is solid, behaviour modification with a warning when setting starts. This trained her to stop at night and has resulted in fewer rashes from training pants. Overall very pleased.

I regularly eat 85% and 90% cacao chocolate. I enjoy the rich, distinct flavors. These nibs have a rich, intense flavor. They are high quality. We have baked with them and gotten excellent results. I've tried them in coffee and they don't dissolve but still add a nice kick. They are an excellent addition to my yogurt. It takes very little for big flavor. So the bag goes far.Just be aware 100% cacao is an acquired taste.

My wife has really enjoyed this. One of the most pleasant scents of any of her cosmetics. It also has not left her skin dry at all. It has absorbed very well and she likes that her face feels very smooth afterwards. She is able to apply a foundation powder afterwards without having to use a moisturizer.

Very comfortable, nice to hold, pretty close shave for an electric razor. Also no after burn. All in all probably my favorite electric razor. Will it replace my manual? Probably not. But that is me. Two reasons. Manual are still closer shaves and less maintenance.But they end up costing more. And this does a good, very acceptable shave. So if you are OK with upkeep this is a good choice that can ultimately save you money over blades.

Versatile and good looking. Definitely a mens size.Very lightweight with the UA loose fit. Because of the collar can wear as a shirt or light jacket. Lettering is a little more modern than most UA designs. Recommended

Simple, no frills, but effective. The broom assembles in moments, then ready to go on carpets and hard floors. Great, easy energy free way, to extend time between larger cleanings.Better on carpets than hard floors for us. And handle is stiff to move down for better angle when cleaning. Supplied tool makes cleaning easy. Overall recommended.

Very good value for the price. Faster than my previous more expensive router, but this is newer technology. No complaints on speed or coverage in a two-story house. It looks nice, quick and easy set-up. And unlike any previous router it has a guest network set-up. I've had this come up before with previous routers without it and feel a bit better having this for the next time it comes up. Good router, giving 5 stars because I think it is an excellent value at the price.

Overall these are very good jeans. They are soft and comfortable from the first wearing. Also nice weight, not thick and heavy and not thin. Dye job is excellent, deep blue even darker near feet.They run maybe slightly big in the waist. But a half inch at most, maybe like a quarter inch. Definitely not slim jeans, but still complimentary to looks. Recommended

I prefer full body exercises with my body weight, but a few, simple home items can help as well. I would put this as one of them. Lightweight but sturdy, easy to connect or take apart for travel. It gives a good core exercise and I feel it in my arms as well as my abs. I like it because I feel like I am doing a full body, functional exercise with help from a piece of equipment.This is why I have a kettle bell and a pull up bar. The pull up bar especially helps do a full body functional (many parts working together) exercise. The one major short coming of this, and I almost dropped it two stars, not even one exercise on the insturctions. You need to go online. It would not have hurt to have at least one exercise listed.

Eggs are well, extraordinary. The yolks are. They have every nutrient to produce a chick from an embryo. Truly nature's multivitamin. We prefer pastured eggs. They taste and look amazing. You've never seen a yolk look like a pastured yolk. Highly recommend them over organic. Both is fine also.As to this: I prefer my eggs raw, or soft boiled, or poached. I ONLY have raw egg yolks if the eggs are pastured. Never try this with any other egg. I've had other egg cookers but the poaching tray sets this one apart. Also ease of use and virtually any kind of egg perfect every time. Eggs highly recommend, the Silex as well.

Trust Viva products, taste isn't for me. But if you are looking for Maca powder this is probably one of the best choices. Everyone has their favorite supplements. I am not exception. I try first to eat whole foods, high quality items. Grass fed beef not CAFO beef for instance. But our soil and food quality has gone down so much I do believe that smart supplementation can help.If you like or want to try Maca powder then I would recommend Viva. It made foods taste off to me. But if you have enough stuff in a smoothie lets say and you can't taste it. Or if you actually like the taste then it might be a 4 or 5 product to you. I am giving it 4 stars because taste is personal and as I said I think Viva is a good company with quality products.

The  Koss Portapro is my favorite sub $100 headphones ever. A true classic that is hard to be even after decades. Koss just got it right. At first I wasn't so sure they had anything right about the SP540. It was an on-ear headphone which I prefer but it felt odd, too light, too loose, too dis-connected to my head. It also did not sound particularly good at first. Worse than my Portapros.So why five stars? Things changed. And after a short time I started to thoroughly enjoy almost everything about the SP540. Most important the sound. I don't think break in periods last as long as some folks do, But these definitely needed some break in. They were flat, and dull and muted at first. But then after a couple of hours they started to sound, good, full, balanced, rich. They are very well balanced to me: mids, lows, highs, voice, just very pleasing.Then I noticed that I started to really like them on the ear. The lightness and looseness makes for an enjoyable extended listening period. They also have a good balance of decent passive noise cancellation but you can also hear just a bit. Good for a work environment. Also very little sound leakage.The cord is not very long but this makes for good sport and commute use. It is detachable so if you needed a longer cord at work you could use one. All in all one of the better if not best sub $200 headphones I have used lately. Definitely recommended. Don't get discouraged if you need a break in period though to get them to shine.

Use the cap and you should be alright. Most mandolin slicers are very sharp. And this is a good thing. As long as you are careful. Definitely use the supplied spiked holder when using this slicer. Nice touches like a box to hold the removable blades. Easy to use almost right out of the box and this can be a huge time saver.We basically eat meat and veggies now. I cut a lot of veggies for salads, stews, crock pot, etc. This is a big time save and worth the cost it sells for our household easily.

Best McAfee to date. I like Norton, a lot. I have the 2014 Norton and it was better than any previous McAfee. The interface was better for me, more intuitive, more features that I liked and it seemed to not slow the computer down as much.While I still like the Norton interface better, this McAfee has the best interface and best for me seems to slow the system down less than previous versions. I tend to stick with one or the other because trusted and tested virus protection is even better. If you haven't given McAfee a try lately, it seems like they are upping their game. Recommended.

Works for tires (toping off, which is most common occurrence, large inflating would be time consuming), general product inflating, and a light. Handy to have. This is nice for the occasional tire inflating but it has many more uses. Nice to have when camping if the battery inflater goes out, and a nice light. Also nice touch to have attachments in base.

Very comfortable backpack, with secure spaces for tablets and small laptop. There are also numerous side pockets and organizing pouches spread throughout. The shoulder pads are very comfortable and there is a chest strap to distribute loading.Really my only complaint is not a lot of room if laptop is kept. But with just a tablet it made a wonderful carry on, vacation backpack. Recommended.

Very useful, creative, well-researched book. America's Test Kitchen makes some of my most helpful and used books. Why? They test. This book is one of the most useful because we want home cooked meals and with little ones and two jobs we need to plan ahead.The book starts going over storage containers, wraps, kitchen discoveries, prep time savers, storage 101. This is clear, concise, good pictures.Then on to the recipes. Something for everyone. We are grain free, low sugar. But still many roasts, stews, vegetarian items, and sauces. I particularly liked the sauces as they do freeze well. Onion braised beef brisket, with a four substitution was great. Lots of different chilis. This book will be useful for years. We won't dent the recipes in one year. Highly recommended.

Seems to charge faster than other car chargers we have used. Which is really the main thing. The only negative is that the whole unit often pops out when trying to disengage the phone. You need to make sure it is secure or brace it a little when removing the phone. But it works very well and recommended.

Overall I am pleased with this unit, but it does have some design flaws. First it is very lightweight, well constructed, and easy to change the filters. Online it seems replacement filters cost around $80 for the set. This is fairly average I'd say with the rated life of 2 years. I don't know if this is how long I will get though.It is also Energy Star rated. Do not underestimate how important this is.  The watts are 5.3 on low, 12 on medium, and 43 on max. Low and medium are virtually noiseless and high is about the level of high on most air purifiers. Our daughter's bedroom has felt fresher and smelled better since using this.I like air purifiers with an ion feature. That is a plus. The negatives are no way to turn the lights off. We try and get our rooms to as pitch black as possible. So this is annoying for us if we want to use it overnight in a bedroom...which we do. Also no auto sensor to adjust speeds. That one is not a big deal.Overall I do recommend this and thing total operating costs are reasonable for an air purifier.

Great addition to our home. This has been a most welcome addition to our home. We still have carpet on our steps and bedrooms. The steps have never been as clean since trying this out. There were some tough stains that this took right out. Also deep stains in the bedroom.But it shined on the stairs. We have the full size deep cleaners but sometimes they are too much of a hassle to use and maneuver. Really liked the ease, size, and simplicity of this. And virtually nothing to build. It is virtually good to go right out of the box. Highly recommended.

I have enjoyed the taste and ease of use of this Thermos bottle after the initial set-up. There are a few steps for set-up but you can scan a QR code for a short YouTube video and the instructions are helpful. So that part was easy.I am using it at work and the water does taste noticeably better. People have posted the costs of the filters. Not sure how much shipping is from the Thermos site, but hopefully they will be carried here as well. Compared to other bottles that were a little noisy with sucking sounds this one is completely quiet and I enjoy the taste. Recommended.

This lamp does take some getting used to. You have to build up to 45 mins or an hour. I use it at work at about the recommended distance of around 18-24 inches. I know the vital importance of vitamin D and that many Americans are deficient. While I am not bouncing around with more energy or sleeping markedly better, it hasn't hurt any.I can see this being a valuable addition for indoor workers not getting a lot of sunshine and for over the winter. Although I plan on using it all year round. It seems to work well and if you have done the science and the output is what you are looking for, then this would be a recommended product.

Didn't work for us as a fan at all. We tried all the trouble shooting recommended and we never got the fan part to work. The mister produced a nice cooling mist. Defects happen and of course I can't say if this will be common or not. The build did seem average at best.If it worked properly it would have made a nice afternoon addition to our hot Texas backyard.

Good mixture of jamming, fun songs, and thoughtful ones. I do recommend the 'deluxe' version for the extra three live cuts. A bit more 'western' and popish than most String Cheese, but very enjoyable still. I'd have liked a bit more jamming, hence get the deluxe, but I find myself listening a lot to this during my work day. Kind of a mellow cheese so to speak, yet still tasty. Recommended.
One of my favorite coffees ever. This is nice, deep, pleasing robust flavor yet also smooth. One of the best coffees I have tried on Amazon. Highly recommended.

Definitely not a dress shirt, but if your workplace is casual good for work and excellent going out shirt. The buttons work well. Easy to get on and open but yet to come off unintended. Nice pattern, not over the top. I have an athletic build and it makes me look good. Recommended.

These are nice looking, a bit snug though. What I like is they are shorter than most of my briefs.  Good for work or play, shorts or pants. Comfortable all day and have held up well with multiple washings.

Comfortable and true to size for me. These are nice walking around or work out shorts. Decent size pockets, big plus for me, and very comfortable waist. The logo is well done and not too big. A bit pricey, but good quality

Great choice for people who normally buy dark coffee. For a 'medium' coffee this has a pretty intense, but flavorful profile. So it was perfect for me as mediums are usually too tame. A little aftertaste, but not bad. If you are ok with a pretty bold flavor, try this. Recommended

My wife is very much enjoying this in the summer. She really likes the short pants size, the material feels comfortable and cool to her. It is just a great summer PJ set with a bit of whimsy thrown in with the coffee style. Recommended.

A bit on the short side (but useful length) but packed with useful, life affirming/ life improving information.If you have been Paleo/Primal for a bit a lot of this information you have probably heard before.But Ben has collected it in short, easy to read in one setting reminder. And I definitely learned some new things and I really needed the reminders. Ben points out very good things to be eating (child and adults), the importance of rough housing (new to me), the importance of walking bare foot (I hadn't thought about that), and some great reminders to put away the electronics and engage with your child on your workout.Because of the book I now do chest pushups using my 3 year old daughter and she loves it. I think one thing that was missing, especially for people newer to Paleo/Primal concepts was what foods to avoid. I think that is as important, possibly even more so, then the good suggestions on what to add to you and your child's diet. Overall highly recommended.

Simple yet very useful feature to have two easy to use opening on the top. One lets you put ice in easily. I like this as I enjoy chilled beverages. Then the drinking opening is also easy to use and very comfortable.The outer material has a very nice feel and secure grip. Drinks stay cold a decent time.Overall one of my favorite bottles despite being just a little too small for my preferred size.
This is probably my largest shaker bottle and useful if you need that. It mixes well as a paddle designed ball. At least as well as the wire balls I have used.Easy to drink from. Overall recommended.

I do like the nice, narrow lines with these pens. Leaving messages at work they look nice. And eraser is functional if a bit flimsy. Cleaner seems to help.The one problem is they are harder to clean than other markers. It isn't the eraser. It works fine with my other markers. Over time it gets a bit annoying to have to work a bit more each time to erase.

Instructions were clear and this is a very easy blender to use. It has no problems with ice and makes wonderful veggie smoothies. I much prefer having all the parts of the vegetable, especially the fiber. So in many ways this is a superior product for me then many traditional juicers.We also use it for many small food processing jobs for which it works very well. For salsa, sauces, guacamole it works great. But it does sauceify things. It would have been nice to have a chopping blade for more versatility. But for its intended uses, it does a great job. Especially with the ice and getting seemingly everything from the veggies.

I am right around a 35 inch waist and ordered a 36. You normally order a size up. So 38 inch belt if a 36. I saw one review that said to order the size of your waist. I can reach the first hole but barely. And I am probably closer to a 34 then 36. So I would go with a size up.The belt is on the narrow side which is what I wanted. I usually can only find thicker belts at box stores. The clasp reverses easily and has a contemporary design. So for most work and leisure situations it will work just fine.

This caught my eye because of the color combination of the rose. Not my normal color but I thought it would look good in jeans that we are allowed to wear at work.It does look nice and my wife approves of it as well. The quality of the weave is good. Solid but not too thick so can be worn in the summer and feel good. Recommended.

This is a great moisturizer and skin protector. I love how it evens out my skin color and adds a healthy glow. It goes on smoothly over my skin and leaves it with a dewy finish. It doesn't streak or look like you are wearing a heavy makeup either. If you are looking for a heavy duty foundation this is NOT it though. It offer light coverage just like a BB cream should. It adds just the right amount of moisture too. It feels good on my skin and washes off easily in the evening.

These are great and they are super thin too. If you are not looking for a thick, bulky liner this is the one for you. I have been using them a while and totally love them. They are supremely stashable as well and fit easily even into a tiny purse or evening bag. I like the bright colors since it makes them seem more hip and trendy.

I have tried a few brands of banana chips now and these are definitely the best of the bunch. They are just sweet enough and have a nice crunch to them. The texture is satisfying and yummy. I added them to my yogurt parfait this weekend and it was delicious. My daughter had recently found a dessert recipe that we wanted to try using banana chips so we are going to work on that one tomorrow. I have to see what other varieties they have for these chips since I think they would be good in the lunch box too.

This microfiber mitt is sized just right and fits my hand comfortably. It provides ideal protection for my whole hand when applying product to my body. It feels soft and gentle on my skin. I always wash everything that touches my skin before using it so I can say that this tanning mitt applicator washes nicely and dries without stretching too. I like that it comes with a reusable poly travel and storage bag. It works with different forms of self-tanner like creams or gels. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

We cook almost daily so it is critical to maintain our expensive cutting boards on a regular basis. This set makes it easy since it has everything in one. You receive a 120ml container of cutting board oil. It also includes a 115g container of cutting board wax. Both of them are 100% natural products.  The soft cloth is also included. The oil and wax have a neutral, clean scent. This cutting board set is effective at helping to keep my cutting boards in good shape and ready for my next busy work night recipe. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

This modern, but rustic blond wood salt and pepper mill duo is ideal for my everyday use. The pretty glass design blends nicely with my modern kitchen decor and has a clean look. I like that the coarseness is adjustable too. You can see your salt and pepper in the bottom of each of the glass mills too. The top half removes effortlessly for fast refills anytime. Even my tween found them fun and easy to use at dinner time. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I love to cook and bake and one of the basics that you need is a good digital thermometer. I love this kitchen thermometer. It helped me make a homemade pudding tonite that came out perfectly. It even has a power saving mode so you use less battery in between multiple measurements. It comes with a replaceable 1.5 volt battery too. It is super easy to operate as well. This thermometer eases my mind especially when it comes to meat and fish. I can get an accurate read so I know it is properly cooked. That is no laughing matter either. The display is easy to read too so I don't even have to pull out my glasses. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I received the conditioner only for review not the entire kit so my particular review is for the conditioner.  My hair gets dry the minute the leaves start falling.  I like that this conditioner is organic and free of chemicals and sulfates plus it is super hydrating. This is a totally natural conditioner that contains ingredients like plant proteins, shea butter, sea silk and peptides. My hair gets very dry in the fall and winter and I like the idea of using a hydrating conditioner like this one.  My hair feels soft and combs out easily after showering and applying this gentle moisturizing conditioner. I love the scent too. It feels gentle on my scalp and does not cause any irritation. I like that I can use this conditioner every time I wash my hair and it styles beautifully. It has a nice blend of shea butter and sea silk which adds moisture back into my hair and scalp but feels light. I like that there this is an organic conditioner that is produced cruelty free. As important as what is in a conditioner, what is NOT in it is just as important to me. Shielo conditioner is totally sulfate free and paraben free plus it is a totally luxurious formula. That makes me feel even better about using it. The lack of sulfates means that it is safe for me to use even with my twice yearly keratin treatments to keep my hair smooth. I feel good about using it or letting my tween use it on her hair too.
These boots are great...she wore them all day long hiking and her feet were very comfy. This is the second pair we have gotten and we are sticking with Timberland...the fit is just right.

I am extremely particular about protecting my skin from the sun every single day. There is no substitute for an effective, broad spectrum sunscreen. This sunscreen provides broad spectrum SPF 30 protection which is ideal for my every day use. It feels silky and smooth on my skin and absorbs in quickly. It is water resistant and paraben free too which makes me feel good about using it on my skin. It even has pro-vitamin B4 and vitamin E to add more moisture and keep my skin smooth and soft. I like that I can use it on my body and my face so it makes it easy for travel and vacations since I only need one product. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

This powerful little flashlight worked like a champ right out of the package. It isn't super fancy or high tech, but it isn't supposed to be so that is fine. It is a tiny, but mighty little light. It isn't heavy so you can stash it in a pocket, backpack, purse or in your car. It has two settings, high and a flashing option. The flasher would be good for emergencies. It really provides super illumination on the high setting too. I would consider more than one since it is so compact and powerful. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I have to get up very early between my fitness routine, kids school and my own job. I need my coffee to get moving. This milk frother makes my coffee a little extra special. It is so easy to use and only takes a few seconds to get a more luxe cup or giant mug of coffee just like it is prepared in the expensive coffee houses. The great thing is that you can froth your milk and have fancy coffee for pennies every day instead of wasting $$. After I froth my milk I just rinse this handy milk frother and place it back in the holder. It dries on a few minutes and is ready to go for the next day, I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.
These are great...wash and dry in a flash and look pretty on as well. They are expensive but worth it.

These hiking boots fit as expected because I know Merrell runs extremely small. I normally wear a 6 or 6.5 and I ordered a 7.5 and these fit perfectly. They were really comfortable and light. I hiked in them all afternoon and plan on using them for many years of hiking.

The first one arrived broken which was disappointing but Amazon was able to replace it quickly with another one in the same beautiful robin's egg blue color and this one arrived perfect. My daughter was able to easily install it in her locker and it really helps keep her more organized. It appears to be sturdy and we hope it will last all year long and beyond. This was a great find that helps her make a lot more space in a small locker at school.

I cook every day and try to keep it very healthy and clean with lots of protein like fish and chicken. I find adding different condiments keeps things exciting and fun. This sweet and spicy salsa has quite a kick that adds some great flavor to fish, chicken or whatever you like. I have even used it on my eggs. Blend it with fat free Greek yogurt for a great veggie dip. It makes an unusual appetizer when you pour it over a block of cream cheese if you are having a party or are in the mood for a tiny bit of indulgence. It has some substance and it full of fun ingredients like mango, coconut and pineapple. Start with a little because it has a kick. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

We have been enjoying this coloring book a lot between myself and my tween. The paper is good quality and sturdy enough to hold up to markers. We have also used colored pencils with good success. The designs are pretty and the book is large enough to keep you busy and relaxed for hours. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I workout about 6 days a week so my feet take a beating between fitness camp, running and daily elliptical workouts. My poor feet were so happy to try this soothing and delicately scented cream. The scent is amazing and it leaves my feet super soft too. This cream comes in an adorable bag which is perfect as a small gift for a friend or fellow workout buddy. I have been using it all weekend and find my feet are much softer and smoother. I like to use this at night right before bed...it is very relaxing. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I am a big essential oil fan and I love the smell of fennel. This delightfully scented oil blends beautifully with my carrier oils like almond and coconut to make a relaxing and moisturizing oil. I like to mix the fennel with a drop or two of lavender. It is so relaxing and soothing especially before bed. I have a diffuser by my bed and I will also add the fennel and lavender oil to that in the evening to settle down with a good book. This fennel smells fresh and natural and I would buy it again when I finish this bottle. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I was impressed with this ceramic knife set that I purchased for my beach house. We cook frequently, essentially every night and we needed a well made knife set. This knife set arrived beautifully boxed in an ebony case. It contains three balanced and perfectly sharpened ceramic knives. You have a large chopping knife which feels substantial in your hands but is easy to manage. You also get a second knife which would also be good for slicing and chopping anything from vegetables to chicken breasts or seafood. The third knife is an ideal paring knife. These three knives are an ideal starter set that cut with exquisite precision. I already used them for a large chopped salad and they were terrific. They made my job a breeze. I like that you can actually store them in the box or use it to transport them as well. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I travel frequently for work and like to have a travel bag ready to go. These leakproof bottle make it easy. They are just the right size for shampoo, conditioner, body wash and more. I can suction them on the shower for ease of use in hotels anywhere. I also like that they are BPA free. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I am an organization hound and this pretty vanity tray organizer is one of the best solutions I have found for my makeup and beauty supplies. I have a beautiful mirrored makeup vanity and it looks perfect on top of it. The organizer is constructed of high quality acrylic and looks really smart. Totally clear so you can see all your stuff too. You can even personalize this organizer with a photo on the bottom. It is great because you can configure it multiple ways since the two smaller trays are removable and adjustable. These are great organizers for inside drawers or on top of a dresser....they look gorgeous and elegant. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

These are so pretty...excellent for a summer soiree or event. You can wrap these multi-colored lights or hang them and they add the perfect mood with pretty color. They totally dressed up my deck for a party recently. It has a solar panel that needs to be exposed to sunlight so placement is key but easy. Charge it for about 6 hours and you get about 8+ hours of pretty multi colored lights. You can run them on continuous glow for a more elegant look, or flashing for a more rambunctious feel. I like steady and elegant twinkling. Either way they add sparkle to any party or event, I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I run several times a week and in between head to the gym. Sometimes I travel for business and I do the same. It was always an issue where to stow my keys, cash and iPhone. This solves the problem perfectly. The Running Belt is adjustable and comfortable...I am petite and it fits great. Lots of pockets and they all zip securely. Perfect for hiking or traveling too. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I am a stickler for sunscreen every day. I don't need any skin damage and I want a sunscreen like this that is not greasy but moisturizers my skin. I am 40+ so my skin gets dry easily. This sunscreen goes on smoothly and moisturizes my skin while providing good broad spectrum protection for everyday use. I like to use it on my exposed arms, hands and legs everyday since I am in the car a lot. It feels good on my skin and has no scent at all. I like that it is free of parabens too. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

We cook almost every day and use our cutting boards all the time. I have good quality cutting boards and like to maintain them with cutting board oil. I really like this natural cutting board oil. It really does the trick to keep my cutting board in good condition. All you need is a little to renew it. I like that it is free of mineral oil too. I find it eliminates food odors too. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I like a clean modern look to the accessories in my kitchen. This pretty glass and stainless steel grinder set guys the bill perfectly. This glass  set features a modern design that would also make a pretty gift. It is stylish and elegant enough for kitchen-to-table use.  Each set contains one salt grinder and one pepper grinder which can hold 3/4 cup of salt, peppercorns or any other spice.  Just know that salt and pepper are not included though they are depicted on the box. I like that this pair of mills has the grinding mechanism on the TOP of the grinder. Less mess compared to my old grinder. You can adjust it from a fine to coarse grind. This set is a cinch to refill and doesn't make a mess like my old grinder.  It really has a pretty design too.  It is a sleek addition to my kitchen.  The stainless steel lid truly is the final touch for this beautiful set. No loud electrical grinders here means no batteries required so you can use it anywhere you want with no worries. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

We have several devices that use these lightening to USB cables and they are forever going MIA. I have been keeping this cable in my bedroom and using it to charge my phone every day. It fits my phone perfectly and has been charging it every night reliably. It connected with no problem to my existing charging block. I received the black cable but it also comes in white I think. It is a good option if you need a replacement charging cable or are just in the market for an extra one. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

I work hard to keep fit and eat healthy but I still think it is important to take supplements. I try to keep it simple though and HealthyCell helps me do just that. As a busy working mama I like that I can get a multi and probiotic all in one with this easy to take product. It has an excellent blend of all the vitamins that I need plus a good probiotic to keep my gut in good condition. It is easy to digest and take and I have been using it every day. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

This is a slim and elegant case that fits my iPhone 6 perfectly. It provides a good level of protection without bulking up my purse. I like the smooth, gold finish. The buttons are all easily accessible and function just like without the case. It is also light and doesn't add weight to my phone which is also key for me since my purse is heavy enough as it is. I would definitely buy this brand for my next phone case or if I am looking to change things up seasonally. I received this product complimentary in exchange for an honest review.

The Lighthouse by Amy Cross is not as thrilling as some of her other work, but I loved the twist towards the end (good enough for four stars). Unfortunately, the story jumps back and forth in time quite a bit, and I thought it did more harm than good to the pace of the novella. I think the story should have been told in chronological order, period. The flashback style didn't add anything extra to the suspense - it was more annoying than anything. That said, Amy Cross continues to impress me with the variety of her stories.

In Project Hindsight by Steven Pajak (author of the Mad Swine series), Joe gets a phone call at two in the morning from Rachel, an old girlfriend who's been missing for thirteen years.
