The other ingredients are pretty good being vegetables, fruit and vitamins and minerals.  My dogs ate this with no problems and they obviously liked it. Since this dry dog food is aimed towards medium/large, less active adult/senior dogs the calorie content is listed as 345 calories/cup.  I'm not a dog food expert but those seem like a balanced amount for less active or aging dogs.  Hopefully they will not gain weight eating this.I think my dogs smelled and tasted the fish.  Dogs simply love fish and even if it's listed as the 4th ingredient they still ate it with no qualms.  I would feel alright buying  this food for my dogs even though meat is not a first ingredient because the entire ingredients list looks healthy and I didn't read any long chemically sounding ingredients.

My husband really liked the applicator since he's the one in charge of applying flea medication on our dog's backs.  He usually gets more on his hands than on the dogs.  The applicator helped a lot with that.  We haven't had much of a flea problems since our dogs have always been on some sort of flea/tick preventative.  One of our dogs is pure white so I can easily spot a flea running through her hair coat and so far she has shown no sign of fleas since using this flea preventative.  The only reason I don't give 5 stars on such products is because I'm not 100% sure the chemicals are not harmful to the dogs in some way, but from experience, fleas can be a devastatingly horrific problem if not controlled.  So, I use the preventative despite my concerns about potential toxicity to the dog.

My niece recently had another baby and she was concerned about her milk flow since she had some trouble with that with her last baby.  When I was offered this to try I thought of her.  She's been using it for about 3 weeks now and though at first she was not particularly fond of the taste, she has now developed a strong liking for it AND she has noticed a definite improvement in her milk flow since last time - and that's what it's all about.  She mixes it up with fruit juice and sometimes adds some honey to it, and says it tastes better.  She always had a sweet tooth so the sugar content doesn't bother her (9 grams/packet).I'm happy this is helping her and she says she will be buying some when this runs low.

This works o.k. for a fake tan, and does look like you've gotten some time in the sun, but it's a lot of work and time to apply.  Mine came with a mitt for review purposes, but I understand that a mitt is not included when you buy the Xen-Tan.  However, it wasn't all that easy to use and I think just using a plastic glove and a soft washcloth will do just as well.I applied this thoroughly over my freshly showered bod using small circular motions as instructed in the directions.  That took a while and I was working up a sweat just doing that, which caused me to have to re-apply in some spots.  I couldn't do my back but I was able to smear enough on it so it was actually a good indicator of how much Xen-Tan stayed on after showering later on.  I noticed I did look noticeably darker after applying the Xen-Tan.  I wore loose clothing for the rest of the day and actually did not shower again until the next morning so I certainly left it on for the minimum 3 hours before showering.When I got into the shower I saw the water run dark-ish down the drain and it had to be the Xen-Tan.  I checked my back in the mirror and saw where some of the Xen-Tan had not washed off, but it was a lot lighter than when I initially applied it.  I'm not really sure I'd want to spend  $65.00 to work that hard, and not get much to show for it.  I want to mention, that yesterday when I first applied the Xen-Tan, it felt sticky and I felt sticky for about an hour until it began to dry.  Also, when I washed my hands any water that dribbled down my arms erased the Xen-Tan and I had to re-apply it.  It doesn't tell you that water will erase the tan shortly after applying.

I have used probably all the various brands of topical flea treatment over the years on my pets, and they all seemed to work just fine. We have had too, on occasion, when visiting relatives in S. Georgia, bathe and re-treat our dogs again upon returning home since the fleas in that part of the country can be ferocious. But for our fenced-in, suburban yard, one treatment for each dog will keep them flea free easily for a month. No other dogs can enter our yard to bring in fleas, but I have seen cats enjoying themselves hanging out near the bird bath.This product is easy to use and I always apply it after they have been bathed and are fully dry. So far our two dogs have not experienced any bad reaction to it and I can honestly say that I rarely ever find a flea on them anymore. I buy this stuff several boxes at a time because I never want to run out. I remember how horrible it used to be when the house would get infested with fleas and our animals scratching all the time. I never want to ever have to go through that again and using this type of product is such a loving thing to do for your dog(s). It's cruel to let them scratch and scratch and scratch from fleas. I used to work for a vet years ago before topical flea products were invented and I actually saw some super serious flea swarming on some dogs - one died anyway from loss of blood due to extreme flea bites though I tried my best to save him by rinsing him for a long time with warm water.  The water ran off blood red down the drain. But he died because the owners had waited too long and there was nothing we could do. I will never forget that dog. So anyway, needless to say I use this product and have used other products to keep my dogs flea free.

My 19 year old cat loves this food.  As a matter of fact, she now demands this food by sitting near her dish (which is full of dry food) and meowing loudly at me.  I know what she wants and of course, I cave.  I normally feed her dry just to keep her teeth healthy, and they are.  My previous 18 year old cat was fed almost exclusively canned cat food and her teeth were in bad shape by the time she got really old, so with this food I feed it to my cat only intermittently as a special treat.  I feed her top quality dry so she eats a good diet, but I still like to indulge her a little an show me a cat that won't like canned food with chicken listed as the first ingredient, followed by chicken broth and then chicken liver.  I scanned the ingredients list and everything looks pretty good. It's got vitamins and minerals plus taurine for their eyes.Keeping a few cans of canned pet food is a good idea too in case you run out of dry food.  You can mix this with dry food and I will be doing that soon.  These cans should keep for a long time if stored in a dry, cool place.  Overall, I can find nothing to merit a lower star rating.  This food is easily eaten by my beautiful old kitty cat.

These are great.  I am female with average/large sized hands and these fit just right.  The come up exactly to where the wrist bends.  I use these a lot when working with foods such as hot peppers and even when picking beans from the garden so the mosquitoes don't bite me nor any stinging insects that may be lurking in the leaves.  These also last a good while before I end up poking a hole in the finger tips.  I can't imagine not having them since I have used them so much and they really keep the hot stuff out from under my fingernails.  They are durable and clear and easy to wear.  Great vinyl gloves! Supposed to be anti-microbial but that quality is not important to me for my uses.

These are small, sweet and dissolve almost immediately.  I don't see how a baby could possibly choke on them since they literally turn to solution when placed in the mouth or under the tongue.  I think babies will like the sweet flavor and calm soothing these small tablets will deliver. I wish I had these when my babies were teething.  Adults can also use these to soothe sore gums but they have to take a lot more of them.  I thought these tasted great too, not too sweet but gently sweet.  And the creaminess was like those mints you get at a restaurant that dissolve real fast after you put them in your mouth.

This is the second book in a series.  The first book, "The Iron Trial" was really good.  I ordered it after I realized I had gotten the second book in a series and I really am tired of trying to jump into series without reading preceding books. I loved The Iron Trial and really liked "The Copper Gauntlet".  I think someone else said what I had been thinking and that was I wish more time had been spent at the Magisterium and less time outside in the real world, though it was still fun to read.  The school fascinates me and and I hope more exploring of it is done in the following books.I really can't add much that hasn't already been said.  When I review books that already have nearly 100 reviews there's not much I can say but if I liked it or not.  I liked it and will buy, "The Cosmos Blade" when it's ready.  These are similar sort of, to the Harry Potter series, but different also.  Callum and his very close friends, Aaron, Tamara and his wolf, Havoc have some stressful, exciting and dangerous events to get through and accomplish.  These characters are very well developed and I feel I know each one on a personal level.  All the characters are well developed and the writing flows smoothly.I had to fight with my 13 year old over this book as we both were reading it at the same time.  I give it 4 stars since I can't help but see things from an adult's perspective, but my kid said 5 all the way.  Therefore, 5 stars since it was written for that age group and not mine.  I still liked it a lot though and it's fun for me to get excited about magic school.  While reading the first book in the Harry Potter series I really felt like a kid all excited about going to Hogwarts.  This book (especially the 1st book) gave me much the same feeling.

This is quite a nice curling iron.  It seems to be well constructed and is an attractive appliance.  The colors are white with copper-ish colored trim.  I expect the copper color to definitely wear off with frequent use, but for starts it's the loveliest curling iron I've ever seen.  And I guess it should be for $185.00.  I have several curling irons and brushes stuffed under my bathroom sink right now and none of them compare to this one.  The clip that holds hair against the heated barrel is strong and the clip must be opened to release hair once it's been curled.  You will not be able to easily pull it out without losing some hair so be sure to open it again.The various 5 heat settings are really nice to have and are very easy to set.  I don't like it very hot but my daughter has very tough hair and needs to use the highest heat setting.  The T3 Micro Twirl Convertible Curling Iron comes (I believe because it's not quite super clear) with a straight 1.25 barrel but you can purchase different sizes of barrels.It heats up fast and they include a black pad to rest the hot barrel on when you lay it down on your bathroom countertop.  I think that was a very nice extra since it could possibly damage it if it was really hot.  The tip of the barrel does not heat up so you can hold it with your bare fingers if you need too.  Still be careful though, because you have less than an inch of "cool tip" to hold onto.  The cord is nice an long and should give you plenty of room to work especially if you only have one electrical outlet and have to share the counter space with someone.  And the cord swivels from the end so getting your cord all curled up shouldn't be a problem.  It also has a 1-hour automatic shut off (which I admit, I haven't tested yet).It's got a nice weight too.  It might get your arm tired for a while until you get used to it.  The instructions are well written with good diagrams so even if you don't read English you can still understand it, but then I guess you won't understand this review lol. I expect this curling iron to last me for YEARS since it's so pricey.  Hopefully, I will never have to purchase another one.  I like this curling iron a LOT but am only giving it 4 stars for now.  I have to give something like this some time to see how it holds up and then I will come back and update this review.

I will never be able to tell if this cough syrup actually works because it stinks so badly that if I can't tolerate the smell, I know my kids won't come near it.  I don't know what's in it that's causing this acrid, chemical smell, but it comes through in the taste too.  I tasted it anyway and I could taste the chemical.  It's got sulphur in it which might be the source, but I don't know for sure.  It seems I am the only one detecting this smell/taste so please read the other reviews and not base your decision just on this one.

I love this scent!!!  I never even heard of patchouli growing up in the 70's.....go figure.  But I have discovered it now and absolutely love it.  This small bottle of perfume goes a L-O-N-G ways.  You just need a tiny amount and it will last all day.  I used too much the first time and though I loved the scent, I think it might have been too much for others lol!  I dab a very small amount on the end of my finger and touch my clothes and I can still smell it the next day.  I'm usually very particular about scents, and for years could not stand any perfume for very long at all before I started to become ill.  But since the "great change" in life I love scents!Awesome patchouli perfume.  I highly recommend it.

I find this book to be almost perfect.  It is absolutely loaded with truly wonderful and mouth-watering recipes, detailed and illustrated instructions and lots of "good to know" information.  The color pictures are all full page and are quite beautiful.  I've been doing a lot of what's in this book for several years so I already know quite a bit about food preservation.  Making your own handmade soap is discussed with a very good recipe for shaving soap. I ran the ingredients through a lye calculator and her amounts are correct and the soap itself is of a very good quality.  In the section on cold process soap making she describes the steps very well, and the reasons for the goggles, gloves and long sleeves (protection from accidentally getting active lye on your skin though it happens to me a lot and it's not that bad - just rinse with tap water if you feel a sting.  Never use vinegar to get a lye spill off yourself as that will only make it worse but you can use the vinegar for kitchen clean-up. You really don't want to get it in your eyes and I always wear eye protection when working with lye.)  There are three very good soap recipes included in the book but you can easily google some good soap recipes and run them through a lye calculator to see if they are good or not. I make up my own soap recipes - it's that easy!I mean really, this is a great book.  It delves into water bath and pressure canning which I do a lot of.  It's all very good information.  I just wish she had included a few pages on dehydration of foods for long term storage.  I have done a lot of that and I feel it is an extremely efficient and safe way to store vegetables and fruit for extended periods of time.  It's even easier than canning.  So that is why I deducted one star.  Other than that, this book is just loaded with all sorts of great information, it's easy and enjoyable to read, and I'm really glad I got the opportunity to read and review it.  It's one of those books that every home should have because there is so much in it that applies to home life.  For instance, you find that your carpet is smelling not so fresh.  You grab the book and voila!  There is a great and easy recipe for carpet freshener that really sounds delightful.  If I didn't have all hardwoods I'd be making it right now!Maybe later on, if this book gets revised, a section on how to use a dehydrator and vacuum sealer will be included.  As I stated before, I really feel food dehydration is of paramount importance if you are wanting to store food for longer periods of time and especially if you are short on storage space.

These are very soft, and nice and stretchy.  They breathe via the waffle pattern in the fabric.  I think it's 93% cotton and 7% spandex and that makes for a very comfortable pair of undies.  They look exactly as pictured and the colors are soft and beautiful.  One very good thing - they don't creep up the crack and that's the most important feature in a pair of drawers to me.  Also there are no tags to cause itching.  I love these!!

I play classical guitar and frequently have to give performances.  I have taken beta-blockers (a musician's dream come true!) on some occasions to help with my nerves because they allow me to play and still keep a clear head.  But the next day I usually have a bad headache from them (I don't drink so it's not alcohol induced lol!). So, I thought I would give the Jarrow Formulas PS-PA Syngergy capsules a try to see if they helped ease the nervous jitters of performance.  Well, I didn't have an actual performance, but I'm a member of a musical group that meets regularly and it can get very stressful.  I started taking these about 4 days prior to the meeting and I did notice I had a calmer feel, and I was able to maintain focus on the music and not get flustered if I lost my place or made mistakes.  It's very complicated music and I am too hard on myself concerning musical errors.  I don't know if I will purchase any of this since it's kind of pricey (as of this review it costs $30.79 for 90 capsules) and musician don't usually make squat as far as money goes.  But, it helped with mental clarity and calmness and if I was rich I'd buy some.  I was given this to review so when it's gone, it's probably gone for good.

I can find nothing wrong with this baby cereal whatsoever.  I love that it's organic and GMO free.  My baby niece just ate it up without any fuss.  Mixing is easy and you can determine how much you want to mix at any given time.  It has lots of necessary vitamins and is made of quality ingredients.  I tasted it and though it was a bit bland, I still liked it and my niece really liked it.

These underwear work great!  But the disposable replacement pads are expensive.  Get the Poise pads and save a lot of money.  There's been about 150+ reviews on these so far so I really can't add anything that hasn't already been said but I will say that this is a great idea and will help kids not feel embarrassed about their bed-wetting problem.  Some kids just take longer than others to learn how to hold their urine all night.  We had to use a bed-wetting alarm for one of my kids and it worked like a charm.  I can see that one would fit nicely with these type of underwear too but I think someone already mentioned that.I think these are a great product although kind of pricey.  These are a lot better that pull-ups imho.

There's been a lot of very good reviews about these GoodNites Tru-fit disposable refills so I will only add that I think they are a great idea and wish they had been invented sooner.  Some kids take longer than others to learn to not urinate during the night, and this can make sleepovers a problem.  I know from personal experience - when I was a kid I had a sleepover and my friend totally peed the bed during the night.  If she had on a pair of these the bed would have been spared, along with her pride.  They are a little bulky, but not really all that noticeable.  And the cloth underwear makes it all look so grownup!The only thing I don't like about them is the price.  As of this review they are $21.68 for a three pack.  I think I read that you can get the refills cheaper elsewhere.

These are great disposable razors, especially for the price.  As of this review they cost $9.97 with prime membership.  The three blades glide nicely over skin thanks to the slick strip and they leave the skin hairless- - baby butt hairless.  My husband shaves his face with them and I use them for my legs and armpits.  The handle fits nicely into your hand and the grip is very secure - it doesn't slip out of your grip like the cheap pink razors.  I really like these a lot and am really blown away by how good they are for what you pay for them.  But, as I have noticed many times, things sometimes are really inexpensive at first only to get jacked up high later.  Only time will tell.

I'm in my 50's and still get zits between my eyes and on my chin.  I'm very concerned about anything I put on my skin drying it out and I have to use a lot of natural oils and butters to keep my skin soft.  I was surprised that the Benzac Acne didn't seem to dry my skin and was very easy to apply.  It's kind of like a lotion - thin and creamy and not harsh to my skin.  My zit problem is much better and I think this is a good product.

I think this is really very convenient to carry and to use.  As far as it's accuracy I think it does a very good job though other reviewers have had some problems with that so please take that into consideration about purchasing this.  That said, it seems to be a well constructed device and and is easy to use.  Mine came with the following components:2 containers of test strips (25 each)lancing deviceglucose meterclear cap for alternate site testing2 packs of lancets (25 each)1 bottle of control solution1 USB charging cableA very durable travel caseQuality instructionsBecause it has Bluetooth capability, it works with most mobile devices so that you can download your reading whenever you want too.  It stores your data as well so you can download all of it at once at a later time.  The size is so nice and small and everything fits into the travel pouch very neatly and is readily accessible when you need to use it.  As of now, the cost of this device (as of this review) with all it's extra components is $29.95 with Prime, and that to me, is an incredibly good price, especially since you get all the test strips, lancets, control, etc... as well.Overall - I have nothing negative whatsoever to say about this device.  There is an excellent You Tube video also.  I'll post the link but it might not get posted with this review.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OjDB4CBUGxI

This is pretty good dog food for the small, overweight dog.  Both my dogs are small but only one is showing the propensity to gain weight so I have to be careful about what she eats.  She likes this dog food fine and I like that chicken is listed as the first ingredient.  I haven't noticed her going to the bathroom (#2) any more than usual, though this dog food is higher in fiber than the regular dry dog foods.  The reason I mention that is because years ago we had a beagle who was obviously putting on the pounds so we fed him a dry dog food made to help dogs get their weight under control.  Well, he pooped so much fiber out that my husband had to go and rake it all into the woods every evening when he got home from work.  So, we didn't continue with that anymore when the bag was empty.

I have a problem out in my garden with some neighborhood cats using it for their litter box. I have sprinkled this stuff around and feel pretty much that it is o.k. to use since all the ingredients are natural.  I didn't read any chemical sounding ingredients at all and I did have 2 years of college chemistry so I should know one when I see one.  It has a lot of natural oils (can't remember exactly now but I do recall thinking how normal and natural they were).  I still see the cats jumping over my fence but only one bed is still being dumped in.  I guess I should sprinkle some more Havahart in it.I also am currently using this indoors to hopefully keep my two small dogs from peeing on a new carpet we put under our dining room table.  We had the old carpet removed and flooring installed and the dogs used to pee on the carpet in there.  I have put several small piles of the Havahart granular repellent on folded paper towels and placed them in the sweet spots the dogs like to use the most.  I have found one wet spot on the carpet but it didn't smell like pee......I think someone might have just spilled some water on it but I'll keep checking to see if the dogs are still going in there.  So, so far, I really don't know that well how good this stuff is working but if I think I notice a change or something I will update this review.

I'm over 50 and I think these vitamins are nicely formulated for women who have entered into that free and wonderful time of life (no more periods).  These vitamins don't have iron which is fine with me, and they have a lot of other very necessary vitamins and minerals.  They are easy enough to swallow and only two/day is the recommended dosage, to be taken with meals.  For now I give them 4 stars because I'm not sure if any commercially produced vitamin supplement is worthy of 5 stars.

I haven't had this scale long enough to feel secure in giving it 5 stars just yet, but so far it seems to work very well.  4 AA batteries are included so that was a nice surprise.  I pulled the tab out of the battery case and stood on it.  I was on carpet and wearing flip flops so it didn't read correctly.  I know I weigh more than 30.2 lbs!!  I moved it to the hard floor and removed my flip flops and it gave me a very accurate weight.  The read out is nice and bright and so much easier to see than my analog scale I have been using for years. The black color is so cool to look at too!I don't know if I'll use the app that's available for download.  I'm kind of old school about stuff like that but nonetheless, this seems to be an awesome scale.

My two finicky small dogs really do seem to love these!  I thought maybe they would walk away from them but they wolfed them down and wanted more.  I ate a bite of one and could taste the fruit but it still tasted a lot like a dog cookie.  These cookies seem to be on the healthy side and the addition of yogurt is a good idea.  Dogs love that kind of stuff and it's good to see it made available to them in a cookie.

I really like this product a lot.  It's easy to use and holds my hair the way I want it all day, even when playing tennis.  It's not "helmet head" but a softer yet firm hold.  It smells great (not strong or perfumy) and easy to get just the right amount out of the tube.  I use it after towel drying my hair and only use a little squirt and it holds great!

I tasted this and it tastes really good, if you like the taste of honey.  It's thick and soothing and hopefully will help with baby's colic distress. It contains no alcohol, artificial colors or flavors, and is paraben and gluten free.

I've had stomach problems off and on over the years.  I was given the opportunity to use and review Jarrow Formulas Mastic Gum capsules and took it.  I have been taking 2/day for about three weeks.  I will say that I have had no stomach disruptions (bloating, burping or aching) in that 3 week period, however, I have gone that long and longer before without a problem so I don't know for sure if the mastic gum is actually helping or not.  For now, I will assume it is and if I have a stomach problem while taking mastic gum I will update this review.  Other than no tummy issues, I can't really tell any other changes good, bad or otherwise since taking these pills.

This toilet paper is so much better than the cheaper one-ply that I'm often tempted to buy.  This may cost more initially than the other, but you use a lot less of it each time which saves paper and money.  If I have to pull 2 yards of the cheap one-ply and only 12 inches of the Charmin for each use, then which one is really the better choice?  And I find that the Charmin is very soft and really gets the job done - no pun intended.  The big rolls still fit in my standard sized toilet paper holders.

I have used this sonic toothbrush several times now.  I want to preface this review to say that I haven't used an electronic, much less a sonic toothbrush in years.  So, when this was offered up for review I thought why not.It's easy to understand and the instructions are very clear.  My toothbrush battery was already charged to two lights (out of three) right out of the package.  I'm not yet clear on which brush head to use so I just picked one and tried it out.  I did like the instructions said to do, and thoroughly brushed all my teeth.  During this process I kept accidentally pressing the on/off button with my holding hand, on the toothbrush body so I have had to reconfigure my holding technique.  No biggie.  I used just a small dab of toothpaste, got it wet and have learned not to start the toothbrush until it is all the way inside my mouth lest I lose my dab of toothpaste in smaller dabs all over my bathroom counter top.It is still taking me a while to get used to the tickle factor that the sonic emits.  There is no way I can tolerate it on my tongue because I tried to brush my tongue with it and it was too tickly for me to withstand.  It kept sending shivers down my spine so I now keep my old toothbrush on standby to use to clean my tongue with.  I will say that after only one thorough brushing with the sonic toothbrush my teeth and mouth in general felt very clean.  I normally brush my teeth two times in a row to remove all the gunk and yuck from them and my tongue.  I'm wondering if the sonic waves emitted by this toothbrush is knocking off some of the bacteria and stuff that sticks to the inside of my cheeks because my entire pie hole feels much cleaner even after one go round.I will continue to use this toothbrush and so far I like it a lot.  I'm not loving it just yet, since I still am trying to get use to the tickle and just the way it operates, but overall I think it does a much better job of getting my teeth clean then my previous double brushing method.  I just can't use it on my tongue. As of this review I still don't know how much it will cost.  And I need to check the price on getting replacement toothbrush heads.Also, I meant to add that it has a nice slim profile, it sits nicely in it's charging stand and it comes with two different brush heads and a sturdy, plastic travel case for those who want to take it with them.UPDATE: 10.15.15 -  I just got back from my 6 months cleaning from the dentist.  I had a PERFECT set of clean teeth, and I have only been using the Philips Sonicare toothbrush exclusively for the past 3 weeks or so.  The hygienist could not find even a tiny speck of tartar or anything at all to scrape off.  I looked at my paper bib after everything was over and there was absolutely NOTHING on it!  She said my teeth were already very clean and I told her I was using a sonic toothbrush.  She said she loved them and now I do too.  I have raised the star level from 4 to 5 to reflect what an awesome job it does at cleaning teeth.  I am totally blown away by this thing.

I don't find this "moisturizer" to be particularly moisturizing to my skin.  It goes on easy and smoothly with no greasy feel, but I feel like I need to put on moisturizer right after I apply it.  I put it on two times about an hour and a half ago and I feel like I need to go and put some lotion on my face.  Personally, I would never pay $41.95 for this (cost as of this review) even if it does say "Green Tea" on the outside of the tube. If that is the natural ingredient they are selling then please take a look at the LONG list of of ingredients that many are not even pronounceable much less good for your skin.I have been using whipped Shea butter scented with a little bit of lemon essential oil and though it seems a bit greasy at first, it really soaks in after a while and my face feels great.  And it has NO additional chemicals.  Shea butter, cocoa butter, mango butter, etc.....just by themselves make a good moisturizer and are very inexpensive compared to this stuff above.  I thought maybe this Proactiv+ moisturizer would be wonderful and maybe it is, but just not to me.  I'm giving the Proactiv+ three stars and I'm being generous.

My two finickies wolfed this food right down.  Obviously it tastes very good to them.  I was surprised because one especially is very particular about her food.  My dogs are small but they were able to easily bite into the big, soft chunks and eat it just fine.  I like this food for a couple of reasons - first it has chicken broth followed by chicken as the first two ingredients and secondly, it's in a can so it will last for months if stored properly.  I am always running out of dog food and like to keep several cans as back up for those times I get low on the dry food.  I normally feed my dogs dry food (of which Nutro makes a good dry food product also) mainly to keep their teeth healthy and breath unstinky.  The chihuahua can really get some bad halitosis going but we had her teeth cleaned a couple of months ago so now I'm extra particular about what she eats.  That said, I still like to give them canned food for variation and as a treat simply because I love them very much!

I have a very old cat who I truly spoil to no end.  I'm always changing out her food so that she never gets bored with just one.  I tried out this food on her yesterday and she didn't readily take to it, but then she probably wasn't very hungry.  However, I have noticed this morning that her dish was nearly empty so I know she ate it.  I like pet food in which the first ingredient is a meat which means most of the food is meat.  Protein is super important for cats and dogs and I never feed them a food that doesn't list meat as the first ingredient. Turkey is listed as the first ingredient followed by chicken meal.This is not the best cat food I've ever given to my cat, but for the price (as of this review it costs $9.77 and free shipping with Prime) and turkey as the first ingredient I feel o.k. giving it to my cat to eat.  I won't rely exclusively on this food but will continue to feed her different types of dry to keep her happy.

I really wasn't expecting much but to my surprise this product really helped me style my hair in a nice way, and without having to go through the usual battle.  I applied a very small dollop after shampooing and towel drying my hair.  I thoroughly rubbed it into my hair (my hair is short) and let it sit while I applied what little makeup I wear.  Then I blew it dry while lifting my hair with one hand and lo and behold it seemed to do what I wanted it to do without a fight, and in a very short time.  My hair is not greasy feeling or heavy at all and hopefully it will last until time to go to bed.So far I really like it and if it continues to deliver I will be buying some of this very soon.

This is perfectly good shampoo that cleans my hair without drying.  And it smells delightful!  This is a real bargain when purchased as an "add-on".  My whole family likes this shampoo and I will most likely be buying some next time I place an Amazon order.

These are very well printed college cups.  The college logo is firmly printed and is waterproof.  The plastic is sturdy and should easily last all day or even longer of intense tail gate partying or other game festivities.  I re-wash mine in the dishwasher since I hate just using them just once and throwing them away to fill up an already overloaded landfill somewhere.  They come out fine.Very good cups!!

I got the chalky white color.  It's nice and white but it takes at a minimum 2 coats and really needs 3 to make it completely opaque.  I didn't notice any strong smell and it dried alright.  I really like a polish that covers in one coat but I can handle two.

My husband wears a 36waist and 30 inseam and these cargo pants fit him just fine with a little room to spare.  They are fleece lined insulated and I think he will be wearing these a lot outside this winter.  They are are soft and comfortable and have enough pockets to carry anything he might need.  They washed well in the washing machine and came out of the dryer just fine and a little softer.  These are great pants for cold weather.

These jeans fit my husband perfectly with a little room to spare.  He wears a 36 waist and 30 inseam.  I think they look great but he's not too fond of the washed out knees but will wear them nonetheless.  The material is very durable and the jeans are well constructed.  I expect them to last for years.  I have washed and dried them in the dryer and they came out fine.  They softened up some and I think he will be wearing these more than his other jeans.

I have taught classical guitar for years and have used all sorts of electronic tuners ranging from the old analog Korgs to the newest ones.  This tuner will accurately tune your guitar to standard pitch (440 Hz) but I cannot get it to tune to a lower pitch such as 420.  I have fiddled with it for some time now, read the tiny printed instructions several times and still it will only tune at 440.  Also, I cannot get this tuner to give me a tuning sound when pressing both buttons at the same time.  It will read out "440" but no tone is emitted.  It clearly tells me what pitch my strings are and I can easily to down to D or C or whatever I choose, but for across the board tuning in a different Hz range I can't seem to get it to do that.What is nice is the clip itself.  It is made out of metal with rubber tips and seems to firmly clip onto the headstock of my my old Ramirez quite well and I don't feel like it will break.  I have broken off two Snarks already and though I love how a Snark tunes, I have found them to be too fragile for me.  This tuner seems to be able to take rough handling better.  The display is clear and bright and easy to see.This is a good tuner but for the price I want more options.  My tiny D'Addario guitar tuner is my favorite.  I think it cost about 12 bucks and will do everything I want it too including remaining at different Hz even after turning off and back on.

These are clear plastic cups.  They are as durable as those solid red, blue, green and yellow cups.  I re-use these types of cups until they break.  And I put them in the top rack of my dishwasher and they come out alright.

Now, that I'm just cranking out the jams while I shower left and right, I've had issues getting too much water in my mouth.  That is kind of gross since its shower water.  The trick to prevent this is to turn 180 degrees so that your back is facing the source of the water flow.  Then you can belt out the top 40's to your heart's delight.  I have not experimented in an overhead "rainfall" shower, but I'd imagine even this ingenious trick would fail.  Might need to keep your inner-mariah on the inside.This works quite well and I would definitely recommend it.  It last about 25 showers before needing to charge and I have had no issues with sound quality or water resistance.  It even works for podcasts!  Shocking, I know.This device has extended the length of my showers by about 45 seconds on average.  Thanks to the peeps at IBSound for letting me try out this bad boy.

"That Blast came from the Death Star! That thing is Operational!" - Lando Calrissian, year unknown.Fortunately, the only thing blasting out of my 2 Pack Silicone Mold Ice Cube Tray Ball For Star Wars Lovers or Party Theme (2pSMICTB4SWLoPT) is delicious cocktails! Often I'll be sipping on a philyorita in a rocks glass with my death star ice cube in it and someone will be like "Where did you get that spherical ice cube?". Now, here's the best part, I get to respond "That's no spherical ice cube, that's the death star you idiot". I enjoy myself every time this happens. No one else finds it amusing. You're welcome for sharing.When these same friends find out that I also own Kotobukiya Star Wars R2D2 Silicone Tray and Kotobukiya Star Wars Han Solo Silicone Tray they are super weirded out. Like, facebook defriending weirded out. Thankfully Mrs. Philyodaddy is locked in with a ring on it, so she can't leave me. It's a trap.Now let me rate the 2pSMICTB4SWLoPT in the categories provided by amazon:How much fun is this toy: 4/5 stars - 5 stars because it makes drinks more fun MINUS 1 star deducted because I don't know in what bizarro world this qualifies as a "toy". Maybe a dog toy if that silicone is totally safe to chew, unknown at this time.How would you rate this toy's educational value? 5/5 - The destruction of the death star is a laudable lesson in exposing the power of nature over the myth of technological dominance.How durable is this toy: 5/5 - hasn't broken yet. Fill it about 80% of the way and it makes a perfect ice Death Star. Every time.Overall - 5/5 Best ice cube death star maker I have ever seen. Dominates the category.Con: it is pretty hard to remove the case from ice cube when frozen. Luckily, philyodaddy has the strength of the Force on his side, but for average people this could be a cause for concern.

I was extremely excited to try this bad boy out as I used a lot of limes in Philyodaddy's world famous margs (recipe at bottom).  I previously had been using: Campeon Lemon Squeezer, Medium, Yellow which I paid about $8 for.  My problem with that device is that it left a lot of meat on the bone (if you will).  I had to do additional squeezing by hand to get those last precious drops.This problem is largely solved by the stronger, metal "Premium" Lemon Squeezer.  This was especially important during the tragic lime-shortage of 2014.  My local grocer was ringing me up to the tune of $1.50 PER LIME.  That is absolute extortion and it is entirely the Mexican drug cartels fault (seriously, look it up).  Even now that limes are more reasonably priced, I still want to get all the juice.  That juice is mine.  Anyway... I definitely endorse this as an improved product.  Props to the folks at Kitchen Frontier for making a more high-quality version of a basic kitchen necessity.  And I do view this as a necessity.I also tested it with lemons when preparing a delicious Salmon feast for Mrs. Philyodaddy (my lady loves her Omega 3 fatty acids, can you blame her?).  It worked swimmingly and kept all the seeds where they belong - outside of my culinary concoction.My one issue would be the price, at $18, it is a little more costly than the plastic versions.  You gotta pay for the quality I guess, but some may see that as a lot for a squeezer.  Philyodaddy understands the concern of the everyman.Philyodaddy simple marg recipe:  2 parts decent tequila (don't you dare bring the cuervo up in this), .9 parts cointreau/triple sec (or grand marnier if youre classy af), the juice from 2 large limes (or 2.5 small/medium lines).  Serve on the rocks.  Get wasted.  Repeat.Disclaimer: received this gratis to test and review from the lovely folks at Kitchen Frontier.p.s. it is dishwasher safe and has shown no issues after 4 washes.  Will update if that changes.  I don't do hand-washing.  That is not an option.

I bought these for my friend Nigels as an engagement present. His fiancee loved the purchase so much that she threw all the balls at me when I came into his apartment. At least I think happiness is the emotion she was trying to convey. The smiley face on the ball should make any person happy, so why not 144 of them? I can't imagine someone would want less than 144 bouncy balls when 144 is available.I purchase all important must-have items in lots of 12 or 144 and so should you. 12^3 is 1728, but I don't think I could afford 1728 of anything let alone something as valuable as bouncy balls.

While the name is quite a mouthful, I really like the MpowÆ Seal Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless Stereo Running, Sport Headphones Earbuds Earphone with Aptx, Mic Hands-free Calling for iPhone 6, 6 Plus, 5S 5C 5 4S, Galaxy Note 3 2 S4 S3 and other Cellphones (I think that is even too long for an acronym, so I'm not going to try).This is my first experience with bluetooth 4.0, so I was pleasantly pleased by the battery gauge showing up on my iPhone 6+ (my phone's bigger than yours, you know what that means). The battery gauge isn't the most accurate thing in the world since it seems to stay above 50% until it's on its last legs. So there's that, but it doesn't really bother me. I really enjoyed the convenience of having ear plugs that I didn't need to connect to my phone (or other device), and the earphones were both comfortable and seemed to be good quality. I'm no audiophile, but I would say Wu Tang sounds just as good on these as they do on my more expensive wired headphones. Aint nothing to F with.I tried to use the mic once for a phone call and it didn't work. I am willing to accept that this is almost certainly my fault as I didn't read the instrux or try too hard to make it work. I'll take the blame on that one. Still really like the product, and for under $50, great value.  At the $30 they're currently offered to, it's really a steal.  Practically giving them away.4 Stars, probably 4.2 if such a rating was allowedDisclaimer: The wonderful folks at Mpow provided me these headphones in exchange for me writing an unbiased review. Which I have now done.

Frank's Red Hot is the standard bearer of the hot sauce world. As I noted in my review of Huy Fong, Sriracha Hot Chili Sauce, 17 Ounce Bottle, Tobasco is yesterday's news. Frank's is just a far superior product. Tobasco is your grandfather's hot sauce, just because he Frankly didn't know better. Not the grandfather you liked, the a-hole one. I prefer Frank's along with Louisiana-based hot sauces like Crystal for my every day use. AND I DO USE IT EVERY DAY. I put hot sauce on everything, including but not limited to:RiceMeatFishPizzaPastaBoobs (just checking if you are still paying attention)Ethnic foodsChicken products - not limited to the wingsAssorted PoultryWild GameSandwichesMozz SticksMexican food - especially Trader Joe's Tamales which are f'ing delicious. Don't hate the player.For those of you in the recipe game. Here is the recipe for Buffalo Sauce for wings: 1 Bottle of Franks for 1 stick of Butter. Heat on low. Stir. Boom. Dunzo.It doesn't have the most kick in the world, but I ain't hatin, it just tastes good.In conclusion, thanks Frank, you did good.

0:21 Mins Makes a terrific Wedding present. After buying Mini Neon Smile Face Bouncing Balls (144 pc) for my friend Nigels as an engagement present, I needed a way to step my game up for his wedding. I figured two steps:1) buy a larger quantity of bouncy balls - this was accomplished because this product has 106 more balls than the aforementioned product. For you mathematicians 250 - 144 = 106. Boom.2) dump them all over his apartment while he is away on his honeymoon. - This was accomplished by me sneaking into his apartment and dumping them all over.Mrs. Nigels was so happy that she didn't even wait a few days to send me a thank you note. As soon as she got home they both texted me! Her text (as remembered by philyodaddy) said "What in the world did you think you were doing?". I obviously shocked her with my generosity.

As you can probably tell from my review of: NFL New York Giants Bleacher Creatures 11-Inch Eli Manning Hand Puppet, I'm quite fond of the guy.  So naturally, I needed a Funko mini-Eli to adorn my window sill.  I'm just glad he took a break from carving up plastic defenses and stealing Barbie from Ken Stabler to hang out in the Philyodaddy household.This item represents an affordable necessity for all Giants fans.Lastly, quick shoutout to the people at Funko: you even got his hair quite right.  It is hard for me to choose whether to keep the helmet on or take it off and let those luscious locks loose in the apartment.  Long live #10.

Christian Louboutin shoes: $700World's Best Wife Trophy: $11.95Easiest way to save $688.05 I've thought of YTD.  Mrs. Philyodaddy is one lucky lady.Only problem with this gift is that now when she is complaining to me about all the housework she does, and I respond "do you want a troph?", she reminds me that she already has one.  I don't like when Mrs. P gets the better of me in a verbal joust.

At $25 currently for 100 feet of the big bubbles, this represents about $1-$4.17 savings from when I purchased the Staples brand product in person.  Moreso than the savings though, I thought it was kind of funny have to have bubble wrap delivered to you. What is it protecting on that journey, a cardboard tube? Must be the most valuable cardboard tube in the world to have 150 feet of bubblewrap protecting it. One cardboard tube to rule them all.Don't know if I'm paying extra for the "duck brand", nor do I know what the means. But none of my expensive artwork (Philyosister's paintings, New York Giants Sports Illustrated Covers, Eli Manning autographed seatbacks - you know, all the stuff you find in the Met) was damaged during my recent apartment move.Oh and as the title says, Mrs. Philyodaddy loves when I pop these for days. She doesn't find it irritating at all. Just last night she said "This behavior makes me question everything". POP! Profound thoughts coming up next. Pop! I don't think she likes it quite as much as when I force her to watch the original Star Wars trilogy, but I mean, how could she? Anyway, good quality bubbz.A final note, I enjoy popping the smaller bubbles far more than these larger bubbles (minutes rather than hours of enjoyment), but my expensive television collection tells me that these large bubbles are far better for protecting my investment.  The more you know.

Colander Me Maybe.  Get it?  Okay, I won't quit my day job.  I will keep making sweet pasta using the Arrow 4 Quart White Plastic Colander.  That's sweet meaning "super good" not sweet like sugary.  Sugary Pasta would be gross.  This colander works as any colander would/should, so I recommend the product.  Seems pretty solid and good at not letting the angel hair fall through the cracks.  Thus far it has appeared to be dishwasher safe which is a must in the philyodaddy household.My one negative note would be that I would probably prefer a slightly larger colander.  I guess that's my fault since the 4 quart size is clearly stated, but I have no clue how big a colander should be.  The bigger the better.  You know what I'm talking about.Mrs. Philyodaddy's review: "Oh i liked it.  So much better than the ikea one. Which is whree (sic) the last one was from."Not much more to say about that.  4 stars.

These are a perfectly reasonable solution to shoes that are just slightly too lose.  I particularly find them useful on slip-ons such as loafers to keep my heel from slipping out the back.  I have big feet (of course I do) and the large size worked as well as I could ask for.  Nothing too flashy about these bad boys.  4 stars.Philyodaddy aside: My wife did try to throw these out when I left them on the table thinking they were trash, so I guess they give off a trashy vibe.  What does she know?

I'll admit it, there are very few things in this world that I am more scared of than shattering my iPhone. I honestly think it is truly terrifying. And the worst part is that it seems so fragile that an overaggressive Cake Bomb in Candy Crush Saga could cause full screen destructsh.True Story: Mrs. Philyodaddy just got a new iPhone 6 (non-plus) on Saturday November 22nd at 5:15 PM EST. Mrs. P did not put any ballistic glass on her phone. Mrs. P then dropped her phone in a bar restroom and shattered the screen at 11:20 PM EST on that same evening, a mere 6 hours and 5 minutes later. Way to go Mrs. P! Breaking Hearts and iPhones since '81.Not me, no sir. I bought the iPhone 6 Plus (5.5 inch ONLY) HD Clear Ballistic Glass Screen Protector, Tech Armor Apple iPhone 6 Plus Premium HD Clear Ballistic Glass Screen Protector. Now that's a mouthful. The TAAi6PPHCBGSP is some serious stuff. Like military-grade protection. Or so they tell me. I didn't take out my Tec-9, battle axe, or light saber to give it a real test. I'll leave that kind of devotion to #1 Amazon Reviewer, Ali Julia. I'm sure she would have at least had a tactical nuke on hand for some real testing. At a reviewer rank of around 1000, Philyodaddy aint giving you that kind of insight. Yes, with a title like that, it does sound like it can stand up to a Cruise Missile, but I have absolutely no idea.I have paired this protector with my Incipio NGPÆ for iPhone 6 Plus - Translucent Black. Thus far it has stood up to several drops of the carpeted, wood, and concrete variety. It has additionally been handled roughly during tense moments of sports viewing and tenser moments of chick-flick viewing.In other somewhat relevant information, the TAAi6PPHCBGSP was fairly easy to put on, and I'm not good at that kind of stuff. These big mitts are made for sports and medieval warfare, not delicately applying a thin piece of military grade glasstic to my mobile computing device. It did not create air bubbles, which are whack.Two Cons: because it can't all be '82 Bordeaux and Nutella, $10.95 is pretty expensive, even for something that could be run over with an APC. Not for erbody. Additionally, it doesn't fully cover the face of your phone as has been discussed ad nauseum in the other reviews. It makes absolutely no difference unless you suffer from OCD and the edges will really bother you.Lastly, for those of you raw dogging with no screen protection, let me quote the always relevant Wu Tang, "You best protect ya (iPhone 6 Plus)".

Dear Nutella,Roses are red,Violets are blue,You taste super awesome,I'm going to eat the crap out of you.I don't know much about flowersBut I have always loved NutellaReminds me of the Rihanna ClassicNot Rude Boy, but Umbrella, ella, ella...I eat you in the morningI eat you for lunchBut I ain't no chickSo there will be no brunchLike all good thingsThis love poem must concludeso, thank you Nutella,You're my favorite food.p.s. no matter what Mrs. Philyodaddy says, Nutella is super healthy and makes you skinny and sexy. Get ready for bikini season ladies!Philyodaddy's aside: I tried to set this to a Taylor Swift song, but "Love Story" didn't really work and there is no way I could set it to "We are never ever getting back together" - that would be a lie.

I bought this bad boy after I purchased my Iphone 6 Plus.  I did a good amount of research and figured that Incipio seems to make the best of the super slim (shady) bendable cases.  I am pairing it currently with some Tech Armor Ballistic Glass.  This pairing seems to be quite excellent, akin to a '82 Bordeaux and a nice Ribeye.I previously had an otterbox on my iphone 5, and it was gross, really turned the ladies off.  If I'm going to have a phone the size of my head, I don't need a case that is adding to the bulk.  I prefer adding bulk on my arms, not on my phone.  Hopefully this does not mean it is fragile, but I have not had any problems yet.  Fingers super crossed.  No whammies.For $13, I think this represents good value and I would recommend the purchase.  Way better than the crappy cases they recommend at the Verizon store and then try to charge you 5x markup for.  Lastly, the color choices leave me a little wanting.  Where's Giants blue?  Where's Camo?  Am I the only super manly man buying this thing?  I guess black will have to do.  Work on it Incipz.

Full disclosure: I used this product when I was 28, which was very recently, so my cane-alysis could potentially be useless for the majority of the cane-living set. I tore my ACL playing basketball and was forced to rely on walking aids. As every person in the world knows, crutches are the biggest drain on humanity this side of Nicholas Sparks. Yes, they might help my leg problem, but here's a new armpit problem for you to deal with while you're hobbled! Anyway, as soon as I could hobble around I purchased this stylish little dandy for $13. What a steal.  Great $ to support ratio.Other than getting odd looks for being a tall 28 year old (I feel like I'm missing some hyphens, is it 28-year-old or 28-year old?) with a cane, there is legitimately 0 downside to this device. The ladies f'ing love it. "Oh who's that hot guy with a cane?" Heard it more than once. The thing just screams vitality.It folds like a champ. To the reviewer who bragged that it takes less than 15 seconds to fold, you must have one arm or an incredible lack of dexterity because this thing takes no more than 5 seconds to be fully folded. The fake (I assume its fake) wood at the top adds a classy touch. And I am one classy mother f'er. Good weight, good grip, all the things you're looking for in a cane. This is my first cane (first-time caner, long-time jerk), and it might be my last. Do yourself a favor and step your game up a notch. That is all.

For adult use, this ball is far from great.  The ball took on lots of water in the ocean and was super heavy and waterlogged.  Even before that it was very hard to throw (especially if you're trying to throw spirals like Eli).  I honestly don't see the appeal.  I'm a large child and this should be right up my alley.  These 5 star reviews are nuts to me.I want to note (since someone commented on my review), this ball is plastic, not nerf material.  Obviously if it was the tradish nerf material, I would expect it to get waterlogged, but the fact its plastic and they claim "weather blitz all conditions", I would naturally assume that the ball was as water-resistant as a divers watch.

I received this from the lovely people at UNU in exchange for writing an unbiased review.I must say I am quite pleased with the product.  It works faster than the other external batteries I have tested against (a multitude of brands).  I get at least 3.5 full charges of my iPhone 5 out of it, which is at least what can be expected (as high as 6 in testing).  It charged every device I threw at it successfully include two different ipad versions, kindle fire, kindle, iphone 5, iphone 6+, blackberry bold.  I think you get the point.It is also smaller than other multiple-charge batteries I have tested, so I can recommend it in that way as well for those of you wearing the skinny jeans.For total speed/charging power/functionality I rate it as five stars.Now if only it came in black.  Once you go Black...

For Philyodaddy's 30th birthday, I went to the Dominican Republic with Mrs. Philyodaddy, 16 friends, our inflatable alligator "Chloe", a healthy stomach, and a lifetime's supply of hopes and dreams.  I left with Mrs. Philyodaddy.  "Chloe" was not so fortunate to make the return voyage.On the plus side, this "gator" works as advertised, it's big, it's lean, it's mean, but it's not a fighting machine.  At almost 7' long, weighing approximately 3 pounds (soaking wet, zing!), it requires 5-8 minutes of intense respiratory action to get to its full size.  The maximum-weight of 80 kg can be safely ignored.  Not that I'd know, but a friend told me.  We successfully got 4 30-33 yr old women to ride the device long enough to take a few non-selfie pics and then get thrown into the alcohol-infested waters.  The women, not the pics.Chloe was a fun toy to play with while getting inebriated in 3 feet of urine, alcohol, and chlorine.  Made me almost forget the first one.  We got crazy, like not putting the toilet seat down crazy.  Like not leaving the pool to find the toilet seat crazy.  Shhh, I won't tell.Con: if you lie on it for a long time, some of the green dye/paint starts to come off onto your body.  I have no idea if this is dangerous, but I'll assume yes.  So beware.  I had to deduct a full star for this because I like my ladies sans green dye.By the way, Chloe didn't pop, but I live in an apartment and have no pool/beach access, so I had no use for this $14, 3-lb paper weight.  The Majestic in Punta Cana is now home to this unique animal.P.S. Just noticed the picture is inaccurate, there is a second handle about halfway down the gator's back.  Shame on you Intex corp.

I may not be the typical nerf demo, but I thoroughly enjoyed this product.  For only $17.99, I got to go all Philyo Everdeen on Mrs. Philyodaddy.  Pretty sure she loved it.  She only used our safe word once!  The Nerf N-Strike Blazin' Bow Blaster (NN-SBBB or N2-SB3) provided me with minutes of entertainment.Philyodaddy is great at many (most) things, but being handy is not one of them.  Yet I was able to construct this within 90 seconds of ripping, and I mean RIPPING, it out of the package.  So your children should be just fine.After assembling, I tried various trick shots with the end goal of annoying my wife.  I measured out a 50 foot shot, which shouldn't be possible in my small apartment.  So you know this thing's got some kick to it.  The nerf arrows didn't hurt.  She was just being a little whiny.5 stars overall, 4 stars for educational value, as it could prove useful in the war against the Capital.Mrs. P's take: "It's amazing (philyodaddy) can get such enjoyment out of 5 min of a product and then you will nver (sic) pick it up again".  Touche.12/11/14 update - I now see that it is > $30. While I still endorse the N2-SB3, I would probably wait til the price comes down (or buy elsewhere). The more you know.

Honestly, who in the world doesn't love goldfish? They are a delicious snack. In the non-sweet snack category, I'd put them right up there in the pantheon with Combos (obviously Pepperoni Pizza as the best kind) and Doritos (preferably Cool Ranch, but I'll hear arguments for other flavors). I have heard rumors goldfish are slightly healthier than the two aforementioned tasty treats. Rumors are a tricky mistress. Hard to say.What more can you ask for when discussing a snack that is as American as Windows 95? Goldfish for everyone.  That's a campaign I could get behind.I will note that these little bags just don't work as well for me as the big box.  I can just dump that thing on my face and make a mess everywhere.  Mrs. Philyodaddy loves that!At the current price of $12.95, I believe this represents good value.  Granted, I live in New York City where a 3-pack of gum costs more than a 2 BR House in rural America, so take that as you will.

I was bored a few weekends back, so I ordered this as well as some black truffle oil and white truffle oil.  Figured I'd have myself a little truff party.  Well let me tell you, it's been a 2-week non-stop party in my mouth.  And you can be invited!  Well I guess the party would be in your mouth, but I digress.My kitchen now smells like Umamiville, USA.  This is some seriously pungent stuff.  Mrs. Philyodaddy put the three aforementioned products in one drawer, which she started calling the truffle drawer (very clever lady that Mrs. P).  More like flavor country.So far I have applied small doses of this product on: sandwiches, steak, salmon, other fish, cheese, chicken, pork, lamb, my finger, and other animals I cannot currently think of.  Everything was improved.  As you can see, I have an extremely healthy diet.  I might be going off the deep end a little, because Mrs. Philyodaddy is "getting sick of truffles".  Like that's possible.  Hey Mrs. P, maybe you should get sick of expensive purses or renttherunway.The ratio is 95 parts salt for 5 parts truffle, not that I could tell.  It seems that there is real black truffle in as well as some sort of truffle flavor, but this is my first truffle salt, so I don't know if that's par for the truffcourse.  I would say, of the three truffle related products I've tried so far I like the salt the best, and a little goes a long way.  Try it out, unless you don't like delicious things.

As a noted Challenge historian (possibly the preeminent CH), I would like to point out that this is by far the best opening sequence in Challenge history.  They are in New Zealand, so naturally they are doing the Haka, the traditional Maori war dance that the NZ All Blacks Rugby team does before matches.  I mean, why not?Generally this is a great season since it had Evan before he (and Kenny) got suspended permanently.  I hope they come back even if what they did may have been pretty horrible.  Check the Google.This season also featured the first ever spelling challenge where (SPOILER) Brad famously misspelled the word "Throne".  CT and Adam also have an epic fight.  As everything CT does is Epic.I mean just look at this cast: Evan, Brad, Lando, CT, Adam, Ruthie, Robin, etc. etc.  The list goes on.  Wish I could watch it all day instead of working.

Ladies, get your tickets to the gun show, asap. Feature attraction: Philyodaddy. Well I don't know if back muscles can be considered guns, but check out these hot, sculpted delts.I am on my second version of the Iron Gym Total Upper Body Workout Bar (IGTUBWB). First purchased about 3 years ago and recently purchased a new one. After 3 years of heavy use (because I am so strong and lift so much), the handles had started to wear away. When I was moving, figured might as well buy a new one rather than schlep it to the new pad.Originally purchased with the goal of improving upon perfection (at least that's what Mrs. Philyodaddy calls it to my face), the IGTUBWB really helped step up my weekly Adonis-maintenance activities. Three years, dozens of protein shakes, and countless Jager Bombs later, lets just say I needed to buy a lot of new suits.To quote Arnold in "Pumping Iron": "I don't have any weak points. I had weak points three years ago, but my main thing in mind is, my goal always was, to even out everything to the point... that everything is perfect."I really only use the IGTUBWB for pull ups and chin ups, as I have separate push up bars. Philyodaddy likes single-purpose lifting equipment for no apparent reason. This is made more strange by the fact I live in an apartment. Between this, my push up bars, and my bowflex weights, I've got a mini-Tony Horton workout studio in the second bedroom aka "the shredzone". Maybe you freaks who have 3000 sq ft can fit a whole gym in your basement, but I'm limited to a pair of dumbbells, a pull up bar, a coffee table, and my 3 televisions. I also have sufficient room to surround myself with mirrors, but I have yet to do so at this time.Putting together the pull up bar took me about 3 minutes and 0 tools. I am the least handy man alive. Literally, my only flaw. So you could say it is easy enough that even the typical roidheads at the gym could do it, not that I would invite them over to my apartment. That would be weird.Only con would be that it doesn't last forever (what does?), so I'll give it a strong 4 stars, closer to 4.5.Lastly, unfortunately just buying these doesn't make you as strong as philyodaddy, some work is required. Good luck. To double my quote total in this review, as Ric Flair is prone to say, "To be the man, you gotta beat the man. WOOOOOO"

Don't know who this Reese guy is, but shout out to him. Reese's really are the height of the candy industry. Shame on you, wannabe's. "If you come at the king, you best not miss" - Omar Little, The Wire. "Reese's are the best" - Philyodaddy, reviewer.Reese's are the Cheerios Honey Nut, 12.25-Ounce Boxes (Pack of 4) of the Candy aisle. Best in Class. Pretty sure they are very healthy as I would like to eat several a day and don't have the diabetes yet. If the packages include a calorie content sectsh, I certainly don't notice because I'm too busy devouring these morsels of heaven. 1.5 ounces of divinity right to the dome.Recommended way to consume: Dipped in Nutella. Can they make a Nutella-filled reeses? Wow, just give me the Nobel Candy prize, right now.Lastly, the full size cups (or even the super-large "Big Cup", which are also Philyodaddy-approved - please Reese's purists, don't nail me to the cross) are far superior to the little, dainty guys that come in the tin foil. Don't bring that weak crap up in this. You got the choc-pb ratio ALL WRONG. I'll eat those little guys if I am stranded on a dessert island or stealing your kid's halloween candy, but otherwise: no way, no how.I swear I'm not fat. By the way see what I did with "dessert island" - pretty clever, right?p.s. As for all the people who wrote reviews of this product claiming it is super fresh, what in the world are you talking about? It is a processed food. Did you think that they just picked your pack of 36 right off the Chocolate Peanut Butter tree before hand-delivering it to you in a refrigerated container? I want my steak dry-aged, my wine in a bottle, my Iphone made in China, and my g-damn Reese's from a warehouse in orange packaging.p.p.s. I learned the following from Wikipedia while researching for this review. "They were created in 1928 by H. B. Reese, a former dairy farmer and shipping foreman for Milton S. Hershey."The more you know.

Bought this for Mrs. Philyodaddy for our 1st wedding anniversary.  I put "Mrs. Philyodaddy" as the employee of the month in every month except March.  Mrs. P had a rough March; she forgot S&BJ day!.With all the cooking, cleaning, and laundry she is doing, she truly deserves this.  Philyodaddy doesn't do the cleaning.  I hung it in the living room so all our guests could see how much I value my partner in crime.Not sure if she appreciated it.  I think she wanted jewelry.  Isn't it the thought that counts?

Dear Nutella,Roses are red,Violets are blue,You taste super awesome,I'm going to eat the crap out of you.I don't know much about flowersBut I have always loved NutellaReminds me of the Rihanna ClassicNot Rude Boy, but Umbrella, ella, ella...I eat you in the morningI eat you for lunchBut I ain't no chickSo there will be no brunchLike all good thingsThis love poem must concludeso, thank you Nutella,You're my favorite food.p.s. no matter what Mrs. Philyodaddy says, Nutella is super healthy and makes you skinny and sexy.  Get ready for bikini season ladies!Philyodaddy's aside: I tried to set this to a Taylor Swift song, but "Love Story" didn't really work and there is no way I could set it to "We are never ever getting back together" - that would be a lie.

Remix to what? Similarly to R. Kelly's jam "Remix to Ignition" - The Orbit Strawberry Remix Sugarfree Gum is probably far more famous than the original. That being said, I like this gum. It is very strong-flavored, so weak gum-likers need not apply. It is true that the flavor does not last as long as other Orbit delights like the Wrigleys Orbit Bubblemint, 14-Count (Pack of 12). You can't win 'em all. Truth be told, that is a better gum. This is more of a special occasion gum, when you're really feeling the need to take the vacation to flavor country. I keep this gum at work so that I can make sure that my oral fixation always has 12 x 20 pieces on standby. Review over.

This is by far my favorite cereal, and while I may sound like a child, I'm 30!  Surprise! If you are on this page, the odds are that you know what HNC taste like - little bites of heaven.  Oh oh its Magic! Traditionally paired with milk, I opt for skim. These circular pieces of deliciousness stand high in the great cereal ranking.Since you're curious, the other three members of the Cereal Rushmore are:Cinnamon Toast CrunchFrosted FlakesCorn PopsHonorable Mention: Lucky CharmsBoom, done.Philyodaddy Pricing Note: at $7.44 for 2 21.6 oz boxes, it represents approximately 38% saving from my local, overpriced supermarket.

When I wear this shirt, people can see how aware I am. Channeling the great Admiral Ackbar, there is no way that I would fail to see a trap. People must expect me to be quick to take evasive action when I am wearing this shirt.I like that the shirt shows the Admiral's face which is indistinguishable from others of the Mon Calamari (is that racist? Do they all look the same?) but then it has his famous quote on the bottom so you know exactly who it is.

They didn't call it the Pauper Blend; this is the real deal.  Don't you want to eat the same blend of texmati and red rice that William, Kate, and Georgie Porgie are eating?  I wouldn't settle for less.  Texmati is right up there with Jasmine as my favorite sovereign rice varietals and it seems that the lovely folks over at RiceSelect have done a good job of sourcing some lordly kernels.  I particularly like wild rice because its just so insane.  More crazy- wild rice or Lindsay Lohan?  HARD TO SAY.In conclusion: Rice is great and this rice is even greater, a truly aspirational product.  I eat rice with almost every meal, so I know what I'm talking about.  Believe that.Philyodaddy Pricing Note: These generally cost between $7-9 each at my local supermarket so 4 for < $30 represents savings.  Philyodaddy loves savings.  It is known.

This was by far one of the best purchases of my life. Yes, it is just basically a super solid ziplock bag, but I don't care. I read my Kindle while sitting in a pool drinking margs in Cabo San Lucas and you didn't. My girlfriend also could not stop making fun of me. I have no idea why the decided that this product needed a strap to wrap around your neck. What is the possible point of that? Looking like a bigger geek? It is bad enough that I have to remember to pack 24 different chargers every time I go on vacation for my Kindle, Laptop, Phone, DS, Ipod, etc. but now I am wearing a plastic Kindle protector around my neck? That is just a little much.I don't have any fancy video to add, although I certainly recommended watching the fancy video reviews (now those guys are the real losers, who takes the time for that? They probably love the neck strap)The one slightly annoying thing is it is hard to slide the power button when the case is on... oh well, I was reading my kindle in a pool! How cool is that?!?!?! Why wouldn't you want to be reading your books while in a pool, pools are awesome.After having this product for 2 years, I have only used it thrice. I still looked like a super big nerd when I did. In addition to reading in a pool in Cabo San Lucas, I have read next to other pools in less exotic locales. It sounds much less awesome when I talk about it this way. I finally broke it when I was trying to use it as a bottle opener (long story), which is not in the described usage scenarios. Bought a new one.

Step your poop game up. When I was in my early 20s, a girlfriend broke up with me because I was using the single-ply variety of toilet paper in a cost-saving measure. Living in New York City is very expensive. I learned an important lesson, you gotta step up your poop game. Take that S--- seriously. Pun intended. At a cost of $0.55/double roll, the Angel Soft Double Rolls (I purchased the 40-pack) this is a good way to step your game up on the cheap.I did extensive product testing comparing to the more expensive Charmin Ultra Soft Toilet Paper 40 Double Roll (10 Packs of 4 Double Rolls). I use the restroom frequently, so I figured myself to be the perfect test subject. Below:Price: Angel Soft: $0.55. Charmin: $.71. If I had a dime, a nickel, and a penny for every time I bought cheaper toilet paper... Oh wait I do, so that is a total of $.16 x 12 = $1.92. Almost enough to buy something useful like an Admiral Ackbar action figure.Softness: Angel Soft: 9/10. Charmin 8.5/10. Angel Soft with a shocking Wichita State-style upset here. The champion of crap has been dethronedToughness/Resiliency: Angel Soft - 4/10. Charmin 8.5/10. This is the big weak point for the Angel Soft. Really can not stand up to daily use.Those are the only categories I could think of to judge Toilet Paper in. In all, it is a solid, if unspectacular product. I don't know how long it will take me to finish 40 rolls of toilet paper, but I can assure all my faithful readers that Stacie is very excited to have such a plethora of supplies. Doomsday Preppers here I come!Aside: I couldn't figure out a reasonable way to work this story into the review, but when I was in college my friends and I had a long debate about whether or not it was weird to wipe while standing up. I maintain this is perfectly normal but they thought I was the odd one. I'm not even sure I'm familiar with the mechanics of the seated wipe. Sorry for that visual. Discuss in comments.

At $15.27 currently, this represents about $1.72-$2.72 savings from when I purchased the Staples brand product in person.  Plus it's kind of funny have to have bubble wrap delivered to you.  What is it protecting on that journey, a cardboard tube?  Must be the most valuable cardboard tube in the world to have 150 feet of bubblewrap protecting it.  One cardboard tube to rule them all.Don't know if I'm paying extra for the "duck brand", nor do I know what the means.  But none of my expensive artwork (Philyosister's paintings, New York Giants Sports Illustrated Covers, Eli Manning autographed seatbacks - you know, all the stuff you find in the Met) was damaged during my recent apartment move.Oh and as the title says, Mrs. Philyodaddy loves when I pop these for days.  She doesn't find it irritating at all.  Just last night she said "This behavior makes me question everything".  POP!  Profound thoughts coming up next. Pop!  I don't think she likes it quite as much as when I force her to watch the original Star Wars trilogy, but I mean, how could she?Anyway, good quality bubbz

These HPs are really Ear Buds (EBs) so my title might be a little misleading. Apol. I was sent a pair in exchange for writing an unbiased review. As the king of unbiasedness, here goes. And... they're pretty good, if unspectacular.To start, I like plain ear buds that fit well in my ear. These fit pretty well, but I have big ears (you know what that means), so it could be a little better. They are also angled, even though they appear straight in some of the photos, which isn't too my liking, but I feel that this is a "to each his own" type of thing.Big like: the wires aren't normal wiry but thick and non-tangely. Big plus in my book. I have approximately 69 different head phones and they all get tangled all the time. It is really annoying. Not with the Brainwavz S1 In Ear Headphones (BS1IEH). Thanks guys!I could not figure out which one was supposed to go in my left ear and which was supposed to go in my right, so I asked the manufacturer and was told to check the "strain relief" for a little L/R. Now, my back was feeling pretty good on that day, so I didn't know what kind of strain relief he was talking about. Apparently that is the little rubbery part that connect the cord to the actual EB. There was a small L and R there. He didn't lie to me.Anyway, people probably care most about sound quality, and while I'm no expert like Mike Erb, I do own approximately 69 headphones (as previously stated), most of which are EB's. The BS1IEH rank in the top quartile (the top 17.25 for you math nerds), possibly in the top quintile, but I don't want to sound like I'm being hyperbolic. They sound very good.I don't know if I would pay $60 with MEE and other brands making good products at a cheaper price point, but I am glad I have them and would recommend them if they were on sale.4 Stars.aside: do you say "pairs of headphones" or does "headphones" obviously apply one set? Who is to know?

I bought and played this bad boy with several members of the esteemed East Coast Bias podcast while consuming adult beverages and waxing philosophical about the corruption of America's youth via Snapchat and Nicholas Sparks novels.  None of us were very familiar with the advanced board game scene, so it was a pretty eye-opening experience.  I don't think we're ready for a Settlers tournament yet, but onward...Before we played A Game of Thrones: The Board Game Second Edition (henceforth AGoT:TBG2E), we each tried to read the 30 pages of instructions.  We understood very little and figured we would try to play as we went.  No one wanted to be the Greyjoys, so we picked out of a hat. Naturally I had to play as Theon and co.  From there we kind of fumbled our way through the game.  It was pretty-to-very enjoyable.I look forward to our next play, but unfortunately being almost 30 there is only so much time for complicated board games with your friends.
